name: 1776 Wargaming Rules
description:
"and a Guide to the American War of Independence".A standard size booklet of miniatures rules with charts for conducting battles of the AWI.

The game scale given is fifteen minutes per turn, one inch equaling twenty yards, and each figure representing twenty men. The basic organizational unit is the battalion/regiment. There are detailed explanations for unit formations with extensive tables covering British, German, French, American, and Indian unit compositions as well as including Uniform colors and rank insignia with a smattering of flags and their colors. Each of the scenarios has a map of the battle involved which would have to be produced in miniature by the players.
categories: Age of Reason, American Indian Wars, American Revolutionary War, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Millennium Wars: Air War
description:
Millennium Wars: Air War is a Games Magazine 100 Honoree for 2004. It is a series of strategic-level, two-player simulations of possible current and near-future conflicts.

Millennium Wars: Air Wars, is an expansion for the five other Millennium Wars games which expands the Sequence of Play to allow players to undertake airborne missions to more accurately reflect air conflict. It also includes rules for special weapons and weapons of mass destruction.

Expands:

Millennium Wars: America
Millennium Wars: Iraq
Millennium Wars: Kashmir
Millennium Wars: Korea
Millennium Wars: Ukraine
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Seven Treasures
description:
2-player game, but could be stressed to 3 or 4 players. The 98 cards of the game are shuffled and dealt into 7 piles face down between the players then the top card of each pile is turned face up.

The object of the game is to dig through the piles and collect most of the seven treasures.

The cards are divided into items and obstacles. On each of your turn you are allowed to encounter up to two cards. If a card is an item you may take the card and turn the next card face up. If it is an obstacle you must pay a price to get through it, often using your collected items. The obstacle Door needs the item Key, the obstacle Thief steals a random item from you. There are 7 different items and 7 different obstacles in the game.
publishers: (Self-Published), Berserkr Jogos, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: O Sanduíche Maluco
description: Players work making hamburgers with SpongeBob Squarepants at the Krusty Krab Restaurant. To do so, they must gather the 5 ingredients: meat, pickles, tomatoes, lettuce and cheese. Players take turns picking random ingredient cards and putting them on their respective mini-board, but ingredients already collected have must be given to the player on the left. And be sure to work efficiently - your boss, Eugene H. Krabs, may enter the kitchen without any warning...

name: Intersect 90
description:
From the box: "Intersect brings the skill and fun of crosswords to a fast paced action filled card game. Intersect can be played three different ways - Intersect - Intersect Solitaire - Intersect Rummy. The deck consists of 90 playing cards: 69 one-letter cards, 10 each two and three-letter cards and 1 four-letter card. The object is to be the player to score the most points. Points are scored by making words from the cards in your hand."

In the basic game, players have eight cards, must make one word per turn, and must use one letter from the previous player's word. Each player scores points for the cards they play that are unused by the following player. Cards are worth 5, 10, 15, 20, 25 or 50 points.

name: Fluxx Reduxx
description:
CANCELLED GAME



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that Fluxx Reduxx will not enter production (According to designer Andy Looney -- "This was never a real product. I'm not sure it ever will be." This entry currently serves as a placeholder for the announced item and will likely later be removed.




Fluxx Reduxx: One part sequel, one part retread, and one part experiment, it all adds up to something we're currently calling Fluxx Reduxx. Similar in many ways to Family Fluxx, this will be a slimmed-down stand-alone version of Fluxx, with all new Keepers and Goals and with just the most standard and important Rules and Actions. It's a sequel in that it's a whole bunch of new Fluxx cards for the fans who've been craving new stuff, which can be combined with the original or enjoyed standalone; it's a retread in that the core game is the same, and many of the "new" Keepers and Goals are cards that have previously been seen in promo card form or in earlier editions of the game; and it's an experiment in that we're interested in seeing how well people like this leaner, simpler, smaller version of the game. Also, Fluxx Reduxx (and Family Fluxx, too) will feature a couple of cool all-new Action cards we've been trying out lately, these being Jackpot! (which lets you draw 3 more cards right away) and Choose a New Rule (which lets you seek out and play your favorite rule from either the discard or draw piles, reshuffling the former into the latter thereafter).

Part of the Fluxx series.

NOTE: This may be referring to the "FLUXX Special Edition" originally sold exclusively at Target Stores.

name: World Cup Rugby
description:
Billed as a "party" game, players are dealt various teams competing in a fictitious 32 team straight knockout rugby tournament.
A die is rolled to determine in which of 6 countries the event will be held - which will benefit certain teams during the tournament.

Teams are rated as A, B, or C - and matchups are resolved by rolling one of five specially numbered dice per team, depending on the strength of the them and the opposition. The winning team's 'manager' gain a chip, which can be traded in for a 'penalty' token at certain times. Playing a penalty token will add 3 points to your teams score in a match - allowing for a small amount of strategy.

Once all the matches in a round are resolved, the remaining teams are reshuffled, and the next round played until the overall winner is determined - although rules are included for "buying" teams if all your own teams are knocked out.

name: Random Violence
description:
Tactical combat boardgame set in the near future.

Players spend money to equip characters with guns and armor and place them onto the tiled board. An action-point-based combat game ensues. Rewards are offered in the form of more money for the next round. The winner is the player with the most money remaining after the final round.

Novel aspects of the game include a customizable inventory system similar to the Deus Ex computer game, randomized missions and multi-floor maps. Also includes a 2-player multi-mission campaign.

2-10 players, play time 30mins+ (play as many rounds as desired).

Full color character cards, weapons and equipment. b&w rulebook, color maps. Box contains:
-10 character cards
-12 weapons (with multiples)
-12 missions
-8 page rulebook inc campaign sheet
-misc equipment cards

Web address: www.randomviolence.net

VARIANTS:

randomviolence: 2nd edition starter set is doing the rounds. Fewer characters (6), less equipment (14 weapons total), but full-colour maps on thick mount, much thicker equipment tokens (printed on both sides), better missions and a more concise rulebook and a new campaign. Priced £15 from the website.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Fighting, Modern Warfare, Spies/Secret Agents, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: AirWar: Pacific! 1942 Expansion Deck
description:
(From the packaging)

Finally, there's a card game for the rest of us. AirWar: Pacific!! For aircraft enthusiasts and armchair generals alike.

The 1942 Expansion Deck comes with 18 more powerful cards, such as the deadly Ki-61 Tony and the rugged F4U Corsair, that can help turn the tides of battle. Upgrade your AirWar Pacific! deck with the 1942 Expansion Deck now. Good luck, General!
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management

name: First Contact: YOUR TOWN
description:
What if intelligent beings from another planet decided to forcibly take possession of planet Earth by taking over people's bodies? And what if the place they landed to begin implementation of this takeover was YOUR TOWN? And...what if YOU were the only one who KNEW about it?

PLAAY's venture into the non-sports arena had them hosting an invasion of Earth. The game boasted as many of theirs did a solid solitaire game system.

name: Objectif Berlin
description:
WWII theme game set between German and Soviet forces on an imaginary battlefield. Designed for the 4th Annual Wargaming Championship of France.

Classic mechanisms, 8km per hex, 24h turns, units mostly regiment/brigade size.

Magazine game published in Casus Belli (Issue 36 - Feb 1987)

name: Starship Troopers Evolution
description:
From the publisher's site:

Starship Troopers Evolution
Based on the ever popular Heinlein novel and the highly successful film, this game uses the Evolution system to bring the War of the Species to your tabletop. Pre-painted Mobile Infantry, Arachnids, Skinnies and Forth miniatures will be appearing in the first wave of releases for this game, hitting your local stores in August.

From the publisher's monthly 'Signs & Portents' magazine:

Starship Troopers Evolution is based on the same game system as the original, though everything has been tightened, streamlined, and developed to give a far more tactical game. The design of the best miniatures in the old range have been retained, the others improved and, to top it all off, everything will come pre-painted, saving you the trouble of creating forces from scratch, and allowing you to get straight into the game itself.

Replaced

Starship Troopers Miniatures Game

name: Battlefield
description:
Battlefield is a Chinese Stratego rip-off, but with some differences. For a start, each player has 44 pieces instead of 40. There are half a dozen unit count differences, plus a different rank name. Additionally, instead of lower rank number defining victory, the piece with the highest points wins.

Flag; 0 points, 1 piece
Marshal; 15 points, 1 piece
General; 10 points, 1 piece
Colonel; 9 points, 3 pieces
Major; 8 points, 4 pieces
Captain; 7 points, 5 pieces
Lieutenant; 6 points, 5 pieces
Sergeant; 5 points, 5 pieces
Miner; 4 points, 4 pieces
Soldier; 3 points, 9 pieces
Spy; 2 points, 1 piece
Bomb; 1 point, 5 pieces

I'm yet to find any significant rules differences from Stratego.

The game itself is "travel friendly". That is to say that it uses a plastic box where the lid flips over to reveal the playing board, though it's pushing the definition of "travel-sized". The instructions are on the back of the packaging.

There are no credits or dates anywhere on the packaging or game, just "Made in China". It is apparently "Item No. 3313".

name: Gondoliere
description:
Giveaway from Nr. 77 of Spielerei

Act as a gondolier and try to transport as many tourists as possible. Extend canals. At every edge there are tourists waiting to spend their money traveling with your gondola. The one who builds landing stages on different routes and transports the most tourists wins.

Contents:

45 tiles with landing stages in 5 colors
44 tiles with canals
1 starting tile “Piazza San Marco”
1 rule sheet


To play you will need to supply a playing piece for each player.

This game is a slightly revised version of InterUrban.

name: Richesses de France
description: The goal of the game is to complete a circuit in France (wine, economic, city tours, or specialties) faster than your opponents by traveling from city to city. This is done either by foot, bicycle, or car. Money can be earned (to buy a bicycle or car) or lost during the game.

name: Bombardment
description:
Bomb your path do victory in this 2-player abstract game.

Equipment:

* 8x8 board
* 16 Missles per player

On each turn, each player take one of the following actions: Move one friendly Missles one cell forward (orthogonally or diagonally) - or - Explode one friendly Missles (i.e., capture all Missles of either color orthogonally and diagonally adjacent including itself.)

You win by either moving one of your Missles into the last row, or by eliminating all of your opponent's Missles. If you eliminate your Missles in the process, the game is a draw.

name: A Game of Games
description:
So, you think you know games? You are reading the latest magazines, going to the most recent conventions, and perusing the Boardgame Geek? then perhaps you and a partner are ready to take on your knowledgeable opponents at A Game of Games as teams compete to guess titles of games before their learned companions.

The game is similar to Password, but players try to clue the names of games instead of English words, and there are a few additional scoring opportunities.

name: Skizzo
description:
Skizzo is a humorous kind of game of goose. There are a few choices about moving after rolling the dice, tricky trading with other players and you need to take memory of what other players collect.

It's fundamentally based on humour and satire on italian politic, economy and showbusiness.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Trivial Pursuit Singles: Music
description: 600 questions about music and the people who make it (and more) in a wedge-shaped storage container.

name: The Simpsons Spoons Card Game
description:
Carpe Diem! − Seize the Donut!

Enjoy this faced-paced card game with a donut twist. Be the first to grab a donut. Mmmmm. . . delecta-ma-ble!
Pick, pass and collect cards until you get four-of-a-kind, then grab a donut before they run out. Eliminate your opponents and win the game by being the last player with a donut. Includes 7 custom Donuts and a custom Simpsons-themed card deck all packaged in a donut-like box.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: König Kasimir und seine Tiere
description:
Game for the very young that comes with rules variants for 1-3 year olds (!).
In the simplest form, a kind of nursery rhyme is read out and the kids can sort the animals in the same order they appear in the rhyme.
In another game, the players roll a die and move the animal they rolled to the end of the line behind the queen. The goal is to complete the row of all eight animals.

name: Die große Ratz Fatz-Spielewelt
description:
Similar to Ratz-Fatz, this is a collection of game ideas and materials. The box contains 50 wooden figures (mostly animals, but also a train, truck, pirate etc.), 4 little metal suitcases, a die, a game book and a CD with stories and a song.

Basic idea: The wooden figures are placed on the table. While a story, poem or riddle is being read (or played from the CD), the players have to listen closely. When an object from the table is mentioned or the solution to a riddle, the players have to grab it. The player who has collected the most figures at the end of the text wins the game.

Variants include just putting the figures into the box after they were mentioned (non-competitive play) and a memory variant in which objects that were put away before the game have to be called out when mentioned in the story.

name: Bellwether
description:
Following the great Madstone war, wizards of this land set out to rebuild all that was destroyed by dark forces. The pinacle of the rebuilding effort is to restore the school of magic known as Bellwether.
Players choose one of four actions each turn: One, they meditate to gain magical energy from the land. Two, they study to gain new spell knowledge. Three, they hunt dark creatures who remain hiding in the land. And four, they rebuild civilization.
Victory points are connected with learning spells, building institutions of society, and hunting dark creatures.
Cover art by Sean McGrath from Quispamsis, NB, Canada.

name: Dead Fellas: The Missing Mooks
description:
Deadfellas was originally designed to included 120 cards. In the process of negotiating the first print run, the card count was reduced to 110 for printing reasons. However, 120 was the "advertised" card count during the Kickstarter project, so the missing Mooks that were eliminated were printed as additional promo cards for loyal and generous backers (and pre-order customers).

The 10 Missing Mooks are:

Roberto "Rocky" Rizzoto
"Giggy" Franchese
Nicky "Nails" Nastassi
"Big Head" Mikey Altimari
Nicky "Glasses" Zicarelli
Johnny "Beach Ball" Baioni
Ralphie "Bubbles" Bendinelli
Angelo "Sockets" Milano
Bruno "The Rug" Pacelli
Petey "Popeye" Panzarino


These Mooks are added to the game and used just like any other Mook.

name: Think: Logic Logo Trainer
description: The game trains logic and imagination, players solve problems in the areas of logic, numbers, language and perception. The wallet card you have to remember at the beginning, they will be asked later in the game. With the correct solution to a task the players with a chip on an icon box and get this type of function points for all our neighboring chips. To this point his character pulls you forward on the path to success, who reached Albert Einstein wins.

name: Amber Road
description:
A "race game" placed in the ancient Roman Empire. Each player leads an expedition along the "Amber Road" to gain worthy resources along the travel.

Moving along the Road consumes resources such as water, food, etc. The first thing an expedition needs to do is fill up its supplies. While still in the starting area, a player may take up to four resource tokens and/or coins; he may stay as long in this starting area and take resources as he wants. When a player thinks he has enough for the journey, he takes off.
In a turn, a player has three options: spend two tokens and move one step for each ox you have; move one step without spending tokens; or remain where he is.
If a player moves to a new mapboard, he has to roll the stick beforehand to see which board is placed. After this each player has the option to place a village marker.
On each map section the terrain changes; on a number of special places a player may perform different useful tasks, such as refilling his supply of water, food or acquire an ox.

Villages are useful to buy supplies. Markers that show the 'pax' side consider the village to be friendly, however, when the village is hostile, it attacks the expedition. All oxes and scout then are placed in the bag together with three neutral green tokens. Two tokens drawn from the bag are considered lost.
If the village is friendly, the stick is rolled. The dots shown is the number of resource tokens a player gets for each silver coin in this village.
When the first player reaches the end of the road by exact count, he wins.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Race, Resource to Move

name: Ace Detective: Strange Tales
description:
An expansion first published for Kickstarter that includes themed cards to bring "Noir Fantasy" into your game of Ace Detective. Drawing upon images from the covers of Weird Tales Magazine and other old magazines from the early 1900s, Strange Tales introduces ghosts and other strange phenomena for a total of 28 new Story Telling Cards and 2 New Detectives as well as 8 Suspect Secrets. Suspect Secrets are a new mechanic to the game.

Strange Tales may be published for retail in 2013 as a boxed expansion to Ace Detective

name: Viaje al Centro de la Tierra
description: The game is based on the novel "Journey to the Center of the Earth" written by Joules Verne. Players take the roles of up to four adventurers who will race through the 3D board trying to be the first ones to achieve the center of the Earth and therefore win the game. To do this, they will face a hard ascension of the ancient Sneffels volcano, a descent into its dark and misterious insides and finally a nightmarish counter-clock run against the lava flowing in the center of the Earth. During the journey they might face dangerous secondary adventures but also find precious treasures. But beware! Only those adventurers to equip themselves with the right object for each stage of the journey will be able to successfully race against the others.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Novel-based, Racing, Travel
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Three Famous Battles
description:
"Three Famous Battles" contains three short wargames covering (as the name suggests) three famous battles. The scenarios included are Lee at Gettysburg, Senlac: Hastings 1066, and The Emperor Strikes Back: Waterloo. The scenarios all use a common rule set but are meant to build on each other. Each scenario adds rules from the previous scenario (Gettysburg is the simplest scenario and The Emperor Strikes Back: Waterloo is the most complicated.)

The turns in each scenario are played in the following sequence:
Gettysburg: Player A = Confederate, Player B = Union
Senlac: Player A = Saxon, Player B = Norman
Waterloo: Player A = British, Player B = French
1. Reinforcements for both players
2. Player A Movement
3. Player B Defensive Fire/Combat
4. Player A Offensive Fire/Combat
5. Player B Movement
6. Player A Defensive Fire/Combat
7. Player B Offensive Fire/Combat
8. Victory Check

Victory in each scenario is determined by a set number of unit losses. For example, in the Gettysburg scenario, the first player to eliminate five of his/her opponent's pieces is the winner. The victory rules for the other games are slightly more complicated but are still based on number of unit losses.

The rules for each scenario are under two pages. The game is designed to introduce people to wargaming but also be complex enough to be enjoyed by experienced wargamers looking for a fast playing game.
categories: American Civil War, Medieval, Napoleonic, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Westerly
description:
Westerly is a co-operative adventure game of westward expansion. Players select a character at the beginning of the game and try to get them to California in one piece...literally. In Westerly things can go from bad to worse in a matter of minutes and your character can be injured, maimed, left to die by the group or maybe just eaten by a bear or even your own party. Ayup that's right I'm talking about cannibalism. Fear not if it all goes wrong you can rejoin the party as a different character that hops into the wagon at the next town.

The game involves strategy and co-operation combined with a tongue in cheek approach to all the horrible things that can happen along the perilous route out west.

Tiles are played in order to navigate the group to California. The game space is split into three different tracks North, South and West. Encounter cards are drawn depending on which track the group is currently in. The group must then work together to select the best way to deal with the encounter and either reap the benefits or pay the consequences of their selection.

The road is treacherous filled with bandits, angry natives, predators, environmental dangers, and the list goes on. Westerly is comedic one minute and brutal the next. You never know what the exact party make up will be or what route you will have to take to go west.

Westerly is all about the story of you and your friends trying their best to make it out west and all the ridiculous things that can go wrong along the way. If ya manage to get there you will absolutely have a wild story to tell.

name: Typisch Deutsch?! Das Kaya Spiel
description: Is this typically German or what? In the party trivia game Typisch Deutsch?! Das Kaya Spiel, developed in collaboration with comedian Kaya Yanar, players travel throughout Germany examining peculiarities of different regions, culture, language and customs.

name: Leviathan 3000: Space Warfare
description:
A space battles game where the spaceships obey the laws of physics and don't fly like World War 2 fighter planes.

Fun, short playtime, strategic/tactical space battle game.

Highlights:

Spaceships fly like spaceships Strategic and tactical No dice, no random factors Easy to learn, quick to play 18 Scenarios (including 8 solo scenarios) Plays 1 or 2 players.

Details:

It plays like good old school hex and counter wargames. It has fighters, cruisers, dreadnoughts, space stations and more.

Play is for 1 or 2 players.

It's easy to learn (maybe 15 minutes), setup takes about 5 minutes and play lasts less than an hour.

Features 216 double-sided tokens, representing a dozen different types of spaceships from small to huge!

You also get to fly round planets in proper orbits and everything.

The game mechanic is really simple, although it does follow proper space physics, its not complicated or hard - in fact it is very simple - very like the old dot-and-dash style games you might have played already.

Spaceships have a vector. They will fly on that vector forever. Applying thrust changes the vector.

The combat process is in the same vein as games like Ogre, Battle of the Bulge, and any Avalon Hill type hex-and-counter wargame.

Each unit has an attack range and strength. No dice involved. The defending unit loses a number of components based on the attack strength. Shields help defeat attacks. Defender chooses what gets damaged and this is not revealed.
mechanics: Action Queue, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Scene it? Glee
description: Get set to join in and "Gleek out". Now appearing live, “on-stage” in your living room, it’s Scene It Glee, the show-stopping DVD game that captures all the amazing music, hilarious hi-jinks and raging hormones haunting the halls of McKinley High. Whether you’re a fan of “Team Schue” or “Team Sue”, you’ll enjoy hours of fun with on-screen puzzles, Glee-inspired music trivia, exciting activities and more. Just don’t stop believin’. Includes a themed Flextime game board which enables players to choose the length of gameplay, high-quality Glee themed movers, oversized dice, 120 trivia cards, 12 Buzz cards, and of course a DVD with patented Optreve technology unique to Scene It so you can play again and again without seeing the same questions. Game is meant to play with the board but put the DVD on Party mode and the fun never stops as the DVD asks all the questions.

name: Big Side
description:
You and your fellow gang members have robbed a bank together, but while trying to divvy up the spoils, everyone's getting greedy and wanting more! With their loyalties now divided between the old boss and new, members are fighting one another over money — and naturally you'll try to take this opportunity to make a few suspicious deals of your own to take a share for yourself!

In Big Side, the game lasts several rounds, and in each phase each player takes one character card secretly, then after negotiation with the old boss decided which team to join. After everyone has divided into two groups, each player reveals their character and uses its ability. All players then simultaneously decide whether to join the battle or not, with the old boss and new having a battle with their followers to determine how to split the money.

After the third round, the player with the most money wins!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Variable Player Powers

name: God Hates Charades: 8-bit Expansion
description: 64 card expansion to challenge your video game knowledge.

name: Berlin 1945
description:
The game covers the battle of Berlin in 1945, the last great battle of World War II.

Can be connected with Czerwony Huragan (Budziszyn 1945).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Bon Appetit: A Fine Dining Frenzy
description:
Love food? So does your opponent! Play cards from your hand to steal a player's meal. Don’t worry, there are plenty of other ways to steal it back. Turn the tables with the eccentric character cards. The first to collect 3 steaks wins!

Players combine cards in order to guess if their opponents have a delicious steak in their hand. If they guess right they win the steak. The first to collect 3 steaks wins. Players can also use character cards to try and steal back their steak. You can only take one action per turn so choose wisely!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Math
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Launchtime
description:
The greatest leapers of the animal kingdom have gathered for a jumping competition, but nobody brought lunch! You need to launch to get your meal and grab the food that you like the most. Use special powers that are unique to each animal to help along the way.

Launchtime is card-flipping family dexterity game for 2 players of almost all ages, and plays in 15 minutes just about anywhere that you can fling a few cards around. Each player has a rabbit, kangaroo, flea and frog card. Using your reference card you flip your animal cards onto cards in the center of the table that have different food highlighted (targeted), you want your animal to land on cards that highlights the food your animal eats. You take the card as a reward AND if your animal and its food match, you gain bonus points. As an added twist, if your animal cards land face up to gain special abilities that are unique to the animal.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Print & Play

name: StartUp Burnout
description:
Startup Burnout is a cooperative and black humor board game that will test your ability to manage the time and resources of your small business.

There are only two options: grow or die.

They can play from 1 to 4 players from 13 years and the games last approximately 40 minutes.

...And remember: when a businessman dies, others may try to win in the next three days. That is, before the body smells in the office.

—description from the designer

name: Bonsai Uchu
description:
Bonsai is a horticultural tradition that combines human hands and trees to shrinks and reproduces natural scenes in pots. Many well-maintained bonsai trees are more than 100 years old and have a legacy that far exceeds human life.

Bonsai Uchu is a two-player game in which players create their own bonsai by carefully combining branches and leaves tiles. The game is a two-round system, exchanging bonsais made by each other when switching rounds. The bonsai family's branches are tested to find out what form to make the bonsai that has been handed over from the predecessor. Use cultivation and pruning to create an infinite bonsai universe in a bowl.

—description from the publisher (translated)

どんな盆栽に仕立てるか

盆栽とは樹木に人の手を加え、鉢の中に自然の情景を縮小して再現する園芸文化のことです。
手入れの行き届いた盆栽は、100年以上の樹齢を持つものも多く、
人間の寿命を遥かに超える悠久さがあります。

「盆栽宇宙」は枝と葉のタイルを上手に組み合わせて、自分だけの盆栽を作り上げる2人用のゲームです。
ゲームは2ラウンド制で、ラウンドの切り替え時にお互いが作った盆栽を交換しあいます。
先人から譲り受けた盆栽をどのような形に仕立てるのか盆栽家としての腕が試されます。
育成や剪定を上手に使って、鉢の中に無限の盆栽宇宙を創り出してみてください。

—description from the publisher
publishers: JUGAME STUDIO (ジュゲムスタジオ)

name: Rail Wreck
description:
Rail Wreck is a fun and educational board game that teaches colors, matching, counting and strategy skills.

Choose trains from the train station and match their colors to fill up your 4 train tracks. Each time a train track is filled, take a power card and use it to hasten your ride to success. Power cards allow you special abilities to get more trains or even steal one from an opponent! Be the first to complete all of your tracks and win!

Each round of the game is quick, engaging and educational. Rail Wreck is the perfect game for parents and caregivers who are looking to spend quality time with their young children.

Contents: 5 game boards, 72 miniature trains, power card deck, drawstring train bag, and instruction sheet.

name: Mon Royaume pour un conte
description:
Play with your children in the wonderful world of fairy tales.

You will first have to build your Kingdom by selecting the places that make it up, the monsters that haunt it and the heroes that inhabit it. This phase is played in draft. Then you will try to reconstruct the plot that is woven into it, among the 15 tales proposed. You will place your tiles according to the constraints specified in the game rules to build your story.

It is now up to the Bard of the Kingdom to tell the tale of your exploits, from castle to castle. This is how the adventures of your heroes will pass through the ages and perhaps become legendary.

The winner will then tell the story he made, either by making it up, or by reading the suggestions on the back of the objective cards.

name: Escape Of The Dead 2
description:
Escape of the Dead 2 is a game for 1 player where the player plays as a survivor heading to the Hospital seeking for help in a zombie-infested city. Roll dice and strategically decide your fate: Will you drive as fast as possible? Or will you defend your health endlessly? Whatever you do, you always need to Survive!

Overview:
Reach the hospital without depleting fuel or health along the way. The player will be encountering large groups of zombies, craft tools to help mitigate those dice luck, and stumbles into both fortunate and unfortunate events, well mostly the latter. Based on actions played throughout the game, the player will score only if the player reaches the hospital.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Schweizer Reise
description:
You can feel the ice-cold wind on your face. Snow is crunching under your feet. The panorama is simply amazing. You are standing on Jungfraujoch and looking out over Switzerland – it is a feeling like no other! You quickly take a picture before continuing on with your tour of Switzerland. There is so much to discover. In Broc you want to see Maison Cailler, the famous Swiss chocolaterie, and you plan to visit the Olympic Museum in Lausanne. And perhaps you will be lucky enough to snap a picture of an ibex in the national park! But unfortunately your holidays will soon be over. Only those who plan well manage to see as much of Switzerland as they can before the holidays officially come to an end. You obviously also need a bit of luck on this kind of trip. An exciting game for all Switzerland enthusiasts.

Aim of the game
You are exploring Switzerland with a small group of travellers. Your three travellers start in different cities in Switzerland: one starts in German-speaking Switzerland (in Basel), one starts in Ticino (in Mendrisio) and one starts in Western Switzerland (in Geneva). You win the game if you score the most points with your three travellers. To earn points, your travellers have to reach as many destinations as possible, go on discovery tours and take pictures of attractions.

How to play
The youngest player is the tour guide and is responsible for managing the calendar during the game. The youngest player begins the game and takes a turn. A turn means they 1) roll the dice and reroll and 2) perform the roll results. After a turn, the next player takes their turn going anticlockwise, and so on. Every time the tour guide takes their turn, a new day of travel begins. The tour guide moves the calendar marker forward to the next day.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Star Wars: Don't Upset The Wookiee!
description:
Celebrating some of Chewie's best scenes, this is a fast-paced card game where the Wookiee gets all the glory.

Play a card with an angrier Chewie than the last until he eventually loses it! Complete a set of Wookiees, be the first to lose your cards, or be the last one standing to win after three fun filled rounds!
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Ladder Climbing, Matching, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Humblebrag
description:
How many Eastern European countries can you name in 60 seconds? More importantly, how many can you CLAIM to know?

In Humblebrag players will boast and brag their way through a variety of different trivia topics ranging from geography to literature to Simpsons characters in a game of one upmanship that always ends with one player putting their money where their mouth is and rattling off a list of names in an effort to beat the clock!

Humblebrag isn’t just about what you know it’s also in what you can convince other players of. In the game, players take turns playing topic cards and declaring a bid of how many of that topic they can name, as play continues other players must either play a new card and raise the bid or call the previous player to find out if their bid was a bluff or a boast! This game is one part Trivial Pursuit, one part BullSh*T, and all parts fun!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Predictive Bid

name: Ik hou van Holland: Het verjaardagsspel
description:
The bang quiz from the makers of Ik hou van Holland. Play the nerve-wracking question game from Ik hou van Holland. Answer the questions correctly and pass the gift. But beware, if you don't know an answer, are you too slow? Then the gift might explode in your hands... BOOM!

—description from the publisher
categories: Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Travel Aggravation
description: In this travel version of a Pachisi descendant, up to four players attempt to move their four pawns one lap around the board, and into their home. Landing a pawn exactly on one of four points on the track allows the player to hop that pawn along those four points, for a large shortcut. Also, should the player roll a one, the pawn can move into the center for an even greater shortcut, since that pawn may exit to the final shortcut point before its home. A pawn occupying a space to which an opponent's pawn is moving becomes "aggravated" and sent back to base. Unlike Pachisi, there is no opportunity to form blockades for safety of the pawns and obstruction of the path.

name: Blenheim
description: Blenheim (The Wargamer Magazine #4) is a simulation of the famous battle involving the Duke of Marlborough which took place on August 13, 1704. The game includes a 16.5" X 11" map, 130 die-cut counters (128 playing pieces, one blank and a game turn marker), and a five page rules booklet with campaign overview by the designer.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Duodecim Scriptorum
description: This game is sometimes referred to an "Roman backgammon" but is different not only because of the board-- which could be drawn in the dirt using "12 Lines" and hence the name-- and because the Romans used tetrahedral knuck-bones instead of the more modern six-sided dice, the game is also more like the backgammon variant Acey-Ducey [traditional among seamen] in that the pieces start off the board, that rolls must be exact to take a piece off the board and other details.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: (Public Domain), Geoludie, HistoryGames.it, Les 7 Cailloux, Senet Belgium

name: Gnomes
description: Have you ever seen a Gnome before? Would you like to? In this game, you and your opponents travel through Gnomeland looking for the elusive little creatures. Whoever finds the most Gnomes is the winner. But beware, the path through Gnomeland can be dangerous, especially when you meet a Troll, the enemy of all Gnomes.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Zehnkampf
description: In "Zehnkampf" (=Decathlon) the players slip into the roles of athletes. Within each of the ten disciplines decathlete trying to collect as many points as possible. The individual disciplines will be chosen through various competitions dice. Who in the end had most points wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Avarium Academy
description:
Description from the publisher:

In the Japanese high school-themed battle board game Avarium Academy, each player assumes the role of one of Avarium Academy's eight unique Idols and tries to win the game by:


Completing their Idol's win condition,
Having the most merit points at the end of the game, or
Expelling all other Idols from the school to be the last one standing!


Avarium Academy has a quick set-up of just five minutes while games generally take 20-30 minutes. With its unique Idols, huge variety of interactive students, and powerful and tricky schemes, Avarium Academy is a fast-paced battle board game that promises a familiar yet different experience with each game!
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: TOPPEN
description:
バベルの塔 ("Tower of Babel"), also known as TOPPEN, is played with ten tiles — five black and five red — with each player taking one color. During set-up, the second player places the ten tiles face down randomly in a square grid so as to form a continuous shape of their choice. The tiles are flipped color-side up, then the game begins. Taking turns, players take one of their tiles and place it on top of a neighboring tile/stack. The following restrictions apply:


You can take only one tile, the topmost of a stack.
You cannot split the tiles into two separate groups.
You cannot move a tile to an empty space.


If you cannot make a legal move, you must pass until a legal move is available to you again. You cannot pass if a move is available.

The goal is to have your own tile at the top of the last pile remaining when the game ends.

name: Slag!: Combat on the High Frontier
description:
From the back cover:
Slag! is the space combat game you don't need to be a rocket scientist to play, or a defense budget to afford. Fast enough to play over lunch, with custom ship design and handicapping rules for different Tech Levels to provide endless variation and challenge. Let Slag! take you to where the wars of the future will be fought. You'll be glad you're not actually there.

name: Mini-Bingo
description: Mini-Bingo is a simple matching game in classic Bingo format for children. Turn over the animal tokens one at a time and whomever has that image on their card may claim it. A bit of luck is needed to place the six matching cards on one's game board. Whoever is the first to gather the corresponding motifs wins the game. An assigning game for 2-4 players. Comes with 4 game boards with pictures, 24 little cards, and 1 set of game instructions all in a charming tin container.

name: How Does Your Garden Grow?
description:
In How Does Your Garden Grow?, players want to tend to their garden, avoid pests that will eat their crops, and plant one of each of the six fruits and vegetables in the game. Whoever does this first wins.

To start the game, each player draws six seeds from the seed pouch at random and places them on front of the six slots on their 3D game board. On a turn, a player draws and reveals the top card. If it's a fruit or veggie and they have the matching colored seed, they can place this card in their game board in the slot next to the seed. If they lack this colored seed, they can swap one of their seeds with a seed drawn at random from the bag; if this now matches the card, they can plant it; otherwise they must discard the card.

Players might also draw a "Pick it!" card that allows them to steal a card from another player's garden, a "Pest" card that eats one card in your garden, or a "Helper" card that allows you to draw two cards, after which you play both.

Players continue taking turns until one of them has all six fruits and veggies in their garden, winning the game instantly.

name: BomBarDum
description:
Build the tallest tower in the kingdom! In Bombardum you must shoot, build and defend your tower in order to raise the victory flag. Enjoy epic games of destruction, strategy and chaos in this fun card game. The cannons are ready: let the BomBarDum begin. Fire!

In each turn a player plays a card on his tower and shoots, if the card is a cannon, to the tower next to it. To win the game a player has to reach 4 levels of the tower and keep it intact for one whole round.

name: Car Wars Fifth Edition Starter Set, Division 15 - Set 1
description:
Car Wars Fifth Edition Starter Set, Division 15 - Set 1 is a complete starter set for Car Wars: the basic rules, counters and components, and two cars. The cars are Hotshot vs. Piranha (with each have modifications). Division 15 duels allow a total of $15,000 for a vehicle. The Car Wars Turning Key included in the set is especially helpful.

Part of the Car Wars (Fifth Edition) Series.

Expands:

Car Wars (Fifth Edition)
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Science Fiction

name: France Fights On: An Alternative History Wargame of June 1940
description:
This alternative history wargame examines the strategic and operational possibilities inherent in the campaign that would have occurred within France in June 1940 if that country’s government had resolved not to give up, as was the case historically. The assumption is that they instead chose to evacuate as much of the French Army as possible to France d’Outre Mer (Algeria). The resultant campaign, then, is one of strategic retreat and pursuit. The German player must try to destroy as much of the evacuating French force as possible, while keeping his own losses to a minimum in doing so.

Both sides’ orders of battle are entirely historical. The game length is held to only one month because, had the Germans not triumphed in that amount of time, the delay thereby caused to their plans for the next year would’ve then amounted to a major defeat in itself in the wider war.

Each game turn represents two days. Each hex represents eight miles (13 km) from side to opposite side.
Components: One 22" x 34" map & 88 counters

Magazine: World at War #39

name: Battleship Bismarck
description:
A solitaire (or two players as well) game about naval-air battles of the II World World. Contains various battles, since 1939 (attack on the minelayer ORP Gryf) till 1942 (attack on the aircraft carrier Hiryu). Some scenarios can be played together in the campaign mode (like three Bismarck scenarios), while the others are stand alone ones.

Game uses tables and counters to show the effeciency of the attacks of the aircrafts or artillery duels between ships. Rules are short and easy, so the game can be played about 15 minutes after opening the box.

name: Monopoly Crooked Cash
description:
In the Monopoly Crooked Cash game things aren't always as they seem. Someone added fake cash and fake Chance cards! Luckily, Mr. Monopoly is giving players his decoder so they can find the fakes and still make a fortune.

It's a game of hidden reveals, and players get to challenge their opponents for using fakes with accusation coins. But use them wisely! You only get a few coins to play. Includes Monopoly tokens that play up the deceptive theme.

The normal rules and gameplay are streamlined to make the game fairly quick. The game ends when the last street is sold. The player with the most money at the end - real or fake - wins.
mechanics: Income, Market, Ownership, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Feeley Meeley
description: Play begins with all the items inside the box and the stack of cards on top of the box. The top card is revealed and players put their hands inside the box and attempt to recover, by feel only, the item pictured on the card. The winner is the player who finds more of the items.

name: Age of Bismarck: The Unifications of Italy and Germany 1859-1871
description:
"Age of Bismarck: The Unifications of Italy and Germany, 1859 – 1871 is a strategic simulation which models these great unification campaigns and the nationalistic drives that gave birth to them. Blending an active war fighting with a diplomatic warfare system, Age of Bismarck models the periods of hot war and the much more prevalent periods of cold war during this dynamic thirteen year period of European history.

Age of Bismarck hearkens back to the SPI Power Politics brand of games, ushered into the modern era of gaming by using the unique card-driven system pioneered by Mark Herman in We the People. The system allows a player to assume the role of Prussia, Sardinia, France, or Austria to see if they can successfully blend war and peace to attain their national objectives — objectives which can and will conflict with those of the other nation-states involved. The system also allows two and three player games, which challenges the player through the shifting of national alliances and the blending of nationalistic objectives."

Game Contents


22x34" full-color map
280 1/2" die-cut counters
176 5/8" die-cut counters
110 Action cards
Rules Booklet
Two Player Aid Cards
Four Power Display Cards
Four 6-sided Dice
Bookcase Box
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Double Take
description:
Double Take is a charades game built for two, so to speak. Each round, time willing, two players will present clues for a half-dozen familiar phrases that all have something in common. A sample category, for example, is "Something's Wrong" with the words to be guessed being divided as:


Play | Foul
In the Closet | Skeleton
Sheep | Black
Gun | Smoking


Each clue giver acts out one side of the card, and since they're facing the guessers, the phrases will be acted out in left-to-right fashion ("Black Sheep", "Smoking Gun", etc.) If someone guesses one side of the card, that player scores – but the clue givers score only after both sides of a phrase have been guessed, so they need to work together – but separately – to make their clues clear.

name: Junior Colourbrain
description:
Junior Colourbrain is a colourful quiz for kids where they get all the answers before they start, and they’re all colours!

All the questions are based on things kids should know but adults might struggle with, such as, “What colour are Strawberry Millions?”

Using the 11 Colour Cards in your hand, players put down the correct colour (or colours) to win the card. If it’s a draw, it starts a rollover! Play the correct colours and your team can race ahead with the points... as long as some of the other teams get it wrong. First to reach 10 points, wins!

name: Skip-Bo MOD
description:
The popular card game gets a modern makeover with bold graphics and a sleek, portable case, making it a great gift idea! It's still the same classic game - but has been enhanced with an exclusive MOD die. For ages 7+.

--

Each player is dealt a stockpile of 30 cards. The winner will be whoever manages to empty their stockpile first. Cards are played onto four shared building piles in numerical sequence from 1 to 12. On each turn, a player draws until they have five cards in their hand, and then plays cards from either their hand, a top card from their discard piles, or their stockpile. At the end of their turn, a player must discard onto one of their four personal discard piles.

Included in this version is the new MOD die. At the start of your turn roll the die. Three sides depict numbers that you can use the dice in place of that numbered card. One side is a Skip-Bo you can use as a wild. One side lets you discard two cards on your turn instead of one and the last side makes your opponent draw one card to add to their stockpile.

name: Doppelt und Dreifach
description:
Doppelt und Dreifach is an abstract card game by an anonymous author. It consists of cards numbered 2-15, with higher numbers being rarer. Each player holds six cards at the beginning. In clockwise order, players play one card each. If it is higher than any other card currently on the table, the lower card is discarded and the player who had played it has to draw a new card. However, if two or more players play the same number, the card values are cumulated. When it's a player's turn and their card is still in front of them, they can discard it without redrawing. First player(s) to get rid of their cards wins.

Doppelt und Dreifach was anonymously sent to various people in March, 2016. The rules or the box give no hint at the identity of the designer, publisher or point of origin. In July, Friedemann Friese revealed that he was the designer (https://boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/210813/futschikato-story-...).

name: Gekishin K.O.
description:
A quick playing 2 player boxing game. There are over 100 different techniques/attacks that can be used. Each one is rated with stats on Damage, Motion (speed), Range, and Target Location. You win by knocking out the other player, which is accomplished by dealing 10 damage to any one area, such as the head, body, or arms. You try to guess where your opponent is attacking as well as roll a die to see if you defend against their attacks. It becomes a rock-paper-scissors type game of guessing.

The first in Grapac Japan's series of games under the label "Aeronaut". They are meant to be very fast playing (around 15-30 minutes). They all come in a file-type holder, with the inside of the file being the game board, and all of the components attached to the ring binder in bags and pouches.

name: Grimaffen
description: In Grimaffen, players must remember the order of animal movements or sounds and imitate them in the right order to win. Choosing from thirty round tiles in five different colors, a player rolls a colored die to see which tile is added to the those already selected. The player then mimics the pictures on the tile to suggest an elephant's trunk motion or a wolf howl or a monkey's down-turned mouth, all within this zoo theme. Since the tiles use picture cues, reading is not necessary and components are not language specific.
publishers: Pegasus Spiele, Selecta Spielzeug, Swan Panasia Co., Ltd.

name: Zama: Hannibal vs Scipio
description:
Description from the publisher:

Zama is a simulation of the climactic battle of the Second Punic War: the decisive struggle between the Roman Republic and Carthage for control of the Western Mediterranean.

The war began in 218 BC, with the Carthaginians led by Hannibal, one of history’s greatest commanders. The two nations clashed for over a decade, with each experiencing triumphs and defeats. Following the Battle of the Great Plains in 203 BC, a ceasefire was negotiated. It was broken following a Carthaginian attack on a stranded Roman fleet in the Gulf of Tunis. Determined to finally win the war, Roman General Scipio Africanus led an invasion force into North Africa, the Carthaginian homeland. The opposing armies met near the town of Zama. Despite being outnumbered, the Romans were able to defeat the Carthaginians. With that victory the Romans had effectively won the war.

Zama is part of DG’s Battles of the Ancient World series, that emphasizes simple but realistic design features to show critical aspects of classical era combat. Special rules for leadership, missile fire, and elephants are included.

name: Pazaak
description:
Pazaak is a card game developed as a mini-game in the Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic video game series. It is similar to Blackjack, or 21, where the two players take turns drawing cards from a communal draw pile, trying to get their total as close to 20 without going over.

However, each player also has a side deck of 10 cards, with 4 of those cards being used each game. The side deck cards can be used to modify the player's current total, i.e. adding 1, subtracting 3, etc. The side deck is built by each player before the game, but at the beginning of the game, only the top 4 cards become the player's hand.

Each player takes turns, which includes drawing a card from the draw pile, adding that to the other cards already drawn/played by the player, then the player may either play a card from their hand, end turn, or stand (not taking and not playing anymore cards).

Each round ends with each player either standing or when a player ends his turn with a total over 20 (similar to busting in blackjack).

The person closest to 20 without going over wins the round. In the case of a tie, neither player wins. After one player wins 3 times, the game is over.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Video Game Theme

name: Martial Arts: The Card Game
description:
Martial Arts: The Card Game is a customizable card game that uses actual martial art techniques and philosophies in creating a unique first-person experience in your card battles. Each box contains four pre-constructed decks, and each deck combines one or more martial arts to create a playstyle that represents a single distinct fighting style.

You can mix and match cards from different decks and styles to customize your fighting style to suit your own preference. Included for this purpose is the Sparring Pack: a collection of individual cards not seen in any of the other decks.

Modes of play included in the box are Normal (1v1, last man standing; legal moves only, no weapons), Anything Goes (1v1 which allows weapons and illegal moves), and Army of One (1v9, hero versus gang boss and his thugs).

The four 54-card decks in Martial Arts: The Card Game are:


King of the Ring - Boxing
Master of 8 Limbs - Muay Thai
Ume and the Blade - Aikido, Okinawan Karate, Katana (weapon)
Enter the Phoenix - Wing Chun, Jeet Kune Do, Butterfly Swords (weapon)
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Stuka Leader Exp #7: Aces
description:
Includes 52 Luftwaffe pilots and 4 aces event cards

Fly some of the greatest Luftwaffe and Italian Pilots in World War 2!
Such Pilots as:
Adolph Galland
Werner Mölders
Rüdel
And plenty more!

Plane Types on Pilot cards

German ACE list
1 x Do-335
3 x Fw-190a5
3 x Fw-190a8
2 x Fw-190d
2 x He-51
1 x He-162
1 x Hs-123
6 x Me-109e
5 x Me-109f
4 x Me-109g
2 x Me-110s
1 x Me-163
3 x Me-262
2 x Me-410
2 x Ta-152
1 x Do-17
1 x He-111
2 x Hs-129
1 x Ju-86
1 x Ju-87d
1 x Ju-87g
1 x Ju-88

Italian Aces
2 x CR-42
3 x MC-202
2 x Re-2001
1 x SM-79

name: GW:s brott
description:
Reimplementation of the game Fluch der Mumie/Pyramid of Pengqueen.

One player takes on the role of Swedish criminologist Leif GW Persson who has to catch the criminals before they destroy evidence left behind.

The criminals each get five evidence cards in different colors which they need to get rid of by visiting different places on the vertical board where matching traces are located. Every time such place is visited the criminal hands over the corresponding evidence card to GW.

The person playing GW on the other hand is sitting on the opposite side of the board, trying to track the paths of the criminals, arrest them and put them in jail. Each time he catches someone he hands over a handcuff token to that player.

The goal for GW is to get rid of all the handcuff tokens, while each criminal tries to get rid of all his or her evidence cards. The first person to achieve this is the winner.

—user summary
mechanics: Memory, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Putin's War: Reclaiming the Soviet Empire in Eastern Europe
description:
The main idea is, NATO devolves toward operational ineffectiveness and, on that basis, old Vladimir decides to try for the big solution to get back all the former Soviet Union's western borderlands.

In designing the game (already done despite the long wait for its publication), I came up with a new system that emphasizes the following perspective: today's First World militaries are part way through a systemic transformation broadly comparable to the one they went through during the 1930s.

The issue in the 30s was how to integrate mechanization into what otherwise still remained foot-slogging, horse-drawn armies. The debate centered around how much horse cavalry to keep mixed in with the tanks, trucks and other combat vehicles. The idea was the large mass of unmotorized units would form a "base of maneuver" from which the relatively more scarce -- but elite -- moto-mech units would operate.

Of course, by the war's midpoint all that had been settled. The question had come to center on determining the optimal mix of tracked and wheeled vehicles, etc.

Today, we're witnessing a similar transformation in that the former moto-mech elite has, in effect, taken on the role of the previous era's foot-sloggers and horse cavalry: they're now the new "base of maneuver" element, holding the line while, evolving atop and past them, is the new elite: the special forces, which are themselves increasingly robot-equipped.

Given that the cost and social advantages involved in deploying small elites rather than the mass mechanized armies of the previous era (the draft isn't going to come back), I see us now at about the 1938-equivalent in terms of the new transition.

Aside from that, another characteristic is more and more of the First World's armies combat experience is increasingly contained within the personnel of the SoF. That, of course, further enhances their relative combat power.

To smoothly model all that, I've come up a system I've titled the "Big And Dumb Armies Super System" (BADASS). I'll be using it again.

This design will be appearing in Modern War issue number 29 (May-June 2017).

name: Wojowoce
description:
A simple card game about fruit warriors

Players compete in creating unique fruit cocktails. They use the unique skills of brave fruit fighters to make their own cocktail even better or spoil your opponents. Every Wojowoc is different and unique in its own way. Only a clever combination of their capabilities will give this unique effect that you are looking for. Wojowoce, is a simple card game that gives so many possibilities during the game, that will provide a lot of fruity fun for dozens of games.

Create the best fruit cocktail and do not be outdone by other players.

The game in "Wojowoce" begins with preparing the deck for the game. For the game, we choose one deck more than we have players at the table (there are a total of 6 decks in the game). Cards are mixed, we give away to players, and among the last cards we place the Heat card signaling the end of the party.

During the game, we play the card, effect it, place it in our game area (cocktail) in the same color fruit column and draw 1 card from the general deck (basket). There are four types of card effects in the game - attack, power (immediate effect), effect (permanent effect) and the reaction that we can play in response to the opponent's attack.

At the moment of getting the advantage over the opponents in the number of fruits in one color, we obtain a corresponding card providing additional points, however this bonus is transitive and we can lose it along with the loss of advantage for another player.

The game ends with a round after drawing the Heat card from the deck. At the end of the game, we count points on the cards in our Cocktail, points from the above-mentioned bonus cards for the advantage and after point for each card in hand. The player with the highest number of victory points won wins.



POLISH VERSION BELOWProsta gra karciana o owocowych wojownikach

Gracze prześcigają się w tworzeniu niepowtarzalnych koktajli owocowych. Wykorzystują wyjątkowe umiejętności dzielnych owocowych wojowników, aby uczynić własny koktajl jeszcze lepszym lub popsuć szyki przeciwnikowi. Każdy wojowoc jest inny i na swój sposób wyjątkowy. Tylko sprytna kombinacja ich możliwości da ten wyjątkowy efekt, którego poszukujesz. Wojowoce, to prosta gra karciana, która daje tak dużo możliwości w trakcie rozgrywki, że zapewni masę owocowej zabawy przez dziesiątki rozgrywek.

Stwórz najlepszy koktajl owocowy i nie daj się prześcignąć innym graczom.

Rozgrywka w "Wojowoce" zaczyna się od przygotowania talii do gry. Do rozgrywki dobieramy o jedną talię więcej niż mamy graczy przy stole (w grze jest łącznie 6 talii). Karty mieszamy, rozdajemy graczom, a wśród ostatnich kart umieszczamy kartę Upału sygnalizującego koniec partii.

Podczas rozgrywki zagrywamy kartę, wykonujemy jej efekt, po czym umieszczamy ją w naszym obszarze gry (koktajl) w kolumnie owoców o tym samy kolorze i dociągamy 1 kartę z ogólnej talii (koszyk). W grze występują cztery rodzaje efektów kart – atak, moc (efekt natychmiastowy), efekt (efekt stały) i reakcja, którą możemy zagrać w odpowiedzi na atak przeciwnika.

W momencie uzyskania nad przeciwnikami przewagi w liczbie owoców w jednym kolorze uzyskujemy odpowiadającą mu kartę zapewniającą dodatkowe punkty, jednakże bonus ten jest przechodni i możemy go stracić wraz z utratą przewagi na rzecz innego gracza.

Gra kończy się na rundę po wylosowaniu z decku karty Upału. Na koniec rozgrywki liczymy punkty widniejące na kartach posiadanych w naszym Koktajlu, punkty ze wspomnianych kart premii za przewagi oraz po punkcie za każdą posiadaną kartę na ręce. Wygrywa gracz z największą uzbieraną liczbą punktów zwycięstwa.

name: Community's Compendium II (fan expansion for Small World)
description:
The Community's Compendium II is a FREE print-and-play single pdf file for the game Small World.
In Small World, players use their troops to occupy territory and conquer adjacent lands in order to push the other races off the face of the earth.

This expansion contains 3 new Small World Races :

Wraiths
Necromancers
Owlbears



3 new Special Power Badges:

Assassin
Elephant master
Lake


All these elements are tested and produced by the BGG community. This Compendium is NOT an official add-on to game. This is an expansion and requires a copy of the Small World board game.
categories: Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Fantasy, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Fimbulvetr: Winter of Winters
description: A chess-like abstract strategy game with a Norse theme wherein pieces attack each other diagonally by matching symbols on their corners. The two included armies differ slightly in their abilities, and suggestions are included for creating your own armies using the black backs of the pieces.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Glider-Pit Gladiators
description:
Glider-Pit Gladiators (GPG) is a free print-and-play board game of ancient aerial combat. The latest version (GPG 2002) is available for download from the files section below.

Two to six players control primitive gliders descending into a deep, sheer-walled pit. Within this natural arena the glider pilots engage in ritualistic gladiatorial combat. A combination of martial and flying skills is required for victory. Every decision a player makes, from the selection of weapons to the anticipation of fickle air currents, helps determine whether a gladiator is on the road to glory -- or disaster.

The object of the game is simply to have the last glider airborne. The game features a variable player turn order (depending on the altitude and speed of each glider), five different types of weapons (including missile weapons and nets), risky ramming attacks, and up/down drafts. Players have the option of controlling more than one glider (up to three when playing with only two players). The game can be played as a competition between two or three teams of gliders, or as a "last man flying" free-for-all.

An experimental Campaign Expansion allows you to play a continuing gladiator character. The expansion includes rules for special abilities and advantages, character survival, and experience. Gladiator characters who survive a match (and aren't crippled in the process) receive experience and a chance to gain special abilities and advantages. Gladiators who are victorious are more likely develop skills that will help them gain future victories in the arena. A procedure for randomly generating experienced gladiator characters is also described.

Glider-Pit Gladiators was originally designed (under a deadline of a month or two) for the online 1998 Microgame Design Contest held via the Yahoo Groups Microgame Mailing List. The game was updated under the name Glider-Pit Gladiators 2002 (GPG 2002) for the second micro-game design competition. The 2002 update focused on cleaning up the rules and making improvements to the spartan components.
categories: Ancient, Aviation / Flight, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play, Sports, Wargame
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Income, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Team-Based Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Zoo Quest
description:
Zoo Quest is set in Africa and based on the UK television* show of the same name, and came out either in the 1950s or 1960s.

Players compete at gathering a prize-winning collection of animals, then returning home with their animals via the one international airport on the map. The types of winning collections (and the collection size limits) vary based on the number of players. Easily collected animals offer a smaller bonus than rarer beasts. Event cards and co-location both dictate whether a player successfully captures an animal for his collection.

In a single game, the first player to complete a collection will almost always end up with the most money even with the smallest award -able bonus. However, a series of games can be played which raises the importance of the value of one's collection.

Players may travel slowly on foot within a territory, and more quickly all over the board by plane. The more distant the target location, the more expensive the flight.

Animals may also be sold prior to the end of the game to gain working capital. This is necessary in some cases when a player spends his money flying across the board for a prize animal, only to have another player in the same location draw a "capture" card first from the event card deck.

For the most part, the game is also educational. Each animal card offers background on the particular animal. One exception is the humorous "Lesser-Spotted Swamp Dragon" card added in for a bit of humor.


David Attenborough's TV program
categories: Adventure, Animals, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Clean Water:  The Water Pollution Game
description:
From the rulebook: "In the game, each player assumes the role of a water pollution control official who is responsible for stocking his lake. He does so by collecting appropriate organisms as he moves around the game board, confronting the problems of water pollution each time he lands on a 'pollution' triangle. Throughout the game he must learn to anticipate possible pollution of his lake, attempt to avoid the problem of overpopulation, manage his finances efficiently, and consider the problem of possible pollution coming from upstream. A player wins the game by controlling water pollution successfully and thereby being the first to completely stock his lake."

Each player is the Commissioner of Water Pollution for their own lake. Each lake is connected by a series of rivers and surrounded by potential polluters. The first player to completely stock his lake with organisms while controlling the pollution from the nearby community of farms, industries and residential developments is the winner. Clean Water acquaints players with some of the complexities involved with dealing different types of pollutants while maintaining a healthy ecosystem.

Players roll a die to move around the board and collect organisms for their lakes. Landing on a pollution space will kill off some of the higher organisms and increase the lower organisms, but players can purchase Abatement cards to try to avoid the pollution. Overpopulation of any one type of critter will also disturb the ecology, but players can occasionally exchange lower organisms for higher ones. Players also have opportunities to bid for federal funding. The first player to fill his lake with the required organisms wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Undersea Adventure
description:
"The deep sea is full of secrets and rich in shapes and colors. This game will give a glimpse of the adventurous world underwater" - Hans Hass. Hass was a scuba-diving pioneer, and with his beautiful wife Lotte was well-known in the 1950s for his underwater photography and film-making.

Each player is a diver competing to bring to the surface the greatest number and value of sea creatures (and some treasure!). The deeper the dive, the greater the rewards, but also the greater the risk of losing the catch from unwelcome events or robbery by another player. Returning to their ship makes the diver's catch safe, but takes time, and the next dive may be limited to shallower waters where there is less to find.

The catch is represented by cards of differing values, with bonuses if sets are collected, including some dangerous creatures scoring negative points. Most show an interesting underwater photo. There are also Action (event) cards and Diving Equipment cards, that determine how deep each dive can go.

The board has a disc underneath, and when this is rotated different colors show through holes punched in the top board. Each turn the player takes the action determined by the color at the current location of their diver pawn - take a number of value cards, an event card or a "dangerous" card - and then hopes to move somewhere else to collect more value cards. The disc is rotated each time cards are taken, and the holes are far enough apart that the change of color is unpredictable. There is a die, but its main use is to determine the outcome of robberies.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Slaget om Blodsgläntan
description:
Introductory fantasy wargame included in Swedish games magazine Sinkadus number 16 (December 1988). The theme and background story is taken from the at the time very popular Swedish role playing game Drakar och Demoner. One player controls an invading orc army and the other player controls the human and elf defenders trying to stop them. Included are two pages of rules, a small color map and a sheet of one-sided unmounted counters.

Besides the standard two-player version there are also rules included for playing with three or four players.

name: Colorful Caterpillars
description: The little caterpillars are very excited because they are to get brightly colored clothes today. There is a great selection because there are many different colors and they come in a great variety of shapes. It's not easy to choose, and so the caterpillars decide to throw the dice to decide on the new clothes. One piece is threaded on after another, depending on what comes up.

name: You've Been Sentenced! Add-On Deck: Sci-Fi/Fantasy
description: A set of 80 additional cards for the game You've Been Sentenced with science-fiction/fantasy themes.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Party Game, Science Fiction, Word Game

name: Adventurous Apples To Apples Snack Pack
description:
Adventurous Apples to Apples Snack Pack can be played as a standalone game or combined with any other Apples to Apples game to bring new choices into play.

Either way, Apples to Apples consists of two decks of cards: Things and Descriptions. Each round, the active player draws a Description card (which features an adjective like "Hairy" or "Smarmy") from the deck, then the other players each secretly choose the Thing card in hand that best matches that description and plays it face-down on the table. The active player then reveals these cards and chooses the Thing card that, in his opinion, best matches the Description card, which he awards to whoever played that Thing card. This player becomes the new active player for the next round.

Once a player has won a pre-determined number of Description cards, that player wins.

name: Pirates Code
description:
User summary:
Pirates Code is a game of deduction and bluffing. There are 14 cards, each numbered 1 through 14, and 12 of them are dealt to players evenly. The remaining 2 cards compose a cipher of the treasure cache. A player wins the game by specifying the correct numbers of these 2 cards.

Each card has its own ability to help gain some clues about the treasure cache. But using the ability comes with a risk of revealing clues to other players. Players have to weigh the risk and the benefit when playing a card.

When a player is sure they have enough clues, it's time for them to declare the codes. The player wins if they are correct. If another player says they have one of the declared numbers, the declaration fails. The declared player misses one turn, but they don't get eliminated, and at least they gain a clue that another player has one. Therefore players may declare codes without enough clues, and experienced players will find out other benefits from early declaration.

「パイレーツコード」は推理とブラフのゲームです。
1～14の番号が書かれた14枚のカードのうち、12枚をプレイヤーに均等に配ります。残った2枚は財宝の隠し場所を示す暗号となります。この2枚の番号を正しく言い当てたプレイヤーが勝者です。
カードにはそれぞれ独自の効果があり、財宝の隠し場所に関する手がかりが得られます。しかし、それには相手に手がかりを与えるリスクも付きまといます。カードを使用する際は、このリスクとリターンを測る必要があります。
十分な手がかりを得られたと確信したら、暗号を宣言します。その暗号が正しければ勝利します。正しくなくても1ターンを費やすだけで、脱落はしません。そのため、実は十分な手がかりがなくても宣言することができますし、熟練者はこの宣言を他の目的で使うことを思いつくでしょう。

Publisher summary:
Pirates Code is a deduction card game without player elimination, where you can hide a trap inside your deduction (the literal translation of 推理の影に罠を仕込む is "to set a trap in the shadow of your deduction"). You lead your pirates and try to decipher the codes for the treasure cache. Your goal is to be the first player who identifies and declares the 2 correct numbers out of 14 candidates. You have more than one chance to declare, so you don't always have to declare the direct answer. Hide your true intention when you declare.

「推理の影に罠を仕込む」ことができる脱落のない推理カードゲームです。あなたは海賊たちを従え、14の数字から財宝の隠し場所を示した2つの数字を、誰よりも早く解き明かすことを目指します。

name: Ausgefuchst!
description:
The young foxes slip into the henhouse for their evening test of wits, to find the fastest and most skilful. Who will be the first to
snatch six hens? But the white chickens are not so easily taken in by their pranks! If one is woken, she immediately drops from her perch
onto the troublemaker! If this happens, all the little foxes band together and help each other out, with one of them catching the chicken ...

In this quick dexterity game, players race to steal six chicken as quick as possible. But beware of the mother hens: if they fall, the other players may quickly grab them as a wild. The first to achieve the goal and leave the stable wins the game!

name: Putin's Northern War: The Coming Struggle for Finland
description:
This is a wargame in which solitaire play can be fudged but is more usually played with two, whereby one (the “Russian player”) commands the Kremlin’s forces and the other (the “Allied player”) commands the Finnish-Swedish alliance opposed to him.

This isn’t a simulation of the “opaque (a.k.a. gray) war” techniques most recently used by the Russians in the Crimea and eastern Ukraine. Rather, it’s designed to facilitate the examination of the strategic possibilities (along with their operational undertones) inherent in this potentially larger and more drastic situation.

The crisis being modeled here, though not yet much discussed, will certainly come into being if the drift of the two “neutral” Scandinavian nations toward NATO membership continues. That would, in turn, most likely occur if – probably in reaction to the growing Muslim in-migration crisis there – a conservative government came to power in Sweden.
