People from Jugamos Tod@s are The Heroes from Córdoba! To be used with Legends 2-5 to reduce the difficulty of the legends - with a strong helping for the brave heroes!

When the narrator arrives the marked letter of each hero, the corresponding Héroe de Córdoba is activated, with different powers.

name: Κυνήγι ερωτήσεων: Ζώα-Φυτά (Quiz Hunt: Animals - Plants)
description:
A competitive game with 600 questions about Greece and the whole world focusing on Animals and Plants.

The game play is simple: Each player rolls the dice and according to the outcome of the dice he is being asked the corresponding question. If he answers right, he collects the card.

The player or the team with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

It belongs to a series of trivia games Κυνήγι Ερωτήσεων
1.History
2.Animals - Plants
3.Science
4.Culture
5.Sports
6.Geography
7.20th century
8.Greece

name: Race to Riches
description:
For party and holiday!

Combined bid, luck, contest in a game.

The rules are simple, the process of stimulation, and yet joyous explosion point game depth, especially for playing together in the New Year with their families!

This is not only a game, but also is table decorations!

Do follow 7 steps in a round:
Step 1: Auction to become the banker.
Step 2: The banker pay into Money Pool, choose a Race Card and receive 6 Point Cards.
Step 3: All player except banker place a Large/Small Betting Card.
Step 4: All player except banker guess the banker's Point Cards.
Step 5: Show Point Cards and distribute the Money Pool to those players who made the correct bet.
Step 6: The banker moves statues of deities forward.
Step 7: End the current round.

Race Card is worth $80 for the first place, 60 for the second place, 30 for the third place, 0 for the fourth place. Each player sum the values of Game Coins and Race Cards in his/her possession. The player with the largest sum wins the game.

name: Moonshine Run
description:
The year is 1932. The Japanese have attacked Shanghai, America has a bobsledding team, the five day work week has begun, and Prohibition is in full swing. All in all, it is a good year and tonight you have to collect the White Lightning. These Tennessee Mountains are full of moonshiners waiting for you to transport their shine. Now all you have to do is brave the dangers and make it back. You are not alone and, although others might not be as brave as you are, some might be smarter. You have to get more shine then they do and buy back the farm.

Moonshine Run is a game about both luck and guts, where each player is racing down the mountain to deliver their Moonshine to their customers. Along the way, they can pick up more Moonshine Jugs and different Items that may help them out. However, there is also hazards up on the mountain that could cause the player to lose their turn and any Moonshine Jugs they have collected.

There are six rounds during a game of Moonshine Run. Each round, a player pays Moonshine Dollars to access Road Card. Each road card if flipped as it is drawn. A play may come across some Moonshine Jugs, Item Cards or Hazard Cards. It is up to the player to decide when enough is enough and to call it quits.

This is a fast, press your luck game where you must know when to stop.

To purchase a copy of Moonshine Run, visit our homepage at madman.mx
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck

name: Crowded Waters
description: Each player places a shark tile of his color on a designated starting space on an 8X8 board. On his turn, a player "moves" his shark by placing another tile of his color on the space next to his previously placed tile to which that earlier tile points. The newly placed tile may point in any direction, except to a space that another shark already points to or to an occupied space. Players eventually will get hemmed in and will be unable to move. Last shark standing or, rather, swimming wins.

name: Madder Than a Hatter
description:
You have noticed that your small city is lacking a proper haberdashery. Who better to fill that need than you? You love hats! With a wallet full of cash and a newly signed lease, you set out to open your very own store. Unfortunately, a few other individuals have had the same idea and open their own stores. To make matters worse, there's only one hat maker in town! Compete with your opponents to stock your shelves with the best selection of hats while sticking them with stock they won't be able to sell.

Madder Than a Hatter is a hybrid of take-that and set collection mechanisms. On your turn, you must place one hat into any player's inventory and take the first hat off of the hat maker's assembly line. Some hats are premium and allow you to manipulate the player's inventories or the hatters assembly line. After all hats have been played, points are scored and a new round begins. Points are scored for having only one hat of a style, or for having a monopoly on a style. Play a number of rounds equal to the number of players, then whoever has the most points wins!
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Irokata Origami
description:
User summary:
いろかたおりがみ (Irokata Origami) is a puzzle game that uses origami (Japanese folding paper).

You are given a sheet of four-colored grid paper, and from a deck of cards you draw a pattern card. This depicts a certain shape with color pattern and a number of folds allowed. You pass the test if you have made that shape and color pattern by folding the given paper that number of times.

This game is recommended for 6 year-old and older people. A test is intended to be solved in around five minutes.

The game is sold with a sheet of folding paper and pattern cards in one package. You can print and play the game free by downloading PDF file of folding paper and 45 pattern cards from the publisher's dedicated website shown in the Weblinks.

Publisher's summary:
「いろかたおりがみ」はお題にある図の色と形に指定された回数で折るための折り方を探す、1人から遊べるおりがみをモチーフとしたパズルゲームです。
[6才以上向け,1お題あたり5分程度を想定]

専用おりがみとお題カードが一箱にまとまったパッケージがあります。
このページ下部のWeb Linkセクションにある、PnP edition on dedicated websiteのリンク先で、専用おりがみのPDFデータとお題のカードデータ(現在45種)を公開しており、自分で環境を揃えて無料で遊んでみることが出来ます。
categories: Children's Game, Party Game, Print & Play, Puzzle

name: Escola de Dragões: Intercâmbio no Oriente
description:
The Gran-masters decided to take their students on a vacation exchange to practicing against a different school. But it seems that will not be easy.

This first expansion for School of Dragons extends the a number of players to 5 (base deck + expansion) and adds 26 cards with Orient-themed illustrations (art by Jersey Giuliano) and two new powers found in two cards:

Old Master - His power change the direction of the table (from clockwise to counterclockwise or vice versa).
Troll Kabuki - Allows the player to see 4 cards from the hand of another player.

The game continues with the same simple features, uniting experienced and novice player while keeping the fun.

From the publiser (Portuguese):
Os magos da Escola de Dragões decidiram levar seus alunos em um intercâmbio de férias para que praticassem contra uma escola diferente. Mas parece que não será fácil.

Na primeira expansão de Escola de Dragões amplia a quantidade de jogadores de 4 para 5 participantes e adiciona 26 cartas com ilustrações com temática oriental, todos os desenhos com a belíssima arte de Jersey Giuliano, e dois novos poderes encontrados nas duas cartas:

Mestre Treinador - Permite que o jogador veja a mão de outro participante
Troll Kabuki - Sim! O terrível Troll também foi para o oriente! E resolveu participar de aulas de teatro! Seu poder é inverter o sentido da mesa. Se o jogo está no sentido horário ele passa a ser anti horário! Ou vice versa.

O jogo continua com a mesmas características simples mantendo sua pegada de unir jogadores experientes e novatos sem perder a diversão.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Party Game

name: Huh, What Is in the Wardrobe?
description:
Somewhere in the world there lives a blue-haired monster who has had enough of scaring people and hearing their teeth chatter every time they see him. That is why we sometimes can't find the cloths we are certain that we put at the right place the day before. Can you remember what you have in your wardrobe? You can find out in this game! A tricky memory game with big and small and cards.

Common goal memory game. A card with several clothes is revealed. After memorizing it the players look at their own cards, and decide if they were represented on the common cards.

name: Barely Balanced
description:
Barely Balanced is a quick game of daredevil antics and reckless stupidity in which you try to create an acrobatic show that would strike fear into the hearts of insurance adjusters everywhere.

Game play - Each round players start with a hand of 6 cards. The goal is to play tricks using the cards in their hand. Players my trade cards from the table or draw more cards from the deck. The player to play all their cards take the round, but all the tricks played by everyone are scored. Once a single player has taken 3 round the game ends. The player who has scored the most points over the course of the total rounds wins the game.

Game play was influenced by French Tarot and Japaneses Hanafuda and other classic card games.

The Barely Balanced card game is based on the Comedic/Acrobatic stunt show Barely Balanced.

Barely Balanced game was designed as promotional product for the group by designer Max Holliday. Max had been a fan of the acrobatic group for a few years, and while watching a show at the Bristol Ren Fair came up with the game. He proposed the game as soon as the show ended.

name: Mad Scientists!
description:
Test your patience with this 2-6 player card drafting game.

Each player controls a scientist that has one thing on their mind... Irritating the other scientists! This frustratingly fun card game takes aim at the family audience, and is most fun with 6 players.

There are two decks (a community deck and an idea deck), and six 20 sided die that come in each game.

At the beginning of each game, a player receives ten cards. Each player will roll their die and whoever rolls the highest goes first. This will continue clockwise.

From the community deck players find resources to help them along with making their awesome ideas come to life!

To create an idea, each player will need 1 lab coat, 2 schematics, and 2 chemical sets.

In the idea deck are patience testers. Everything from monsters, contraptions, to your favorite TV show!

When coming up with an idea, you never know what you'll get. Idea cards are marked with a + or - on them and can either be played against a player, or on yourself.

When playing a - against a player, this will make their patience go down. Say you come up with a -3 patience card and you play it against someone. Their patience die will go down from 20 to 17.

Also in the deck, are + patience cards. If your patience die is at 17 and you play a +2, you will turn your die back to 19. Players may not go above 20. If a player reaches or goes past 0, the player has lost all patience and is mad. (They are out)
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Player Elimination

name: Hakoniwa no kuni "The Reclamation"
description:
User summary
箱庭の国 "The Reclamation" (Hakoniwa no kuni "The Reclamation") (in English The Land of Miniascape "The Reclamation").

Hakoniwa no Kuni is a two-player game with a theme of flower-growing in an enchanted garden. In a 6x6 square grid, two gardeners move, grow their flowers, and shorten opponent's flowers.

Each turn, you move your gardener to adjacent square, and play a reclamation card. A reclamation card indicates squares to be reclaimed. You may grow your flowers and/or shorten opponent's flowers in these squares.

This game has two modes of play, and each mode has specific victory conditions, such as to occupy 12 squares with your flowers. You win the game when you fulfill the victory condition, or forcing your opponent unable to move or reclaim.

The flower components are hand-made by the designer, formed in clay and baked in an oven.

The first edition was published in May 2016 for the Tokyo Game Market (TGM). The second edition, published in December 2016 for TGM, includes another set of rules in addition to the first edition's rules.

The first edition's rules descriptions in the rulebook are slightly adjusted, but its rules are basically passed down as is to the second edition.

Publisher's summary
「箱庭の国」は、魔法にかけられた花たちの庭園を舞台にした二人用ボードゲームです。
手番では、プレイヤーは「庭師」と呼ばれる駒を移動させ、手元のカードを使って「開拓」アクションを実行します。
その結果、「庭師」を中心としたボード上の一定範囲に自分の石が置かれて陣地となり、逆に相手の石は取り除かれていきます。
このゲームでは、「庭師」も陣地も積み上げられた石で表現されており、局面は同じ形状をした石の裏表と積み重ねのみによって形作られます。
陣地を12マス得る、相手の「庭師」を無力化するなどの条件を満たしたとき、ゲームに勝利します。
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Stratos: Light in the Darkness
description:
It has been a year since the five tribes of Stratos began their journey - each carving their own path to prosperity in the fabled land of legend. Plentiful resources have begun appearing along fault lines almost as if they were gifts from beings dwelling in the depths below. The people thought the gifts a blessing but they could not have been more wrong...

Stratos: Light in the Darkness plays as both a themed extension to the original 'Stratos' and as a stand-alone 2-player game. Exciting new challenges await, including Monsters which add a co-operative element to the game. When combined with the original, Stratos: Light in the Darkness can be played with up to 7 players!

Stratos: Light in the Darkness has 5 character classes, each serving a distinct function. Characters move from space to space on a tile-based board which can be arranged randomly or according to set maps. Each character can perform up to 2 unique actions per turn with movement being a repeatable action. Available character actions (dependent on class) include Harvest, Travel, Search, Attack, Shoot, Defend, Cast and Use.

Points are awarded by defeating characters, casting unique spells, discovering treasures, hoarding resources, promoting characters, occupying strategic locations and slaying Monsters! The first player to reach a pre-determined number of Prosperity points (default 10) is declared the winner.

Stratos: Light in the Darkness is a product of Board and Tale Games Inc., a Canadian boardgame publisher based in Hamilton, Ontario.
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Tile Placement

name: Dwarven Weeaboos
description:
Description from the publisher:

Dwarven Weeaboos is a light set collection game celebrating nerd culture. Players take on the role of a Dwarven Weeaboos and work together to build the perfect waifu (husbando / inhuman abomination).

Players sell cards in their hand for gold, which can be used to buy cards fro their collection. These collectibles can be purchased either from the communal store, or the player's own hand. Cards have unique effects that help build sets or mess with the other players. Players must match sets to build the strongest collection possible. Collect across 5 categories of cards: Card Games / Anime / Culture / Apparel / Internet.

When a set gains a 2nd card, the player gains a waifu part. When a set reaches 3 or more cards the player gets to play a waifu part. Players contribute Waifu parts together and each part changes the way scoring works at the end of the game. Be sure to build wisely! Once the waifu is complete, it will marry the player with the highest scored based on the card that make her/him up.

Cards all have unique art and are filled with references and jokes to nerd culture. Dwarven Weeaboos is sure to get a laugh!

name: Quick Eye
description:
Quick Eye is an amazing game for kids and grown-ups that requires you to use your imagination and notice the surroundings.

How to play?
The rules are simple. Shuffle the cards and place them face down. Turn over the top card from the deck. Read out the word and explain the meaning to any younger players. .Look for a noun (name or object) – which you would associate with the word on the card. Use the environment around you for inspiration. Found it?

For example:
‘Soft’ – this can be your favourite toy (Paddington bear), neighbours cat (Spots), your clothes or your mommy’s hug.
‘Smelly’ – this can be your brother, broccoli or fish.
Then open the next card and look for something that is matching both these words. Now another card! The game becomes more difficult and fun with each new opened card. Let your imagination and creativity kick in!

Where to play?
Anywhere you like! You don’t have to sit at the table to enjoy Quick Eye. You can play at home, in the car, outdoors, on your way to school, when visiting friends or queuing at the shops. Looking for objects with given qualities becomes even more fun if you change the location.
Who is this game for?
For all the family. Quick Eye encourages kids and adults to discover the world and focus the attention on things around you.
When travelling.. With just a deck of cards you can cover a few hundred miles having a lot of fun and keeping your kids busy!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Fantasy, Word Game
publishers: ABM Yayınevi, FoxGames, Simple Rules, Sugorokuya

name: Doro-Doko
description: This is a deduction game happening in a honeycomb-shaped collective housing complex. Guess where the robber is hiding, using stolen goods as clues.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment

name: 木馬と英雄 (Trojan Horse & Heroes)
description:
User summary
木馬と英雄 (Mokuba to Eiyuu) Trojan Horse & Heroes is a card game themed on Grecian wars.

You are a hero of Ancient Greece fighting for control of the lands. Sometimes you deceive your opponents by hiding your soldiers within the belly of a wooden horse, sometimes you march to the front lines to boost the morale of your troops.

However, it’s important to keep in mind when the deciding card for a battle is placed down on an area, all following turns will be lost.

Trojan Horse & Heroes is a card placement game that builds upon the classic home-base occupation style game, requiring players to compete to take over the lands.

あなたは古代ギリシアの英雄となって新たな支配地を求めて戦います。ときには兵士を木馬の中に隠して相手を欺き、ときには自ら戦地に赴いて兵士の士気を高めましょう。
ただし、一つの地で勝負を決めるカードを置くと、その後の手番をすべて失ってしまうことに気をつけねばなりません。
「木馬と英雄」は土地をめぐる一種の競りに陣取りの要素を加えたカード配置ゲームです。

name: Stud Poker
description:
Stud poker is any of a number of poker variants in which each player receives a mix of face-down and face-up cards dealt in multiple betting rounds. Stud games are also typically non-positional games, meaning that the player who bets first on each round may change from round to round (it is usually the player whose face-up cards make the best hand for the game being played). The cards dealt face down to each individual player are called hole cards, which gave rise to the common English expression ace in the hole for any hidden advantage.

Cards are dealt in a prearranged combination of face-down and face-up rounds, or streets, with a round of betting following each. This is the next-oldest family; as poker progressed from three to five-card hands, they were often dealt one card at a time, either face-down or face-up, with a betting round between each. The most popular stud variant today, seven-card stud, deals two extra cards to each player (three face-down, four face-up) from which they must make the best possible 5-card hand.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Pillaging Maruaders
description:
You are a space pirate trying to retrieve a treasure that was lost during a bitter battle many years ago. You need to return the loot to your own planet to win the game. Do you wait for them to find it and then wipe out their fleet? Or do you go for it and hope to make it back to your planet unscathed?
movement uses dice rolls to determine how far you can go.
movement is done with either one ship moving each dice in a single direction. or the same direction. or two seperate ships moving a direction based on one of the dice counts each.

https://www.facebook.com/PillagingMarauders/

name: Polar Party
description:
When the parents are not there, the little penguins launch a "Polar Party"! As they slide on the icebergs, they go fishing for fish, their favourite treat. But beware of the killer whale that roams and steals fish! And, most important of all, they have to be in their pyjamas and asleep when their parents come home from their dinner...

Every turn roll the dice to get some fish! The hardest part? Deciding whether to continue or go to bed!

Welcome to a special sleepover!
publishers: DV Games, Ediciones MasQueOca, Happy Baobab, Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, Pegasus Spiele

name: Pick-Up
description:
Throw your chips onto an unstable turntable and be the first to get rid of all your chips.

The equipment is like a turn-table. There is a spring on which you place a cap, with a pointed top facing up. The top is to serve as spindle for the turntable. All 32 chips are divided equally among the players who sit down (or stand) at a certain distance from the turntable. Minimum distance should be 30cm, measured between the clenched fist (arms outstretched)and the centre of the turntable.
The object of the game is, for each player to try to get rid of his stock of chips, as quickly as possible. Players try to do so, when it is their turn, by throwing a least one chip onto the turntable, after which they may give the next player his turn. However, if a player thinks he will be able to get rid of more than one chip during one and the same turn, he may go on throwing chips onto the turntable. But mind this: if, during a player's turn, chips fall of the turntable, his turn is over, and he must add the fallen chips to his stock.
In case a player, when it is his turn, feels it would be too risky to try and throw chips onto the turntable, because he is afraid many chips may then fall off, that player may throw one of his chips and miss, deliberately. In other words: he may try to throw his chip in such a way, that it will bounce off the top side of the turntable. There must have been contact.
The player who first gets rid of all his chips, wins the game. Players may also agree to play several rounds, to have one final winner.

name: Superfight: The Naughty & Nice Deck
description:
The Holidays are a time for family and cheer, but we know that you're tired of that. So here's a holiday expansion to Superfight that mixes horribly offensive things with whimsical all-ages cards. Be warned though, the naughty cards in here are not for children.
WARNING: This deck contains XXX-Rated cards that are not appropriate for children.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Science Fiction

name: X is Y
description:
A friendly game of making clever connections between unrelated things.

Which ice cream flavor is a bass guitar? Which sport is breakfast? Which Star Wars character is the Eiffel Tower?

X is Y is a game about comparing two lists, such as ice cream flavors and musical instruments. The facilitator will choose an item from list A (musical instruments) and show the other players the title of list B (ice cream flavors). Then all players will all come up with their best answer to the question, which X is Y?

Players gain one point for each other player that they match, and then they try again with a different word from list A, such as which ice cream flavor is a flute? Using the information that they gained about their friends in the first turn, they will try to preserve the points that they earned, and earn more in the second turn. On the second turn, the players gain one point for each other player they match, but they lose a point for each player they don’t match.

At the end of 2 turns, points are tallied and positive points are added to their score. The facilitator changes and one word is swapped out. After each player is facilitator, scores are tallied and the high score wins!

-description from publisher


Released in the January 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Chaos Chosen Team Card Pack
description:
This is a pack of 44 handy reference cards for a Chaos Chosen Blood Bowl team, along with blank cards allowing every coach to create their own players! Contained in the pack:


Reference cards for Beastman Runner, Chosen Blocker, Minotaur, Chaos Spawn, and Frog;
Reference cards for the following Star Players: Lord Borak the Despoiler, Grashnak Blackhoof, Lewdgrip Whiparm, Max Spleenripper, Bilerot Vomitflesh, Withergrasp Doubledrool, Scyla Anfingrimm, Gobbler Grimlich, Morg 'n' Thorg, Guffle Pusmaw;
The following blank cards that you can use to create your own players: 12 Beastman Runners, 6 Chosen Blockers and 2 Minotaurs;
A team roster card, with match record on the reverse;


The following 7 Special Play cards: Daemonic Ectoplasm, Whispered Secrets, Hand of God, Helm of Many Eyes, Sweatband of Everlasting Conquest, Over Familiar, Athletic Cup of Damnation;

The most important card: a card explaining how to use the other cards.


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Mix-Max-Rallye
description:
A monkey can climb well, a penguin can swim fast, and a kangaroo can jump very high — but are you familiar with the Pinguru? No?! Well, you'll be astonished at how well it can swim and jump!

Mix the appropriate mix-max animal for the race in Mix-Max-Rallye and be the fastest player to traverse the obstacle course. With some luck, you'll win this exciting obstacle race.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Squirrelin' Around
description:
Your group of Squirrels has chosen you as their champion, to face the others in the Forest Harvesting Championship! You must be the best collector of Acorns and Berries while climbing the heights of the Magic Acorn tree.

On your turn, play a Tree Branch card to collect your desired treat, then place a Tree Stump on top. Plan your turn carefully, as all players get a tasty treat each round.

Be careful though! One wrong move could send the Magic Acorn tree tumbling down. Add your squirrel token to the tree if you're brave. If your token is highest when the tree falls, you get extra points. After 3 rounds, count up all your Acorns and Berries and see which squirrel is the champion!

-Description from publisher

name: Jokes de Papa: version Sucrée
description: In this Sweet version you will find 200 jokes specially chosen to spend a memorable moment with your family!

name: Kross the Wordz
description:
Crossword puzzles with a difference: Kross the Wordz allows each player to choose one letter in turn, which everyone must then use. Quite tricky, if the sideline wants a Y, which now does not fit in their own word plans. Although one can also expose a disagreeable letter, but that gives negative points, and - of course - the longer the word, the more points there are.

Here's how it works:
A player calls any letter. All players enter it on their block sheet. Everyone has a task card that they have to work on. The goal is to form as long and meaningful words as possible in order to fulfill the task. Whoever succeeds best, gets many points. If you do not want to enter a letter, take a penalty card from the middle. Who has the most points in the end, wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Death Rabbits
description:
In Death Rabbits you fight against other clans of mutant rabbits, in Battle Royale style, with the goal to destroy them and conquer the post-apocalyptic world!

Death Rabbits draws influence from old style turn-based artillery games such as Scorched Earth and Worms, incorporating move, attack and defend mechanisms along with concepts such as Range, Line of Sight and Area of Effect.

The game is played on a landscape made up of 6, out of 8 tiles, randomly selected. The Rabbits then move across the landscape trying to kill each other, whilst defending themselves against incoming attacks from other clans.

Players must manage their arsenal of Explodey, Stabby and Shooty weapons to inflict the maximum damage on their rival clans. But, they must be aware of their opponents' weapons and build their defences appropriately.

Death Rabbits also contains 5 Booster cards which come into play later in the game, giving the clans additional powers that enhance their attack, defence or movement abilities.

The last clan with Rabbits alive rules the world!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Against the Shadow
description:
Darkness falls upon the world of Urth, the Demon Lord’s shadow spreading chaos, war, and madness. The darker the shadow becomes, the worse the world gets until the Destroyer of Worlds finally emerges from the Void to devour and destroy everything. Are these the end times as foretold?
Perhaps. Perhaps not.

Across the lands of Rûl, great patrons have come forth to answer the threat of the Eternal Shadow in a desperate bid to throw back the darkness and seal the rifts to the Demon Lord’s realm. The Great Druid rouses the forests to fight back against demon and cultist, while the Queen of the Fey rallies the last of her children to stand against the horrors loosed by the growing unrest. These and others come together to find the light that is needed to safeguard Urth for the rest of time.

In this game, you play a patron, one of the great powers of Rûl, working to halt the demonic threat. You do this by recruiting heroes and sending them into deadly circumstances, to defeat demons and the vile cultists who summon them, to slay beasts, and to protect the failing light in the face of the encroaching shadow.
You win the game if the light reaches its goal before the shadow. You lose if the shadow reaches its goal before the light, or if four breach cards are in play.
Against the Shadow is a cooperative game, best played with two to five players. A typical game takes about an hour to finish.

name: Zombie World: Enclave Expansion – The Mall
description:
Welcome to the Mall

A temple to capitalism and a fortress against the dead. Maybe this place will help keep you alive, so long as you don't mind living off the food court for a while.

The Mall Enclave Expansion for ZOMBIE WORLD adds a whole new enclave you can use in any session of the tabletop roleplaying game, with new options, characters, and possibilities for your game.

Includes: 18 Population cards, 27 Identity cards, 4 Advantage cards, 4 Fate cards, & 2 Enclave cards

From the back of the box
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Storytelling

name: Kubruss
description:
In this 2-player game, each player gets all 7 pieces (4 small 1×1 square pieces, 2 medium 1×2 squares pieces, 1 large 2×2 squares piece) of the same color (red or blue).

On a 4×5 grid, players must choose one of their pieces and place it on the board (large and medium pieces can cover smaller pieces if as long as the smaller piece is completely covered).

The game ends when players run out of pieces or places to add one. The player with the largest area (adjacent squares of the same color) wins. In case of a tie, the player with the most apparent small pieces wins. If the tie persists, the player who wasn't the first player wins.

name: Mars Needs Heroes
description:
Mars Needs Heroes!

Save the Peaceful Colony on the Red Planet

Transmitting live from Mars, a distress beacon beams directly to Earth: Mars Needs Heroes! The peaceful colony on the red planet is under siege from intergalactic invaders intent on taking control. Use your team of allies (the Bot, the Doc, the Tech, and your two Squad Leaders) or employ the powerful freeze ray to outplay other teams and capture as many evildoers as you can. Whoever traps the most invader cards is the ultimate hero!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Constrained Bidding, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Fumbling Ferrets
description:
Fumbling Ferrets is a word game in which you use your animal instinct to buy letters and ferret out words most the most points in this high-stakes game of nimble-minded fun!

The game is played over three rounds of four turns each. Players may buy one letter each turn. At the end of the fourth turn, players have just 30 seconds to make the highest-scoring word they can using the cards they have in their hand. They can also opt to take advantage of the High Stakes Bonus card for bonus points! The player with the highest points at the end of each round will receive a Mother Load token, worth additional points. The player with the most points after three rounds wins the game.

—description from the publisher
publishers: Games by Bicycle, The United States Playing Card Company

name: Clue: Downton Abbey
description:
The classic mystery board game has an aristocratic twist as it features characters and themes from the award-winning masterpiece television series, Downton Abbey. While at a Crawley family dinner party, Mr. Carson realizes something was stolen and he needs help solving the mystery.

The game includes:

Iconic stolen objects. Which objects were stolen? Includes golden miniature tokens inspired by iconic Downton Abbey items: a pocket watch, bow tie, Lavender loaf, typewriter, pantry key, and telephone.

Exclusive Downton Abbey character tokens. Move around the game board as a favorite Downton Abbey character: Lord Grantham, Lady Mary, the Dowager Countess, John Bates, Mrs. Hughes, or Tom Branson.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Galaxy Raiders
description:
Humans have entered the Space Age! As the Commander General of your space fleet, you are in charge of finding and capturing new planets and moons. But, you must use all your powers to defeat the other Galaxy Raiders. Ready? Time warp...activate!

In Galaxy Raiders, players are in charge of finding and capturing new planets and moons.

Place the hexagonal boards in the center. Each hexagonal board has one planet and 4 moons on it. Yhere are two numbers in each half of the planet and one number in every moon.

All players start with a console mat and eight pegs of one colour. The card deck consists of number cards and power cards. The deck is shuffled and each player gets seven cards. There is a dice with 4 operations & 2 any operation symbols.

On your turn, you roll the dice. Using the operation you roll and any two number cards you have, you must capture a number position on the board. Once your cards are played, they are discarded. Pick up an equal amount of cards from the deck. At all times each player must have seven cards with them. Rules for capturing a number position:

You must capture at least one moon to be able to enter that planet.
If you have captured all the moons, nobody else can enter that planet.
You can enter a planet only after all four moons have been captured - either by you or by others.
You need to capture both halves of the planet to win the planet.
Once you win a planet, give the pegs of that planet back to the respective players and take the planet's hexagonal board and keep it with you.

The power cards allow you to either evict another player from the moon or planet position or replace them in that position. If you cannot perform an operation, but have a power card then you must play it. You cannot simply skip your turn. But, if you don’t have a power card you still discard a card and pick one up from the deck, you then either use your new card or pass your turn.

The rules of entry, are first, moon then planet and rules of eviction, are first, planet then moon.

The first player to capture two planets or with the highest points, wins the game. If all number positions are captured then there is a “stalemate”, then points are counted. the points system is:

each moon equals 1 point
each half of a planet equals 2 points
total value of a planet equals 8 points
Player with the highest points wins!
Galaxy Raiders is a game of planning, strategy and negotiation. Challenge your friends and family to see who will emerge victorious in this engaging battle of wits. Enjoy with them as they set forth on a galactic conquest to capture planets and moons using your mathematical prowess. For parents with young kids, it's the perfect way to introduce them to an entire learning multiverse. See them transform into problem-solving geniuses right before your eyes! A true interstellar skirmish, perfect for all ages!

-description from publisher
categories: Dice, Educational, Negotiation, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Map Reduction, Modular Board, Push Your Luck

name: Party Bowl
description:
Three rounds, two teams, and one Party Bowl! In this instant classic from What Do You Meme?, players use prompt cards to come up with a bunch of words or phrases which get thrown in the Party Bowl. Two teams then compete to out-guess each other in three increasingly high-pressure rounds of fun.

Family friendly: This game is part of What Do You Meme?®’s lineup of family-friendly games! Perfect for family game night, game night with friends, and gatherings of all kinds. Designed for ages 12+ to be as risqué (or not) as you like.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Humor, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Deduction, Memory, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Team-Based Game

name: Two Player Liars Dice
description:
This is the two-player version of the award-winning Liars Dice by Richard Borg that made this game famous.

With 2 copies, it can be expanded to 4 players with the double-sided mat (by setting the mats side by side).

This version comes with: 2 cups, 10 player dice, 1 tracker die, 1 double sided rubber mat, and a rulebook.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: Cringeworthy
description:
Your next party is about to get super cringey with Cringeworthy -- the adult party game that puts you and your friends in horrible, hilarious, NOT-suitable-for-easily-offended-ears situations.

In each round, the Cringemaster reads a Situation card that sets up an open-ended scenario. Each player then chooses a Cringe card to play and reads it out loud to the group. Yes, you have to read it yourself. Got an "[Insert Name]" Cringe card? Say the name of any player other than the Cringemaster to amp up the awkwardness. Whoever makes the Cringemaster feel the most uncomfortable wins the round keeping the situation card which is worth one point. First player to earn five points wins.

Hot tip: Any card can be a winner if you sell it hard enough. Hate losing? Play an "And then ..." Cringe card plus another Cringe card from your hand to block the win. So grab your morally compromised friends and get your next game night started!

Includes 100 Situation cards and 300 Cringe cards.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Banana Katana
description:
Banana Katana is a fun party improv card game where players take it in turns to control a monster and the other players have to combine cards to create an invention which will defeat it!

First a monster card is drawn by the monster player, then the other players take it in turns to explain how they would defeat it with their invention!

There are 3 different invention cards that the players much combine one of each to create their invention:


The base of the invention e.g car, sofa, washing machine etc.
the power source of the invention e.g pulled by seagulls, steam powered etc.
the weapons on the invention e.g laser beam, spear, overcharged leaf blower etc


Before each player shows their invention they must also draw a malfunction card which adds a random element to their invention for them to explain!

Once each player has explained their invention the monster decides who’s invention would be the most likely to defeat it!
mechanics: Acting, Open Drafting, Player Judge, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Boruto: Naruto Next Generations – The Board Game
description:
Boruto: Naruto Next Generations - The Board Game is a cooperative game of ninja action for 1-4 players designed by Mitch Schroeder and Jeff Fraser. Based on the hit anime, Boruto: Naruto Next Generations - The Board Game sees players working together to protect the village of Konoha from dangerous villains attempting to destroy it.

Each player chooses a duo of one next-generation ninja student (such as Boruto, Sarada, or Mitsuki) and one adult ninja mentor (such as Naruto, Sasuke, or Sakura), combining their unique cards together to form their player deck. Each combination will result in different synergies and tactics, providing a new experience each time you play!

On their turn, players each play 2 cards from their hand to perform actions such as moving, attacking, and triggering special abilities. Each card played this way is added to the team's chakra pool, allowing other players to spend said chakra to trigger more powerful abilities! Playing the right card at the right time is key to defeating the villain and saving the village, so work together as a ninja team to strike when the time is right!

Whether you're a fan of the anime or simply enjoy cooperative games, Boruto: Naruto Next Generations - The Board Game offers something for everyone thanks to its easy-to-understand rules and deep game choices!
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game

name: Geometric Emoji Cube
description:
An educational building block game. There are 2 types of wooden cubes: 6 emoticon blocks (each side has a different cartoon expression) and 8 geometric blocks (each side has a different geometric pattern).

Each player starts out with their own set of the chosen cube type and the corresponding deck of puzzle pattern cards face down in a stack. Pick up a card and choose the correct combination of blocks to create the picture on the card. For the victory that takes the shortest amount of time, an hourglass can help keep time.

This is a great way for children to stimulate their attention, exercise fine motor skills, enhance their hand-eye coordination, spatial imagination, logical thinking ability, and practical abilities, and cultivate their hobbies. The cubes are painted with safe, non-toxic, water-based paint.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Educational, Puzzle, Real-time

name: Conquest
description:
In Conquest, players alternate turns placing an influence chip on a space adjacent to 3 or 4 cards, and then moving their marker to the next numbered space. One player starts on the 1 space, then moves to the 2, 3, and so on; the other player starts on the 18, then moves to the 17, 16, and so on.

The game ends after 17 turns. The player with the most chips adjacent to a card wins that card, which is worth the printed number of points.

Some cards have special abilities; for instance, in a player wins the 1, 2, and 3 cards, they achieve an auto-victory. Otherwise, the player with the most points wins.

name: Jeder gegen jeden
description:
The players, each of whom is assigned a color, receive 3 chips at the start of the game and must answer questions during the course of the game. To do this, the active player moves a figure across color fields by rolling the dice. The player whose color was hit must answer the question correctly or he loses a chip. The player who has no more chips is eliminated. If you can answer a question correctly and you have less than 3 chips, you get one chip back. The last player left wins the game.

—user summary

name: Watch This Game!
description:
Each player chooses a set of 6 colored dice & matching speed cup. The game is played in a series of rounds. There are no turns, all players roll their dice at the same time.

Draw the top 3 cards and place them face up in the middle of all the players. These are what cards players will try to win in the round. To begin, players count down to showtime with '3, 2, 1, showtime!'. There are no turns, all players roll their dice at the same time.

After each roll, players place any of their dice next to a card to 'book' it. This indicates which cards they are rolling for. Players continue booking dice until the combination is matched and someone wins the card.
Any player that had dice booked on that card may now take them back.

When all 3 cards are collected the round is over and players add up their scores. Draw the next three cards and place them face up to start the next round. Keep playing rounds until someone collects 1 million subscribers!

name: Quintus
description:
Quintus is a light-hearted yet tactical partnership trick-taking card game for five players, which is comparable in game mechanics to the Dutch game of Klaverjas (and its better known siblings Belote and Jass).

The game is played with a standard French deck, without twos, threes, fours and jokers -- 40 cards in total. The cards rank as usual, from 5 (low) to ace (high) in all suits.

The title stems from Latin and means `fifth'. This refers to the fifth player who plays alone, against the rest who play in two teams of two. The objective for all players is to take card points in tricks; the two teams combine their points while the quintus receives a card point bonus and the privilege to choose the trump suit. Jacks, queens and kings earn points while pip cards cost points. Additional points ("premiums") may be scored by winning combinations of cards in tricks.

As an alternative to a standard hand, the quintus may elect to play a nil hand in which he seeks to avoid taking any court card or ace.

Team mates may signal information about their cards through specific hand gestures.

As a variant to the base game, the quintus may be chosen through a bidding round in which the bid for the highest amount of combined card, nil and premium points wins.

name: Crime Scene: Palermo 1985
description:
Welcome to Palermo, the home of “Cosa Nostra.” Here human life can have little value, but this crime shocks everyone. Who murdered the great Don?

This story does not seem to add up, so employ your instincts to solve it. Study the clues and solve the puzzles to find out who the culprit is.

Challenge Level 3/5

Contents:
1 Crime Scene image
1 Story Booklet
Game Guide
64 Cards

name: Coffee Shop Pocket
description:
Become a barista at a popular coffee shop and fulfill various orders.
The secret to its popularity lies in its perfect recipe.
I'm not allowed to arrange recipes just because I'm busy.
Whether or not you can serve the food with the correct recipe during business hours is a showcase of your skills as a barista.
Sometimes I cooperate with my friends, eat cookies and take a break.
A first-class barista can be said to be a first-class barista not only in terms of techniques and knowledge about coffee, but also in providing the best relaxing space for customers.
publishers: JUGAME STUDIO (ジュゲムスタジオ)

name: Динотур (Dinotour)
description:
Players in the role of brave journalists are sent on a mission to collect unique pictures of incredible animals. You will have to drive cars around the Dinopark, and its inhabitants will certainly run away from you!
Plan your movement on the map correctly to get next to the right dinosaur, take photos and get victory points for completed editorial tasks.

A simple family-format game in which players roll dice, choose from the dropped values how much to move their car, and then, by throwing the same cube, how much the dinosaur will move. The task is to be in the same square with the dinosaur or in the next one, take a photo by pulling out a card and, collecting sets, complete tasks that bring victory points.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Kewbz
description:
From the publisher's website:

In the clever, creative, competitive, and captivating game of Kewbz™, opposing players compete for ownership of 'tower units' by positioning the final cube on top. Each time a corner is made, a cube is stacked at the intersection. When multiple corners are created, then multiple cubes are added into play. Clever strategy moves give you the winning edge.

name: Watizit
description:
Each player combines 3 randomly drawn cards to create funny bans, then draw them to make the other players guess what is forbidden.
"No surfing mice with mittens", "No guitar playing for mummies", "No DJ pirates in the shower"…

The games last 3 rounds, then the player with the most points (from guessing others' bans, and having their own guessed) wins.

name: Car Wars Fifth Edition Starter Set, Division 15 - Set 2
description:
Car Wars Fifth Edition Starter Set, Division 15 - Set 2 is a complete starter set for Car Wars: the basic rules, counters and components, and two cars. The cars are Lightstrike vs. Banshee (with each have modifications). Division 15 duels allow a total of $15,000 for a vehicle. The Car Wars Turning Key included in the set is especially helpful.

Part of the Car Wars (Fifth Edition) Series.

Expands:

Car Wars (Fifth Edition)
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Science Fiction

name: Incognito
description:
Hide your drawing!

A banana at granny’s, a hat in space… take your pencils, ready? Scribble!

Each turn, players must hide an item in a place. You have to succeed in hiding it (but not too much) so that some players still manage to find it (but not all of them). Once players have hidden their word, they will try to find their opponents’ hidden words.

—description from the publisher

name: Grab Bag
description:
The players have lots of fun feeling and grabbing for pieces: rummaging in the little bags and trying to pull out the right piece as quickly as possible. What has to be found? Cube or sphere? Pasta or biscuit? Whoever reacts quickly and finds the right piece first, will gather lots of little cards thereby winning the game. A terrifically fast tactile game with variants. (from box text)

Ages 4 and up
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Educational, Memory

name: Trek
description:
Trek is a fairly straightforward 'expedition' race in which the object is to travel from you base camp to camp number twelve.

The most appealing elements of the game are the little plastic mules, jeeps and storage crates that are required for the journey. Mules & jeeps are needed for movement; stores are used to sustain the expedition. Additional components include the game board, a sales price indicator, money and a deck of 52 cards.

Players start with a sum of money and four cards. On his turn, the player must first pay his expenses either with cash or by expending a store. He then plays one (sometimes two) cards and follows the instructions. An 'Authority to Buy' card permits the purchase of one type of commodity (mules/jeeps/stores); the price of these items starts low but steadily increases with demand. Award cards give the player free commodities or allow cheap purchases from a rival. The most common cards, however, are the Camp cards. These are numbered from one to twelve, and playing an appropriate Camp card and transport item allows advancement within the same or subsequent group of camps on the board. If the player has a jeep, he can advance to two camps that turn provided he has two suitable Camp cards available. Money is earned upon reaching a new camp, and the turn is completed by drawing back up to four cards. By moving onto an already-occupied camp, you become the 'guest' of that player which forces him to pay for your upkeep as well as his own until one of you moves away. The winner is the first person to arrive at camp twelve.

name: Killer Eyelashes
description:
The apocalypse is here... and it’s beat for the gods!Martian micro-organisms have proliferated within every single make-up product in the planet. Now, everyone who applies them becomes a glamor-thirsty zombie. Talk about shade, right? But don’t panic - not everything is lost! Possibly due a make-up overdose, Drag Queens have gained superpowers. Now they are humanity’s only hope for salvation - and they are more than ready to spill some tea.

Get ready to take on the role of a cabaret drag queen in her struggle to reach stardom while keeping her Dignity. To achieve it, you'll complete challenges and face off against badly made-up zombies, undead celebrities and other eyesores.

A fierce game with high doses of madness and glamor!




Game descriptionAn adventure game where you'll embody humanity's only hope: a superpowered drag queen. Your mission: to be more successful than any of them. But how can a poor drag queen succeed in a post-apocalyptic world? As usual... attracting some loyal fans, defeating your enemies, including other drag queens, and overcoming all kinds of challenges. Gather weapons, knick-knacks and any old stuff you come across to ​increase your already large arse-nal and move between stages to accomplish your goals.

Each Queen has different Dragabilities! There are no Hit Points... There is Dignity! Every time you lose Dignity, it will transform into Weirdness. If you lose all your Dignity, you will become unworthy and die. But being a little bit Weird will help you use your superpowers. Gather success with Fans, challenges and beating enemies. The Queen with more success, win!

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Science Fiction, Zombies
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Take That

name: UNO Power Grab
description:
UNO Power Grab is a quick playing card game that presents a twist on the classic game of UNO. Players try to be the first empty their hand by matching either number or color of the card on top of the discard pile. Players must yell "UNO" when they have one card remaining.

Wild cards can be played on any color and some cards give you control of Power Towers. Power Towers can be used to block action cards or sabotage opponents. If you manage to collect all 4 Power Towers, you get instant UNO! Discard until you have one card left.

Includes 112 UNO cards, 4 Power Towers and discard tray

name: Archimedes
description:
Archimedes is a nautical battle game for 2 players.

The board is an 8×8 grid, and each player has 10 (in the original version) or 12 "ships" represented by pieces of one color. The object of the game is to capture the opponent's ships.

Pieces may move any distance in any direction. They do not capture by moving; instead, a piece that could move to an opposing piece's space threatens it, and a piece threatened by at least three pieces may be captured.

A captured piece may be placed on the board as one's own piece instead of moving a piece. (The pieces need to be reversible or extra pieces need to be available to swap for.)

Online Play


Super Duper Games
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Square Grid
publishers: (Web published), Games and Puzzles (magazine), GAMES Magazine

name: The Gorgon's Loch
description:
The Gorgon's Loch is a classic dungeon crawler with a difference.

The game system it uses has been developed by us and allows for some interesting mechanics, one of which is a completely autonomous enemy movement and attack mechanic. What does this mean? Unusually for a tabletop role playing game, this means that a single player can play through the Gorgon's Loch scenarios while generating and battling enemies that are controlled with a very simple algorithm. The STORM system allows players to GIVE, TAKE, USE, FIGHT, SEARCH and MOVE their way through the dungeon, enriching themselves and trying to avoid traps and battling enemies along the way.

Enter the magical dungeon, find treasure and fight the Gorgon Queen and her minions.

The game box includes six dungeon levels of varying difficulty and is designed for novice or veteran gamers. The Gorgon's Loch is a board game which encourages Roleplaying and cooperation.

—description from the publisher

Here is a digital 'Guide for New Adventurers';
https://online.flippingbook.com/view/643379573/
categories: Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: What Do You Meme?: BSFW Edition
description:
The What Do You Meme? Adult Party Game is fun for friends from the social media generation. This is the BSFW, or Barely Safe for Work, edition of the title, which features toned-down content from the adults-only regular version.

This party card game is simple to teach and quick to play. Every player selects one of the caption cards from their hand to accompany that round's image and plays it in secret. The judge then selects which caption they think is the funniest, and that caption's player gets a point. You can play to whatever score you like.

Contents: 360 caption cards, 75 photo cards, 1 easel
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
publishers: KENSHO Kft., What Do You Meme?

name: Counter Point
description:
Players pull chips at random, scoring by completing a row vertically, horizontally or diagonally in four colors. The rows apply thereby horizontal, vertically and diagonally.

It was published as 'Quaro' in the Ravensburger Casino Series.
publishers: Entex Industries Inc., Hallmark Games, Otto Maier Verlag

name: Super Jock Super Toe Football Game
description:
"The score is tied and time is running out..."


Pick the spot for your field goal try.
Line up Super Toe kicker with the goal post.
Whack the top of Super Toe's helmet.
Watch the ball fly through the air.


In the regular game, each player gets 5 kicks in each of 4 quarters. Different points are awarded for successful kicks of different lengths.

In the Special One-on-One game, players alternate kicks from different areas of the room, as in the playground game H.O.R.S.E. You get 3 points for making a field goal that your opponent cannot duplicate, and 15 points wins the game.

This is a children's game that is also fun for adults. the appeal lies in whacking Super Toe's head to see how far you can make him kick the football.

name: Dziobaki
description:
This is a tile-laying game with players starting with boards that are identical, and one player drawing tiles that they all will use. They lay tiles on the board trying to make meadows with one type of animal on it. The game ends when player's boards are full. Than we score 1 point per animal if it's only type on the meadow. 0 points if there are more than on type of animal on a meadow. Most points wins.

—description from the publisher

W grze występują 4 gatunki australijskich zwierząt: dziobaki, koale, kangury i lotopałanki. Gracze układają płytki na swoich planszach tworząc łąki przecięte wodą. Starają się stworzyć łąki z jak największą liczbą zwierząt danego gatunku.

—description from the publisher (Polish)

name: Cake or King
description:
Game description from the publisher:

King Kyle Kilo the First loves sweets and he munches on them all day long. So he is always sending out his eager jesters to bring back new tidbits, with the promise of a royal reward. Who can wait for the right moment and win the biggest heap of sweets with his cards?

Keks oder König, part of HABA's "Fex" line of games, includes tougher rules in which players have to avoid claiming particular types of sweets while still trying to grab as much as they can of the other goodies.

name: Dwarf Slayer
description:
You are a Dwarf. A stout, short fellow who has incredible skills with his hands. Dwarves live in caves, mining the hearth for minerals and gems, working them as smiths and jewelers and other sorts of craftsmen.

And, of course, all Dwarves love booze!

Each night, you frequent the local inn for a stiff drink. What you seek is the "Dwarf Slayer": an exquisite liquor, yet too much of it and you will remember naught of the past night when cometh next morn.

Each night, the inn hosts a "Tournament of Drunkards," with the patron to hold his liquor the best, collecting all the wagers. The Dwarf who has fallen into a humiliating slumber must pay for everyone's drinks; for, of course, he cannot remember if he agreed to do so. So who shall be the Champion Drunkard tonight?
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Phase Order

name: Wackelturm
description:
Wackelturm is a game of stacking wooden game pieces. There are yellow sticks and blue round pieces which can be stacked. The components to stack in a turn are decided by dice roll. You have to stack on top of previously placed items (by you and other players) so a tower emerges.
If the tower falls apart in your turn, you lose that round and get a red chip.
The first to have 3 red chips loses the game.

name: Shendao
description: Shendao, As d'or Cannes 2002, is a game board with effect cards and doors.The aim of the game is to connect the greater number of your tiles. Game action :place a tile in through an open door, slide it along its line or diagonal until it meets either a tile or a closed door, using a stick, close the door through which the tile was placed in. When you choose to play a card, apply the effect on a tile and close the door. Shendao, the way of the spirit, is based on Chinese mythological God and Goddess.

name: Mercenary
description:
A board game covering diplomacy, military and political strategy and economics during the Renaissance.

The players become merchant princes trying to alter the course of world events in return for good profits. Mercenary was designed with the aim of filling two gaps in the field of wargaming. Firstly, it is a game involving diplomacy and intrigue that can be played by as few as two people, even a solitaire game being possible and, secondly, it is based on an important period of transformation from a medieval to a modern style of fighting, which has previously been neglected. This game is designed to give the atmosphere of a corrupt, money-grabbing Europe, torn by military strife, when almost everyone's first thoughts were for self-interest: truly a mercenary age.

Mercenary covers the period of European history from the invasion of Italy by Charles VIII of France to the French Wars of Religion in 1560. The game, therefore, consists of 11 turns each 6 years in length. The object of the game is for the opposing players (1-5) known from now on as Merchants to try, by bribery, terror or military conquest, to amass the largest amount of money (measured in crowns) by 1560.

Components include 22" by 21" full color mounted mapboard, 220 die cut counters, 11" by 16" diplomacy chart and rules book.
categories: Economic, Negotiation, Pike and Shot, Political, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Negotiation

name: Troina '43
description:
Troina '43 simulates the July-August 1943 battle for the town of Troina in northeastern Sicily. The US 1st Infantry Division and the 39th Regiment of the 9th Infantry Division attempted to pierce the German 15th Panzergrenadier Division's line west of the town in an effort to trap the Axis troops that were falling back to the northwestern corner of the island.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 12 hours
Hex: 700 yards / 640 meters
Units: Company to Battalion

Game Inventory:
One 11.5 x 17" five color mapsheet
One dual-side printed countersheet (100 1/2" counters)
One 8-page Troina '43 rulebook
One dual-side printed players aid card

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 2-3 hours

Players will need to provide one 6-sided die

name: Provopoli: Wem gehört die Stadt
description:
In Provopoli, players belong to one of two groups: Blue represents forces that support and defend the current order, while Red stands for groups that critisize the system and actively try to change it.

Each player belongs to one of these two camps, and controls one (or, with low player counts, several) pawns of that color. A random scenario card defines the objective of the game. There are open scenarions where each group knows what's at stake; and hidden scenarios, where only one party knows the objective, but the other group has to stop them.

Depending on the scenario, there are some devices available: Cars that increase movement (but can't enter buildings or parks); barricades that block roads or access to buildings; and explosives that can be used to block spaces or remove barricades. There are also chance cards that either call a random event, or represent an utility that can be kept for later use.

The two groups act in alternating order. Three dice are rolled for movement points that are assigned to pawns (the decision is made as group). On the target space, the pawn may pick up a chance card, collect a device, use a device, seize an opposing pawn, or even free an arrested member of the own group. Depending on the scenario, there might be additional actions available.

Play continues until one of the sides fulfill their objective, or until they are no longer able to reach it.

Example of objectives: Blow up the red head quarter; arrest a number of neutral pawns (or, for the other side, escort them to the train station); escort a state guest to several locations (or make it impossible to reach these locations).
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Micro Fleet: World War I
description:
This wargame is a part of the Micro Warfare Series covering World War I naval combat. It is a miniatures-style game that includes cardboard ship counters. The rules include both Small Action (individual ship command/gunnery) and Fleet Action (squadron command/gunnery) rules. Specific counters are included to fight the Goeben Incident, the Falkland Islands, Dogger Bank and the battle cruiser action at Jutland.

Supplements
Naval WWI
TTG-MN-101 British Jutland Set
TTG-MN-102 German Jutland Set
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I

name: Numaro
description:
From manufacturer's website:
With Numaro, the answer to every question is an amazing numerical fact, which allows every player to guess on each question. The player with the guess closest to the actual answer wins the round. For example, how many episodes of the TV show, The Cosby Show, was produced? (Answer: 204) .

name: Czerwony Huragan (Budziszyn 1945)
description:
Czerwony Huragan (Red Thunderstorm) presents the last months of the Third Reich. The Southern Group of Soviet forces starts the final strike into the heart of Germany - Berlin. Field Marschal Koniev is competing with Zukhow to be the first to reach Berlin.
The first strike of Soviet forces is overwhelming - they break through German lines and move forward, but the Germans do not give up. They pull up their last remaining reinforcements and counter at the stretched south flank of the Red Army, which happens to be the Polish II Army. The fierce and bloody battle begins where prisoners are not taken.

The game uses rules of the "WB95" (Great Battles 1939-1945) system designed for dealing with large battles of World War II. Counters represent regiments (Germans) or divisions (Russians), one hex represents about 2500m, one turn represents one day.

name: Evolution in the Box
description:
The history of mankind is just starting. First antecedents of man are entering the scene full of wild prehistoric plants and bizarre creatures. You are one of them, a leader of a large group of anthropoids. A mysterious force of evolution makes you grow, multi-play and evolve at surprisingly high speed. For a quick evolution you need a lot of meat so you focus on hunting mammoths. The more mammoths you hunt down, the more quickly your brain grows.
With a bigger brain you can do more things… You can improve your hunting skills and face your enemies more successfully. The best hunters will achieve the desired goal of evolution, becoming a modern human – and thus securing immortality of their species. Those less successful, whose development froze at a lower level of evolution, can at least go to have a chat with their relatives in a zoo.

Brief summary of the game, the goal and the end of the game:
The player determines by means of the cards of commands, where his pack should go. Packs go across the landscapes and they try to hunt down as many mammoths as possible (by going across cards with pictures of mammoths on them), so that they have proteins to grow their brains more quickly and to rise on the evolutionary meter. By doing this the skills of the pack will grow and evolutionary advantages can be acquired. The winner of the game is the person who will be the first to complete his evolution by reaching the level of a human homo-sapiens. At this moment the game ends.
mechanics: Area Movement, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Where is Mausi?
description:
A kids card game where Mausi the Mouse visits her friends the goose, the cow, the horse, the rabbit and the pig and hides with one of them. Players have to guess where Mausi is hanging for the day, winning the card on which she's located if they do. Be the first to reveal cards with all five friends on them and you win.

The short description: Each player has five cards depicting the animal friends, and these are shuffled and placed face-down before the player. On a turn, the player rolls the die, flips an animal card in front of her, and hopes it shows the animal on the die; if so, the card stays revealed; if not, the card is flipped face-down again. Roll an animal that's already revealed, and you can flip a card of your choice. Roll the moon, and one of the timing cards is flipped. The game ends when one player finds all five friends or time runs out, in which case no one wins.

How to play Wo Ist Mausi?:

- The six-Mausi cards with the page "Mausi comes home" to the top placed in the middle of the table.
- Each player is dealt five cards with the same animal back color and places them with the back upwards before him.
- Whoever's turn it is throws an animal that needs to turn one of his cards. If it is he animal rolles on the die, the card is exposed.
- If there is a different animal, the card will once again be face down.
-The dice shows the moon is one of the six cards on the side of Mausi, "Mausi sleeps" reversed.
- The dice shows an animal that the player has already found, nothing happens.
- Winner is the person who discovered the first five friends of Mausi on his maps.
-When Erica is sleeping all six cards on the page "Mausi" lie, there is no winner.
publishers: Albi, AMIGO, Shafir Games (המשחקים של חיים שפיר)

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Tal'Kir Vulcan Expansion Pack
description:
This ship is one of the ships players purchase as an entrance fee to parcipate in the Star Trek Attack Wing "Resistance Is Futile" tournaments.

Contents:
Ship cards and maneuver card
(*) Captain: Solok
(*) Elite Talent: Vulcan Logic
Weapon: Photonic Weapon
Tech: Power grid
(*) Crew: Kov
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Cross Dices
description: Roll the dice and make as many linked words as possible within the time of the hourglass. Write down your points and beat you opponents. This is a fast paced game that exercises the mind. Includes 14 dice, an hourglass and a beaker

name: Bop It! Tetris
description:
Bop It gets you moving! It's the game of fast action and reaction. Now, Bop It Tetris moves the excitement of Bop It to a thrilling level with Tetris block-matching action. The shapes appear on the screen and you must slam them into place. Race through the levels and rack up the points!

Keep the lights and shapes coming fast with Bop It Tetris! Get in the game and don't stop, sliding, spinning, and slamming the shapes into place. It's Bop It, with a cool twist. The Tetris shapes challenge you to match the blocks on one screen to the open space on the other screen. As you play, move the blocks back and forth or rotate them to make a perfect match before time runs out. With 2 game modes, 4 levels, and Bonus and Challenge rounds, you'll have a blast playing solo or have a Bop It Tetris party with your friends!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Video Game Theme

name: Elemental Trunk Man
description:
エレメンタルトランクマン (Elemental Trunk Man) is a Japanese game, following up from Time Trunk Man. You are an Elemental Trunk Man, a time-traveling agent, who unblocks treasure boxes collected over time and takes out treasures. With the help of the elemental spirits, we will unlock the seal of the treasure chest and aim to open more treasure chests than our rivals!

We will start from the point where you can communicate with the four spirits of Fire, Water, Wind, and Earth.
In order to open the sealed treasure chest, we communicate with the spirits to gain mana and unseal the treasure chest. You can earn points of contribution by the degree of contribution.

There are two things you can do in your turn!
-Summoning spirits (increases the spirits that can be communicated)
-Unseal the seal of the treasure box (Communicates with the spirits, obtains mana and unseals the seal of the treasure box)

The spirits are wooden tokens of the four elements. On your turn, you shake up your set and throw them. The pieces that land upright can be used to trigger your actions. The more tokens you collect, the better chance of success.

There are some treasure chests where bonus points can be added to the contribution points by releasing the seal quickly, and by removing the final seal. It is important to have the bonus points at the end of the game and the timing of releasing it. However, if you do not summon the spirits, it will become difficult later.

Summoning spirits requires a deck build idea of ​​how to combine the spirits. It's fun to think of your own combination. In addition, it may be important to change the combination depending on the situation of the treasure chest."

Publisher's summary
New sense game of "token build" x "role action" x "placement"! You are a treasure chest unlocker "Elemental Trunk Man". With the help of spirits, unlock the seal of the treasure chest.

The game starts with four spirits pieces of fire, water, earth, and wind. And, shake those spirit pieces like a dice every time. As a result, you can gain spirit power if the spirit piece is standing up. You use this spirit power to unseal the seal of the treasure chest.
You can also increase spirits pieces by using spirit power. Create your own strategy by combining 11 kinds of spirit pieces.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: The Sandwich Guy
description:
You are The Sandwich Guy, whose food truck is known far and wide as a premier foodie destination. You're given a non-stop barrage of ingredients, which you use to make sandwiches... of variable quality.

Starting with a hand of eight cards, each turn you choose three cards to discard as a "sandwich." The only rule is that the three must be equally distant from each other (e.g., 2-3-4, or 3-6-9, or 5-5-5, etc.). You then draw a number of cards based on the "quality" of your sandwich: if it all cards discarded were of the same suit, you draw four; if all three were of the same color but two different suits, you draw three (that is, you get back the same amount you discarded); if the cards were of different colors, you only get back two.

The game consists in decisions about when to play certain cards and when to hold on to them, having a good idea of what's left in the deck and what's not, and in keeping your hand size healthy enough to stay in business. If you would draw the last card, you win; if you cannot make a sandwich out of your ingredients, you lose.

The game can be played entirely in-hand, holding the deck of cards with the ingredients on top and the discard pile face-up below.

As part of the Isaludo collection, the rules can be found in this forum thread.

name: Pick It Up
description:
Essen 2022 preorder link

Pick it Up is a surprising game: The treasure hunt inside your house!

There are no rounds and the players won’t play only around the table.
All players run around the house at the same time trying to find objects that match their cards.
The cards show 1 or 2 requirements among an icon, a letter, or a color.

When a player ends their deck, the game ends and players score points. In order to be able to score their cards, however, players will have to convince their opponents that the objects they found match the requirements shown on the cards!

-description from designer

name: Nice Weather
description:
In Nice Weather, you and a million tourists travel around Europe chasing, that's right, Nice Weather. Spend your autumns and winters around the Mediterranean, your summers by the Baltic coast and your springs in Central Europe.

Travel by your own railroads or pay the other players to use theirs. Set your ticket prices high to squeeze out profits or low to undercut competitors. If you can't find a cheap train ticket, then you can always go by airplane, in which case you might contribute to global warming. Global warming makes the Southernmost cities unattractive, while new holiday destinations pop up in the far North.

Will you bet on a bright future and invest in ferry lines to the sunny islands of the South? Or will you defy the icy emptiness of the North and then keep prices high to make people fly and tilt the climate in your favor?

Nice Weather is a relatively fast and family-friendly track building game with a foundation of logical thinking paired with prisoner's dilemma-like pricing diplomacy and livened up by random action cards that lets you set hilarious traps. But amidst the easy and fun, the experienced player will inhale a strong breeze of Go as the network struggle scatters among a dozen frontiers that suddenly merge to one final whole, making the player with the most well-oiled micro-macro mental elevator the winner.

Dynamic land prices let you buy up cheap competing lines, allowing for a randomized yet balanced game board; for each game, 6-12 European cities out of 28 are randomly selected, making for up to 36000 different start configurations. Then there is always Essen, and this is where you start the game; in October 2008 to be exact.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Bautzen 1945
description:
Bautzen 1945 is a simulation of the German counteroffensive in Saxony, from the 22 to the 30 of April 1945.

This battle pitted the 2nd Polish Army, the Soviet 5th Guards Army and additional Soviet units against elements of the 4th Panzer and 17th Armies, that launched a counterattack against the flank of the Soviet-Polish forces marching on to Dresden and Prague.

Although the counteroffensive failed to stop the Soviet advance or reach Berlin, the Germans inflicted a sound tactical defeat to the 2nd Polish Army, recovering Bautzen and holding it until the end of the war.

name: Catch
