description: Catch is played on an 8x8 game board, with players taking turns placing rectangular pieces on the board to cover two of the spaces in the grid; one player places blocks horizontally, while the other places them vertically. If a player closes off an area that contains 1-3 spaces – whether by surrounding it with blocks alone or with some combination of blocks and the edge of the board – the player places marbles of his color in the area enclosed. Whoever captures the most area wins!
publishers: intellego holzspiele, W. Nostheide Verlag GmbH

name: Parrotdigm
description: In the trick-taking game Parrotdigm, a new scoring condition is revealed each round, with the points sometimes being positive, sometimes negative. Try to play your hand right to end up on top!

name: Sakapuss
description:
A card game where players to have the fewest parasite at the end of The Game.
Players are dealt four cards of different cats. At each turn, move one card of the player to the left will until someone takes all four cards of the same cat.
Then they should quickly extend your hand in the center of the table and the last to do so will get a letter from the parasite.

name: Troquons !
description:
Troquons! is a game of bartering. What the name doesn't tell you is that it allows you create mean, stupid, brilliant or dumb maxims and proverbs. Thanks to Troquons! you'll get morally subtle gifts, capable of summarizing life in several strong images. But watch yourself, you risk every moment looking like an absolute idiot. Deeply cerebral or a medical mystery, such is the unpredictable journey to the land of clowning around!

Each player receives 3 cards: subject + verb + moral. From the beginning, you have a proverb in hand.

The barter phase begins: you can swap one or more cards as many times as you want between players and/or only once with the pile! Thus, your proverb may become "the artist in you + is a slobbering Mmnster + speaks him gently in his ear"

Each player reads their proverb and must reveal their viewpoint if another player asks "but what you meant by that?". Luck and your barter strategy, combined with your imagination, will make you defend or justify the indefensible "maxims" to make them... brilliant!

The voting phase closes the round: every player submits a secret ballot of 1 card of "you're awesome" to the author of the best proverb and 1 card of "let's barter!" to the one who deserves it! If you receive the Awesome card, it's worth 1 point (i.e. 1 blue cube), while a "let's barter" card is just a friendly message that expresses condolences and to try again.

Troquons! is a very simple and addictive game that will make you appear sometimes as a great and gifted philosopher gifted of profound reflexion and decisive for the future of mankind, and sometimes as a schemer trying desperately to justify a proverb that is worth not a cent.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Voting

name: My Very First Games: Off to Bed!
description:
It’s time to go to bed — but the rabbit, bear and cat are unable to settle down because their beds, pillows and covers are all muddled up! What's more, the animals each want their favorite stuffed toy.

If the children have good powers of memory and a bit of luck in turning over the tiles in My Very First Games: Off to Bed!, they can succeed in getting their animal into bed first.

—description from the publisher

name: The Exodus
description:
This game recreates the journey of the Book of Exodus, wherein Moses was called upon by the Lord to lead his people from slavery under the Pharaoh of Egypt and guide them to Canaan, the Promised Land.

This game is for two players, one as Moses, the other as the Pharaoh.

Moses must safely lead his people across the Red Sea, while the Pharaoh must stop him.

This is a strategy game, the winner determined by placing road tiles strategically and effectively.

name: Edamame
description:
Do you know what an Edamame is? An Edamame is a kind of soja bean you can eat in japanese restaurants. It is also what you are in this game.

As the chief of an Edamame clan, you will raise a dragon because you need his vital energy to bring you to live. To do so, you will have to recruit new Edamames to reinforce your clan. You will send them to work to get resources and you will also make your opponent’s Edamames work for you. Lastly, you will use your resources to breed your dragon.

A game of Edamame will be timed by the number of dragon cards that will be bought by the players. In a 2 players game, a round is 3 dragon improvements. In a 3 or 4 players game, a round is 4 dragon improvements. At the end of each round, everybody will check for a common intermediary objective. After 3 rounds, the game will be end by an honorship championship in which each clan will fight each other one. So, how does it work ?
publishers: Happy Baobab, Sorry We Are French

name: Defenders of the Realm: Battlefields – Scorpion Canyon and Karmak Sands
description:
2 new battlefields to expand your choices in the new Stand-Alone Defenders of the Realm game!

Not part of the retail edition, and first released as a promo for Kickstarter supporters.

name: Ayrton Senna: The King of Monaco
description:
From the box:

Ayrton Senna The King of Monaco Monaco Ayrton Senna and Monaco are names that are linked together forever. No other F-1 car racing driver ever won six unforgettable victories at Monaco. In this game you will be able to feel the thrill of this circuit where the strategy, control and audacity that made Ayrton Senna the best of the racing drivers must be put to good use."

(Playing time may vary depending on the number of laps and players.)

name: Party & Co: Evolution
description:
From the Party & Co family, Party & Co Evolution is made out of 5 different categories of games:

Brands
Mimic & Sounds
Trivia
Drawing
Taboo


The game includes:

1 Board
1 Note Pad
1 Pencil
1 sand clock
400 cards, each with 5 challenges)
4 tokens in the shape od CD player
20 CD tokens in 5 colors
categories: Deduction, Memory, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Memory, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Singing, Team-Based Game
publishers: Diset S. A., Nordic Games GmbH

name: Poker's Wild
description: Score the most points by creating the best poker hand possible using up to any 5 consecutive cards (your card and up to 4 cards adjacent to it- either vertically or horizontally) on the game board on each turn.

name: Millionary
description: Millionary is a big business game about buying and selling shares and options. The game uses real company names like Shell and Microsoft and real markets like the Dow Jones and the Dax. The game rules offer both a family version that uses a roll-and-move mechanic, and a strategy version for real gamers that does not involve dice. The rulebook is highly detailed with three complete sample games, but alas all in German.

name: Micro Colonial
description:
This game recreates a complete battle during the late Colonial period. The basic game covers the second Zulu War, with a Zulu army of six Impis against a smaller, predominately British force. This is the period of the introduction of breech loading rifles and machine guns, wherein small regular forces were thrown against huge native armies with a usual outcome in favor of the regulars.

Part of the Micro Warfare Series from Tabletop Games. The games in the series were intended to be played directly on the game table (without a mapboard) using rules concepts from traditional miniatures wargaming. The games offered an affordable alternative to the miniatures hobby in that they used un-cut cardstock counters for the game units.

Colonial
TTG-MA-C01 British / Egyptian (Sudan)
TTG-MA-C02 Dervish (Sudan)
TTG-MA-C03 Rorkes Drift Set
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Musashi
description: Musashi is the Japanese take on the tower building dexterity game genre. Unlike Jenga, you don't start out with a tower, but build it yourself, and also unlike Jenga, you don't use your fingers but chopsticks to place the tiles. On each turn, players roll a dice to decide if and how many tiles they have to place on top of the existing stack. To make things a bit more challenging, there are two types of tiles - while they are both round, the standard ones have grooves carved into them that give them some stability. However, there is also a batch of slick tiles which are much harder to put into place.

name: Alchymia: La Quête du Cristal Noir
description:
From BGN:

Alchymia - La Quête du Cristal Noir (The Quest for the Black Crystal) is a small print (500) game, self-published by Swiss designer Frank Schwab. The game accommodates 2-5 players and plays in roughly 30-60 min (my best guess). Images and rules (in French) are available at the Alchymia website.

Each player is given a personal board and 3 potion cards and 8 atomic element tokens in 5 colors are placed in the central reserve. Each potion card depicts 1-4 atomic elements used to create the 5 Elemental Crystals (Fire, Water, Earth, Air and Time). Players attempt to collect and place the atomic element tokens on their board in such a way as to mimic the current configuration of one of the 5 crystals. They do this, in turn, by playing a potion card to retrieve an atomic element token of one of the types shown on the card from the central reserve and place it on their game board. They can also choose to remove an element token from their game board by playing a potion card with that element type. Alternatively, players can pass their turn by wiping their board clean of tokens.

Once a player has matched a crystal configuration, they wipe their board of tokens, collect the crystal structure card they matched, reveal a new crystal configuration card and begin collecting beads for another type of crystal. The twist is that each type of crystal confers upon its owner an additional special power (for example, the Time Crystal allows you to rearrange your board during your turn, instead of taking or removing an element token). The first person to collect each of the 5 crystals becomes the master alchemist who can create the coveted Black Crystal.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Travel Jeopardy!
description:
The classic television quiz program has been adapted to be played while traveling by three publishers. Each version is miniature version of each publisher’s version of the game. The Pressman Toys version has one player acts as quizmaster while the other players play like the game show. The Tyco edition divides the categories among the players and each will act as contestant and quizmaster for each other during the game (although players could agree to play the game show way). The Outset Media version introduces a third format: Categories for the Jeopardy, Double Jeopardy, and Final Jeopardy rounds are on separate playing cards. The gamemaster can mix and match them as one sees fit.

In all versions of the game, a player chooses a category and a dollar amount. The first to give the correct response in the form of a question is credited with the value of the response. However, the jeopardy is that an incorrect response has the values deducted from one’s score. Random Daily Doubles during a round allow one player make a wager based on one’s own knowledge. Players may wager any or all of their money on one final response in Final Jeopardy! The player with the most money is the winner.
publishers: Outset Media, Pressman Toy Corp., Tyco

name: Räubersprung
description: Players each get three figures in different colors. They move their figures along like-colored lines to collect treasure bags, to steal the bags from other players and to change the amount of treasure that will win the game.

name: Aries
description:
This game is played on the following 8x8 square board.

MOVE - Rams slide orthogonally (like chess Rooks).
When a Ram moves into an enemy Ram, it butts it one cell in the same direction.
This may set off a chain reaction of pushes if additional enemy Rams lie in the same direction. Friendly Rams don't get butted.
Captures are made by either butting an enemy Ram off the board or into a friendly Ram.
A Ko Rule is in effect: One may not play in such a way that would recreate a board position that has just occured previously in the game.

GOAL - The first player that captures all enemy Rams or moves into the opposite corner wins.


Online Play


Super Duper Games
mechanics: Area Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: Barcode Battler
description:
In this game, warriors and wizards are fighting against each other. These characters are... barcodes !

The game consists in an electronic device with a barcode scanner included, and a set of cards representing heroes, enemies and equipments. There's also a few blank cards that you can use to create your own characters with any barcode found on common products.

name: Mi agente en Berlín
description:
Nike and Cooper divided their games between two main categories, "wargames" and "thematics". This was one of the first games published by them in the latter one, along with "La fuga de Colditz" or "Asalto al banco de Inglaterra".
Set in the Cold War era, players enter East Berlin in order to find a personality who wishes to pass to the other part of the Wall. They have to find out who he is while evading military police and other hazards. Besides, one of the players is really a mole working for the Russians...
The game is inspired by a tale by writer Arthur W. Landsbury.

Contents:
-64x80 cms. mapboard
-24 wooden pawns
-8 plastic counters
-2 dice
-Leaflet with an extract of the tale
-Rulebook
-90 cards which make up several decks (Opportunity, Incidence, Shots...)
-2 cardboard pictures

Number of players: 2 to 6
Playing time: 60-90 minutes
Difficulty: 4 (average)

name: Catch Out
description:
Catch Out is a bluffing cardgame. About concerning three digits number, you must guess previous player lied or not, and then deceive or convince next player as you said true.

Turn player calls 3 digit number consist from three cards. The left player must decide to believe right player' call and take those cards, or call challange. If right player called three identical numbers like 777 or 888, you have to challange.
At challange, you must call Doubt or True. If your call is correct, you can select which card you take and hand to right player. If your call is miss, the right player can select. Angel cards is 2VP. Devil cards is negative 2VP.
The game is finished when draw deck is exhausted. Winner is the player of highest VP.

name: Nuns on the Run: The Anchorite
description:
This official Mayfair promo expansion was included as a convention and retail give-away on a tile sheet titled: Game Variants & Mini Expansions Set #1.

This token is used in a game with only 1 or 2 Novices to effectively shrink the size of the board. In a 4 player game it can be used to change the landscape a bit.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Religious
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck

name: Royal Prep Academy Game
description:
From the publisher: "Princess Sofia is new to Royal Prep Academy where she is learning the way of a princess. She's lost her dance shoes, teapot, schoolbook, and other valuables, all around the enchanted building. Help her find her prized school supplies, and discover fun lessons from the Good Fairies along the way."

This is a hide and seek game for 2 players. Princess Sofia (the seeker) tries to find the supplies that the hider is hiding around the academy. The hider draws from a stack consisting of different supplies, some of Sofia's friends, and a wildcard lucky guess card.

If the hider draws one of the supplies, it is hidden by having the seeker cover their eyes or look away from the game play area. The hider then hangs the item behind one of the many windows. The seeker then spins the spinner to determine how many "peeks" behind different windows they will get (1-4 peeks are possible).

If a Sofia friend is drawn, the hider shows the seeker which window the friend is behind, and this encourages the seeker to use their memory so they don't search behind those windows on future turns.

Lastly, if a wildcard/guessing card is drawn, the hider selects one of the supplies and hides it in their hand. The seeker then gets to guess which item is in their hand.

Lots of fun for kids as they hide items and use their memory and luck to find the charms.
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Front Nine: Promo#2 – Fluor-ESSEN-t Golf Balls
description: The Front Nine: Promo#2 – Fluor-ESSEN-t Golf Balls — a single card expansion that can be incorporated in the base game — is played during the income phase, adds +£2 to the income generated, and is then recycled into the discard pile.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Questions de Merde 2
description:
Discover 312 new cards where it's best to let other players answer!

Expand your horizons thanks to 3 new categories: Career and Ambitions, Family/Friends/Love and Psychoanalysis!

Also, deepen the 3 current theme:
Sex, Daily Life, Philosophy & Progress

A true parody of classic quizzes, Questions de merde 2 invites new players find their best answers

Second degrees, anecdotes, relevations... the options are endless options to think of and win!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Word Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Voting
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Le Droit de Perdre

name: Distrify
description:
Distrify is a connection game played by two players, White and Black, on a square board. Board sizes from 9x9 to 19x19 are recommended. The game’s etymology stems from its primary mechanic, which penalizes players for the creation of 3-in-a-rows with their pieces. The result is a game with devious tactical twists and a hint of coldness.

Black moves first, placing a single stone anywhere on the grid. Players then alternate turns, placing up to two new friendly stones on empty cells. If two stones are placed, then:

a) the placed stones must not be diagonally adjacent to each other, and
b) the placed stones cannot result in the formation of a new horizontal, vertical, or diagonal three-in-a-row comprised of friendly stones.

A crosscut is a 2x2 square in which each player controls a pair of opposite corners; a player's move may never result in the formation of a crosscut.

Black wins if there exists a path of orthogonally or diagonally adjacent black stones reaching between the top and bottom rows, while White wins if there exists an analogous path stretching from the westmost to eastmost columns.

name: 1WW: World War One in Europe
description:
1WW: The First World War is a low complexity, highly abstracted, two-player game of the entire First World War in Europe that lasted from 1914-1918. The game is played on a single tabloid-sized map, and 140 half-inch playing pieces.

This mini-game is included in Issue #2 of Counterfact magazine.

Components:
One rulebook
One 11"x17" map
140 double-sided die-cut counters
One six-sided die is required to play (not included)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: TopATop Family
description:
TopATop Family is a family party game for 3-6 players, aged 4 and above. The gameplay time depends on the number of players and takes between 15 and 30 minutes. It is a simple and very dynamic game in which you will have a chance to use your dexterity, observation and quickness.

During the game, you take turns placing cards in the middle of the table and reacting appropriately to the pictures on the cards played. A player who does that better — either quicker, more accurately, or without making a mistake — than others wins that challenge and collects that card.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game

name: The Nasty Woman Game: A Card Game for Every Feminist
description:
Cards Against Humanity meets Nasty Woman

Take turns drawing cards, following the prompts, and strategizing your next move to collect as many Nasty Woman Cards as possible -- including Beyonce, Michelle Obama, Gloria Steinem, and Ruth Bader Ginsburg. Shout out saucy answers to any Statement Cards to win more Nasty Woman cards.

This game includes:
-20 Nasty Woman Cards
-55 fill-in-the-blank Statement Cards
-25 Action Cards (including Girl Gang, Attack of the Mansplainer, and Visionary Cards)
-10 You're Trumped Cards
-Instructions with Nasty Woman Bios and Feminist Field Notes

Celebrate your favorite feminists.

Notes give definitions and context for feminist terms and phrases.

In more detail...
To start the game, each player is dealt one prized Nasty Feminist card, featuring 1 of 20 women who have changed American history, and you’ll earn more as you play. And just like in real life, the more amazing women you have on your side, your chances to win are greater. This card keeps you in the game if you get the dreaded…

You’re Trumped card! This is the death card which means you’re out, loser! It’s really the worst card you can get. Getting trumped is truly, truly terrible. But, you can trade in a Nasty Feminist card to stay in the game.

To earn Nasty Feminist cards you’ll need to win Statement cards, which are unfinished statements about politics, celebrities, and current events. Each player will finish the fill-in-the-blank statement with their best improvised verbal answer and the judge (the person who drew the card) will pick their favorite one. The winner gets to keep the statement card. You can trade in 3 of your earned statement cards for a Nasty Feminist card during the game.

The game can end in two ways: the last person standing or the person who has the most Nasty Feminist cards once you’ve gone through the entire deck wins.

name: Speedy Beedy
description:
Buzz your bee across the meadow and grab the right flowers first! Turn a card to see what order the flowers have to be picked and be quick about it – because the fastest bee scores a point! A fun, action-filled matching game for young players.

Comes with durable plastic bees and flowers.
Easy-to-learn gameplay is suitable for very young players.
Look out for the bug that may try to ruin your game!


—description from the publisher

name: Treasure X: Quest for Gold
description:
Explore Xeo and discover buried riches. Collect money, keys and the coveted golden treasures! If Exis attacks, you could lose everything!


Play Cards to explore map
Reveal the buried surprise
Don't let Exis steal your treasures


—description from the publisher

name: Roland Wright: The Dice Game –  Board Game Trends
description:
The "Board Game Trends" card set is a mini-expansion included with the Kickstarter edition of Roland Wright: The Dice Game. It adds some new board game trend cards that add in more ways to score points.

COMPLETING A BOARD GAME TREND CARD: This card is an additional, public card that players may complete during the game. Immediately after you complete the pattern, write in the point value in the green "Hallmark" score space on your Player Board. The first player(s) to do so will earn 8 points. All players that complete the pattern on the same turn receive the same point value. A player completing the pattern on a later turn checks the lowest value that any other player earned on a previous turn, then writes in the next lowest value on their board.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Enclosure, Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Квакнуті музики (Freaky Band)
description: International Music Contest is announced in Freakyville. One of the participating bands is elected by popular vote. The second contestant will be the band that will score points as close as possible to the band that of the popular vote.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Music, Party Game

name: 横柄歩道 (Ouheihodo)
description:
Oh! Hey! Crosswalk is an abstract game inspired by pedestrian crossings. The goal is to transfer all five of your pieces from your territory to the opponent's territory.

Each turn, you can take three actions, which can be used for the following:

Move an Adult/Dog/Senior/Child piece forward by one space.


The pieces have the following characteristics:

Dog pieces can pass through other pieces.
the Piece in front of a Senior piece must retreat on the next turn.A Senior piece can only take one action per turn.
Child pieces can only take one action per turn but can move up to two spaces.


Utilize the characteristics of the pieces to be the first to cross the pedestrian crossing and achieve victory.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Pattern Movement, Square Grid

name: Cactus King
description:
In the fun card game Stichelkönig from HABA, players gather around cactus king Miguel de la Espina, turn his spikes and try to play their cards wisely and skim off neat patches. Whoever can show the most of them wins. A fun card game from HABA for the whole family and cactus lovers from 8 years.

—description from the publisher

name: God of War: The Board Game
description:
God of War: The Board Game is a co-operative dungeon crawler filled with epic fights and puzzles for 1-2 players who will encounter various iconic monsters in the form of highly detailed miniatures.

The game also features a unique combat and leveling system based on the bonding of characters and co-operation. Take on the role of Kratos and Atreus, and follow a series of adventures that imagine scenarios during the years between the 2018 God of War video game and 2022's God of War: Ragnarök when Fimbulwinter descends on Midgard.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Mythology, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Sony Interactive Entertainment, LLC

name: Plan-Cheroli
description:
In Plan-Cheroli each player has three arches which start at one corner of the board and must be moved to the opposite corner. On each turn, one arch is moved by rotating one leg of the arch around the other leg, with other pieces blocking the rotation.

Several variants are included. There are chips which can be placed on the board at the start of the game to block certain spaces, creating different board configurations. Alternatively, all the spaces can be covered with chips, and the goal of the game then becomes to capture the most chips by moving onto them. In addition, there is a die which can be used to give each player one to six moves per turn instead of the standard one.

Re-implements: Cheroli

name: Stealth: The Game
description:
From game summary on box:

A brilliant dimension lies before you and a cunning battle must be fought. Your powerful Stealth Force has been protecting its portion of Dimension Gemstone for centuries, but the enemy has been looming ever closer; threatening to conquer your territory.

Strategy - You may find that your only protection is your wide array of Stealth Attack Modules and their Concealed Power Pieces as you move through Dimension Gemstone, evading your dangerous opponent. Some of your Power Pieces can be used to destroy, while others can distract and act as decoys. The Starburst, Blaster, Ringer, Decoy and Laser each have special ways of fending off the enemy (see below). As commander of the Stealth Force, you must remember the importance of your mission - defend, retaliate and move with all possible speed. The future of Dimension Gemstone is in your hands.

Under Fire - The longer you wait to retaliate, the more time your opponent has to build strategy and plan the next attack. Keep focused as there are concealed dangers that may catch you unaware.

Escape - Dimension Gemstone has Portals that are the way for you and your Stealth Force to find a route of escape, or as a means of Surprise attack. They can zip you from one side of Dimension Gemstone to another, swiftly out of danger's way.

Your Mission is Clear - and it is of the utmost importance that you keep in mind the dynamics of each Stealth Attack Module. Your victory or defeat may be at stake. As Commander of the Stealth Force, you control the fate of Dimension Gemstone.

Each move is an exciting and strategic challenge to outmaneuver your opponent. Dimension Gemstone needs your protection. Seek to conquer, but be careful not to fall into the hands of the enemy.
Each type of power piece is different. While a BLASTER can destroy all pieces and Portals in a 2-space range, the RINGER has only a 1-space range. The LASER has a 7-space range limit and can destroy the first piece or Portal in a straight line. The STARBURSTS have the power to emanate energy in a starburst pattern and can destroy all pieces and Portals within a 3-space, straight line.

name: Level XI
description:
Level XI uses the components and basic rules of Level X and can be played only in conjunction with the base game. Now your playing pieces can be placed on this supplemental board in addition to the tracks on the main game board. The pieces are not moved here, but they stay where you once placed them - however, you may remove them for other use at any time giving up your position.
The playing pieces on the highest spaces of the Level XI board earn you special points at the end of the game – and you can even score for more than one marker. Beware: you may miss a playing piece you placed on the supplemental board for the regular tracks - but if you are too late for it, the best spaces will be occupied there.

name: Jarjais
description:
A history card game in a background of French Revolution, in which players try to understand, through clue collect, Where, When and Who finally kept the lost treasure destined to free the imprisoned French Queen Marie-Antoinette.

First, players have to select secretely one of the characters (Marie-Antoinette, Borel or François de Jarjayes), a place (Jarjayes Castle, Highlands, Temple prison) and a year (1791, 1792,1793).
When the scenario is completed, each player earns an investigation sheet, 6 gold pieces, and a pencil.
Note that each clue (characters, places and years) are in 4 copies in the game, only discriminated by a specific iconography.

After a drafting phase (memory needed!), the players will bid to collect new clues, spending carefully their gold pieces in order to find new informations.
Sometimes, they only catch rubbish, but often, they can find news info cards or secrets hiding places full of money to help them in their prospections.
Then, they may deal their cards, and lies are permitted.
When an entire year of searching actions (the full game is made of 2 phases) is over, the players may bet about their suspected scenario, allowing them to score bonuses or maluses points.
If there is a tie at the end of game, the richest player is the winner.

name: Meuse 1940
description:
Vae Victis issue 19. This issue's game reprises the system used in Vae Victis issue 1 (Tunisia 1943), with some significant differences in the combat rules, to depict the German invasion across the Meuse in the spring of 1940.

This game also includes a scenario and counters for "Cry Havoc!" from Standard Games.

As with all Vae Victis games, the counters need to be cut out and mounted. The rules are entirely in French, although translations are available online.

name: Whack a Catgirl: Crazy Characters
description: The first expansion for Whack a Catgirl is here! This is a set of six characters that you can play as. Each character card, featuring all-new art, doubles as a player aid for newcomers to the game. Features the Yaoi Fanatic, Alpha Fangirl, and more!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor

name: Tief im Riff
description:
Description from the publisher:

In Tief im Riff ("Deep in the Reef"), players work cooperatively as fish swimming through a coral reef to turn over 28 sea animal tiles placed around the game board. The fish start in one location, then travel through a series of paths — following the arrows as they move — to reach openings in the reef.

On a player's turn, they roll a die, then choose one of the four fish and move it along paths a number of spaces equal to the number rolled. After they finish moving, if they're on a space all by themselves, they can reveal a tile that has only one bubble on it. If they share a space with other fish, they can reveal a tile with as many bubbles as the number of fish on that space. Thus, players need to keep their school from wandering too far apart as they travel through the reef.

If the players manage to reveal all 28 tiles before all four fish have swum out of the reef, then they win!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gear's Knights
description:
It's written in the "Imperial Heizei of the history" in the national library.
300 years ago,
At the beginning of the "steam engine", the most armies in the world is organized in the Imperial "Heizei". It's not for the other counties. It's for the monsters around the Heizei.

In this dark age, there were three heroes and elves. Each three heroes is the expert of the sword, the lance and the gun. The elves don't exist now. Even this age, they were the rare species.
They battled with the monsters, and died in the battles. However they are called "Gear's knights" as the heroes. Because they are the experts of the weapon with the "Steam engine"!

Then the tradition is that the heroes died by the curse from the monsters...

-Overview
Each player collect the weapon cards, and they take the tiles of the soldiers, knights, and elves as the power. Their tiles are placed on the front.
Then the player will battle with the monsters. The monsters are the android of the gears, the mad scientist, the lunatic black knights and the legendary dragon "Bahamut"!
The power of the player is the total values of the horizontal or vertical tiles.

However when the player wins the monsters, the beated monsters curse the player as the penalty. The player guard it by the barriers.

In the end of the game, the winner is the player with the most points as the beat monsters, the tiles and so on.

-Component
35x Player tile(Soldier, Knights and Elves)
4x Start tile
20x Monster tile(Android, Scientists, Black Knights and Bahamut)
1x Startplayer marker

72x Weapon cards(Three colors of Red, Blue and Yellow. And the elves as any colors)

The cards are divided by the gear size in the reverse side. The small is as the one cost for taking. The medium is as the two costs. The big is as the three costs.


20x Cursed chip
10x Scroll cards *For the variant.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Baciamo le Mani
description:
The bag with the cash is disappeared. The Boss is angry and wants his money back. When he will discover who is trying to fool him, he will deliver to him/her a wonderful present: a nice pair of cement shoes that will turn out to be very comfortable during underwater strolls.

One player is the boss, while the others are the remaining members of the “famiglia”. They try to Pass the Blame to each other, in order to avoid the Boss’s fury. In doing so, they also try to protect their Darling, hoping to succeed in escaping with the money.

During their turn the players try to play Excuses Cards that match with Boss’s Mood. In order to do so, they have to use their imagination, by inventing stories that both match with the played Excuses Cards and sound credible. Be Careful! Every time that a player succeeds in Pass the Blame, the Suitcases Cards pass from one player to another.

As soon as a player can’t invent credible stories anymore, the Boss looses his patience and dispenses his fair Judgement against both the unlucky player and his/her protector. At this point the game ends and the player who owns the Bag with the Cash can slip away with the money. However, if the Bag with the Cash was in the hands of the accused player of in those of his/her protector, the Boss gets the money back and wins the game.


la Borsa con il malloppo è sparita. Il Boss la rivuole indietro e quando scoprirà chi ha tentato di “farlo fesso” gli fare un bel regalo: due scarpe di cemento da utilizzare per una gita in fondo alla baia.

Un giocatore impersona il Boss, mentre gli altri giocatori sono gli altri membri della “famiglia”. Questi si Scaricano la Colpa l'un l'altro, per evitare la furia del Boss. Nel farlo, cercano anche di proteggere il proprio Prediletto, nella speranza di riuscire a scappare con il malloppo.

Durante il proprio turno i giocatori cercano di utilizzare le Carte Scusa dalla propria mano per riuscire a giocarne una che combaci con l’Umore del Boss. Per farlo si è costretti a lavorare di fantasia, inventado storie che, non solo devono rispettare gli spunti delle Carte Scusa giocate, ma devono anche risultare plausibili. Ma attenzione! Ogni volta che un giocatore riesce a Scaricare la Colpa su di un altro giocatore, le Carte Borse passano da un giocatore all’altro.

Quando un giocatore non è in più grado di raccontare scuse credibili, il Boss perde completamente le staffe ed emette la sua Sentenza contro il povero malcapitato e contro il suo protettore. A questo punto la partita finisce e il giocatore che possiede la Sorsa con i Soldi può felicemente svignarsela con il malloppo. Se però la Borsa con i Soldi era nelle mani del giocatore beccato o del suo protettore, sarà il Boss a vincere la partita, recuperando il malloppo.

name: #hashtag: the game
description: In #hashtag: the game, two teams compete to prove their creativity as well as their feeling for Instagram. Have the most followers after ten rounds, and you win!

name: Space Drifters
description:
The astronauts on the space station »Trimenz 5« are having a day off for the weekend. To distract their boredom they take a race around the station. Because they only have limited control over their drift direction, they try to help themselves with little asteroid pieces they throw away to use the kickback for the direction the want.

Space Drifters is a dice-driven race game. But in this game the dice do not determine the length of the moves, but the direction of the move on a hexgrid. Each players rolls 3 dice per turn and has to use at least 2 of them for the move. On the control bar there are 5 fields where they can place the dice. These fields determine how much the number on the die is altered and how far the astronaut can go with that die.

Published in Spielbox 5/2009 and in the English Spielbox 1/2010.

name: Schmatzspatz
description:
The breakfast worms are coming! Twelve hungry baby birds stretch their wide-open beaks into the air. Will the busy parent birds manage to get enough food for all of them?

In Schmatzspatz, four wooden birds sit on the edges of the circular rotating "board in the box", each with a worm in its beak. In the middle area are twelve hungry little birds with open mouths. A symbol die determines the sector of the board where the most hungry baby birds are. The player now decides which one of these birds to feed and tries to rotate the board to move one of the adult birds to the right position.

The turning board occasionally blocks the feeding, however,so the players must remember these "blocked" positions. When the worm can successfully be fed to the bird, the baby closes its beak. If the players manage to feed all the baby birds before running out of worms, they win the game together.

Schmatzspatz includes a competitive version in which each player tries to get rid of his worm supply first.

name: Peninsula Italica
description: This game is a variant of the "Britannia" system, this time set in ancient Italy from 2000 to 200 BC. Units include Infantry, Archers (really elite infantry), Cavalry and Leaders.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Mission Command Card Game
description: This card game was issued in 2003 and 2004 by the Army Nation Guard to the children of the soldiers. This was distributed as part of their Freedom Salute Campaign as recognition for soldiers who supported them during Operations Noble Eagle, Enduring Freedom, and Iraqi Freedom. This game was a part of their "Future Soldier Footlocker Kit" which also included the Daring Eagle board game, ARNG trading cards and a comic book.

name: Star Fleet Battles Supplement #2: X-Ships
description: The second expansion for the Commander's Edition of Star Fleet Battles, covering technologically advanced X-ships. Includes a 32 page SSD book for X-Ships, a 24 page rule/scenario book, and 108 die-cut counters. Races covered are the Federation, Orions, Tholians, Romulans, Gorns, Kzinti, Klingons, Hydrans, WYN, I.S.C, and Lyrans
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Latvija Galda Spēle
description: In Latvija Galda Spele you have 400 cards with 2400 questions from six categories : Miscellaneous, History, Sport, Culture, Nature and Geography. Most questions concern Latvia. Collect a token from each category to win. The players roll a die to move and then they must answer a question from the category they land on. If they answer correctly they get a token and when they've gathered tokens in every colour, they can head to the capital (center). First they need to get to a corner of the board where they answer a question of their own choosing. Then there are two coloured spaces from the corner to the center. When the players get to the center they answer a question of the other player(s) choosing. A correct answer in the center means victory!

name: DrunkQuest: Promo Cards
description: Various individual promo cards, which have been made available for the DrunkQuest game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Cat On Yer Head
description:
Cat On Yer Head is a crowd game that starts with a few simple rules that can then be modified while it is played. An imaginary cat, passed between players, chases an imaginary mouse who must escape it and eat cheese; or hide down a mouse hole; or turn into a cat-eating monster – or whatever the players invent. Because that’s the aim of the game: to build upon its basic rules, redesign it on the fly and make it sillier while you play.

The game is now available in digital and print editions as a 48-page illustrated storybook. The book includes full instructions so that anyone can play, fun extra features and details of numerous popular variants in five sections:


Getting Started
Extending the Game: Cheese
Extending the Game: Mouse Holes
More Features
Adding Your Own Rules


A free sampler PDF including the Getting Started section is also available.

All versions are available from www.catonyerhead.com
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Party Game, Print & Play, Real-time

name: RePresidency
description:
50 States and the District of Columbia make up our Electoral College, the goal of the game is to win states and get the most votes. Each player will be dealt a total of three candidate cards--these will include 24 of our nations most influential Presidents throughout history. From those cards you will choose one candidate and that will be yours for the remainder of the game. Not all candidates will be able to gain states as easily as others, the 'Political Cause' cards can help get a candidate Electoral Votes that they normally could not get just on merit alone.
Throughout your turns, you will gain Political Allies and use their Historical Influence to gain States (each worth different Electoral Votes) and to assist in becoming the next President. You will have to come up with the best strategy to ensure you get the most votes to beat your opponents.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Take That

name: Hootie Cutie
description: In the real-time game Hootie Cutie, players attempt to find matching animals on the cards placed on the board, but they cannot play on previous played cards. In the end, whoever collects the most friend cards wins!

name: Cubopolis
description:
Cubopolis is a quick and fun game in which two to four crazy architects will try to build the city of Cubopolis on top of a big cube.

Each turn the current player places two little cubes (the "houses") on two previously positioned sticks (the "roads"), and then a new stick on these little cubes. If the new stick protrudes out one side of the big cube more than any other stick, the player gets the matching territory tile, taking it from the table or stealing it from the current owner.

Beware: each construction will make the city even more unstable!
Each time a player causes a collapse, his or her opponents gain one point for each terrritory tile they own.

The game ends when all the players have placed their sticks, and the player with more points is the winner.

name: Spanish Civil War Battles: Vol. 1 – Brunete & Jarama
description:
Spanish Civil War Battles, Vol. 1, is two-games-in-one depicting two battles of The Spanish Civil War (1936-1939).

The first game is Brunete and the second is Jarama.

The Spanish Civil War Battles, Vol. 1 Brunete and Jarama was published in Strategy & Tactics magazine #213, Nov/Dec 2002.

Game Scale:

Game Turn: 1 day
Hex: 1 mile / 1.6 kilometers
Units: Company to Brigade


Game Inventory:

One 22 x 34" six color mapsheet
One dual-side printed countersheet (280 1/2" counters)
One 16-page Spanish Civil War Battles rules booklet


Solitaire Playability: High
Complexity Level: Medium-Low
Players: 2-3 or more
Playing Time: 2-8
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Operation Market Garden
description:
World War 2 in your pocket Operation Market Garden is a two player card game, ideal as a filler before or after your main gaming event. Also great as a travel game to take on holiday or when you're out with friends. It plays in 20-40 minutes for players aged 8+. It's quick to learn but strategic, learn from your enemy and try to get inside their mind to work out what sequence they will lay their cards down. Artwork by Adrian Stone.

Recreating the largest airborne invasion in history, Operation Market Garden in World War 2. Use your battle and tactic cards to out smart your opponent, use your equipment wisely, reveal events and monitor your divisions. Can you win enough battles to secure the vital bridges, will you be able to capture and hold all of them in time?

Each round consists of 7 battles, to win a battle the player must have the highest points score. The player will combine, battle, tactic, equipment and event cards to get to their total score. Whoever wins the most battles wins the bridge. The Allied player must win the bridge to proceed to the next bridge a draw is not enough. Players will take it in turns to be the Allied player to see how many bridges they can capture. The German player can reduce the effectiveness of the Allied player by altering the Allied Division cards, the Allied player can try and counter this using the Victoria Cross card but these are limited so you must use them wisely.

Events can be positive or negative for both sides. Players must try and work out what sequence their opponent will lay down their cards. They must remember what cards have already been used and try and get inside their opponents mind to out think them, what did they do last round, will they do the same thing, which combinations of cards do they favour, when should I use my Victoria Cross card. There are only 3 equipment and 3 tactic cards for each side so they must be used carefully. Can you get your opponent to use their most powerful card on your weakest card?

-description from designer
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Memory, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Memory, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Isaac Asimov presents Super Quiz II
description:
This is the second of 3 trivia games in the Super Quiz series. It uses the same rules as the original Isaac Asimov's Super Quiz. The only difference is the question categories: Famous People, Music, T.V., Spelling, Leisure & Travel, & Potluck.

Original game design by Ken Fisher (who is also the designer of the Wizard card game).

All questions edited and approved by Dr. Asimov Also, a 1-page essay by him, titled "Any Number Can Play" is included in the 4-page rule book of each of the 3 games.

name: Trivial Pursuit Singles: Entertainment
description:
600 questions about movies, music, & more plus a special die in a small, wedge-shaped storage container.

The game does not feature a game board, and thus, there is no roll-and-move mechanic. Instead, players roll the color-coded die, and answers a question matching the color rolled. If a player correctly answers a question, he may "go for a wedge" by answering another question in the same category. If he does so, he keeps that card. If the player answers a question incorrectly, it is the next player's turn. Play ends when a player has collected six cards/correctly answered 12 questions.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game, Trivia

name: Hide n' Seek
description:
Trying to recall this from memory, as it's been close to 30 years since I last played this one.

Hide n' Seek is a childrens game. For those days when you couldn't play outside, and playing the real thing inside would have driven mom nuts.

One player is "it". The other players put their pawns under any of the 9 hiding locations, and up to two players can hide in any one location.

"It" rolls the die and moves toward one of the the hiding places. Some of the hiding places are alone on paths, some are located on paths that diverge to more than one hiding space, and of course there are near and far spaces to hide.

After "It" moves, the other players can decide to make a break for it, trying to reach home before "It" can catch them.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Willi wills wissen: Das Quiz
description:
Content:
100 quiz cards, 1 board, 4 pawns, 1 estimation line, 4 estimation stones, 20 tipp cards, 8 action-chips

Willi is the moderator of a popular German children quiz show on the children channel "Kika".
He asks for more information about what children want to know - and this with great success. In this quiz game his fans can prove their knowledge themselves.
categories: Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Flower Garden
description:
The objective of the game is to create as many complete flower as possible before the caterpillar is completed.

Each turn, the player rolls the dice. Either she adds a part to the caterpillar or she takes a petal of the color indicated on the dice. A flower is completed when all of the petals are of the same color or when they are all of different colors. Instead of taking a new petal, a player may also choose to move one from one flower to another.

There is a minimum strategy to use in this game, so it's great for kids who love flowers. The wooden pieces are all magnetic and are of high quality. You can also bypass the game and just "play" with the components.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Environmental, Farming
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pattern Building

name: Food Fight!
description:
Players are considered to have wandered into the middle of a food fight. During the game each player (or team-member when playing with 4) throw food at each other, trying to gain the least food cards in front of them ("on them" in theme).

The game consists of 3 rounds. Each round begins with setting up the cafeteria table (2 stacks of cards to draft from). Each player in turn order chooses to one of three things: take 1 card, swap a card, throw food.

Each option will result in adding cards to your hand or giving them to your opponent(s). At the end of the last round all players add up how many types of food they have on them. The player with the least amount is declared the winner.
publishers: Superior Print On Demand (POD), T.O.G. Entertainment, Inc.

name: Nobunaga
description:
You are Generals of Oda Nobunaga. You have to prepare for wars against your enemies.

Lord Nobunaga is also prepared to fight.

A Great battle will soon begin!

After each attack is resolved, you or Lord Nobunaga will get Victory Points depending on the deed that has been accomplished.

After two wars have been fought, if you have the most VPs among the Generals in the game, you win. But if Nobunaga has gathered the most VPs, all of the Generals lose the game. Thus you must not only compete for Victory Points but you must also cooperate each other in order to get more Victory Points than Nobunaga.

Component
Clan cards: 60 (6 clans by 10 cards)
Nobunaga card: 1
Leader card: 1
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Cro-Magnon Rrrevolution
description:
The pre-hysteria with stones.

After their first game on the subject called "Cro-Magnon" the team behind that game comes up with the follow-up called "Cro-Magnon Rrrévolution", which is a completely independent game from the original.

As in the original, you play as a tribe that will evolve over time. The change is that this time every time you move your pawn on the track and change area, the playing conditions change. As in the first version, the basic principle is to make your tribe guess as many words as they can.

The method of making the tribe guess the words is what changes each time. In the first age it's miming combined with an uncontrollable effect of a die; in the second age, you will make shapes with stones; later you can talk only with words that never contain the letter of your tribe taboo; and finally in the fourth age you can use overlapping cardboard shapes to evoke the mystery word...

"Cro-Magnon Rrrévolution" is a game of communication and pure atmosphere.

name: Breath
description:
Without a sound, or even a tremor, the fractured shards of many worlds have been haphazardly fused into new reality. The inhabitants are dazed and lost. The broken remains of each civilization now seek to rebuild. To even begin building a new home, each alien land must be tamed to suit the temperament and needs of your people.

Breath is a 2-4 express print-and-play area control game, inspired by Terra Mystica. And it fits in an Altoids tin!

The handful of cubes each player has are used both as workers who terraform the land as well as markers for settlements and bridges. When enough workers have been placed on a hex, the terrain can be changed to suit your people. Settlements placed on hexes that match your peoples needs can be joined together to build bigger settlements. When you run out of room to expand, build bridges to reach the land across the river, or send your workers on ships to colonize the far reaches the world-spanning river.

Although larger settlements give more points at the end of the game, having many smaller settlements next to your opponents will give extra income during the game. Consider carefully which path you choose - a single large world-spanning settlement, or many tiny village-sized settlements.

name: Shanghai Incident: 28 January – 2 March 1932
description:
A faction of the Japanese military had been looking for an excuse to extend Japanese control deeper into the Chinese mainland. When several Chinese monks were beaten, this faction paid thugs to fan anti-Japanese activities in the Chinese sector of Shanghai. Seizing the “opportunity,” a small force of naval infantry invaded Chapei, the all-Chinese northern section of the city of Shanghai. But the Japanese had not counted on the quick reaction and effective fighting of the Nationalist Chinese forces from nearby Nanjing. The initial Japanese thrust was thrown back quickly. It took repeated reinforcements over the next five weeks for the Japanese to push the Chinese out of the city and away from the Huangpo and Yangtze Rivers. Shanghai would become a major springboard for further Japanese advances, but the battle had taken its toll. This game covers those five weeks of fighting.

Shanghai Incident uses the Fire & Movement system designed around the realities of mechanized warfare, giving motorized and/or specially-trained units clear advantages. Players can augment units at the instant of combat with support fire, provided by weapons ranging from mortars through cannon and light ground attack aircraft to heavy bombers. A seemingly predictable assault can be overturned at the last minute by heavy defending fires, while even small units may develop tremendous offensive punch with the assistance of a heavy bombardment. Winning the battle is a matter of maneuver, firepower and asset management.

The Japanese military has greater overall skill and firepower, although the Chinese have two German-trained divisions. Both players have manpower limitations that are eased only when the Japanese player calls a pause to his offensive. Both sides therefore have to weigh time and space against numbers. The player who strikes the best balance will emerge the victor.

Skills:

Level: Regiment
Hex: .625 miles (1 km)

name: Æther
description:
Description from the publisher:

The stars and the galaxies reveals its mysteries only to the watchful eye. Æther invites you to play and have fun with our notions of the universe and its inception.

In Æther, the players take turns playing cards in a quest to see how the universe takes shape. To do this, the players use cards that represent matter (Nube Molecular) and energy (Campo Gravitacional), stars, galaxies and singularities. To play a galaxy, a player needs to discard 2 stars under his/her control, but to play a star you need to discard both matter and energy cards. The goal of the game is to be the fist player to control two galaxy cards and one star card.
But every card has an effect on the game. From drawing extra cards to stealing from other players or even canceling a card's effect just played from your opponent, using them in the most effective way is crucial for victory.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Het Grote DE Koffiespel
description:
Game given by Dutch coffee company Douwe Egberts to customers which had collected a lot of coupons found on their products.

Theme of the game is coffee (really!); you are a coffee seller buying raw harvested beans and rights for different production phases (blending, roasting, packaging and distribution) to optimize the profit from selling your coffee. You can trade coffee and rights with other players.

One can also buy stock in one of the production plants (squares on the board); when you land on that square you get the rights for free, when others land on it they buy rights from you instead of the bank.

It resembles Monopoly (though it is different enough not to be called a clone) and has a similar limited-but-existing possibility for using strategy.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: LEGO: Life of George
description:
Note that all apps required to play this game were discontinued in early 2015.

LEGO: Life of George combines LEGO bricks and iPhone technology into a fast-paced building game.

In the two-to-four player game, each player takes turns building objects with LEGO bricks based on a pattern shown on a player's iPhone or iPod Touch (4th gen and later) [and an Android 2.1+ app was added in summer 2012] via the LEGO: Life of George and LEGO: Build Your Brain apps. When the player finishes building that object, she snaps a picture with the phone, which then presents a score based on how difficult the object was, how quickly the player built it, and whether it was built correctly. After five rounds, the player with the highest score wins. In LEGO: Build Your Brain, players play "game show" style, solving in different categories a variety of pattern building and logic puzzles for points.

In the single-player mode, you're presented with a series of images, and you complete them as quickly as possible in order to record a high score. The "My Life" section of the app allows you to upload pictures of LEGO models that you created for posterity or for future challenges against other players. The separate Build Your Brain app can also be played individually, solving pattern-building logic puzzles (and taking a picture of one's solution when complete) like those that are presented in the multi-player game.

name: Dragon Ball Z Power Up! Board Game
description:
Join the Z fighters as you compete to defeat the dragon and become the next champion in Dragon Ball Z Power Up! Board Game.

Each player starts with a unique line-up of characters that they are trying to score the most points with. Players take turns moving any character up the board until a character gets to the top. Once a character is advanced to the top board, players vote to see whether the character stays or is kicked off the board. It takes only one NO vote to get them off the board — but players should use their NO votes wisely as each player has only two NO votes in their hand. The round ends when the character is unanimously voted to stay at the top.

Score up your points and play another round. Game ends after three rounds.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Trödeln
description: Re-issue of Ausbrecher AG, with children dawdling to be the last into class and get to sit at the back. Includes selection cards showing the randomized positions, instead of the original version's choices being written out by the players. A light and funny dice-roller worth getting.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Presidential Election
description:
From the publisher, JKLM Games:

In the race to the White House, the players represent Democrat and Republican candidates aiming to sway the voters and win the American election. Either advancing your policy pieces to pander to the middle ground of public opinion, or passionately making the case for more radical ideas, are options for this. Cleverly using dominoes to both move your pieces along the track and to form the track itself, Presidential Election is an elegant and fun game, particularly in the months before November's election!

name: Looney Labs Mammoth Fun Pack
description:
Looney Labs 2013 Christmas Present contains four card add-ons for four different Looney Labs games. After the initial Christmas 2013 gift release, the pack is now available for purchase in some retail locations.

Contains the Cards:
Live Woolly Mammoth (Chrononauts) - a new artifact for the game, something neat to collect.

Knock, Knock (Monster Fluxx) - a new goal for Monster Fluxx, you need the Spooky Door and Angry Mob of Villagers to win!

Fluxx or Looney Pyramids (Choose One) - It begs the question of which one would you choose: Fluxx or Looney Pyramids?

Scramble Colors (Fluxx: The Board Game) - A new Action card: "Gather up all color cards currently in use, shuffle them together, and deal them back out." It really switches things.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Grim Reaper Sect
description:
■Idea of the GamePlayers play Hunter cards (Grim Reaper, Angel, and Devil cards) to fight over Soul cards.
Players fight over Soul cards on the table by playing Hunter cards from their hand. The player who has collected Soul cards of all 3 types, 3 Soul cards of the same type, or 5 Soul cards of any type wins the game.



■How to playPlay a Hunter card from your hand face down on the Angel or Devil team side.
After all players pass their turns or the maximum number of Hunter cards playable (as shown on the Soul card) are played, flip all played Hunter cards face up.
Add the strength of the cards on each team side (Angel and Devil) to calculate the total strength of each team.
The player who played the Hunter card with the lowest number in the team with higher strength shall receive the Soul card of that round.



■PointIn this game, you need to play a high-number card(s) to form a majority and a low-number card(s) to outdo other players in the majority.
The point of this game lies on how you handle this dilemma.
publishers: (Self-Published), さとーふぁみりあ (Sato Familie)

name: Sneaky Statues of Easter Island
description:
Help to solve one of the greatest mysteries in history!

In Sneaky Statues of Easter Island, players take turns moving eight "stone" Moai statues. Where do they move? How do they end up in a straight line? That's up to you!

Be the first to outwit your rival and arrange your four mysterious statues together in a straight line and win. But wait! Your rival knows which statue you will move next. The question is...does he know where it will go?

-Game description from the publisher:

name: Murder on the Cards
description:
Murder on the Cards is a quick play card game for 2 to 6 players that combines dark humour with the silly extremes of everyday irritants.

Each player is dealt 6 random Save Yourself cards and a Life Card at the start of the game, to be used against the To Your Demise Card scenarios that are presented on each turn. There are also To Your Demise cards that rely on a player's wit and luck alone. The Save Yourself cards counteract the various To Your Demise scenarios, but a player needs the correct Save Yourself card to survive, and if they don't have it, they can either barter with other players or gamble with the house deck. If you can't save yourself then you are Critically Hit and reduced to 1 Save Yourself card and your Life Card. After that, if the murderer gets you through the To Your Demise cards - you're toast.

The goal of the game is to last the longest against The Murderer. Every game is different, some result in a lone survivor and others leave everyone dead, but ultimately the last alive wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Move Through Deck, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Car Wars Fifth Edition Starter Set, Division 15 - Set 3
description:
Car Wars Fifth Edition Starter Set, Division 15 - Set 3 is a complete starter set for Car Wars: the basic rules, counters and components, and two cars. The cars are Vindicator vs. Dragon (with each have modifications). Division 15 duels allow a total of $15,000 for a vehicle. The Car Wars Turning Key included in the set is especially helpful.

Part of the Car Wars (Fifth Edition) Series.

Expands:

Car Wars (Fifth Edition)
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Science Fiction

name: Asteriks: Wielka wyprawa
description:
From the publisher:
Fearless Gauls take part in a great expedition. They will travel through forests, seas and visit many Roman camps and even Egipt! To proof their accomplishment they must come back with Roman helmets.

In this game players race around the board formed of cards. In a turn a player has to swap a card which lays between him and the first opponent behind him. After swapping she moves to the first card in front of her which shows the same picture as the card just swapped. If a player passes the village she receives a Roman helmet.

The first player to stop on village with 5 Roman helmets or the first to gather 8 helmets is the winner.

This game is a Polish version of Ahoy. It's almost the same game, but one rule is added. Originally the goal of the game was to stop on the starting card with 5 tokens, while here it is also possible to win by gathering 8 of them.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Memory, Racing, Travel

name: Monopoly Secret Vault
description:
Guess the code and get rich! The Monopoly Secret Vault board game for kids 8+ features Mr. Monopoly's vault filled with valuable items that give players more wealth. Begin by filling the vault with riches. Each time a player unlocks it and gets what's inside, it gets refilled with more valuables. Which means there are always plenty of riches to unlock! To open the vault, players guess the code, which is a random number from 1 to 6. Be sure to pay attention to numbers already guessed! In this exciting family board game for 2-6 players, each time the vault is opened, the code randomly resets. Along with Monopoly Money, there are hotels that players can only find in the vault, plus keys to locked properties. The player with the most money at the end of the game wins!

MONOPOLY GAME WITH VAULT: In the Monopoly Secret Vault board game, Mr. Monopoly gives players chances to take riches from his vault -- if they can guess the code to unlock it

CRACK THE CODE AND GET RICH: Players buy properties and collect rent, but in this edition players try to guess the codes to open the vault as many times as possible

FIND MONEY, HOTELS, AND KEYS TO LOCKED PROPERTIES: Inside the vault, find money, hotels, and cardboard keys that allow players to unlock properties

THEMED MONOPOLY TOKENS: Features tokens including Scottie, Top Hat, T-Rex, Hazel. Racecar, and Rubber Ducky -- all designed to look like they're ready to break into the vault

ENTERTAINING FAMILY GAME: The Monopoly Secret Vault board game for 2-6 players is fun for adults, teens, and kids ages 8 and up. It’s a great choice for family game nights, parties, and get-togethers

—description from the publisher

name: Baseball Classics Simulation
description:
Overview:
Baseball board game emphasizing fast & easy play, while still maintaining statistical accuracy & realism.

Features:

Full-color, easy-to-use player cards, or streamlined, single-page MLB Team Sheets
3 playing levels for the beginner-to-novice-to-expert MLB fan: Basic, Intermediate, & Advanced
Flexibility to order any MLB Teams or Seasons 1901 to 2013


Gameplay:
Pick any MLB teams 1901-present, choose your lineups, and then the current batter faces the pitcher. Roll the 4 dice (3d6 and 1 binary die with only zeroes and ones). If the binary die roll is a "0", refer to the pitcher's card. If the result is a "1", refer to the batter's card. Add up the results of the 3 other d6 dice. Then, lookup the roll in that player's Result column. (Optional play using fielding ratings: use fielding chart or fielding grid to see if there's an error on the play.) Call the shots using the stealth game play chart where anything in an MLB game can happen in Baseball Classics. Track all your progress on the Scorecard to determine the winner

Website offers free Print-&-Play version to try out the game.

name: Dai Hasami Shogi
description:
Dai Hasami Shogi is a variant of Hasami Shogi. It is played on a 9x9 grid, traditionally on a shogi board. The word dai mean large and the name is apt because this game uses twice as many pieces as Hasami Shogi, 18 per player placed initially on the two back rows nearest the player controlling those pieces. The two sides are called sente ["black"] and gote ["white"], as in shogi, with sente moving first. Traditionally, Go-stones are used for the pieces.

The object of the game is to capture all of an opponents' pieces or to have captured more pieces than one's opponent if a situation arises in which additional captures are no longer possible. All pieces move like rooks is chess, i.e., in any uninterrupted vertical or horizontal line in any obstructed direction without jumping. Pieces are taken by custodial capture, i.e., when an enemy piece becomes horizontally or vertically sandwiches between two of a player's own pieces. One of the two pieces bracketing the captured piece must be moved in order to capture but multiple simultaneous captured are allowed.

The game is a member of the petteia or lantruculorum family of games. A similar game is played in Thailand and in , where respectively it is called Mak-yes and Apit-sodok; this game differs only in that the second row of pieces starts on the third rather than the second row.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement, Square Grid

name: Caption if You Can!
description:
Create captions for funny photos and vote on your favourites!

Caption If You Can! is a party game where you and your friends create funny captions for all sorts of weird, wonderful and wacky photographs. Vote for your favourite caption each round, and rake in the points when your friends pick your caption as the best!

The game includes:
160 phototgraphs on 80 extra-large cards
200 caption slips
60 scoring gems
8 pencils
Rules booklet

Caption If You Can! has been released in a limited first printing of 100 copies, signed and numbered by the designer.

name: Shadow Agents
description:
Shadow Agent is a small, fast, diceless microgame wherein one player controls a secret agent, and the other controls a master villain.

Secret Agent: One player controls one of four secret agents, who uses a mixture of spy gear, experience from prior missions, and specialized military training to infiltrate the villainous mastermind's secret lair at Skullcrusher Mountain. He must bypass or neutralize the villain's security and locate the hidden control room.

Villain Mastermind: One player controls the villain, who has just activated the countdown on his apocalyptic doomsday device. He has hidden the control room in one of the areas of his secret lair, and he must place a mixture of traps, sentry guns, guard dogs, and cameras in various areas to trap the agent.

Win Conditions: If the agent enters the control room, the agent disables the doomsday device and wins. If the villain traps the agent, the villain wins.

name: Pássaros
description:
Birds are envied by humans and watched since dawn of history. Birding is one of the greatest hobbies in the world. In this game, you are a bird photographer, competing to get the more precious photo collection of Brazilian birds by travelling through all the regions of the Brazil.

Pássaros (Birds) is a light strategy game in which the players, as bird photographers, try to get the best photos of Brazilian birds while traveling in all Brazilian regions.

Pássaros has two game rules included, a basic rules, in that the players travel and take photos in any desired order. In the end, players receive points for the most different types of birds, for each three of a kind photos and also considering the resources they did not spent during the game.

In the advanced rules, players must travel first, and take photos later, also, the birds themselves fly all along the board. All points categories in basic play still counts, but also players get points for having the most photos in each categories.

The game is played in five rounds of three turns each, and during each round, the players are considered to be traveling, and the photos taken are in "unsecure" memory cards, that can be lost. Only at the end of each round the photos are downloaded to a secure server.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Clobber
description:
Clobber is played by two players, White and Black, on a rectangular
checkerboard, often of size n*(n+1) for some n. However, in the Computer
Olympiads Clobber is played on 10x10-boards.

In the initial position, all squares are occupied by a stone, with white stones on the white squares and black stones on the black squares. A player moves by picking up one of their stones and "clobbering" an opponent's stone on an adjacent square (horizontally or vertically).
The "clobbered" stone is removed from the board and replaced by the stone that was moved. The game ends when one player, on their turn, is unable to move, and then that player loses.

name: Upper Hand
description:
This is a simple but challenging game. It is very simple to learn but the strategy can be very deep. The board consists of a 5x5 grid of dimples in which marbles are placed. The game is played somewhat differently than Pylos or Pyraos which form a pyramid on a 4x4 grid.

The "wild" third colored marble is placed first in the center of the 5x5 grid. This overcomes the problem that the pyramid on a 5x5 base requires an odd number of marbles to build.

In Pyramids the goal is to get rid of all of your playing pieces first. If placing a marble completes a square and at least three of the marbles in that square are the player’s color, then the player gets to place an additional marble on top of the square. If the additional marble completes another square, then using the same rule as before the player gets to place a third marble on so on.

Since the two players may have overall played a different number of marbles towards the end of the game, the game might be over before the pyramid is finished. The game obviously can’t last longer than 27 moves since there is no rule to remove marbles in Pyramids.
publishers: BSM Jeux, Hilco Corporation, Orda Industries Ltd.

name: MetalTalon
description:
MetalTalon is a free game from Invisible City Productions. It is played on a hex like board of circles. The object of the game is get a ship onto the enemy home base or just destroy all of his or her cash reserves.

Ships are made from the initial 26 cents. Each coin that comprises a ship does something different. Each penny allows you to move the ship one space, nickels attack and dimes allow either and reduce damage.

Attacking is simple and is based on a dice roll and distance.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Happick
description:
Happick is a game about farming and growing vegetables. In addition to growing vegetables, players can steal neighbor's vegetables or embed mine as a trap.

Happick is turn base game. In every turn, player have 5 phase to do his action.

Phase 1 : Agriculture - Player draw 2 vegetable tiles and put one on his blank field and other to bottom of tile pile.

Phase 2 : Draw : Player draw up to 2 card, but not over hand limit. Player hand limit is 3+number of vegetable tiles on his field.

Phase 3 : Havest & Pick : If player's vegetable is growth, he can havest it with card in his hand that match with havest icon on vegetable tile. In other action, player can pick other vegetable tile using theif card.

Phase 4 : Card Used : Player use any cards in his hand and resolve effect this phase.

Phase 5 : Vegetable growing : All vegetable tiles in player's field are growing depend on field's number that tile on it.

When any one player have collect some vegetable tiles that match with end game's condition (depend on number of players). Game end immediately and player who have most score is win.

name: The Amazing Spider-Man Labyrinth
description:
The Amazing Spider-Man Labyrinth uses the same basic game play as Ravensburger's decades-old title The aMAZEing Labyrinth. Players try to move through a labyrinthine game board in order to reach a desired symbol shown on a game board tile that matches a hidden card held by this player. The game board consists of a number of fixed tiles as well as rows and columns in which tiles can slide back and forth; these tiles show tunnels – T-shaped, straight, and otherwise – and a player can move his token only along the path as it exists on his turn.

At the start of his turn, however, he takes the one tile on the side of the game board and pushes it into a row or column of his choice, shifting the tunnels and pushing out one tile that the next player will use. This player now moves his pawn, and if he reaches the desired symbol, he reveals the card, then looks at the next card in his stack to see what he wants to reach next turn.
