This expansion adds 3x of every Equipment Card from the Starter Game allowing a single player to build a more focused deck or more players to use those Equipments while building own decks in a multiplayer game.
This expansion does not add new content, it adds just more copies of the same content of Starter Set.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Simulation

name: Family Farm
description: A speed game where little farmers must quickly see if at least 1 of the 2 items depicted on a tile is in their own Farm, and eventually grab it before anybody else.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Farming, Memory, Real-time

name: Streets of Atlanta (fan expansion for The Walking Dead)
description:
This is an unofficial fan-made expansion released to the public with permission from Cryptozoic Entertainment, publisher of The Walking Dead Board Game.

Streets of Atlanta is a dice-based expansion for The Walking Dead Board Game that expands the core game to a whole new experience. Visit four of six locations, then return to either the camp or the prison. Use new weapons and fate cards to survive the zombie apocalypse — but beware because if you die, you turn against your fellow survivors. All you'll want is their brains. Good hunting!

Streets of Atlanta allows up to six players to compete with newly designed character cards to match the look of season three of the AMC TV show The Walking Dead. Other features of this expansion:

- Updated special abilities for each characters
Each character has his unique matching special ability.

- Added 20 Scrounge Cards
For six player support!

- Added 6 new playable Characters
Choose Daryl, T-Dog, Michonne, Maggie, Carl and Hershel

- Added 4 Zombie character pieces inclusive female zombies and zombified version of the survivors
You can choose more default Zombie Pieces to hunt the survivors or switch to the zombified version of your character.

- Added 6 Special Ability Tokens
Now you can track, if a special ability has been used up.

- Added 1 Team Zombie, 1 Team Survivor Token, 8 Ally Tokens and 8 Location Tiles
For six player support!

- Added new Encounter Cards
More variety of Walkers will try to kill you on the streets.

- Replaced original map with 16 Map Tiles for a new random map every game
You don't longer need the original Game Board. With 16 Street-Squares called Map Tiles you build a different Atlanta each game. Every new game needs a new strategy.

- Added 2 new Corner Locations: The Fuel Station and the Pawn Shop
Introducing new Locations to the game. With the Pawn Shop, you can get Fate Cards or your Special Ability back. Or you decide to visit the Fuel Station to get more movement with Jerry Cans. You still need only 4 Locations. It's your decision.

- Added 2 minor new Buildings: Motorcycle Shop and Firestation
These buildings can upgrade your character, if you got the special Fate Card in your hand.

- Added 12 Jerrycans for the Fuel Station
Jerry Cans are everywhere in Atlanta. You can collect Jerry Cans for the Fuel Station to provide your character a faster movement. But watch out, other survivors want them too.

- Added 27 different types of fate cards for advanced strategy (total 45 cards)
This is a brand new deck of cards. Fate cards are kept hidden in your hand and can be played on yourself or on other survivors. Some are good, some are nasty. Are you a good guy or a bad one?

- Added 18 different types of INCIDENT Cards for unpredictable board incidents (total 20 cards)
This is also a brand new deck of cards. Incident Cards are drawn, if you roll a 1 on the incident die. The card will tell you, what happens to the board, survivors and/or walkers. They may be good or bad. You may change your strategy to some incidents.

- Added Prison Map Tile (Alternate Camp)
You can head back with your 4 Locations to the Camp or try the saver way to the new Prison. But be careful, the prison has many fences and you have to stop many times to get into the building.

- Added 6 different new Walker Cards
Walker Player get 6 new different Walker Cards to kill the remaining survivors

- New Sewer System
Walkers can use Sewers to move quickly through Atlanta to head up the survivors.

- Added New Encounter Boss Cards: Walker Herd, The Governor and Merle Dixon
With the new encounters, there are Boss Fights. Fight together against the Walker Herd or battle with another survivor with Merle Dixon. But be aware, the Governor is out there and he is unpredictable and dangerous.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Horror, Zombies

name: Argh!
description:
Argh! is a press-your-luck pirate-themed card game where players randomly draw face-down cards spread out in a center playing area. The goal of the game is to collect treasure cards and score points. A player only scores points when they decide to end their turn and the total number of points awarded to the player is based on the number of treasure cards they have in front of them. Some treasure only scores points when the player has 3 or more of the same type. Included in the cards are 8 Pirates that will steal all scorable treasure from the player if drawn before they end their turn. There are also a few cards that allow a player to steal treasure from their opponents.

The winner of the game is the first to collect a set number of points (which is based on the number of players at the table).

name: Jintol
description:
Jintol is an abstract 2-player game and is played in 2 rounds.

Each player starts the first round with an identical set of tiles ( 1 player black - 1 player white) and 3 action cards ( picked from a set of 8).

In turn each player places one of these 2x2 tiles on a 5x5 grid and/or plays an action card (depending on the type of card). When playing a tile, it is mandatory to cover at least one uncovered square of the 5x5 playing grid.

Players keep placing new tiles until the 5x5 grid is completely covered with tiles.

Each player counts how many squares of his colour are on top.
The board is then cleared and the second round is played. While the tiles can be used again played cards cannot but each player can pick 3 new cards and if the player has any unplayed cards left he/she can use these as well.

Whoever has the highest combined score of the 2 rounds wins the game.

From the box: JINTOL was invented by two mathematic geniuses from Keio University. It is a new game which requires intelligence and strategy skills.

name: Cursed!
description:
Cursed! is a card game where fortune favors the cruel. Gather a few friends ’round the table and see how quickly all those years of bonding and camaraderie can be ripped to shreds with a well placed hex. Strategically protect your own good fortunes (Wealth, Health, Love, Fate, and Luck) while devastating the fortunes of those around you.

Each player in Cursed! is dealt a hand of three cards (blessings, curses, or neutrals each in one of five fortunes) and must choose to play one card on herself, one card on an opponent, and sacrifice one card to make a slight alteration to the rules of the game. When a player accumulates curses on three or more fortunes, he is out of the game (play continues until one player is left). If he accumulates blessings on three or more fortunes, he wins.

The game consists of 104 poker-sized cards in a tuck box and an optional player mat. There is also a print-and-play version.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Phase Order

name: Trivial Pursuit: Family Edition – Card Set
description:
Here\'s the perfect Trivial Pursuit edition for kids and parents alike. This Family Edition Card Set features two boxes of questions - one specifically for adults, one tailored just for kids - to give everyone a chance to win in these categories: People & Places, Entertainment, History, Science & Nature, Sports & Leisure, and Wild Card.
Grown-UPS will test their trivia memory on everything from Thomas Jefferson to the Ayatollah... Cobb to Clemens... Pearl Harbor to Kuwait City;... and Trump Tower to the Ozone Layer. The kids can show what they know from Dinosaurs to Gerbils... Adam and Eve to Cabbage Patch Kids... the Little Dipper to the Little Big Horn... and the Alamo to Oz.
Trivial Pursuit Family Edition... It\'s fun for all - and all for fun!

name: Hex Survival
description:
Hex Survival is a tactic game of survival set in fantasy world of Moffee, where you'll have to be the last man standing.

PLOT
In order to complete his masterpiece, the perfect Zombie, Dr.Skelrt trapped Moffee's heroes in his laboratory. In order to survive, the heroes will have to fight each other and avoid zombification: only the last man (or woman, or orc, or boar) standing will earn freedom!

GAMEPLAY
Control your hero pawns and kill your adversaries while escaping their zombie version and collecting treasure cards, in a randomly-built HEXangonal map full of bonuses and maluses.
You'll have to collect treasure cards in order to attack your fellow adversaries or heal your own zombified pawns, to fire your gun, stab your opponents' back, trick, bite and infect them, and a lot more.
Being zombified hero is not the end, but just another beginning.

OBJECTIVE
Eliminate all your opponents and be the last survivor at the end of a round.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Open Drafting, Player Elimination

name: Cold Combat
description: First expansion pack for Platoon Leader. Includes three new scenarios and a new, winterized map. Act as the Americans or try your hand as a German commander. New rules allow for snipers, the Waffen SS, wounded leaders, smoke and an optional advanced panic rule! Comes with a play aid which was not included in the original Platoon Leader base game. Also includes new additional counters and a graphic orders/turn track. Platoon Leader is required to play Cold Combat.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Łamisłówka
description:
Łamisłówkais a tile-placement word game played on a field of hexes clustered around numbered fields, where players must place words in twisted lines and the situation on the board is constantly shifting, and can be subject to interpretation. Somewhat reminiscent of diagramless crosswords.

Each player puts down tiles that, in connection to some already on the board, spell out a word; the word has to be declared, as, unlike scrabble, it could be read in many directions, touches letters that aren't part of the word, and so on. Each letter has an assigned number of points, and each word places scores points. Additionally, if one closes the right surrounding a numbered field, one collects as many points as the number signifies. The player with the highest score at the end of the game wins.

name: UNO: Planes
description:
The usual Uno rules - Players race to empty their hands and catch opposing players with cards left in theirs, which score points. In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching its color or number to the topmost card on the discard pile. If unable to play, players draw cards from the draw pile until they are able to place a card. Wild and special cards spice things up a bit. Additionally, when playing their penultimate card from their hand, players must shout 'UNO' or face a forfeit of drawing two further cards.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: Altimeter Alert Card. When played, the player of the altimeter alert card chooses one color and each player puts 1 card of that color, face down, in front of them. Then each player reveals their card and whoever has the highest number wins. If 2 players have the same card, the number is invalid and the next one who has the highest number wins.
Whoever wins then plays his card and the game continues.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Unser Sandmännchen und seine Freunde
description: In Unser Sandmännchen und seine Freunde, the little Sandman wants to distribute his sleep sand, but the beds of all of his friends are empty. To help the Sandman wish them a good night, players need to find those friends. If they can get the friends to their beds in time, they win the game together.

name: Redshirts: Convention Cards
description:
This is a mini-expansion.

Due to differences in print sheets, we had a bunch of extra blank cards during the last print run. And so we had some more cards created, and we are offering those to you first. These will normally only be available directly from us at conventions, and there are a very limited amount. This set doesn't have a name or a theme, but we do make fun of Warhammer 40k a lot.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Science Fiction

name: Can't Down the Bull
description:
You are one of fresh matadors dreaming the No.1 Bullfighter in Spain.
Today you are facing an anniversary debut fight.
However, this bull is the notorious one. He will not be absolutely downed by only one sword.
Can you down the bull by “Matador sword” and become a super bullfighter?

“What to do in this game?”
You get 4 cards at first. Using them, you will disturb other players, take their cards, finally play “Matador sword” to down the bull.
publishers: こたつパーティー (Kotatsu Party)

name: Bears!: Alarm Clock
description:
Promo card for the Bears! dice game.

This promo allows the player of the card to convert one of your paired sleepers into a runner.

It is being given away as part of ordering the Bears! promo pack and can also be acquired at conventions from Fireside games.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Goshuin Atsume
description:
User summary:
御朱印あつめ (Goshuin Atsume) means Goshuin Collection in English. This game was designed by a priest working in a Zen temple in Tokyo, Japan to promote the work of the temple and the experience for visitors.

Goshuin is originally a stamp given as a seal of submitting hand-written copied sutras to temples. Presently, Goshuin is a popular souvenir among people visiting temples.

In this game, the players visit temples and offer copied sutras to collect Goshuin. You may choose to form connection with many Bodhisattva deities or deepen the connection with certain deities. The player who manages to achieve the highest score through such connection wins the game!

Goshuin Collection is a bidding and hand management game for 3 to 4 players.
The box with words written in Indian ink contains components, such as Goshuin cards, Sutra chips, and Goshuin Notebook boards. 29 Goshuin cards and the Sutra chips are in a Buddhist monk’s own handwriting. The original Goshuin Notebook boards were made to order by Aribundou, a long-established bookbinder which has been in business since the Meiji period.

After drawing a Goshuin card from the draw pile, players offer their sutras. Once all the players have taken their turn, the player who has offered the longest sutra receives the Goshuin. Place the Goshuin you've received in lines next to your Goshuin Notebook board. You can also score substantially by collecting the Goshuin of certain deities!

But watch out for non-Goshuin cards which have slipped in! Well, let's just pray for the better...

Experience the fun of forming your original Goshuin notebook!

Publisher's summary:
テーマ：お寺、競り、役

御朱印とは、写経したお経を寺院に納めた証のこと。平成の世においては、参拝した記念の証として親しまれています。
プレイヤーはお寺の参拝者となり、写経を納め、御朱印をあつめていきます。たくさんの仏さまとご縁を結んでもよし、同じ仏さまとご縁を深めるもよし。仏さまとのご縁をいただき、もっとも得点を獲得したプレイヤーが勝利者となります！

『御朱印あつめ』は３人～４人で遊ぶことができる「競り」と「役」のカードゲーム。
墨字が目立つ箱の中には、御朱印カードと、お経チップ、御朱印帳ボードなどがおさまっています。
２９枚の御朱印カード、お経チップはお坊さん直筆。専用の御朱印帳ボードは、明治から続く製本屋「有文堂」様にお願いしました。

"
山札から御朱印カードを一枚めくり、プレイヤーはお経を出しあいます。一巡した時点でもっとも長いお経を納めたプレイヤーが御朱印を拝受。獲得した御朱印は、御朱印帳ボードの横に並べましょう。特定の仏さまがそろうと得点が大幅アップします！
でもちょっと待って！御朱印のなかにハズレがまぎれこんでいるかもしれません・・・合掌。

さあ、あなただけの御朱印帳を完成させましょう！
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Spill and Spell: Roll Call
description: Roll Call (Spill and Spell) is an ALL-PLAY letter dice game where you CALL IT AS YOU SEE IT! ROLL out the 22 letters and 7 category dice. Then, CALL out the first words you can make that fit the given category. For every Category you CALL out, you collect that die. Once all category dice are earned, its time to ROLL and CALL again! First player to earn 20 points is the winner!

name: Master of Spies
description: Master of Spies As a player, you take the role of a powerful spymaster in the world of Eldinmoor™, using your underlings to infiltrate the four Powerful Factions of the world. By moving them higher and higher in the courts, you can amass more secret information. But be careful, for other Spymasters are about, and they will try to thwart your every move! Master of Spies is a card game of luck, skill, and betrayal set in the World of Eldinmoor™. The game is for 3 to 6 players and takes about 30 to 45 minutes to play.

name: Travel Game
description:
Travel Game is a card game that's easy to learn and quick to play!

From 2 to 5 tenacious travelers try to organize more trips than their friends to win the game. The type of journey (as well as the means of transport used) changes both the conditions of the departures and the assignment of victory points. In addition, a variant included in the rules provides a small memory component that makes the game competitive even for the greatest players.

name: Pulp!
description:
Pulp!! is a skirmish miniature game set in the adventurous world of the old pulps. Players control groups of 3 to 12 figures, controlling Heroes, Villains, Sidekicks, Henchmen, and many supporting characters. A game lasts typically 1 to 2 hours, and can be linked to other sessions in a campaign.

Each turn the players roll to determine who has Initiative.

Next, the characters that are still locked in Melee from the previous turn get to fight a round of combat or attempt to withdraw from the fight.

Then the main part of the turn begins. Players alternate activating Units. Models in an activating Unit check their cohesion. Models may be In Touch with one another or Out Of Touch. Models roll to determine if they will receive a Full or Partial Activation – models In Touch having a better chance to activate fully.

Models in the active Unit resolve their Full and/or Partial Activation. They may walk, run, attack with ranged or melee weapons, get ready to fire, or take a defensive stance. Special Points can be spent to purchase special Benefits.

When a fight occurs, the attacking Model rolls a number of dice equal to the Impact value of their weapon. The number to meet or exceed to score a Hit is based on the character’s Ability. For each Hit inflicted, the target gets a Save roll based on their Protection value. Each unsaved Hit results in a Suppression or a Wound.
Suppressions impair the target; Wounds get the character closer to be removed from the game.

After all Models in a Unit have resolved their Active and/or Partial Activations, another Unit activates. Activations continue this way until all Units have acted. At that point tokens that do not apply anymore are removed from the play area, and a new turn is started.
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fighting, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Ninja All-Stars: Yokozuna
description:
Yokozuna is a mercenary ronin for Ninja All-Stars. Ronin bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. As mercenaries, ronin may be used by any player, on any team. This makes ronin invaluable assets for every team, regardless of clan, since they may be used to supplement a team’s weaknesses in battle or further augment their strengths.

Yokozuna takes great pleasure in his work at the employ of Shojo, a woman notorious for treating work like a party. Cheerful, kind, and incredibly strong, he has risen to a position of leadership amongst Shojo’s dock workers. The Moonlight Tournament, however, is a nice break from the tasks that typically occupy his days on the dock. Those jovial by nature, he is no fool. He is always on the lookout, ready to be in the right place at the right time to stop trouble in Kagejima.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Fully Assembled Model
Brawny Earth and Water Wielding Dock Worker Ronin
categories: Adventure, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Miniatures, Sports, Video Game Theme

name: Dis comme moi
description:
A game of words and association of ideas in which interactions create laughter, emotions and teasing.

Each player completes the words of his list secretly by the first word that comes to mind. Which players will have the same answer as you? In turn, you must try to put yourself in the skin of other players to guess what they may think. You score points every time you succeed. Be the first or even the only one to give the right answer and score even more points. Who will say like you?

name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Essentials Pack
description:
Description from the publisher:

Enter the battle for Terrinoth! The Runewars Essentials Pack gives you all the non-figure accessories you need to play the Runewars Miniatures Game. Tokens, terrain, templates, cards, and dice are all included in the pack to help field the various armies of Terrinoth. Use upgrade cards included in the pack to further customize your armies, before leading them to glorious victory!

name: Rapidofruit
description:
Rapidofruit - Jeux d'observation et de rapidité
Les animaux et les fruits et légumes défilent au fil des cartes. Si deux éléments identiques sont retournés en même temps, il faut vite taper sur la carte fruit et légume ! Mais interdiction de jouer lorsque votre animal porte des gants de boxe !

--

The animals and fruits and vegetables parade through the cards. If two identical items are returned at the same time,
You must quickly hit the fruit and vegetable card! But not to play when your pet wears boxing gloves!

name: テーブル花火 (Table Hanabi)
description:
User summary
Table Hanabi (テーブル花火) (Te-buru Hanabi) is a balancing game where players strive to expand seven colors like an exploding firework (Hanabi is the Japanese word for firework). Not overly strategical nor a game of deep dilemmas — however, the game does offer plenty of suspense and uncertainty, requiring finesse in order for a player to retain the proper balance.

Color, shape, and size have a high impact while players build up vibrant fireworks that skyrocket off the table.

Publisher's summary
花火のように、大きく七色に広がるバランスゲームです。
戦略性やジレンマなどのゲーム性はほとんどありませんが、グラグラ感や繊細さやハラハラ感などのバランス性はたっぷりあります。
色、形、大きさのインパクトが高く、積み上がっていくうちに華やかな花火が卓上に打ち上がります。

name: BeerIQ
description:
Beer IQ is a beer-themed trivia party game that features 400 multiple-choice questions covering beer history and lore, with answers adding or subtracting IQ points from your score. A two-round format favors learning; the first tests your knowledge, while the second tests your memory, giving novices a chance to challenge seasoned hop heads.

—description from the publisher

name: Fang den Wurm
description:
Fang den Wurm, which has also been released as Early Bird and Sjef Specht en Willie Worm, is a fast dexterity game. Willie the worm is hiding in a tree, and Sjef the woodpecker is trying to release him to grab a bite to eat.

The tree is divided in three colors. On your turn, you must spin the wheel or roll the die (depending on which edition of the game you have). The results: yellow, blue, green, choose a color, spin two additional times, or skip your turn.

You rotate the tree to match the correct color, aim, and release Sjef. He pricks holes until Willie is released and jumps out of the tree after which the game ends. Whoever makes the worm jump wins!
publishers: Identity Games International B.V., Liniex, Schmidt Spiele

name: Superfight: The Purple Deck 2
description:
Purple Deck 2 adds 100 new scenario cards to Superfight from "LITERALLY RAINING MEN" to "FIGHTERS HAVE CARTOONISHLY LARGE HEADS" and more! Use these cards before or after fighters have been drawn, or as tie breakers in close fights.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Party Game, Science Fiction

name: Divorce Simulator
description:
Ever wonder what it would be like to get a divorce? Live that fantasy with Divorce Simulator! Slam the deck down in front of your spouse (or anyone) and tell them you want a divorce, then play the game and see who comes out ahead.

In Divorce Simulator, you will take turns splitting possessions (or even relationships with other people) and laying out cards for your opponent to take on their next turn. Bluff by laying some cards face up and some face down, and tempt your opponent into taking the pile you want them to take.

Compete for a majority in 5 different categories like Reputation and Possessions in this game of deduction and dark humor. The player who wins 3 or more categories by grabbing the best set of possessions and deceiving their spouse/opponent into choosing poorly will win the game!

—description from the publisher

name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): The Empire
description:
Warhammer: The Empire is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect The Empire faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Catch the Martians!
description:
Catch the Martians! is a simple family game where you play as a space explorer and try to catch Martians. Your main goal is to trap two of them and get more points than your opponents. Every player draw a card with their mission and score to trap the Martians. The rules are very simple:
Move your character - move your explorer into a neighboring space. You may use one of your three cards in two ways to choose a path of your moving. After all players move their explorer - Move the Martians. They have a deck of Movement cards which explain their walking behavior. Monsters are afraid of people, so they will try escape when they collide. Gotta catch em’ all! And… that's it!
Winning the game - if you have a higher score than your opponents for the capture of the Martians.
AWARDS
Winner of the "Baby Expo Ukraine 2020" (best strategy game)
mechanics: Action Queue, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Rect
description:
Rect (Rekuto) is an abstract game.

A square grid or a cube grid is written on the game board. Each player has a pawn at an intersection of the grid at the beginning of the game.

During your turn, your move your pawn along the grid to an intersecton. Your pawn must turn exactly once, and you place two markers, the one at where your pawn turned, and the other at where your pawn landed on. No player's pawn may pass through or land on any marker.

Players take turns moving their pawn, and if a player's pawn cannot make a legal move, that player is eliminated. The last survivor wins the game.
user summary

手番では自分のコマを一度曲がるように動かします。曲がった場所と着いた場所にチップを置きます。既にチップの有るマスには入れません。先に動けなくなった方が負けとなります。
publisher's summary
publishers: 新ボードゲーム党 (New Board Game Party)

name: Tunnel Run
description:
This card based race game is an adaptation of Cartagena for play with the Green Box of Games game system.

Build a track of tiles with the six different symbols spaced out. Each player controls one or more cubes and is dealt one or more cards (the number of cubes and cards can be adjusted to your preferred level of complexity)

To move you play a card and then move one of your cubes forward until it reaches an available tile matching the symbol of the card you played. If the tile is occupied by another player you keep moving to the next match. The winner is the first to reach the end of the track with all their cubes.

—description from the designer

name: House Of Pounce
description:
House Of Pounce is a family-friendly set-collecting card game about cats competing to be the cutest, most athletic, toughest, and screwiest cat in the house. If you are the best and accomplish "cat goals", you may win House Of Pounce.

Gameplay involves playing a card onto the Pounce Pile and when you wish to collect the Pounce Pile, you play a Pounce Card. Upon collecting the Pounce Pile, you separate the cards by category and make sets, claiming Pounce Points as you do. The cards that you can't make sets from? They stay around until you Pounce again!

There are bonus points for collecting Cat Goal Cards and for unplayed Pounce Cards. The cat with the highest Pounce Points wins!

Although a single deck is made for two players, with some minor setup changes, two decks will allow up to 4 players!

name: Bumbling Bees
description:
A fine and sunny day, and the fields are in bloom! The bumblebees are hungry, if a bit short-sighted, and need your help to visit as many flowers as possible. With just a single sheet and a pen, can you guide them through the fields?

Bumbling Bees is a fold-and-write game for a single player, requiring nothing more than a printed sheet of paper, a pair of scissors, and a pen. The current time creates a unique setup condition so no two games are the same. Throughout the game, you will begin to fold your game sheet over on itself, concealing portions of the playing field and creating new opportunities. For fans of roll-and-write games, this offers a similar one-page puzzle experience without the dice.
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Word Chain
description:
Word Chain is a party game in which players have to say a word that links to the previously said word, according to the rules shown on the cards they draw.

The game was originally an entry in the 2019 9 Card Game Print and Play Design Contest where it was voted best 3+ player game.

The Extended Edition of the game consists of 27 cards and does away for the need of any tokens to track scores. It features additional fun categories and includes variants for multiplayer and a solo variant that can be played in hand.

The Print and Play file includes optional card backs and a tuck box and is available from both PnP Arcade and Randomskill Games.
Professionally printed copies are available from The Game Crafter.

—description from the designer
categories: Party Game, Print & Play, Real-time, Word Game

name: Rivet Wars: Battle of Brighton Kickstarter Roundup
description:
The Kickstarter Roundup contains additional aerial forces for the Battle of Brighton expansion.

The set consists of two planes with standees for each Blight and Allies, as well as a new weapon plug per faction.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Hit Manga
description:
An easy and fun party card game “Hit Manga” based on the traditional Japanese game “Karuta”! Think of a line that fits perfectly into a blank balloon and read it out on the spot, let others guess which card it is!
Each turn, the active player draws a card that matches the grid. They think of a line that fits, and everyone else tries to guess which card in the grid they're thinking of.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Party Game, Word Game

name: Bezzerwizzer Bricks: Filmpärlor
description:
Can't you pass a mirror without saying "You talkin' to me?". Do you remember how the Joker got his scar and do you know what a Quarter Pounder with cheese is called in France? Then this is the game for you.

This game contains 60 questions, in addition to a category tile, that can be used as a standalone game, or to expand your Bezzerwizzer game with this new category.

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Ellen's Games: Danger Word
description:
The Danger Word game is a wildly funny and unpredictable guessing game based on the Danger Word challenges seen on the Ellen DeGeneres Show and Game of Games. Players choose a card and give teammates one-word clues hoping that they'll guess the Winning Word on the card…not the Danger Word. Who can get teammates to say "pool" but not "swim", or "infant" but not "baby"? Saying the Danger Word gets that player stamped with an X. Teams win by collecting 5 cards or if the other team gets 3 stamps.

—description from the publisher
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: If You Were...
description: Hilarious game in which we can get to know each other better. In the game you only need to reveal your worldview by correctly choosing who or what our players would be in the alternative world. Each player receives five response cards (with numbers from 1 to 5) and 3 tokens to bet on the certainty of our response. All game participants wonder which version of the answer best suits the rival being asked. The answer that appears most often is correct - those who gave it are moving towards the finish line. The sequence of events is repeated in each round. The first to reach the finish line wins.

name: Zombienation 2060
description:
The era of zombies has begun, and they need you to fight all the opponents and manage to be the winner, assemble 4 teams and the best man wins, you will have hours of fun, entertainment and strategy. What are you waiting to take it?.

Zombienation 2060 is a strategic board game that takes place in a world destroyed by a rare zombie virus. Your objective is to take your clan to conquer the world and the last remaining humans.

You take control over one of the four faction of zombies. During your turn, you move your zombies through the map to explore territories to find items or human survivors to add to your army. If you enter a territory already occupied by zombies from a different faction, you have to fight those to gain control over the territory.
The game is played over several rounds until one of the faction kills the leader of one another faction or kills at least 6 special zombies. With 3-4 players, the game can also end by reaching the explosion level of the round track, where the faction with the most territories under control wins.

It's also possible to improve your gaming experience with a free app that provides some level of augmented reality and different missions for every player.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers, Zone of Control

name: Flatter Me
description:
Flatter Me is a compliment battle card game for two players that makes giving and receiving compliments a little easier — by turning compliments into a competition! This quick-to-learn, family-friendly battle of kind words takes 15 to 30 minutes to play.

As in the classic card game War, each round, both players simultaneously reveal the top card from their stack. If your revealed card best suits your opponent's personality, they take both cards; if their card best suits your personality, you get both! In the event of a tie where both cards fit both players or neither card is a good fit, draw three more cards and reveal the fourth. Winner takes all. Repeat until the tie is broken!

Once both stacks are gone, whoever received the most compliment cards wins.
mechanics: Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling

name: Arkenshield: The Gates of Thy'an
description:
The royal city of Thaera´Ijun is the starting point of your expedition all the way across the continent. From here, you’ll set out to face thrilling adventures and perilous challenges. You’ll pass by endless grassy plains, advance into the depths of impenetrable forests, traverse the Obsidian Islands of the Westbound Reach, enter the legendary City of Outer Sands, leave the hostile Great Salt Desert behind you, walk the mysterious Nowhere Trail, find a way through Stonewalled Lives and finally – after slipping past the great Ice Wall and its dangerous narrow places – arrive, emaciated and exhausted, at the foot of the mighty fortress in the ice. And here, your greatest test awaits you.

Gather Companions around you, overcome epic tests and vanquish the mighty walls of the Citadel. Always remember: In the contest to conquer it, you’re competing with other fellowships. It isn’t the first player to get hold of the Crown of the Princes of the Northern Lands who’ll definitely be able to claim the glory of victory, but the one who, using a well-thought-out strategy, captures treasures (Victory Points) and valuable objects (cards) at the right points in the game.

Arkenshield is a turn-based, – deck building – boardgame for 1 to 4 players. It combines components of a boardgame with those of a card game. Thanks to the large number of Companions, movement tokens, cards, and events, it’s never boring, as it offers new and different possibilities – especially in interaction with other players. The use of dice is explicitly avoided. Instead, it is more important to succeed with your strategic abilities.

—description from the publisher

name: UNO: Toy Story
description: Play UNO to infinity and beyond with Woody, Buzz, and the toys from Andy's room. Become the master of the aliens with the special Claw card and rule! And be sure to yell "UNO!" when you're about to reach for the sky and win!
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That

name: Family Charades
description:
Family Fun!
No more time spent thinking up good charades - the fun starts as soon as the box is opened. With both easy and challenging charades, and with charades for different tastes and interests, Family Charades is THE perfect game for your next family game night.

name: Goblin Horde
description:
Goblin Horde board game puts you in charge of a ramshackle horde of Goblins!

The goal as chieftain will be to collect as many treasures as possible. To do this, you will use your subordinates of questionable intelligence.

Choose your team of Goblins, each with their own characteristics and abilities, catch the adventure and get ready for various dexterity challenges!

Who will be the most precise or creative will take home the coveted treasure! But be careful! The Goblins are very quarrelsome and the fight is always around the corner.

—description from the publisher

name: Russia's Great War: 1914
description:
A seven-turn game based on Russia’s invasion of East Prussia from August 17–18 through August 29–30. The Russian player wins by eliminating three German corps or by having three corps in the western end of the Western box (i.e., west of the Vistula River) and at least one corps in the other four boxes of the area-movement map. The German player’s victory requires eliminating three Russian corps and preventing any Russian units from being in the western half of the Western box.

The five movement boxes are overlaid on a map of East Prussia and a portion of the Russian Empire. Each is divided into two parts, distinguished by brown in one half and yellow in the other. Opposing units may occupy the same box without being in the same area, in which case combat is not mandatory unless the German side plays the German Reckless Advance marker. When battle occurs in the Broken Terrain of the two southern boxes each side rolls a die to limit the number of enemy corps that can participate and might further mess with an opponent by playing a Confusion marker. Other Combat and Random

Event markers include Air Recon, Cautious Advance/Pursuit, Cavalry Raid, etc. Restrictions and opportunities also arise based on individual game turns and what happened historically on the days those turns represent. A sidebar describes the historical events. (The game won an award in the Educational Board Game category at the 2019 Serious Play Conference.)

Designed to be a solitaire game published in a magazine, the stand-alone version comes with two-player rules as well. Players have to supply their own six-sided dice.

—user summary
categories: Abstract Strategy, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: PURI! PURI! 漏ルカー (Poo Poo Leaker)
description:
This is a freebie game from Toryo Hojo designed as a "クソゲーRTA" (kusoge real time attack), which is a speed run to make a shitty game.

Players race to the finish line by rolling dice and choosing a result to use for movement, placing poop markers in the space they have left. If a poop marker is in the destination space, the player is eliminated. If another player's piece in the space, the active player rolls for movement again.

The game ends when either a single player remains on the board, or if a player crosses the finish line.

This was distributed as part of the Spring 2021 Market Crash pack and players must provide their own playing pieces.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Risk: Deep Space
description:
CONQUER THE UNIVERSE: Why conquer the globe when you can conquer the universe instead? The Risk Deep Space strategy game is an exciting fast-paced, spaced-based twist on the classic Risk board game.

Risk: Deep Space has 9 planets where players try to be the first to control 4 planets. Players battle for planets and attack intergalactic adversaries with a roll of the dice. Players need recruits and resources as they strive to build bases on as many planets as possible. Each time a player lands on a planet, they must immediately have a dice battle until only one player is left.

Includes gameboard, 128 plastic recruits, 20 plastic bases, 36 action cards, 2 dice, 30 gem tokens, 30 ore tokens, 2 planet covers, and instruction booklet.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Neon
description:
Neon is a 2-player game about speed and memory. Can you put the cards of the same number together to gain the bonus under time pressure?

Shuffle and split the deck of 54 cards between the players. Each player lays down a 3x3 grid with the center card faceup. Both players act simultaneously to reveal one card from their deck at a time and use it to replace any one card in their grid. Keep replacing cards (and of course memorizing their numbers) until their deck runs out.

Victory points are rewarded in 3 ways:

Be the first to run out of their deck.
Have a lower sum of their 9 cards in the grid.*
Win more "battles" against the opponent in the 3 columns.


The fun part of Neon is, if you can place cards of the same number next to each other (the more the merrier), you will gain a bonus that reduces your sum!
Play multiple rounds until someone earns 5 VP and wins!

name: Oh, The Horror!
description:
"A Horribly Hilarious Horror Card Game!"

Every player is dealt 7 cards face down from the Method of Death deck. The oldest person in the room (i.e. the one closest to death) will assume the role of "Death Dealer."

At the top of each round, the Death Dealer will turn over one Killer and one Victim card from the top of the deck. The remaining players will all play one of their methods in an attempt to create the funniest or most gruesome (usually both) combination. This is decided on by the Death Dealer. Once the Death Dealer decides the winner of that round, the victim is given to the victor and it is added to that player's "body count." How many bodies is enough? Whatever it takes to make the players feel satisfied in their blood-lust.

Players will need to overcome several unique challenges in gameplay such as Plot Twists (cards that alter gameplay mechanics for Players and Death Dealers alike), Guardian Angels (cards that steal rounds from other Players), and Death Itself (cards that randomize gameplay in unexpected ways.)

Once the round is concluded, the person counter-clockwise to the first Death Dealer becomes the new Death Dealer and play resumes.
categories: Horror, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Player Judge, Score-and-Reset Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Storytelling

name: Grabbit
description:
A game that is essentially the "15 puzzle" combined with a memory game and cute bunnies trying to get vegetables.

On your turn, your rabbit jumps to a space where you hope to find a vegetable you don't already have.
The first to have all four different vegetables, wins.

name: Jumping Jacks
description:
Jumping Jacks is a trick-taking game for 4 or 5 players in which the Jacks are all-important. The object is to have the most points after eight hands.

Jumping Jacks is played with a stripped deck of 20 cards, 10-A in four suits. Play is standard trick-taking must-follow with no trump suit.

Only the Jacks are worth points and must be avoided or sought after depending on the phase of the game. The game has two phases. The Jacks are worth negative points in the first four hands. They are worth positive points in the last four hands.

The winner is the player with the most points after 8 hands.

name: 4-in-1 Dice Games
description:
4 dice games in 1 box.
- Play & Repeat
The aim of the game is to earn as much possible money. Money can be earned in 3 different ways: crossing out rows, crossing out colours and crossing out bonus coins.

- Quick & Tactic
You have 3 options during your turn after Rolling the dice: cross out 2 white dice, cross out a combination of 1 white die and 1 coloured dice or pass. The game ends of one player has closed 2 coloured columns.

- Bingo Dice Game
Roll all dice and select 2 of them to cross out on your scoresheet. This game is a little bit like Clever.

- Rainbow Dice Game
Game is like Yatzy, but with coloured dice. The numbers on all dice need to be noted by the right colour.

name: Dated
description:
Dated is a trivia game for people who suck at trivia. The rules are simple. Each round, one player picks a category and reads the title out loud. All other players take turns guessing the year it was released. The closest guess wins the card! The first player to ten cards wins the game.

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Ozeango
description:
Ozeango is a two-player only game inspired by chess. Two players use their six sea creatures in a 4x4 grid to try to capture the other player's animals and checkmate their Octopus. Once a player has captured an opponents animal, they can use it in their team. Each animal has a different way it can move around the grid.

The game comes with two bonus animals - the Dolphin and the Pufferfish - to add some variety to the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid

name: ビルドトリック (Build Trick)
description:
Build Trick is a combination of a trick-taking game and a deck building game. A game is played based on the size of the number, and the winner gets points for the number they put out, and the loser gets the money for the number they put out and gets the purchase right. The first to score 50 points wins!

Each player has an initial hand of 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5. Players can buy cards of value 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, and 25.

The game comes with 54 cards, 1 market sheet (A4). A bunch of score tokens (around 142 pieces) and money tokens (67 pieces) and a leader marker.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Trick-taking

name: Junk Jumble
description: You have delayed cleaning your room for a while... there is junk in all your drawers! Luckily with your eagle eyes you will spot whatever is needed in no time! Flip checklist cards to find out which objects you need to find to complete your task. Take turns with your friends peeking into the drawers of your choice, and call it out when you think you know where each item is. Win pin tokens when everything you need is found in the jumble!

name: I Feel Attacked
description:
I Feel Attacked is a party game about the people you love to hate, and would hate to be!

Each round, the Judge will play a card, and it’s up to each player to pick the card in their hand that best matches the Judge’s card. The winner of the round will be the one whose card is judged to be just the right type of terrible!

Want to add some arguing to the game? Give each player an I Feel Attacked card at the start of the game. After the Judge makes their choice, but before the point is awarded, if you are offended by the choice for whatever reason, you can play your I Feel Attacked card to give an impassioned speech about why the Judge’s choice is bad, wrong, unfunny, or gross, then find an alternate choice on the table that you think is better. All players vote between the Judge’s choice and the alternate. If you win or tie, you get the point instead, regardless of who originally put the winning card down. Each player may play their IFA card once during the game.

Play for as long as you like. Whoever has scored the most cards at the end of the game wins!

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Psychic Links II
description:
Stand-alone (combinable) sequel for Psychic Links.


It's nice to play a round of golf on a brand new course. But if it's a new course on every stroke, you know the psychics must be hitting the link again.

Players first take turns to draw cards and place them building the course (until the hole card is placed). Each player starts with his token (ball) on a solid green square of the starting card.

Players will then take turns making shots (shown on the top of each card). To make a shot, choose any of the four face up options and move the ball as shown in the diagram. You may not choose the same option twice in a row. Sand and slope squares affect your shot. If the shoot includes an action, for example modifying the course, perform it as stated.

The first player to end a shot with the ball exactly in the hole wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Trivial Pursuit: Marvel Studios The Infinity Saga – Ultimate Edition
description:
MCU superfans, assemble! Take on opponents with your vast knowledge of the Marvel Cinematic Universe in this trivia game for the best and biggest Marvel movie fans. Test your mastery of the multiverse with 1800 questions spanning films from Phase 1-3. Have the upper hand and seize all six coveted category wedges (Power, Reality, Space, Soul, Mind, and Time) to win! Includes full game board and custom Marvel-related movers such as the Tesseract, Loki’s Scepter, Aether Casket, Orb, Vormir’s Gate, and Eye of Agamotto.

Conquer the Marvel Cinematic Universe with Knowledge: Join forces with fellow MCU enthusiasts in this trivia showdown! Show off your expertise as you answer 1,800 questions spanning MCU Phases 1-3 films, aiming to secure all six infinity category wedges like Power and Space to claim victory.

Marvel-Themed Strategy: Dive into the immersive world of the Marvel Cinematic Universe with custom movers like the Tesseract and Loki's Scepter. Test your knowledge, outwit opponents, and master the multiverse as you journey through the full game board.

For True Marvel Devotees: Calling all devoted fans! Engage in epic battles of wit and wisdom, proving your status as the ultimate Marvel movie aficionado. With iconic category wedges and exclusive Marvel-themed movers, this game is your ticket to becoming the ultimate MCU guru.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia
mechanics: Questions and Answers, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tempo
description:
Tempo was Wolfgang Kramer's first published game. In it, each player is given a hand of cards that will affect the movement of six colored pawns. Based on this hand, players place bets regarding the outcome of the race. Players then proceed to play their race cards to try and ensure their bets were correct.

Tempo is the abstract predecessor of Wolfgang Kramer's Auto-Racing card system. Later games in this family include: Top Race, Detroit-Cleveland Grand Prix, Daytona 500 and Downforce.

name: Frayser's Farm: Wasted Opportunity
description:
From the Decision Games' website:

The Blue & Gray classics are being updated with a slight change in scale to 352 yards per hex, an updated game system that treats unit differences more accurately, and a combat system that includes step losses.

In June 1862, as Federal troops attempted to retreat after withdrawing from Gaine's Mill, Virginia, Gen. Robert E. Lee saw an opportunity to annihilate them on the congested roads between White Oak Swamp and the small community of Glendale. Lee's army included most of the notable Confederate luminaries, such as "Stonewall" Jackson, "Old Pete" Longstreet, A. P. Hill and others, collectively fielding 45,000 men. The Federals, numbering about 40,000, had become disjointed as they attempted to reach and cross the James River. At the same time, though, the Confederate approach became uncoordinated and irregular. The mass of the battle eventually pivoted north of Nelson's Farm, known to the locals by its former owner's name, Frayser.

Frayser's Farm utilizes the all-new Musket & Saber Combat System, which provides a simple yet accurate portrayal of warfare during the American Civil War. The combat system is intuitive, including all of the details that characterized battle during the Civil War while also simulating the unique aspects of 19th century warfare. Units can become weakened and rout; attackers can pursue, and the fortunes of war can intervene at any time. Cavalry can rip open enemy lines and shred fleeing units, and reserves must be ready to plug holes or secure the line of retreat.

In Frayser's Farm a new Combat Results Table emphasizes playability while also simulating the lethality of the rifled musket. Leaders accelerate the action, replicating the importance of their presence during battle, and supply lines require players to protect their logistical trains. Winning a battle will depend on deployment, maneuver and massing firepower, as well as the strengths and weaknesses of each particular army.
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Wargame

name: Cubicado
description:
The cubes are shaken out arbitrarily onto the board, making a pyramid. Any cubes that may be lying on their own on the edge of the board should be placed on the pyramid as well. The wobblier and higher the pyramid, the better. The start player takes the two sticks and we're off!

The aim is to try and get as many cubes off the pile as possible using the sticks (either one or both of them may be used). But be careful! None of the other cubes must move or your turn is over and the next player can try his luck. And one thing's for sure--all of your opponents are going to be watching you with eyes like saucers. Whoever has the most points at the end of the game wins.

name: Charly: Picky Pig
description:
Rule Blurb:

Game Setup:

Shuffle the animal cards including the 6 animal cards "Picky Pig"

Game Play

II. Part - Feast
The "Picky Pig" may only be added to food cards showing 1 of its 2 favorite foods (comment: compared to "regular pigs" which will consume all 4 types of food).

End of the round and feeding animals in hand

For each pig, players must add two honey drops to the feeding dish. Since each "Picky Pig" card has 1 pig on it(comment: "regular pig cards" have to pigs depicted), this means that players will always have to add 2 honey drops for each of these cards.

name: Tunnel Rats: The Escape From TERROR CAVE
description:
Players play one of four humanoid "Tunnel Rats", each represented by a painted plastic miniature. The rats are trying to find their way out of an ancient underground city through the use of an electronic compass. The pyramid shaped compass contains 16 different maps for the maze board and shows players if they hit an "invisible wall" (counters are included to represent the walls). The first player to navigate their way out of the maze wins.

Includes "special" Tunnel Rats Adventure comic book to assist with the theme of the game.

Similar to "Lost Treasure", "Dark Tower" or "Electronic Dungeons and Dragons"

From Box:
"Trapped by a landslide in an ancient underground city, the Tunnel Rats must find their way to the secret passage that will take them back to the surface before their supplies are exhausted. Although there are 16 different routes to the hidden tunnel, they are enclosed by invisible walls that can only be detected by the Tunnel Rats' ELECTRONIC compass.

Determined to be the first to reach the surface, each of the Tunnel Rats takes a starting position on the map of the ruined city. Then the ELECTRONIC compass is turned on and selects one of the secret routes. The first to escape through the secret passage is the winner!"

Gameboard is 15x15 grid.
categories: Adventure, Animals, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Electronic, Exploration, Maze, Miniatures

name: Gliders from the Sky: The Fall of Eben Emael
description:
This is a game on the fall of the Belgian fortress of Eben Emael, May 10-11 1940, by a daring and unheard of, at time, glider attack made by less than 100 German paratroopers. It's a fast and furious solitaire game (you take the German side and try to make the best of it), that should be playable in less than an hour, once you master the game.

To try to make the victory harder to get, several variants and optional rules are provided, based on the historical situation and on several what if situations that could have happened on those fateful hours that cleared the way for the German initial smashing victory in the West.

Contains:
8 Page Rules
A4 Map (7.5"x10.8")
187 Counters.

This Print-n-Play download is available at wargamedownloads.com and as a laser-printed DTP from Boulder Games.
http://www.wargamedownloads.com/item.php?item=610
publishers: High Flying Dice Games, TCS Games

name: Cuban Revolution
description:
The Cuban Revolution depicts the critical area and time in the Guerrilla war fought between the colonial government of Fulgencio Batista and the Guerrillas led by charismatic individuals like Fidel Castro and Ernesto “Che” Guevara. Beginning in February, 1958 Castro began the first Guerrilla offensive by coming out of the Sierra Maesta Mountains and attacking the Bastiano troops in the plains. The Bastiano army counterattacked driving the Guerrillas back into the mountains beginning in June 1958. When the Bastiano army attempted to destroy the guerrillas, the Bastiano army was all but destroyed itself. With all the newly acquired weapons, the guerrillas launched a final offensive that ended in the only major battle of the war at the town of Santa Clara. The defeat of the Bastiano western forces caused the rest of the army to begin deserting. When Batista fled in January 1959, the guerrillas triumphantly declared the island was finally free. The improbable victory of the Guerrillas resulted in the only communist country in the Western Hemisphere.

The Cuban Revolution uses area movement and a simple and easy-to-learn combat system. Learning the game takes minutes and about 1-2 hours of playing time at most.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Pay Cards!
description:
Based on the obscure 1968-69 game show, an MC is chosen and shuffles a deck of twenty cards. The cards are inserted face-down into a numbered vinyl sheet. Players choose three numbers from the vinyl sheet and the cards are revealed. If a pair shows, the player must take all three cards. If not, the player may refuse the cards and they are turned face down and placed back onto the numbered sheet. After all cards are drawn, the hands are evaluated and the players given cash for pairs, three of a kind, four of a kind, and for highest hand in the round. The player with the most money after three rounds plays the Jackpot Game and can earn additional money. The player with the most money after the Jackpot Game wins.

Three versions were apparently released: the original ("Version I") has no Wild Cards and a red Jackpot spinner; the box has black copyright lettering, and the adult male wears a brown shirt. Some early copies of the release with Wild Cards ("Version II") feature the same red Jackpot spinner and box design as Version I, but include the updated rules for using the Wild Card decks. Later Wild Card editions ("Version III") have the updated rules and a black Jackpot spinner, plus the box has pink copyright lettering and the adult male wears a red shirt.

The game was given away as a consolation prize on the show. On the one circulating episode, late in the show's run (#209 of 260, taped 4/22/69), host Art James holds up the box with the brown-shirt male. This strongly suggests that Versions II and III each had a short print run.

name: Foreign Legion
description:
Players are Foreign Legion agents, each with a mission to locate and secretly observe the clandestine preparations for war of rebels in the fictional sheikdom of As Q’Ara.

There are two maps of the place, each made up of four cards with “grid references” for the locations of the various activities of the rebels. In game terms the object is to collect and display a number,of ‘Mission’ cards. The deck comprises twenty-six of these with points values ranging from fifty to five-hundred. There are also eight ‘Unsuccessful Search’ cards to be played in accordance with the location rules for mission cards. These score no points, but count towards the target number of cards. There are also two ‘Spy’ cards in the deck. These are also played in accordance with the location rules, do not count towards the target total of cards, but double the value of all mission cards already exposed by a player. As soon as one player has laid the required number of mission cards, the player with the highest points total on their displayed cards is the winner. The rules suggest playing a number of games to an agreed target score.
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Square Grid

name: Girl Talk Date Line
description:
Be the first player to match all your Teen cards with dates, then find a date for yourself. The first player to get rid of all their Teencards by making dates wins the game.

Includes talking speaker unit, 30 minute cassette date tape filled with teen conversations, gameboard, 26 plastic teen cards, card holder, 4 game tokens, die, and instructions
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: PanzerForce
description:
PanzerForce is a realistic game that shows the problems faced by tank commanders in World War II. But it is much more than just a game. The two different tanks that will collide in battle will respond and perform as they actually did. You, the tank commander, will make the decisions that lead to victory or defeat. This is tank combat, the way it really was, a game of deadly adventure."

A game of tactical tank-to-tank combat where two Tigers face off against four Shermans. The game uses 6 HO scale plastic tanks.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, I Cut, You Choose, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Simulation, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: La Regia Marina
description:
"La Regia Marina" is a Strategic level wargame of naval combat in the Mediterranean Sea during World War II. The units represent individual capital ships, squadrons of smaller ships, air groups, and amphibious and paratroop forces.

Players have two main objectives: Destroy the opponent's naval forces and deliver supplies to their troops fighting in North Africa. A turn consists of assigning shipping routes to convoys, moving combat forces to intercept detected enemy formations, and adjusting supply levels for successfully delivering supplies.

La Regia Marina can be linked with D.A.K. also published by Simulations Canada.
When played this way, the supplies delivered in La Regia Marina are the supplies one's ground units have to fight with in D.A.K.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Way of the Warrior
description:
A chart based solitaire game.

"The Way of the Warrior (WotW) is a solo system to simulate small tactical war operations. Is not aimed at a specific period: the base version of the rules is set on WWII but is quite easy to introduce new periods/themes."

"Campaign Setup. Select one of the available nationalities for your units if this is the first mission: German, US, Russian, Italian and Finland are available for the WWII. Select one theater of the operations in the [Theater of Operations] Table where your nationality is present and use the other nationality specified in the in the table for the enemy forces."

"The basic flow of the game is the following:
- Mission briefing: determine the objectives of the mission
- Equipment: choose your team
- Mission:
- Event determination
- Encounter phase
- Advance to next zone
- Post-mission debriefing: experience gain"

This game was part of the Microgame Design Contest 2002. Updated rules can be found at the designer's site.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Ukraina 1941
description:
Ukraine 1941 shows the very first days of Fall Barbarossa - a German attack on Soviet Union.
Even though the Red army seemed very powerful its front line was almost annihilated during the first days of the campaign. But Stalin did also had tremendous reserves heading on the front...

This is the second game of K-2 system presenting southern front of German assault through steppes of Ukraine towards Kiev. Soviets seem to be hampered at first but as games progresses the problems for Germans arise.

Game allows to play first month of Fall Barbarossa in Southern part of Soviet Union. Map covers Eastern Poland, middle and Western Ukrainian territory and provide German, Romanian, Hungarian, Slovakian and Soviet forces that were involved in the region. Both Players must control as much strategic cities as they can at the end of the game.

There are 2 scenarios in the game: German initial assault on June 22nd and full battle which started when Romanian forces joined on July 1st.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: Pretpark Tycoon
description:
From the back of the box (translated):
"Build the most powerful themepark that you've ever seen. In Pretpark Tycoon you stand at the helm of your own amusement park. Build 3D attractions and attract many visitors. Groups of people walk through your park. If they visit your attraction, you earn fun chips. The player who earns most fun chips, wins the game. Pretpark Tycoon. The ride of your life!"

Pretpark Tycoon is a Monopoly-like/Hotels-like simplified children's game. Players buy and expand attractions with in-game money. Money is earned via Chance-cards or by exchanging fun chips for money. Fun chips are collected when visitors stop at your attraction. The first player to collect a certain number of fun chips, wins.

Players have no personal token on the gameboard. Four visitor group tokens move in one direction in the park. After your 'dice roll' (with a spinner) you decide which of the visitor groups you will move to reach your goal:


to a spot where you can buy or expand an attractions,
to a spot with an attraction you own to earn fun chips,
to a spot where you get a Chance-card,
or simply to a spot to pass the attraction of the other players so they won't collect fun chips.


From the back of the box (in Dutch):
Bouw het machtigste pretpark dat je ooit hebt gezien. In Pretpark Tycoon sta je aan het roer van je eigen pretpark. Bouw 3D attracties en trek zoveel mogelijk bezoekers. Groepjes mensen lopen door je pretpark. Bezoeken ze jouw attractie, dan verdien je pretfiches. De Tycoon met de mooiste attracties die de meeste bezoekers trekt, wint het spel. Pretpark Tycoon. De rit van je leven!

name: Ballot Bots
description: You are a politician, and your position in the race depends on your ability to fund raise, advertise, debate and speak to your contingency at the right time and place. Advance your campaign, solidify your position, put yourself in the spotlight as you strategically maneuver around your opponents!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Phase Order

name: Surprise Attack!
description:
From the rulebook:

In Surprise Attack!, each player is the commander of a military force—one has his army encamped in the middle of the battlefield at the time when the other hurls his forces into action from the surrounding forest, launching the surprise attack. The defender suffers early losses, then regroups and attempts to move two of his valuable Command Units to the safety of the forest. The attacker tries to capture two of the defender's three Command Units before they make good their escape.

name: Grand Prix Championship
description:
...all the drama of F1 racing, pit stops, punctures, engine blow-ups restarts etc… (From the back of the box)

Each player gets 2 cars, and they're pretty good: 5.5x3 cm, wheels that turn, not all cloned from one mold. It's a move-by-dice game with the die modified by cards you must pick up whenever you overtake an opponent on a bend. Mods include extra/lost spaces/turns, enforced/canceled pit stops, retirement, or (many) no changes. Some of those mods are whole positions rather than spaces - it must start getting a bit random and skill-less. The lap is 39 spaces long and the track is only 1 space wide with only 2 cars allowed per space so there's going to be lots of blocking: however it is obviously a 'ladder' game and not one where skill predominates over other factors to any great extent. One of the cards takes out the car you're overtaking as well as yours! A couple force a race restart.... You can forgo part of your move by declining to overtake in some situations, to avoid picking up a card. A few spaces on the straights have optional card pickup as well.
Shame there's not a big skill factor, because those cars are really nice.
(From a Micro-Review by David Budd)
http://people.man.ac.uk/~zlsiida/text_files/mrbg-rev.html#cp...

name: Royale Mastermind
description: Royale Mastermind is a variant of Mastermind where two players solve 8 patterns, alternating between being the knower and the guesser. Shapes and colors are guessed independently on each side of the board. The total number of guesses each player requires to solve the color/shape pattern is tallied, the winner being the one to take the fewest guesses. The patterns consist of three elements, each having one of five shapes and one of five colors. A deck of 25 cards is used to establish the pattern, and after each card is used in a puzzle, it is not used again. The corresponding shape/color is also covered on a grid in the center of the board so the players can use this information in future rounds.

name: SideLinks
description:
SideLinks is a word association game all about conceptually connecting words found on adjacent cards. It can be described simply as a cross between Scrabble and Dominoes but with words.

The game contains 140 cards with 560 English words. Each card has four family-friendly words (one per edge) and a point value between 1 and 5. 1-point cards have words with the most connections (some with over 30), while 5-point cards have words with fewer connections. But don't worry, as well over 12,000 connections are known to be available!

There are a half a dozen ways to play the game.

Players compete to get the highest score by connecting related words. For example, TEACHER can be connected with STUDENT, SCHOOL, RESPECT, LEARNING, JOB as well as a dozen other words.

Hilarious dialog begins when someone attempts a dubious connection and has to “sell” it to the group. This makes it a game about connecting people.

Other ways to play include Match, Memory, Grid, Airplane Mode, Secret Connections and Team Secrets.

This family and party game is for use at home and school as well as corporate office team building.

SideLinks is the next version of the Connections card game, renamed for worldwide distribution as we only had the Canadian trademark for "Connections". It's a new standalone game with more cards, larger cards, some new rules.

—description from the publisher

name: The Wall: Fatal Error
description:
Three boxes for three stories await you: work in a team and ask the right questions... the answers may surprise you.

'The Wall - Fatal Error' is part of a trilogy: three investigating games that will keep you nailed to the table with bated breath!

Try to shed light on a mysterious event, collecting valuable clues between places to explore carefully, objects to analyze, and pressing interrogations. At the end of the investigation, you will be asked some questions that will measure how able you have been in solving the mystery, getting points for each correct answer. Each investigation is divided into several chapters that will allow you to continue the investigation. The detective's work seems to never end, and one case leads to another: if you feel able to answer the final questions, turn the card!

In The Wall - Fatal Error, a young computer programmer is found dead in her own home. On the crime scene there are few clues and the suspects are hiding something. You and your department will have to analyze each and every detail, evidence and testimony to discover the truth. But will it be what you are expecting?

-description from publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: Mastermind44
description:
From the box:

Each player takes a black (number) and a white (colour) code counter and secretly places them with the colour and number facing him. The first player then places a row of code pegs in row no. 1. The other 3 players must give information about their own hidden code by placing either a black or white key peg in a key hole beside the first players code.

The winner is the first player to break the code.

Re-implements:

Mastermind
publishers: Capiépa Éditeur: Jeux Éducatifs, Clipper, Invicta Games, Parker Brothers

name: Yukon
description:
The Yukon, the biggest river on the North American continent, became famous in the period from 1896 to 1903, when in hope of making a quick fortune prospectors stampeded it. This period is known as the Klondike gold rush, and an estimated 100,000 people were prospecting gold during that time. The gold rush was over almost as quickly as it came, but the people that live there believe that the river still contains plenty of the shiny ore.

In Yukon, you want to be the smartest prospector and collect the most of that valuable gold. But be aware, others also vie for that ore you laid eyes on, the quickest and most vigilant fortune hunter will win.

The playing area consists of a 7x7 card grid. The starting player may decide to take a card from the row or the column that the gold digger is standing in. This card is placed in front of the player, and the gold digger is moved to the spot the card occupied previously. This ends the player's turn. The next players may always take a card moving in a perpendicular direction from the previous movement. The gold digger always moves to the newly freed spot.

The game contains the townsfolk expansion that includes 30 extra cards (10 characters, 3 of each) and 9 gold nugget tokens.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Open Drafting

name: Rolling Stone
description:
Rolling Stone is a rock & roll music game for anyone who has ever heard a song. You don't have to be a music buff to win this game; you just need to know the names of some very famous bands and have heard a famous song or two.

To start, a player from each team competes in the Music Buzzer Battle. The winner of this round takes an advantage into Round 2: Triple Charades Jeopardy. Here, players try to get their team to guess the artist by describing them in one of three ways: quoting lyrics, humming or using one word. The first team to collect a disc from all eight genres wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Keren: East Africa 1941
description:
(from the publisher' website:)

Keren simulates the Battle of Keren, one of the pivotal engagements in East Africa during the Second World War. The Italian units, particularly the Savoia Grenadiers, fought so well the Commonwealth forces had to conduct three assaults to break their position. Indeed, the Savoia Grenadiers were never dislodged from their hilltop position, and were only compelled to surrender after being surrounded an after the other Italian positions had fallen. In spite of their ultimate defeat, it’s regarded as one of the Italian Army’s most impressive showings during the entire war.

Keren includes one counter sheet (228 counters) and one map of the Keren area of Eritrea (each hex represents about 220 yards), portraying the Dongolaas Gorge and the heights on both sides, dominating the area south of Keren. The system’s unique feature is the ability of infantry units to self-reduce to dispatch men as supply-runners, as was necessary for both sides historically. Fighting atop the difficult hills will give players a sense of why the Italians were so difficult to dislodge, as well as the importance of artillery and air support, and the limitation on the usefulness of tanks.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 228 counters

Magazine: World at War #25

name: Marschall Vorwärts!
description:
Marschall Vorwärts! is the thirteenth game in the Pocket Battle Games series from LPS, Inc.

Coalition forces under Blucher attacked here in an attempt to take control of the vital supply routes feeding into the city of Leipzig.

Marschall Vorwärts! is a mini-game, postcard sized. Rules at the back, map front and 17 double sided counters along the sides.

The game is a hex and counter game where troops are activated though a standard deck of cards: black activates French units, red Coalition. How many and all is determined by the specific card.

Combat is resolved by comparing combat strengths of the units and drawing cards from that same deck. Whenever a joker is drawn, the turn is over, the deck is reshuffled and a new turn begins.

Goal of the game is to occupy a certain hex on the map at the end of 6 turns.

This game is part of a series of postcard games about the battle of Leipzig, which can be played individually or combined into a single game called A Bridge Too Few (for this you will need an article published in the 2013 Against The Odds Annual):
13) Marschall Vorwärts!
14) "A Matter of Honor, Sire"
15) The Nations Assemble
16) Trapping the Ogre

name: Rocky Road: Dice Cream
description:
Rocky Road: Dice Cream is a microgame for 2 players.

Collect scoops of ice cream to match the quantities on the demand dice. The more demands you serve at once, the higher your reward!

Game Play:
The player further behind (or on top) along the time track is the active player.

On your turn, do one of the follow two actions:

Collect: Gain 1 to 3 scoops of one flavor of ice cream. Move your player piece that number of spaces clockwise on the track.

or

Serve: Pay scoops to match the die value for one, two, or all three flavors of ice cream. Then score VP and move your player piece clockwise along the track as indicated on the game card based on how many flavors you served. Then re-roll the dice for all of those flavors. If any die value matches any of the unserved dice gain one scoop of the unserved flavor

First player to gain 12 VP wins immediately.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Monopoly: St. Louis Cardinals World Series
description:
The MONOPOLY Brand proudly presents the St. Louis Cardinals World Series Collector’s Edition. The St. Louis Cardinal’s soared in 2006 as they took home their 10th World Series Championship title.
