The City is a surreal and dangerous place where anvils intermittently drop from the sky and death is only an inconvenience (if you have the money to buy a clone).

There are many powerful groups in The City, like the Church, Ninjas, and the Post-Apocalyptic Beasts. HappyCOM-9 has announced that there will be an election and that any group that wants to nominate a candidate to run against it may do so. You are one of those candidates.

Your goal is to increase your power, influence, and intelligence so you are strong enough, popular enough, and smart enough to beat HappyCOM-9 in an election. During your campaign for President, you'll buy fantastic items (rocket-powered roller skates, flamethrowers, etc.) from the Catalog and compete in Game Shows (minigames within the game, like You Bet Your Clone!).
categories: Adventure, Bluffing, Fighting, Humor, Negotiation, Political, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: The Experiment
description:
You regain consciousness in a small room - a cell. You have no memory - no past, no identity, not even a name you can remember. The door slides open, revealing a corridor. THE EXPERIMENT has begun.

A cooperative, competitive and challenging experiment in psychology, trust, betrayal and survival.

Who are your friends?
Who are your enemies?

Find out as your work with and against other Subjects to find the exit and escape...

The goal of the experiment is to be the last player surviving or to complete a set of exit cards either by themselves or in groups to escape your captivity. Players do this by taking turns drawing cards and collecting weapons, defensive cards, action cards, or encounters which allow player to form groups. Groups can be done for mutual benefit or to attack and remove players. Actions will allow players to escape groups and/or attack. Game play is very fast as players start with no cards and take turns drawing one card from the deck. The game is suitable for 2 players, but gets better with 4 or more.

https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/the-experiment
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Set Collection
publishers: PowerUp Studios Inc., The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Mario Kart Wii Grand Prix Race Pinball
description: Seen at the Tokyo Toy Show, a marble race game based on Mario Kart for the Nintend Wii where two players manipulate buttons and knobs to race to get their colored ball to the finish first.

name: Flip Six
description:
Despite the name of the game being Flip Six, no player is guaranteed to flip six cards while playing. Instead that's only one of the ways for the round to end.

In more detail, at the start of each round each player is dealt six cards and places them in two rows of three cards without looking at the cards. On a player's first turn, he first flips two cards face-up – one on the top row, the other on the bottom – then takes his turn, drawing the top card of either the discard pile or the deck. The player then either:


Replaces one of the cards in his array with the newly drawn card, placing the new card face-up and placing the replaced card on the discard pile.
Discards the card he drew.
Places the card on a matching face-up card in his array, then discards both of these cards, then the card either above or below this position.


The goal of Flip Six is to have the lowest total when the round ends, and the round ends when a player has six face-up cards, a player has no cards (due to discarding) or a player calls for the end of the round because she thinks she has the lowest score; in all cases, each other player takes one final turn.

Players then tally their scores, which can be negative due to the deck including negative numbers. If the player who ended the round doesn't have the lowest score, that player's score for the round is doubled. The player with the lowest score after ten rounds wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Math, Number

name: Pebble Rebel
description:
Pebble Rebel is a strategy game for two players. Each player has different goals and different ways of playing, but still get in each other's way.

If Pebble gets four stones of the same color in a row, horizontally or vertically, she wins. (Diagonal four-in-a-row does not count.)
If Rebel fills up the whole board, he wins.

name: A Thousand Years of Blood
description:
This game was designed for the 24-Hour Game Design Contest - June 2012.

A Thousand Years of Blood is a solitaire game where the player takes on the role of a superhuman in an alternate-universe future. After Hitler's assassination in 1944, a superhuman named Heinrich Kirchner took power over Nazi Germany. Under his reign, the Nazis took over the world. As a virtual immortal, Heinrich began a thousand-year Reich.

You are a Nazi experiment with superhuman abilities of your own. And you plan to end Heinrich's rule and put a stop to his thousand-year plans.

The game requires a simple PocketMod, a pencil, a d6, and a d8. The player selects two of seven unique abilities, then uses the dice to randomly generate the maps of the three levels. Actual gameplay in the first two levels in completely non-random, as the player seeks to move from the Start point of the map to the End point while taking as little damage as possible from the various enemies. If you end your turn in an enemy's line of sight, you take damage, so watch out! The third level is less about sneaking and more about combat, so there is more randomization--Heinrich teleports to different points on the map while activating Laser Turrets and blasting you with lightning.
categories: Adventure, Print & Play, Puzzle, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Invasion of the Saucer People
description:
Introduction: Invasion of the Saucer People is a card game for 2-4 players working together to fend off a 1950's-style alien invasion. Each turn, a wave of saucers attacks, and the players must band together to defend against them. To fail is to lose one of the inner planets—Mercury, Venus, Earth, or Mars—to the invaders. Lose them all, and humankind faces extinction.

Fortunately, your crew cards provide special abilities that can be used in a pinch to help hold off overwhelming attacks. Also, the game is self-leveling, so that 2 players face a lesser threat than 3 players or 4 do. Each game lasts 30 to 60 minutes.

Game Play: (1) Each player is dealt one random Captain card, Navigator card, and Engineer card. These cards each have a special ability usable once per game to help against overwhelming odds. (2) Half the play deck is dealt to the players as defense cards; the other half becomes a draw pile of offense cards for the Saucer People. (3) Each round, three Saucer People cards are turned up to attack. (The actual attack value is calculated differently for 2, 3, or 4 players.) (4) In defense, the players each lay one card from their hand and add them. (5) If the total defense equals or exceeds the attack, the Saucer People are defeated at the asteroid belt. (6) If not, the Saucer People cards now attack individual worlds--indicated by the card suits. And each player's card defends the world of its suit. (7) If the total value of Saucer People cards at a world exceed the total value of defender cards at the world, the world falls to the invaders.

Victory Conditions: Game play continues until the deck is depleted, then victory conditions are calculated, ranging from Total Human Victory, to one or more worlds lost, to Total Human Extinction.

Expansion: There's now an official booster pack for the game. The Invasion of the Saucer People! Booster Pack adds new options to your defense of the inner planets. Included in this pack are full crews for both Luna and Ceres, in addition to Dr. Sato from the Pluto research station, a Captain from Hollywood, a young psychic Captain, a Robot Sidekick, and the ever-popular Space Monkey. Also included are color-coded rocket ships from each world, and new rules for rescuing planets the saucer people have captured!

name: Armageddon Preppin
description:
Preppin is a 2-4 player card game for ages 8+. The goal of the game is simple, keep your family alive and be the lone survivors of the cataclysmic disasters.

Each player is the head of a household trying to survive an onslaught of disasters. Every round you must decide how many of your family members will go out searching for supplies, and how many will stay sheltered. Family members who are sheltered, are safe from disasters. Those that go out, might not come back. Next you draw 1 card from any area pile of your choice for each unsheltered family member and place them into your hand. After you've drawn your cards, you take care of your upkeep by discarding 1 food card and 1 water card. If you can't, then you lose a family member to starvation or dehydration.

Once each player has taken a turn, the last player chooses a disaster card from the disaster deck of their choice. The red ones are the worst. The disasters effect everyone at the same time. In order to survive the effects, you need to use the surplus cards you've collected in your hand. For example: The Oil Crisis Disaster card is drawn. It takes 1 shelter and 1 food away from everyone, or else you lose 1 family member. In my hand I have 2 Waters, 1 Food, a Generator and a Gas Mask. I will discard my food and generator to survive the disaster.

After everyone has dealt with the disaster, the next round begins starting with the player to the left of the person who just drew the disaster. The game ends when there is only one player left, crowning them the most prepared.

name: Gusuka Pasuka
description:
The original Japanese title means "Is it rock? Is it paper?"

The game is basically Rock-Paper-Scissors.

There are 12 cards, of which 6 are Scissors, 3 are Rock and 3 are Paper. Additionally, every card has a coin value between 0 and 2.

Two cards are discarded secretly, and the other ten are dealt to the players. Players play a card face down and reveal it at the same time. The winner is determined by normal Rock-Paper-Scissors rules.

The winner of the bout takes as many coins as the two cards combined show. The loser takes the cards played. If there's a tie, the players move to the next bout and the tied cards stay on the table, adding to the pot.

The game ends when a player runs out of cards or the 13 coin pile runs out. If the coin value of the last bout is higher than the number of coins left, the remaining coins are taken from the opponent. (This rule makes a last-minute comeback possible, even after the opponent has amassed 7 coins.)

name: Heroes of Metro City: Powers and Enemies
description:
This is a 25 card Kickstarter-Only promotional set called "Powers and Enemies" available to backers at the "A HERO IS BORN – COMPLETE" or higher level.

There are a variety of cards in the pack, for example a Power card called "Kickstarted Super-Cycle" that, for 2, gives "Revved Up: Once activated, this card is an Energy Source for Travel and Wild Powers", and for 4, gives "Gain +1 Plot Point".
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Magical Restaurant
description:
Magical Restaurant is a quick-playing game in which players are small restaurant owners, trying to cater to the varying tastes of idols from the nearby production office and capture their hearts. There are some eccentrics among the customers, so players have to carefully balance upgrading their restaurant furniture and food skills with feeding the passing customers.

The goal of the game is to collect the most love points by the end of the game. In order to gain love points you will need to have your customers eat as much of your food as possible. And to do that you need to improve your food preparation skills and get good furniture for your restaurant.

Players start the game with one food stand (which lets you prepare one food card) and five food cards. Five food cards are placed face-up in a row in the middle of the table, and six character cards are also placed face-up.

As the first action in the game, each player chooses two of their food cards in secret. These are then revealed to show which food preparation skills they start with.

Taking turns round the table. players may take two actions of the four available. They may take the same action twice. The options are:


Take a food card - take one of five face-up food cards on the table, or the face-down card from the top of the deck.
Prepare food - Take one food card from your hand and place it on an empty food stand. You must have the skill required to play the food card.
Buy furniture - discard any two food cards to buy the furniture you want. This could be more food stands, or wallpaper/floor tiles that may give you bonus points at the end of the game.
Raise your skill level - Play a food card in front of you to raise your skill level.


When you prepare food, you need to check whether the hunger level of any of the face-up character cards has been satisfied by the food you have prepared. If it has, you take the character card and place it face-down in front of you. This is where most of your love points will come from.

At the end of your turn, replace any food or character cards that were taken from the table, shuffling the food discard pile if necessary. If you now hold more than three food cards, discard down to three.

The game ends when the deck of food cards has been depleted twice in a 3-player game or three times in a 4-player game. Play continues until each player has had the same number of turns. Love points are awarded for the character cards you have collected, from drink cards that you may have played during food preparation, and bonuses from the wallpaper/floor tile furniture cards. The player with the most points wins.

name: Ironcrux
description:
Ironcrux is an abstract strategy game in which 2-4 players take turns moving their colored piece, which starts from one corner, across a square grid of pieces. Each move shrinks the grid by one piece, making maneuvering increasingly more difficult. In certain situations, a few removed pieces can be returned to the grid to open up new movement options.

When a player cannot make a legal move, he is eliminated. The last player standing wins.

name: Top This! Hot Chilies Expansion
description:
From the Kickstarter campaign:

Chilies can be added to your order and reward the player completing that order with an extra Tip card.

Includes 5 hot chili topping discs
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Die Logik-Piraten
description:
Die Logik-Piraten, as the title suggests, combines pirates and logic puzzles — more specifically, pattern puzzles in which players need to figure out the item missing in a sequence.

On a player's turn, he looks at one of the puzzle cards — brown for easier puzzles, blue for harder — and chooses one of the four sequences on the card. He says what object fits into the sequence, then uses the pirate ship on the edge of the box to shoot marbles into the trays on one edge of the playing area. If he lands a marble in the tray below the correct missing item, as verified by the answer on the back of the card, he gets to draw a treasure tile. He can then stop or continue to draw treasure tiles — but if he draws a treasure of the same color as one he already drew that turn, he must return all of them to the play area and gain nothing that turn.

Once all the treasure tiles have been claimed, players compare stacks of tiles to see who wins. Die Logik-Piraten includes two sea monster figures, and players can choose to add one or both to the playing area to make it more difficult for pirates to shoot their cannonballs.

name: Stranded No More
description:
A solitaire game where you play as Captain Oscar Locke, a stranded pirate, whose luck just turned around. Another crew of pirates has landed on the island where you were stranded by your mutinous ex-crew. This new crew of pirates are here to bury their treasure; leaving their boat unmanned just off the coast. You could try to man the ship yourself but with no gold to spend, what's the point? Capture the treasure before it's buried and make it to the ship to sail the high seas with your newly claimed booty.

In this game of exploration, players will use various resources coupled with dice rolling to battle the pirates and animals they will encounter as they move throughout the island. If players can manage their inventory and time, they might be able to get off the island alive.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Fighting, Pirates, Print & Play

name: Monopoly: China Edition
description: An edition of Monopoly specifically geared towards China. This version plays the same as the regular Monopoly, though the sets are named after well-known places throughout China.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Numerabis
description:
Numerabis combines memory and math.
There are 49 face down tiles with the numbers from 1 to 49.
Players roll tow dies to determin the task for a round. This coulod for example be to reveal 3 odd numbers for example, or 2 cards that add up to more than 60.
If a player reveals cards fitting the task, he can keep them.
The game ends as soon as there is onle one or no more tile left.
The player with the most tiles wins.

name: 皇帝なき帝国 (Empire Without Emperor)
description:
User summary:
皇帝なき帝国 (Koutei Naki Teikoku) is themed on the Interregnum in the Holy Roman Empire. But the game centred around the placement of numbered tiles and their effect. The main focus is on control using the Knight placement from Chess.

An area-control game themed on middle-ages Germany, where your goal is to gain control of Cities and Nobles. Players control "Knights" which have "Military points". Majority of Military points are required to control Cities.

On the other hand, you need the majority of number of Knights (regardless of Military points) to control Nobles. You must spend one turn to "prepare" the Knights, or they would be treated as "unprepared", or woth 0 Military points. But since they are initially face-down tiles, you can't be sure which of your Knights are the stronger ones.

The game was originally published in 2012 and a new edition with updated artwork was released in 2017, but gameplay remains the same.

Publisher summary:
神聖ローマ帝国、大空位時代を舞台に都市の支配権を争う。騎士タイルをボード上で配置し、連なることで勢力も合わさるのでより適した配置ができれば勝利につながるでしょう。

中世ドイツを舞台に、都市や貴族を支配することを目指す陣取りゲームです。
プレイヤーの手下の騎士は「武力ポイント」を持ちます。それは都市を支配するのに必要です。
貴族を手下にするには騎士タイルの枚数で相手を上回っている必要があります。
騎士タイルはめくり、いったん控えの間カード上に移されます。この手順から運の要素があるのです。
publishers: ガーデンゲームズ (The Garden Games)

name: Hydras in Hats
description:
Hydras in Hats is a light and fun game of match-making and deduction for 2-5 players.

To begin, players are dealt a secret goal card defining what heads and hats they want growing on the hydra. On their turn, a player draws two hydra cards, selects one, and uses it to cover an existing head, showing two new heads in its place. Once a player matches six heads on the hydra to their goal, they win!
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: Die Jagd nach dem verschollenen Schatz
description:
A pirate & treasure game with stamps for 2 to 4 players aged 6 years and up.
Each player picks out a pirate.
The game sheet is torn from the game pad, crumpled up and smoothed out again, so that it is wild and weavy as the sea. 10 treasures are placed onto the game sheet using the treasure chest stamp and the gold ink pad.
The game is played in turns in a clockwise direction. On your turn, put the die onto the game sheet. Cover it with the dice cup so that you can no longer see the die. Now raise the dice cup slightly and push it over the game sheet like a ship on water and stop at a free treasure of your choice. Carefully lift up the dice cup and see what is on the die:
Saber: You can keep the treasure! Stamp your pirate stamp onto the treasure. It now belongs to you and no one else can ever steel it.
Jolly Roger (pirate flag): The black pirate has struck and stolen the treasure! Take the Jolly Roger stamp and the black ink pad and stamp the treasure out. It is now lost for everyone.
Treasure chest: Take the treasure chest stamp and the gold ink pad and stamp another treasure chest on any free space of the game sheet.
The game is over as soon as all treasure chests have been stamped. The player with the most treasure chests wins. There can be more than one winner.

name: Unspeakable Words: "K is for Exploding Kithulhu" Promo Card
description: Given out at Convention Booths. After you play this card, give it to another player. She must play it in her next word or discard it and automatically fail her sanity check.

name: Multiple
description:
マルチプル (Multiple) is a Japanese card game in which you create a "multiple" of the target number by combining digit cards. You can either play a number that is a multiple of the target card (for instance a 9 when the target card shows a 3), use two number cards as two digits (for instance 1 and 2 to form a 12), or use "+" or "-" cards to create an equation (for instance 7-1). However, you may not play a multiple that has been played by another player in the same round. The goal is to be the first player to get rid of all your cards.

•••

指示された数の倍数を、数字カードを組み合わせて作るゲームです。

name: Pictopia: Marvel Cinematic Universe Edition
description:
Description from the publisher:

Marvel fans assemble for the action-packed, picture-trivia card game
Pictopia: Marvel Cinematic Universe Edition'. Test your knowledge of your favorite Marvel movies with two hundred questions! Answer trivia about Earth's Mightiest Heroes, the greatest Guardians of the Galaxy, and all Realms in between! Earn tokens for each correct answer! For a daring twist, risk what you've earned for the chance to win big!

name: Burg Flatterstein (reisespiele)
description: Hurry to the top of old Castle Flutterstone to win the race for the magic cup! The only way to advance in this travel version of Burg Flatterstein, however, is to use the catapult to shoot the bats through the openings in the castle. Flutter to the right places, and you'll make your way to victory...

name: Wulong: Chow's 11
description:
Chow's 11 takes the Wulong base game to an entirely new level. Challenge your skills in big casinos with your expert team to win money and keep ahead of the crews of the other players. What are you waiting for? Hire your crew, play smart, and operate ruthlessly for victory and a big pile of cash!

Chow's 11 comes with a deck of action cards to influence the game of Wulong in your favor (to manipulate dice, reroll, influence the other players, or defend oneself against the other player's actions). The goal of the game remains the same: Throw a wulong (five dragons in one go) or achieve the biggest fortune at the end of the game.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck

name: Monopoly: Silver Line
description:
Make a move. Make a deal. Make a Fortune. In the Monopoly game, players tour the board in a quest to own the hottest properties, railroads and utilities. Invest in houses and hotels, then watch the rent come pouring in. Make deals to trade with other players and also look out for bargains at auction. This Silver Line edition of the Monopoly game features a sophisticated look for serious Monopoly fans. It includes a foil-accented gameboard, 8 pewter-colored tokens, pewter-colored drawstring bag, and 2 black dice with pewter-colored pips.


Foil-accented gameboard
Features black dice with pewter-colored pips and pewter-colored drawstring bag
Comes in premium packaging
Features 8 pewter-colored tokens
Fast-Dealing Property Trading Game
It’s a Monopoly, Silver Line Edition


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey: Lively and Spry
description:
Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey is a new take on the collectible non-collectible KB line, with Jeffrey Neil Bellinger once again putting the rabbits through the grinder. Six new starter decks Animals, Crops, Elementals, Energy, Land and Technology will be available, and players can construct personalized decks of no less than 60 cards, with the cards from any deck.

Ultimate Odyssey is not collectible or random. Players can now buy starter decks and booster expansions for Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey and then use any combination of those cards to form their own constructed decks to play against opponents. Unlike in Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot, where up to eight players play with the same deck of cards, all sharing the same draw pile, Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey has players each draw only from their own constructed deck of 60 cards. There are not any random packs, so players will always know which cards they are purchasing in a deck and they can buy the right products for their planned deck. For Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey six brand new starter decks (red, violet, blue, yellow, green, or orange) allow players to construct a personalized deck with any of the cards of any deck.

The setting for the new game is an ultimate race to build a bunny society on planet Earth. Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey pits players against each other as they struggle to gain Civilization Points, by building cities and increasing their bunny populations. Players gain points by developing their own civilizations or by using zany weapons and hilarious scenarios to destroy their opponents.

Lively and Spry contains the Animals, Crops, and Land starter decks, as well as 3 limited edition promo cards.

name: Alles läuft!
description:
The zombies are coming! Run for your life ..
The fast running game with the ultimate adrenaline rush! By rolling the dice successfully, you‘ll proceed steadily on the placed course.
If you are afraid and often save your path, you‘ll risk that the others reach the safe hut in front of you .. Who can do it first?

A entertaining quick game with coasters. Fun for everyone!

—description from the publisher

Game play:
The start field will be laid open first. Then all running fields are placed one after the other in any order (from the start field) as a continuous course, always edge to edge. Finally, the target field is placed to the last running field. The number tokens are mixed loosely and placed open on the running fields as desired (with the yellow side open), so that exactly 1 number token is left each running field.

The player rolls the dice and can move his figure forward (towards the target) as the shown number of the next coaster is rolled.
After a player has reached a new coaster, he always has the choice to continue (again up to 2 rolls to get to the next coaster) or secure himself on the current coaster. Then the number token will be turned to the red backside and the player must finish his turn immediately. A secured number token is saved forever and applies in the rest of the game for all participating players!

Object of the game: To reach the target field in front of all other players. If there are several players (at the end of a complete round), there are also several winners!





Die Zombies kommen! Lauf um Dein Leben ..
Das schnelle Laufspiel mit dem ultimativen Adrenalinkick! Durch erfolgreiches Würfeln kannst Du Dich auf dem gelegten Parkour stetig voranbewegen. Bist Du ängstlich und sicherst Dich oft ab, riskierst Du, dass die anderen vor Dir die sichere Hütte erreichen .. Wer schafft es zuerst?

Ein kurzweiliges schnelles Spiel mit Bierdeckeln. Spaß für jedermann!

—description from the publisher (German)

Spielablauf:
Das Startfeld wird als erstes offen ausgelegt. Dann werden alle Lauffelder nacheinander in beliebiger Reihenfolge (vom Startfeld aus) als fortlaufender Parcour angelegt, immer Kante an Kante.
Abschließend wird das Zielfeld an das letzte Lauffeld angelegt.
Die Zahlenmarker werden lose gemischt und beliebig jeweils offen (mit der gelben Seite oben) auf den Lauffeldern ausgelegt, so dass dann pro Lauffeld genau 1 Zahlenmarker ausliegt.

Der Spieler würfelt und kann mit seiner Spielfigur einen Deckel vorrücken (Richtung Zielfeld), wenn die ausliegende Zahl des nächsten Deckels erwürfelt wird. Nachdem ein Spieler einen neuen Deckel erreicht hat, hat er immer die Wahl fortzufahren (wieder bis zu 2 Würfe, um auf den nächsten Deckel zu kommen) oder sich auf dem jetzigen Deckel abzusichern. Der Zahlenmarker wird dann auf die rote Rückseite gedreht und der Spieler muss sofort seinen Zug beenden.
Ein gesicherter Zahlenmarker bleibt dann für immer gesichert und gilt im weiteren Spielverlauf für alle teilnehmenden Spieler!

Spielziel: Vor allen anderen Spielern das Zielfeld erreichen. Stehen dort (am Ende einer kompletten Runde) mehrere Spieler, gibt es auch mehrere Gewinner!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Race, Tile Placement

name: Tony's Treasures
description:
You are elite collectors trying to win the most pieces at Tony's illicit street sale of 1960's objet's d'art.

Buy as many items as you can without spending the most money, as the police could be here any minute.

A 9-card auction-style microgame.

Remove one card without looking at it. Write down and enter sealed bids on each subsequent card as it is turned over. The highest bid wins the card. There is no limit to what you can bid, but if the police card is turned, then whoever has paid most is eliminated. After that the winner of the most cards wins with the value of those cards serving as a tie breaker.

—description from the publisher


Released in the October 2018 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

A limited special members-club release and a print & play 2017 16-card editions were available before official publishing by Button Shy.


COMPONENTS

Button Shy 9-card edition

8 Auction Item cards
1 Police card


16-card editions

13 Auction Item cards
3 Police cards



Auction Items

Inverted Jenny Stamp
Bottle of Lafite Wine
Faberge Egg
Flowing Hair Dollar Coin
Qianlong Dynasty Vase
Stradivarious Violin
Painting by Picasso
Baseball Trading Card


16-card first edition only:

"La Peregrina" Pearl Necklace
1957 Ferrari
Codex Leicester Book
Silk Isfahan Persian Carpet
Statue by Giacometti

name: Way of the Fighter: Mbiraru & Ying Pei Fighter Pack
description:
Amp up the power and expand your game by adding Mbiraru and Ying Pe to Way of the Fighter! These two new characters add exciting new techniques to your existing decks, while also allowing you to try out the new themes and strategies based around these two new characters.

This fighter pack includes a complete set of actions for Mbiraru and Ying Pei, along with their fighter standees. In addition to the two new fighters, this pack includes two complete sets of actions for the Choke technique belonging to the Wrestle style and the External technique belonging to the Chi style.

Over a period of twelve intense turns, each player will control a fighter’s movement, manage the fighter’s energy, and decide on what actions to have the fighter perform against the opposing challenger. The game continues until one fighter is knocked out, or the time runs out; at which point one fighter will be declared the Champion!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Mistigriff
description:
A GAME OF PAIRS AND TACTICS
OBJECT: earn the most courage points
All of the cards are shuffled and dealt to the players. The player whose turn it is draws a card at random from his neighbour to the right. If they can make a pair, they lay the pair on the table before them. If one of the cards has a magical power, the power is immediately applied (play again, steal a pair, etc.). At the end of the game, each player counts up the courage points from the cards in front of them: whoever has the most points wins the game.

+++ A game of pairs with a tactical twist!

—description from the publisher

name: Wortblitz
description:
Six letter dice (d6) are permanently mounted to a hexagonal device. Each player receives a pencil, a sheet from the notepad. The players pick one of the three interchangeable category dice (d12) and put it in the device. Then the start player rolls the device and places it on the middle of the table. Now, all players have to write down words matching the category of the category device. The initial letter of the words is determined by the letter dice. The start player of the round may call “stop” at any time, even if he has not yet found a suitable term for each letter. Any valid term that no other player has written down is worth one victory point. The game is played for four rounds. The player with the highest total score wins.

—user summary

name: Geistertreppe
description:
Small scaled-down version of Geistertreppe (Spooky Stairs). Children's game about children being transformed into ghosts who want to reach the top of the steps first.

The Metallbox game series features well-known games in smaller versions, mostly with less sophisticated material and sometimes scaled-down rules, provided in a small metal box for easy transport and at a cheaper price.

name: Schmock
description:
Schmock is based on the game rock, paper, scissors, lizard, Spock and the card game President. The goal is to get rid of your hand cards as fast as possible by defeating the cards according to the old proven principle "scissors cuts paper...". The winner is the president and in the next game he gets all the president cards from the loser (the schmock).

—description from the designer

name: Pierniczki
description:
Master Caramel's pastry shop is famous for the most delicious gingerbread. It gets so many orders that the master is no longer able to fulfill them on his own, so he asked you for help, which is a very responsible task! Each gingerbread must have the right shape, plenty of icing and the right sprinkles. Those of you, who deal with your tasks as quickly as possible, will surely fall into the favors of Master Caramel... and get a pot of icing to lick off! So get to work!

Pierniczki (The Gingerbread) is a game that combines the element of memory with matching shapes and colors, which is why it is perfect for the youngest children.

—description from the publisher

Cukiernia mistrza Karmela słynie z najpyszniejszych pierniczków. Spływa do niej tyle zamówień, że mistrz nie jest już w stanie ich samodzielnie zrealizować, więc poprosił Was o pomoc.To bardzo odpowiedzialne zadanie! Każdy pierniczek musi mieć odpowiedni kształt, dużo lukru i odpowiednią posypkę. To z Was, które najszybciej upora się ze swoimi zadaniami na pewno wkradnie się w łaski mistrza Karmela... i dostanie garnek lukru do wylizania! Zatem do dzieła!

Gra Pierniczki łączy w sobie element zapamiętywania, dopasowywania kształtów i kolorów dlatego idealnie sprawdzi się wśród najmłodszych dzieci.

—description from the publisher (Polish)

name: Escape Box: Pirates
description:
Embark on a fabulous adventure aboard a pirate ship! The Pirate Captain lands on an abandoned island and leaves you 45 minutes to find the lost treasure of Pirate Buzzard.

It will be necessary to do quickly, because the Captain will not leave you a minute more! Time is running out, will you solve the riddles and bring back the loot to save you from the clutches of these dangerous pirates?

Recreate the atmosphere of an escape room at home! You have 45 minutes to find clues concealed by the Master of the Game that will allow you to solve all the puzzles.

name: Tournament Fishing: Night Fishing Expansion
description:
Tournament Fishing: Night Fishing Expansion is a stand-alone, solo version of the hit game Tournament Fishing.

This expansion can be be played as a solo game or integrated into the base game by simply adding the starter deck to the base game allowing for a 5th player. The Bait Shop and Lake Cards can also be integrated into the game but are not necessary.

This expansion also adds a third AI angler to the two that come with the base game

—description from the publisher

name: Doodle Mayhem
description:
Doodle Mayhem is a fast-paced party game where everyone draws at the same time! The sooner you finish your doodle, the more points you can win. However, make sure that your doodle is clear, you'll win points if your team mates can guess your sketch - but you'll lose them if they can't!

—description from the publisher

name: ProcuRatos
description:
Mouse wanted! Is this the one? Is it him? Or will it be that one? Test your bounty-hunting skills in ProcuRatos to find the most wanted rats in the west! But be careful because every detail counts...

Each round, players randomly choose a card from the table, revealing the target rat. Everyone then races to find the matching rat card on the table. Players keep their dominant hand under the table, simulating holding a gun, and use their other hand to search for and reveal the correct rat card. The first to find it becomes sheriff, which is indicated by a special card. Winning two consecutive rounds as the sheriff secures victory.

—description and summary from the publisher (translated)

Procura-se um rato! Achou? Será que é ele mesmo? Ou será aquele? Em PROCURATOS teste sua habilidade para encontrar os ratos mais procurados do faroeste! Mas fique esperto, porque todo detalhe (até o fio do bigode) conta!
PROCURATOS é mais um jogo da LINHA MICRO assinado pelo aclamado autor Reiner Knizia.
—description from the publisher

name: Toi Aider Moi
description:
The Prehistoric Chat and Build Game! Get ready for the loudest, funniest, and craziest construction site in the entire Stone Age! Players form one or more teams and must try to build figures of different shapes together. However, only the master builder in the team knows which figure needs to be built. They can only use words defined in the 'prehistoric dictionary': these are word cards laid out on the table at the beginning of the game to define shapes, colors, and actions. The architect can only use these words, and the team must try to understand them and recreate the figures correctly and quickly.

For example, "FLEK BOOD KLUV" could mean, "Rotate the blue cube to the right." Who understands each other the best and builds the correct structure first?

New combinations of words and instructions in each game
Trains teamwork and concentration - not just for children.

—description from the publisher

name: Volcano
description:
Race to Build Your Temple Before the Volcano Erupts.

The Angry Rumble of the Erupting Volcano,the Cascade of Boulders and the Ensuing Threat to Buildings Are Captured in This Exciting Action Game."

Push down the Volcano centre piece. Players then take it in turns to take a building piece. Check the value on the piece. Place the correct number of balls into the crater. One ball too many and the volcano will erupt. The erupting volcano may destroy your temple.

The first player to build their temple wins the game.

name: Staccabees
description:
Looking for a game that kids and parents will love to play together? Use your brain and a steady hand to play Staccabees, an exciting, easy to learn family game that kids AND parents will want to play again and again!

How to Play: Staccabees is for 2 to 6 players ages 6 and up. A game takes about 20 minutes. Players take turns spinning the top and, based on the results, place cubes on the "stac". Be the first to balance all your cubes on the "stac" and you win!

Staccabees is based on a traditional holiday game. Teetotum was an ancient game played in the Middle Ages and adopted by many cultures around the world. Modern examples of this game include Put and Take, historically played at Christmas time in England, Dreidel, traditionally played during Hanukkah, La Pirinola, traditionally played after the "Day of the Dead" festival in Mexico, and Parta Ola, traditionally played at Christmas and New Years in Greece. Staccabees is inspired by this classic holiday game.

Game includes includes:
- 54 Hardwood Game Pieces
- 1 Engraved Wood Spinning Top
- Illustrated Rules
- Classic 100% cotton heavy duty canvas game bag with embroidered logo

Staccabees is great for practicing:
- Fine Motor Skills
- Halving
- Even/Odd
- Rounding Numbers
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Party Game, Religious
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Japanese: The Game – Conjugations Expansion
description:
This 36-card Expansion Deck brings your Japanese grammar concepts up to an intermediate level. You’ll be able to conjugate Verbs, Adjectives, and certain Copulas to many different tenses, including:

Past Tense
Negative
Command Form
Polite Request Form
Invitation/Volitional Form
and many more!

Much of this isn’t discussed until the third semester of college. But you can integrate this after one or two days of getting used to Japanese: The Game’s Core Deck, maybe sooner.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: The Cookie 2.0
description:
Playing The Cookie 2.0 you will try yourself as Alice in the Absurdland or as a double agent who has to hunt for his victim and kill it on the one hand and not to become a victim himself on the other. But the game itself is not that cruel as it sounds: the cutest characters and bright illustrations will always remind you about it. Deduction, bluff, surrealism, sweet insanity and a cookie for the first player are in set!

The Cookie 2.0 includes basic rules for 4-6 players from the original version of The Cookie but also an absolutely new 2-4 player mode. In “The Big Hunt” mode players will have to figure out which character’s head is a price is put on. Besides to the price you need to stay in the game.

Each round consists of three stages. During the first stage you need to announce your role in the game… but you can lie! It’s up to you to choose what to say but keep in mind that any of your decisions will give useful information to other players. During the second stage you can try to uncover the role of the player that lied (as you think). And finally, during the third stage all the players, based on the information received, attack the hidden target card, then it is revealed and the winner is decided. But pay attention to the fact that you can not only attack the target but also other players!

This game is pure insanity where bluffing skills and cold-blooded premeditation can help to win!

name: Die Fürsten von Catan: Sonderkarte 2011 – Carol, die Spieleerklärerin
description:
Carol, die Spieleerklärerin is a special card for "The Rivals for Catan" (published 2011).

Ability of the card (unit hero):

Place carol in the beginning of the game in your princedom. One-time in the turn of your opponent: Answer a rule question correctly. Each player gets one resource next to Carol.

name: Prism
description:
In Prism, the object of the game is to try to collect cards representing the six colors of the rainbow. The first player to collect all six wins the round, and is awarded bonus points.

In the deck, there are cards that represent red, orange, yellow, green, blue and violet. Players can only have one of each color in their collection. In addition, there are action cards that allow you to steal colors from other players. Some of these take cards allow you to continue your turn, taking as many color cards as you can, but with a downside- the more cards you play in a turn, the fewer cards you have left in your hand, limiting your options in future turns. Since bonus points are awarded to the winner for the number of cards in their hand, using play again cards also reduces your potential bonus score.

There are a limited number of blocking cards that you can use to prevent an opponent from stealing one of your colors.

There are a number of other cards, such as a the Prism Wild Card, zap cards to permanently destroy an opponent's color card, and cards that allow you to replenish your hand with additional draws from the deck on your turn.

Prism is ideal for Ages 8 and up. The game is normally played in multiple rounds until one player scores a certain number of points, but each round is enjoyable as a game by itself.

name: Crazy Chicken
description: Use your flippers to keep the eggs from getting into your 'basket'. The winner is the one who has kept the most eggs from getting in.

name: Inklings: the Ultimate Bible Game
description:
The Inklings® Board Game is an exciting and unique question and answer game that requires strategy to win! Just flip the spinner and watch the fun begin! If you spin a 1 or 4 either answer or sell the question to an opponent. Spin a 2 or 5 and draw an action card! Spin a 3 and to take on your opponents in answering the question. Spin a 6 to get a chance to bid on
who gets the question!

The game contains more than 280 questions. Each question has six clues. The more clues you ask for the easier the clues get. But remember, the more clues you ask for the less points you can win. The first player or team to 55 points wins the game!

Don't know the Bible that well? No problem! The six clues get progressively easier until you get to the sixth question which is multiple choice!
publishers: Cactus Game Design, Family Choice Products, Inc.

name: Invader Zim: Doomsday Dice Game
description:
In Invader Zim: Doomsday Dice Game, you and up to three of your friends play as either Zim or Gir working for their Almighty Tallest Irkin overlords—or as Dib or Agent Darkbootie working to protect the earth as part of the secretive Swollen Eye network! Draw cards to build a krazy machine to either destroy the earth (yay!) or save it (boo!). Connect matching cards, and earn power surges that let you roll the BIG DIE.

The more rolls, the more power you can generate. You might even get to roll the tiny special die (aww, it’s cute!). Be careful, though, as rolling either die can end in a fizzle or a malfunction, costing you all the energy you’ve earned or even breaking your machine! The first player to earn 100 energy wins, and everyone else owes them taquitos!

This fast-paced dice game is based on the cult-favorite animated series Invader Zim and is packaged in a collectible tin and includes 64 cards, 4 player boards, 8 power trackers, 16 special ability tokens, power surge die, special die, and a rulebook.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Das Labyrinth des Minotaurus
description:
Build a labyrinth for the Minotaur on Crete on behalf of King Minos, but don't forget to worship the gods while building, by erecting statues. Plan your labyrinth well and create good connections in order to be able to reach the hidden treasures fast.

Announced for Essen 2009.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Okos kertész
description:
A special collection of games, all using the same tiles consisting of 1-6 squares showing 1 to 6 flowers. In all of these games these tiles must be placed in a frame; the way these are placed is different in the games. All these games help logic and spatial thinking, math, shape and color recognition.
Some examples:
"Lucky gardener": roll a die. Take one, two or three of your tiles. Use basic math (+, -, x, /) to reach the number rolled using the three numbers of the flowers on the individual tiles (e.g. your tiles have 1 flower, 2 flowers. 3 flowers and you roll a 4: 2+3-1=4) and you can place all the tiles used in the frame. The first player to fill the frame or place all his tiles wins.
"Clever Gardener": when it's your turn you try to make the garden have one or two more flowers than before. For this you can add and take away tiles, but only three tiles can be manipulated this way.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Fateful Days: The Marne Campaign of 1914
description:
This is the third game in the TPS of the Pocket_Battle_Games from LPS, Inc.
It covers the Marne Campaign of 1914. One player is the German and other play with the Entente (French and British troops).
German Player wins if there is a German unit in or adjacent to Paris at end of any turn and he can trace a line of connected squares, free of Entente units. Otherwise, the Entente players win.
Counters need to be cut from around the edge of the card. Die-cut counters are available from Turning Point Simulations with any purchase at no additional charge.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Bid It Right: The Price is Right Card Game
description:
Bid It Right - The "Price is Right" Game

"Everyone who watches 'The Price is Right' show on TV, will enjoy playing Bid It Right at home. The object of the game is to out-guess the bid your opponents will make and win prize money."

Each player has 15 bids cards from $10 to $150. Each turn a prize with value from $10 to $150 is turned up. Every player places a bid card. The highest bid takes the prize and all bid cards used are discarded. If there is a tie for the highest bid the lowest bidder takes the prize.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Ferrocarriles Pampas
description:
British investors and newly settled Argentine immigrants develop the vast fertile pampas of Argentina with broad gauge railroad networks from 1870-1890.

In this game, players invest in companies and try to increase the value of their holdings through cagey track construction choices. Track construction in this game is accomplished via "Consortium bidding" a unique system that forces players to cooperate to grow their companies.

Ferrocarriles Pampas is the first game in the Prairie Railroads Series.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Crayon Rail System, Pattern Building

name: Tricky Wildlife
description:
In Tricky Wildlife, each of the players is a wildlife manager who's trying to keep many different animal species in his wildlife park, while also preserving the food chain of predators and prey and helping endangered species.

The food chain of animals has top predators who eat the lower predators, who in turn eat the next species down the "animal pyramid", who in turn eats the lowest prey – for example: Sharks eat Penguins, Penguins eat Fish, Fish eat Shrimp. Missing a prey animal means that the higher animal type starves, which gives you penalty points as a wildlife manager. Thus, you want to maintain all species in your wildlife park, especially the rarest species as they give you prestige points.

In each of the eight game years (i.e., rounds), you can add 1 or 2 animal groups to your park; each group first consists of 1-4 animals of one species. When you attract them to your park, these are young animals. They can grow old and die naturally after five years, but to do this they need enough prey to feed on during their lifetime. Otherwise they starve. At the same time, higher predators in the food chain can eat these animals.

An animal's age is shown by its location on your lifetime track, which uses four sticks to divide the track into five sections (i.e., years). After each year, you shift your rightmost stick to the leftmost side, which ages all of your animals by one year.

When you don't have all four different species, you gain one penalty point per missing species (and higher level animals may starve). If you have the most (or second-most) of an animal which was rare before, you score 1-2 prestige points. After year eight, you add the number of your animal groups to your prestige point total to calculate your final score.

The challenge in Tricky Wildlife is to balance your desire for prestige points with the need to preserve your complete food chain.

name: IPA: The Agents
description:
Important information/hints.

Having seen a clear difference in ratings between people who have had the game displayed to them and people who have not. We have put together a little information that might help giving players a better experience with the game.
Hopefully, this will help improving the enjoyment of the game.

The most essential part of the game is the Space Shop. It must be used or the game will become boring and you are left with a feel of just chasing one another without any tactical considerations. The Space Shop adds strategic/tactical depth to the game.

The game is about making tough decisions figuring out when it will pay off to sell cards and thus earning credits for purchases. When and where you place field equipment is of the utmost importance. Failing at placing your field equipment the right place can cost you the game. Like in chess you must carefully consider your next moves and in accordance to your plan, buy and place field equipment. Credits are not easy to come by, so be sure not to buy field equipment without having carefully planned out a strategy on how to use the field equipment.
Do not expect to keep a favorite weapon throughout the whole game (although it is possible). At a certain point you may have to give it up

Here are a few hints:
Gravitational Enforcers are among other things used for preventing a melee-heavy agents from catching up to you.

Space Tunnels are used to travel vast distances and thus ensuring that enemy agents will not get too far away from you. Keeping them within your reach.
Sentries are very useful to the agents as they give you more fire power. Placed correctly you can cut off fleeing agents or blow down walls that enemy agents may use as a defensive barrier trying to buy a little time. But placing sentries randomly is just a waste of credits/cards.

Melee weapons. If you are not a really experienced player, you should not only go for strength and melee weapons. As a beginner you should go for precision and intellect and later in the game , you could attempt using the melee weapons as a support weapon.

The game.
IPA - The Agents is a tactical strategy game that takes place in a near future. You take on the roll as one of the agents of "the agency", who fight other agents in an attempt to find rare objects to his/her employer.

Among many other things the game includes 200 playing cards of which 145 are distinctly different. These cards are both used as items for in-game fights and they are also used as the currency of the game. The currency can be spend on buying equipment that is placed physically on the gameboard or for buying temporary boosts for your agent. All cards are valuable in one way or another and you must wisely choose how to use them. This gives an economic aspect to the game as the number of cards at your disposal is limited.
There are small roleplaying elements in the game that make sure that you cannot use an especially powerful card early in the game. This mechanic is made to reduce the agony of an unbalanced game.
To strengthen the replay value of the game, the obstacles (walls) of the game are placed on the gameboard before the game starts. This is incorporated into the beginning of the game as a strategic element which ensures that the gameboard looks different every time you play.

There are alternative rules that among other things varies the luck factor of the game. Gamers have different needs when it comes to the luck factor. Now they have the opportunity to adjust the luck factor so it meets with their needs.

We have experimented with a new kind of artform. Every picture is a uniquely hand painted painting made by a Danish artist.

There are many tutorials on our website and we try to make tutorials on request from our fans, if we find a need for it.

The game may look complex, but most players get into the mechanics/dynamics quickly. When we attended the boardgame fair at Essen 2013, we saw that most players had understood and gotten into the mechanics after only 5-6 turns into the game.

We are in the Beta phase of a new game mode called "Vampiric Elite", which "kills" the player-elimination" part of the game. All players stay in the game until it ends, thus dealing with "Player Elimination" that some people do not like. Instead the winner is found by a unique point system that awards being a good, but somewhat aggressive, tactician. You must be able to deal the most damage possible while staying aloof of enemy attacks. The whole point system is monitored by the agents' life.
In this game mode it is possible for up to 8 players to participate.

Don't miss out on a tactical treat.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game

name: Myth: Rath Captain Pack
description:
From the publisher's website:

In dark caverns deep beneath the old buried cities of the world, lie the spawning pits of the Rath. These ponderous, lumbering rats are a perversion of the once graceful Huranii, their great eyes now filled with malice and hate. Masters of ranged combat and shadow magic, the Rath are feared by even their own kind. The shadows are not safe when Rath are nearby.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Operation Typhoon: Barbarossa Denied
description:
Sept, 1941: Army Group Center is poised to begin the final phase of the conquest of the Soviet Union, the assault on Moscow.

Although the German Army had not tasted defeat in two years of war, loses of men and material and the ever worsening weather and extended supply situation, casts a shadow of doubt over final victory.

Operation Typhoon: Barbarossa Denied is a simple 2 player game that reflects Army Group Center’s drive to Moscow in the fateful months from Sept. to Dec. 1941. The last ditch efforts by the German Army to bring the War in the East to a conclusion before Christmas. They failed!

Units may move and attack all adjacent units at the end of movement. After resolving combat, units that remain adjacent to enemy units may attack again. Stuka counter increases odds column by 1. Units have 1 side step reduction. Object of the game is to take cities and kill enemy units. Points are awarded for both. Weather in Operation Typhoon is handled in a very interesting way. As weather gets worse, movement points are deducted. Simple and effective. A typical game should not last more than 30-45 minutes at the longest. 4 pages of rules. Combat is resolved with a d6 die on the combat matrix CRT.

This is an EXCELLENT game for introducing a beginner. or to simply kill some time when both space and time are an issue.

(from the publisher's website)

name: Bonkers
description:
Cards come in four categories: fill-in-the-blank, add-ons, rhyme time, and letter perfect. In the first three, a 'keyword' is announced, and an opposing player or team tries to name the four additional words on the card that are related to the 'keyword' in the same way. That is, all four i) can fill in the blank to form a two-word phrase with the keyword, or ii) can be added to the keyword to form a new word, or iii) can be rhymed with the keyword. In the letter perfect category, the player must name the four words that fit a topic and that use a letter in the same way, eg, boys' names beginning with 'M'.

The team that reads the question also ranks the four items from easiest to hardest. The harder the item, the further forward a team moves for guessing it. Each opposing team gets one chance to name unguessed items.

name: SINS: Rise of Wrath – Battle Pack
description:
STORY:

"In the darkness of space, infernal forces are rising to the surface. Ancient energies, born in distant stars, has been welded into existence by the cosmos. Through endless time, they have been searching for a purpose. They have been searching for a place to belong, a place to inhabit. Across the constellation of stars, they found unsuspecting vessels to embody. They enforced their will upon the dust of space. Celestial beings, weak and fragile, but omniscient."

"As puppeteers, they weaved their plan, with strong strings of greed, corrupting spirits in distant realms. They grew stronger and gained lust for powers, enslaving beasts and undead creatures with their sinister play. They found their purpose within their own weakness, a prideful display, as they released wrath upon each other, for eternal dominance."

GAMEPLAY:

SINS is an aggressive push-your-luck deck-builder for two players. Every turn, you can either activate actions, gain power or give despair.

Shuffle the sins-cards together and deal 5 cards to the middle of the table to form the Realm. From here, you can buy or gain new cards throughout the game. Deal 10 starter cards to each player and draw 5 cards into your hand. The most sinful player at the table, is the starting player.

Play cards each turn to activate actions, gain power or give despair to your opponents. Push your luck and resolve for dominance. When a player has 1 dominance, that player is the winner.
mechanics: Action/Event, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Take That

name: Monopoly: Target Edition
description:
In the 2021 Monopoly: Target Edition game, players browse for Items instead of buying properties. It's about how much one can save in this Target-themed family board game. Players get to explore their happy place with a Target-themed Monopoly token. Choose Target's mascot Bullseye Dog, a shopping bag, a coffee cup, or a shopping cart.

When a player lands on an Item space, they put that Item in their adorable red Target basket. Then they'll buy their items later at Checkout on the Go or Free Parking spaces. When players pick up an Item, they might also pick up Target Circle Tokens. These double or even triple a player's Savings when they check out. Who doesn't love a deal? Compete for the coveted RedCard to double the Savings at Checkout. The player with the most Savings wins!

Includes gameboard, 4 tokens, 4 shopping baskets, 10 Target Circle tokens, 143 Savings tokens, RedCard, 18 Chance cards, 18 Community Chest cards, 2 dice, money pack, and game guide (rules).

—description from the publisher

Note: The game ends when all the Target Circle Tokens have been used; there is no player elimination, and games take about an hour.

Note 2: There was an earlier "Monopoly: Target Edition" released in 2007 which uses standard Monopoly gameplay instead (buying properties, etc.).
mechanics: Advantage Token, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Samarcanda: The Marvellous Adventures of Marco Polo
description:
Subtitled: "The Marvelous Adventures of Marco Polo"

Translated text from the game box: "The voyages of Marco Polo to the fabulous cities of the
Orient took more than ten years. To a player of Samarcanda two hours are enough,
should fortune smile, to reach the financial position to be named Doge of Venice. Precious
goods are available to all, but between the Venetian merchants and a thousand dangers stand
expensive tolls, desert raiders or the worst misfortune of all, terrible Genoan pirates just
waiting for the incautious traveler to make a false step in order to clean him out. All of these
don't even take into account the variations in market prices that, with a simple roll of the dice,
could change a fortune into ruin! Up to 6 merchants can try, traveling on earth or sea as they
prefer, this wonderful adventure, which is offered to all players who love games. The refined
graphics of Samarcanda, based on the colors gold, white and green, provide also a
visual pleasure. Moreover the simplicity of the rules, added to the wide variety of situations
that can be created, allows a pleasant passage of time, even to those who, after a hard day's
work, do not want to deal with complex rules. So we invite you therefore, on behalf of the
International Team, to return to the fantastic times of fabulous medieval merchant traders.
Upon which, amidst the experiences of day-to-day modern life, it is impossible not to regard
without nostalgia and interest."

A game about trading in the Renaissance with rules in Italian,
English, French and German. Beware the Genoese pirates!

name: Incognito: The Game of Charades
description:
The game of charades with three new twists

Players act out the provided charades and then try to stump your opponents with Bonus Tidbit questions.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: Buffalo Chips
description: Round up 2-10 players ages 6 through adult, and let the fun begin. BUFFALO CHIPS color keyed cards will send your family and friends through a Stampede or a Shoot Out, but be careful! Don't Slip On a Buffalo Chip or be caught with a Chip card. You might lose the game, but never the excitement of BUFFALO CHIPS!

name: Don't Go Overboard
description: Be the first player to place all of his magnetized sailors on board the ship. Sailors being placed on the ship can either attract or repel each other. If your sailor attracts then he is on board, if he repels then it's man overboard.
mechanics: Area Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Australian Menagerie: Tasmanian Expansion
description:
Adds new habitat - Tasmanian, 4 new animals - Eastern Quoll, Giant Freshwater Crayfish, Orange-bellied Parrot, Tasmanian Devil and new threat and management strategy cards for Cats.

Expands:

Australian Menagerie
categories: Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game

name: Guadalajara
description:
Guadalajara is a strategy game that reproduces the battle of the same name happened during the Spanish Civil War from 8th to 23rd March 1937. This was the last attemp of Franco to conquer the spanish capital, this time using the powerful Iatlian army corps to encircle Madrid from the Northeast. The battle resulted in a shocking defeat of the franquist forces.
It's a game for 2 players, one controlling the Italian forces and the franquist Brigada Marzo, with the other player commanding the units of the 4ª Division of the Army of the Republic.

name: Dyrenes hotel
description:
In this game each player receives a card with pictures of animals. The goal of the game is to fill the card with matching animal cards. The roll of a die decides how many and what type of cards you draw. The draw pile is either animal cards or action cards.

Awards

2003 Årets Familiespil, Family Game of the Year Denmark

name: The Gospel of John: Family Board Game
description:
The Gospel of John: Family Board Game is based loosely on the motion picture of the same name, although the majority of the information (and hence the game play) comes primarily from Gospel of John (found in the Christian scripture).

Players take turns moving pawns around a board following a Jesus pawn, answering trivia and performing tasks, with the goal of having the most scoring tokens when Jesus completes his journey.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Storytelling, Voting

name: Beans
description:
Buon Gioco (pronounced "bon joko") - or "Good Game" was published by Avid Press for Starbucks, and separately marketed as a classic coffee house card game from Italy and from Mexico.

From the publisher:
"Originally from Italy, BUON GIOCO is a game of skill and chance for 2 or 4 players. Played extensively wherever people gather for friendship and pleasure, BUON GIOCO is the perfect cafe companion for North American coffee lovers.
The design of the forty card deck is based on traditional European playing cards that date back to medieval times. The name of the suits in Italian are "Coppa" for Cup, "Oro" for Gold, "Spada" for Sword, and "Bastone" for Club.
For convenience as well as atmosphere, use coffee beans for scoring by collecting one coffee bean for each game point won."

Attractively packaged in a small wooden box with cardstock cover, the game includes a bag of coffee beans (for scoring, presumably not consumption!), a deck of 40 particularly attractive cards, and a small rulebook.

name: Totentanz
description: Totentanz (Dance of the Dead) is a card game with a real board game flavour. The almighty power of the dead was established in the 14th century via a dance. A dance that called the living to the dead, a dance that forced the unwilling. A dance that nobody could resists, be they young or old, rich or poor, everyone’s the same to this dance. In this game featuring intricately-rendered artwork on the cards, this concept is used and updated to modern characters. Two players let Death dance in a circle around a group of different people and show the power of death over life.

name: Operação MX-1
description:
Most likely the first "real" wargame (by today's standards) released in Brazil, it had lukewarm reception during the 80's and has been discontinued.
The game simulates a battle between two fictitious armies, using an hexagonal board and two sets of rules: basic and advanced.
This is the same Avalon Hill's Tactics II (1958), with a redesigned hexgrid mapboard.

name: Dos Trios
description:
From the dusty outposts of the Argentinian plains to the wilderness of Bolivia’s Altiplano, Dos Trios™ is the classic card game that has kept South American gauchos and señoritas entertained for generations. Relive yesteryear with the rich, linen finish of these authentic cards.

Dos Trios™ is a real thinker’s game - there’s no room for simple luck here! You’ll need to use strategy, cunning, and nerves to play your best hand. Each round has a different objective! Be careful how you play - don’t be too quick to show your hand, or your opponent will surely take advantage!

name: Cranium Jam Pack Jam
description:
Race to pack the trunk full of silly stuff
Pack a cake, guitar ... even the kitchen sink!
Spring-loaded timer adds suspense
If time runs out -- stuff goes flying!
Second-chance rounds so everyone can shine
The "pack the trunk before it pops!" game

A cactus, recliner, skateboard, birthday cake ... Cranium Jam Pack Jam has you racing the clock to pack the trunk with everything including the kitchen sink! Hurry -- if the timer goes off before you’re finished packing -- Pop! -- the spring-loaded trunk sends your stuff flying!

Can you squeeze in the cactus next to the spare tire, or will only the skateboard fit?

Players draw cards to select the items to pack, then fit them into the trunk of the toy car before the timer goes off. Quick rounds and second chances keep players on their toes. With silly sound effects, pop-out action, and unexpected items to squeeze in, packing the trunk has never been this fun!

What's in the box?
Includes a toy car, 14 packable objects, 32 game cards, score pad, and pencil.

name: A Good Lie
description:
A Good Lie combines the cunning and strategy of poker, the irreverence of liar's dice and the game of golf.

The object of A Good Lie is to create the lowest possible nine hole or eighteen hole score. This is done by:


Declaring a low score and fooling your opponents to let you keep that score
Or, by fooling your opponents to obtain LIES handicap strokes
Guessing correctly whether your opponents are lying or telling the truth in order to collect Lie Detector Cards, which can be used to lower your score
Using certain Lie Detector Cards to give yourself a second chance
Being lucky on the die roll.


Each turn, player #1 rolls a 30-sided die, concealing the result behind the Liar's Wall screen. He then decides to either tell the truth about the results of the die roll, or lie to improve the result obtained.

The other players now decide for themselves whether player #1 has told the truth or lied. Each simultaneously reveals his choice, using the provided truth/lie coin.

Player #1 now reveals his actual die roll. Results for the hole are now calculated based on how many, if any, other players were fooled. Opponents who guessed correctly are rewarded with a Lie Detector Card.

Play then passes to the right, and that player rolls to determine their score for the hole in the same manner.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Voting

name: I've Never... The Outrageous Game of Truth
description: To play, roll the die, move your playing piece, and follow the instructions on the board where you land. For example, you may be told to read aloud an I've Never Card, which might say something like, "I've never had a lemonade stand" or "I've never had a pet goldfish." You then have to admit whether the statement is true or false, for which there are further exciting or funny consequences, depending on your answer. you may have to dance, sing, imitate your best friend, spin 5 times in a circle, and answer outrageous "I've Never...®" questions. Family friendly.

name: Pikk-pakk
description: This game is played on a 9x9 grid. There are 49 balls, 24 and 24 in the color in the players and one special ball placed in the inner 7x7 grid (it can be random, or the players put their balls step by step, or they choose a starting position together). In a step a player can push all the balls in a row or a column to one direction if he/she controls more than half of those balls. The game end if the special ball has 4 neighbors of the same color (that is the winning color).

name: Picco Sortino
description:
What a mess! Fortunately, there are the little gnomes who like to clean up. The pot is in the kitchen, but one where should the pillow go? The player who is the first to put all his goods into the right room, wins. A memory game for children.

Content
4 rooms made of cardboard
16 counters
1 dice
instructions

name: Domino met de muis
description: This game, based on the German animated series Sendung mit der Maus, is similar to Picture Dominoes. However, instead of matching numbers, players have to match pictures of objects with pictures of the Mouse using those objects.

name: Gasp!
description:
Gasp! is a chaotic, extremely interactive trick-taking game for the Basic Decktet, a handful of its suited tokens and 2-5 players. Players are likely to gasp in astonishment as they watch their fortunes change with alarming frequency and rapidity.

One token in the reigning suit is awarded after each hand and the winner will be the first player to acquire 2 tokens in each of the Decktet’s 6 suits.

name: Tic-Attack-Toe
description: Tic-Attack-Toe makes tic-tac-toe cool again! Players try to get three-in-a-row before their opponent by playing with numbered X and O cards. Higher numbered cards can be played on lower numbered cards. By combining the easy to understand rules of three-in-a-row with the luck of the draw Tic-Attack-Toe is a fun, strategic game that kids and adults want to play over and over again. The Tic-Attack-Toe playing board also doubles as a carrying case to make for a great summer travel game.

name: Tangram Race
description:
From the publisher:
Tangram is a classic seven-piece dissection puzzle from China. In Tangram Race, each player has a set of tangram pieces. Pick a task card randomly and try to form the shape shown in the card. The first player to do so gets the card, and the first player to collect five task cards, wins the game!
With three difficulty levels, Tangram Race is suitable for both beginners and advanced players. The game includes 200 tasks and solutions.

name: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: Kingdoms of Men
description:
It is the swords of Men that have protected Middle-earth for countless centuries against the vast armies of Sauron. From the Horse Lords of Rohan, to the White Tower of Gondor, these men fight to protect the Free People of Middle-earth and drive back the darkness from their lands.

This 48-page Sourcebook for The Lord of the Rings contains all the rules you'll need to field an army from the Kingdoms of Men (including army lists for Minas Tirith, Rohan, the Fiefdoms, Arnor and Númenor), as well as detailed background information and scenarios.

You must possess a copy of The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game in order to use the contents of this book.
categories: Book, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: World of Tanks: Rush – AMX 12t
description: World of Tanks: Rush — AMX 12t, a promotional card for the World of Tanks: Rush base game available at conventions and through hobby stores, features a light French tank that costs 1, gives 1 resource, and has no special ability.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, World War II
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Japanese: The Game – Travel Expansion
description:
This 36-card Travel Expansion is geared to teach you words you’ll need to get around in Japan. Words like Hotel, Where, and Bathroom as well as Pay, Taxi, Fare, Train, and Ticket will make your adventures in the Land of the Rising Sun more comfortable and less stressful.

Each expansion to Japanese: The Game adds new vocabulary words, and thus the rules that go along with how each noun, verb, or particle can be placed to make a sentence.

The expansion decks are shuffled in with the main deck to accommodate more players (the game plays 2 by itself and needs either an additional core deck or an expansion to accommodate more), or just to add less common words to the mix for 1-2 players.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Minotaur Max
description:
Will you accept this quest?
Brave adventurers sought! Travel into the depths of the Minotaur's labyrinth to bring back rare ancient treasures. Be light-footed and use your torches carefully. Steal as much treasure as you can and find the exits to escape to the surface. If you survive you will be immortalized in the roll of bravery forever.

Each player has entered the minotaur's labyrinth to try and gather as much treasure as possible while paying close attention to the correct paths in order escape the changing labyrinth. A player's turn consists of 2 phases: the Player phase and the Minotaur phase. During the Player phase, the player can play cards to perform actions or attempt to escape by matching the labyrinth paths explored with the exit cards. Then during the Minotaur phase, the minotaur will move towards the player depending on how much noise the player made in that turn.

Some of the available actions available are:
Move : explore a new room
Search: search the current location for treasure
Use Items: to perform certain actions

The game ends when all players have either escaped or been captured. The player who escapes with the most treasure is the winner.

The base game will come with several scenarios.

name: Grunz, Miau & Muh
description:
Description from the publisher:

Every morning, Bruno the farmer must bring his animals to the pasture. But where are the lambs, cows, chickens, pigs and cats hiding? Only the players who press the animal sound buzzer, prick up their ears, and recognize which animal sound it plays will be able to find the animals quickly and lead them to the pasture.

Grunz, Miau & Muh is a collection of three animal games: memory, snap, and reaction.

name: Totem
description:
A simple trick-taking game for 4 players.
