description: This is Vanilla Ice's Rap Happy Rhyme to Rhythm Game. Players play rhyming cards to complete rap lines on the game board. Each card played scores points. Every time a rap line is completed, the player raps it out loud to the rhythm of the electronic beat box mike. When all the rap lines on the board have been filled, players count their points. The player with the most points wins, and raps the entire board, using the "beat box" mic. This game is a pretty funny gem from the early 90s.

name: Murder Mystery Party: Death in St James Park
description:
Another variation on the theme of murder mystery parties. Each person plays the role of a possible murder - only one of whom actually did the dastardly deed. Can the villain be unmasked?
Contents include:
- Invitations to be sent to your guests
- Complete instructions on how to host your party
- Background information on each character
- Clue sheets for each of the six rounds
- Costume suggestions
- Menu suggestions
- Tape recording of the murder
- Name tags for each guest
- Solution to the murder

name: Havoc
description:
In Havoc each player has 17 pawns which start in his home area or waiting to enter. Each turn you move three pawns one or two spaces each. The board shows a fairly complex network of spaces, most of which have arrows on them showing mandatory movement direction. Some spaces have two arrows, offering a choice. In the center the board are four spaces with stars on them.

If you move onto an opponent's piece, you capture it and place it on your "Speed Card". As your speed card fills up, you move faster: capturing two pawns allows one of your pawns to move up to three spaces while the other two may still move only one or two spaces. Capturing four pawns allows two pawns to move three spaces each, and your sixth pawn captured lets you move all three pawns up to three spaces. Once you've captured eight pawns, one may move up to four spaces, and so on.

The game is basically following the arrows and moving around the paths trying to capture opponents. You can also capture pawns by moving onto two star spaces in the same turn. These can be captured from opponents' starting spaces or from an opponent's Speed Card.

Last person with any pawns left alive wins the game.

name: Quit
description:
This is an old Parker Brothers sequence card game. The deck consists of three Block cards and five suits - A, B, C, D, and E. The suit cards run from 1 to 11 (there is no A4 or A9). The entire deck is dealt out to the players. The player to the left of the dealer starts by laying down any card from his hand. The player who holds the next higher card in the suit (regardless of where they sit at the table) must follow, laying the card down on the table (D4 followed by D5 for example). Then whoever holds the next higher card plays that, thus continuing in sequence (unless blocked) until the high card of the suit is reached.

Whoever plays the high card (or blocks) gains the Lead, and starts a new sequence by playing any suit card from his hand, thus getting rid of two of his cards. If you have a Block card and you wish to "block" a sequence, you play the next card in the sequence paired with the Block card. You then Lead the next sequence, thus getting rid of three of your cards. As the hand continues, natural blocks occur due to players leading with cards in the middle of suits. The player who plays the A5 or the A10 card wins an immediate 5 or 10 points respectively.

When a player plays his last card, the hand ends, and that player receives 1 point for every card left in the other player's hands. He also scores 5 or 10 points if the A5 or the A10 cards remain unplayed. A player still holding a Block card loses 5 points as a penalty. The first player to score 100 points wins.

name: Bing Crosby's Game: Call Me Lucky
description: Each player has a draw pile of numbered cards. The object is to capture cards placed on the board. The winner is the player who captures a set of cards with the highest combined total value. The game board is laid out in squares. On each square is printed a number from 1 to 10. There are 14 sets of cards each set a different color.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music

name: Saturankam
description: Saturankam is an ancient game from India that is similar to Sadurangam and Ashtapada. It is played on a 9x9 board of cells with a winding path that spirals to the center. The middle squares along each edge and the square in the center of the board are safe places where pieces cannot be attacked. Movement is determined by two four-sided dice. The object is to enter pieces on the middle square on one's own side of the board and race them to the center. Each player has two pieces. Pieces that are not on safe squares can be hit and must be reentered, as in Pachisi.

name: Jamaïca
description:
A magazine game from Jeux et Stratégie #9

Each player uses three ships to transport gold from ports to its island while trying to prevent others to do the same.
publishers: Jeux & Stratégie, W. Nostheide Verlag GmbH

name: Maze Craze Spy Guys
description:
From the publisher's website:

"Be a master Spy and try to search and seize the Top Secret Briefcase! Y ou must navigate your own game piece 'blindly' through a maze of obstacles to locate and seize the Case. You may only use clues and a 'Mapping Tablet' to move your game pieces through the unique maze game boards. Once you have located the Top Secret Briefcase you must get it back to the Spy Guys Headquarters to win the game. The portable game case comes with 28 unique mazes, 2 mapping tablets, 2 pencils, and instructions."

Related to:

Maze Craze Bounty Hunter
Maze Craze Backstage Pass

name: Age of Battles: Shogun – Okehazama 1560
description:
This one takes place in Japan using the "A.o.B" system with the great MINIS and I'd expect to see MORE 'Expansion' packs for them! Then maybe, those 'Mongol hordes' just might make it upon the island shores during a successful "Invade Japan!" game session.

Description from the back of the box:
The military historical game the Battle by Okehazama is based on the events that took place June 1560 in Japan, at the height of the Fighting Provinces period. It was the time when all the Japanese Samurai clans clashed in the combat for power. In the battle by Okehazama the small army of the Oda clan defeated the lmagawa troops by sudden attack. A new general Oda Nobunaga entered the combat for power.

This game is for 2-6 players. The enemy armies led by the players meet near the bay of lssa, in the valley of the Pinar river. Battle characteristics of the armies are close to the reality. Tactic maneuverings are very important in the game. Under a skillful leader a smaller army can defeat numerous enemies. You can either recreate the historic battle or change the course of the fight. Anyway you should rely not only on the number of your army but also on your leadership and war skills.

name: Totally
description:
Totally is a game of arranging numbers so that they add up to a given total. It can be totally frustrating as you struggle to find a spot for a final number, but it's always totally fascinating and totally fun.

This game plays like a numbers Take It Easy. One player randomly selects 15 of the 30 numbers available in his color, and the other players select those same numbers from their pool. Then two "key total" tiles are selected and revealed. The players then attempt to arrange their tiles in such a way that rows and columns equal one of the two key totals, with their figure based around only one of the key totals. When one player announces they are done, a three-minute timer begins and the remaining players must finish their work before the time runs out.

Scoring is done by multiplying the number of tiles used in horizontal lines by the number used in vertical lines and then subtracting five times the face value of any unused tiles. The players with the highest scores for a round receive bonus points.

The later magazine edition of the game was basically the same, but only had 20 tiles for each player and had slightly different scoring (unused tiles subtracted a flat ten points each).

name: Micro Medieval
description:
A micro game released by Tabletop Games meant to simulate a medieval warfare miniatures game using cardboard counters. Similar to their Micro Napoleonic and Micro Ancients games.

Combat units for English and French armies are included.

A tabletop is used as the battlefield and movement is given in distance (millimeters).

Missile and Melee combat is regulated with combat charts. Rules are also included for formations, pursuit and morale.

Supplements
Medieval
TTG-MA-M01 Burgundians
TTG-MA-M02 Scots
TTG-MA-M03 Italian States
TTG-MA-M04 Russian
TTG-MA-M05 Polish
TTG-MA-M06 German
TTG-MA-M07 Spanish
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: Link-Up
description: The object of the game is to score points by placing tiles so they form continuous lines. Each tile is a square with bars connecting either the opposite sides, the opposite corners, or both. The board is plastic with an 8x8 grid of circular holes, and the tiles have circular bases that fit into the holes. Each turn, a player places one of his tiles on the board and scores for any straight lines formed connecting the bars on the piece just played with the bars on adjacent pieces.

name: Combat Operations
description: A counter and hex based war game, using a diceless combat system. ComOps is a somewhat generic war game system, that can be used to play many different types of combat. This public beta 1 release includes the rules, the map, the counters, and the few tables needed. A primary goal of ComOps was to present a 'real' war gamers war game, that can be played from setup to end in a reasonable amount of time. At this time no further work is being done on ComOps.

name: The Franco Prussian War of 1870
description: A free historical card game simulating the Franco Prussian War of 1870. One player is the French Empire and the then Third Republic, the other player is the coalition of various German states dominated by Prussia. The game is free to print and play from the Ludi Popina web site.

name: Batter Up Baseball Card Game
description:
Batter Up is a Baseball card game (using the rules of baseball) consisting of 36 cards and a fold out paper "field" depicting the Baseball diamond. The cards are:

BALL (x11)
FLY OUT (x2)
STRIKE (x10)
FOUL BALL (x2)
STOLEN BASE (x1)
OUT (x3)
SINGLE (x3)
DOUBLE (x2)
TRIPLE (x1)
HOME RUN (x1)

The first player at bat shuffles the cards, turning over 1 card at a time, until he gets a hit or an out. If he gets a hit, he places the card on the indicated base. The play is carried on as in an actual baseball game. When 3 outs are made, the playing side is retired. The opposing team comes to bat and the cards are reshuffled.

Special rules can be made. For example, it is optional to advance all base runners one extra base on a single and a double. This game may also be played as a party game where players take positions on bases.

A record of the balls, strikes and outs may be kept by a member of the opposing team calling out each card as it is turned over.

name: Classic Dice Games
description:
A multitude of popular dice games:

Flip-Up - Roll 2 dice and mark off the number you rolled or any two that add up to what you rolled. Try to get all 12 numbers (1 through 12) marked off

Yacht - basically Yahtzee, just a different name as Yahtzee is copyrighted.

Bunco - A three-of-a-kind of the number that corresponds to the round (three "1's" in Round One, three "2's" in Round Two and so on.)

Ship, Captain, and Crew - Get the highest score on the total of three rolls, but you must get a 6 (ship), a 5 (captain), and a 4 (crew) in that order before any score can count

Hog - Roll 2 dice and get that many points, winner is the first to 100. However, if you get a single 1, you score nothing. If you get 2 1's, your total score goes back to 0

Hi-Dice - Score the highest amount of points based on 5 rolls, but at least one die must be set aside each roll
Poker Dice - Get the best possible poker but there are no suits and straights do not count.

Game includes large print score pads for Yacht and Bunco, 5 oversized 6-sided dice, felt-lined dice cup, flip up board, felt pad and instructions

name: Sonic Skillball
description: The Aim & Score Arcade Action Game! With Electronic Light and Sounds. A game for the entire family!

name: Teleporters
description:
From GAMES Magazine review:

On your turn, move two poles and two ports. Poles can move one or two spaces orthogonally, or they can teleport. A port has two ways of moving: It can either reorient (that is, spin so that its right angle is flush with any corner of the space it occupies), or it can glide across the board like a chess rook. A port forms a teleport by landing on a square with another of its color, with each right angle in opposite corners of the square. A teleport enclosing an enemy pole sends the pole back to one of its home spaces.

A pole teleports between any two of the following: friendly teleports, home spaces, and goal spaces (except that a pole can only teleport to a goal space from another goal space). Poles can be blocked by port walls or other poles, but they can also move between the board's left and right edges as if the edges were connected. A pole completely blocked by the opponent teleports home.

name: Big League Baseball
description: A baseball game that is spinner-activated. The spinner and all four-color charts come on one heavy-duty cardboard base. Underlying the spinner is a printed disk divided into pie sections containing realistic percentages of singles, doubles, triples, home runs, walks, strikeouts, fly outs, out-at-first (and a thin sliver for a possible triple play). Also on same gameboard, four charts: Nobody on Base, 1 on Base, 2 on Base, 3 on Base. Each chart gives results for 0, 1, or 2 outs and contains various results including: hit-by-pitch, 2-base error, out stretching a single into a double, out at 2nd, out at 3rd, five levels of double-plays, caught stealing, stolen base, one-base error, four levels of singles results, pick-off, fielder's choice, balk, passed ball, or wild pitch. Game comes with 9 plastic pegs to keep track of action. Peg charts include Runs Scored, Innings Played, Outs, and Batters (one peg on either side of home plate). Comes with two-sided "Spinner Results" sheet which lists explanations for all abbreviations describing play outcomes.

name: Venturers in Argent
description:
Taken from the games website:
Venturers in Argent is a fantasy boardgame set in the World of Argent. It is a cooperative game in which as many as five players can participate, or as few as one (thus it is suitable for solitaire play). The players take on the parts of venturers, who set out to find treasure on a dangerous enterprise called a venture. The game can be played as a single venture in one session, or as a campaign of several ventures, with the power and abilities of the venturers increasing as they prepare for their final objective: the stronghold of the Silent Mountain … and the One Who Waits.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Affenparty
description:
A jungle-themed cooperative children's game.

Theme
Baba Banana and his four monkey friends have decided to throw a party. They've got the decorations and the food, but they don't have any guests yet. So they are running, climbing and jumping through the jungle to invite the other animals. Will they be able to invite enough friends for the biggest and greatest party the jungle has ever seen?

Aim of the game
The players work together, trying to get seven or more animal tiles and three monkeys to the clearing before the game ends.

Game play
The board shows a track consisting of 18 spaces. Each of the spaces shows a different animal; the same animals are also printed on the tiles. At the center of the board there is a clearing.
The 5 monkeys are placed on random spaces. The animal tiles are shuffled and placed next to the board in a face-down stack. Players take turns drawing a tile and then look for the corresponding space on the board. Then they try to reach that space with one of the 5 monkeys. Each of the monkeys carries 1-3 fruits, and this number shows exactly how many spaces that monkey can move. If none of the monkeys can reach that space, the tile is removed from the game. If a monkey succeeds, the tile is placed on the clearing space that shows the fruit which the successful monkey is carrying. Then the player may also place the monkey on the clearing. Monkeys that have been placed on the clearing stay there for the rest of the game.

The game ends when all animal tiles have been used or all monkeys are on the clearing. If there are 7 or more animal tiles and 3 monkeys on the clearing, the players win the game. Only animal tiles accompanied by a monkey count.

name: Hop Little Frog
description:
One day four hungry frogs went hunting. When they got to the edge of the pond nearby, they each spotted a fly on the other side that they wanted to catch. The only problem was how they would get to the other side? They thought that a path of lily pads pads would be the answer, but there were not enough lily pads to go around. Their problem can be solved with the help of the die, so join them and catch the fly!

In Hop Little Frog, the frogs hop across the pond to catch the flies, but to do so they must first of all "make the lily pads grow".
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Monopoly: Surfing
description:
MONOPOLY is stoked to team up with the Surfrider Foundation to bring you the Surfing Edition of America’s most popular game board. Buy, sell and trade the most prestigious and formidable surf destinations around the world, from Hawaii’s Waimea Bay to Tahiti’s Teahupo’o. The game features stunning photography of the world’s best breaks by renowned surf photographer Jeff Divine.

Comes complete with 6 collectible pewter tokens: surfer, beach cruiser, woodie, flip flop, shark and surf wax.

A portion of proceeds will be donated to the Surfrider Foundation.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Game of Pony Express
description: This is a roll and move game based on the Pony Express. The goal of the game is be the last person with money left in the game.

name: Mercator
description: Mercator is a business and trading game for 2 to 6 players. The board is a copy of the map of the world of the geographer Strabon (60 B.C. - 25 A.D.) and encloses the Orbis Romanum (the Roman world) which agrees historically with the Roman empire in the first and second century. The game uses ideas ahead of its time for trading, development, land management, and political maneuvering.

name: Schneckenrennen
description:
Which snail will win the exciting race, roll the right colors on their dice and reach the goal first? Watch out: Not only speed counts! If you run too fast you can easily stumble and get a knot on you snail's tail... and that costs time! Therefore remember, dear snail, that more haste makes less speed, and be careful so that you reach your goal safely.

Or, as they would say in Germany:

Welche Schnecke wird wohl das spannende Rennen gewinnen, die richtige Farbe würfeln und als erste ans Ziel gelangen? Doch aufgepasst: Nich nur die Geschwindigkeit zählt! Denn wer zu schnell läuft, kann leicht stolpern und einen Knoten in seinen Schneckenschwanz bekommen... und das kostet Zeit! Darum, liebe Schnecke, eile mit Weile und Bedacht, damit du heil am Ziel ankommst.

name: Criss Cross
description:
Text from the back of the game:
A preferably long word with Y? How about x-y-l-o-p-h-o-n-s-p-i-e-l-e-r (xylophone player)? Of course d-e-s-o-x-y-r-i-b-o-n-u-c-l-e-i-n-s-ä-u-r-e (DNA) is much, much better, because it will give you a lot of points! But will it fit into the crossword grid? And where? Where is the next letter situated? You've got to be fast, because the sand in the hourglass is running. And all the other players have entered their words already...

The fast game of words for all crossword-lovers, who like to juggle with letters.

name: Monopoly: USA Greatest Cities
description: America’s favorite board game brings you the chance of a lifetime to buy, sell, and trade USA’s greatest cities from the East to the West coast. Celebrate life, liberty, the pursuit of happiness and… capitalism as you wheel and deal San Diego, Honolulu, Miami and more. Amass wealth and increase your net worth by creating USA vacation destination monopolies. Includes six collectible pewter tokens: Apple Pie, Mount Rushmore, Capitol Building, Liberty Bell, Bald Eagle & Statue of Liberty.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Contactic
description:
This game in travel format is played on a 3-piece board, 9x13 in size when assembled. Each player has 60 tiles. They come in 6 different designs, having 1-4 sides in the player's color and 0-3 sides in neutral white.

Every turn, a player draws one of his tiles and places it on the board according to the placing rules. Since the players have no tiles in hand to choose from, the chance that a tile cannot be placed (and a turn is missed) is relatively high. However, the unplayable tiles come into game later.

The game ends, when either all tiles are laid out or no further placement is possible. The player with the largest contiguous "island" is the winner.

name: Primo Calculino
description:
Description of the game from Spielbox:

Reiner Knizia, himself a mathematician, has developed a new game in the “Clevermacher” series that will engage even notorious mathphobes: Primo Calculino. The ‘hero’ in this lovingly-produced game is the seller Johann, who has lots of tasty things for sale. Ready for the big sales, Johann, represented in the game as a seven cm high wooden figure, has not only the appropriate shopping tiles but also shopping bags in different sizes. And unfortunately, not everything fits into them! Little math artists will have to figure out more than just adding one plus one to make sure that only those things that belong land in the bags. The rest just wouldn’t fit.

Primo Calculino doesn’t just add enjoyment, it also subtracts and multiplies it. And so, while playing, mathematical abilities as well as memory and concentration are built. The nice thing is that nobody outside of adults will notice.

Description of the game from Selecta Spielzeug:

A mathematical learning game with many variations.

You can put so many tasty things into your bag, but sometimes, they don´t all fit! This game will teach little mathematical wizards more than just adding up one and one.

Contents: 1 figure, 36 task cards, 40 food cards (2½ x 2½ in.), instructions

name: 3 Tage im Mai
description:
In "3 Tage im Mai" you lead a group of citizens to the Hambacher Schloss in a march for democracy.
This event actually took place in Germany 1832 and is regarded as the starting point of the democratic movement in Germany.
You move your citizens with movement cards in a system just like "Cartagena".
In order to gain new cards, you have to move backwards onto so-called gathering-points. Here you have to answer trivia questions concerning the revolution.
After a fixed length of 9 turns, the player with the most citizens in the Hambacher Schloss wins the game.

There is a special variant for "young democrats", so children from the age of 6 may play.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Der Top Aktionär
description:
In Top Aktionär (Top Stockholder) the goal is to become the richest player in the defined play-time. To achieve this goal, players buy and sell stock. Whoever buys stock, gets shares and then must pay dividends. In the game,it is possible to purchase many stocks, and to unexpectedly be tossed out of control by other players.


Bei Top Aktionär geht es darum, nach Ablauf der festgesetzten Spielzeit der reichste Spieler zu sein.
Zu diesem Zweck kauft und verkauft man Aktien. Wer Aktien besitzt, erzielt Einnahmen und muss auch Dividenden zahlen.
Im Spiel geht es darum, möglichst viele Aktien zu erwerben, aber auch immer für unerwartete Ausgabengerüstet zu sein.

name: Stage Fright
description:
Try to guess the four or five highlighted words or phrases by acting out a charades-style performance. Unlike basic charades, you may use sounds, gestures, pointing and even humming to get the answers right.

Part of the Generations Edition Party Mixers 1950s-1990s box tins.

name: Battle of Kettle Creek
description:
In February of 1779, Kettle Creek Georgia was the location of the greatest American Revolutionary battle. This was also one of the last battles to be fought before the British surrendered to the war. The object of the game is to defeat the other player’s Colonel while protecting your own.

This game is a cross between Stratego, Chess and Risk. (At least the mechanics of them are)

This is a Free Print and play game. You will need 2 dice (one White and One another color)
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Wargame

name: Sensuikan: Eastern Solomons Sept 1942
description:
Japanese Submarine Offensive in the Eastern Solomons September 1942.

Sensuikan is a simple strategic simulation of the attempt of the Japanese Sixth Submarine Fleet to prey the U.S. carrier groups engaged, during the opening days of September 1942, in covering important convoys carrying reinforcements and supplies to Guadalcanal.

Sensuikan is a solitaire game in which a single Player controls both the opposing forces. The Player will command the Japanese submarine force by playing the role of Vice Adm. Komatsu Teruhisa , who, between August and September 1942, prepared and ordered the I-boats offensive from his headquarters in Truk. By contrast, the Allied escort groups will operate in accordance with a strictly defined set of rules. The specific game scenario will allow the Player to simulate the crucial moments which led on 15th September to sink the carrier U.S.S. Wasp and to hit some units of another carrier group built around the U.S.S. Hornet. As a consequence, the Player will be able to understand the logic of a submarine force whose potential was underestimated even by the High Japanese Command, and perceive the tension of Japanese sub-commanders in their ultimate search for high estimated preys, personal glory and, most of all, respect.
Specific rules for random events, like intelligence resources or air raids, will add to the realism of the game. Concurrently, these elements will also offer the opportunity to examine through a different perspective, limits and contradictions to the Imperial Japanese Navy management of its ‘silent service’ during one of the most intense (and largely unknown) phases of submarine warfare of the entire War in the Pacific.
categories: Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Auf Dem Lande
description:
"It's Grandma Edna's birthday and she longs for her favorite, apple pie. The family gets up early in order to gather all the ingredients from around the farm; apples have to be picked, the grain ground and the cow milked. Everybody is in a hurry as they all want to be the first to surprise Grandma Edna with their apple pie.

Who will, with a bit of luck and a good overview, be the quickest to collect all the ingredients?"

This game may be played cooperatively or competitively. Players choose a final food (pie, sandwich, etc) and must assemble the ingredients from around the farm. Some items are one step, such as gathering apples, some are multi-step such as feeding hay to the cow to obtain milk which is then processed into cheese.

Bonus advanced instructions for including cow patties into the equation, possibly a gaming first!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Dirty Laundry
description: The game where players let it all hang out! Which 3 of the Seven Dwarfs are most like me? Who are my 3 heroes? Players write answers they think others will write on their wipe off board. If they know their friend well, their answers will match and they collect socks from the laundry basket. Whoever forms the most sock pairs wins!

name: G.I. Joe Card Game
description: A card game for 2 to 6 players, in which the object is to get rid of your hand by playing one card per turn. The cards all portray different G.I. Joe characters, and are either numbered or marked with a star. Players try to match the current face up discard by either picture or number. Players who cannot play must draw from the discard pile. Play stops when one player is out of cards or when no one can play, and points are awarded based on remaining holdings.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, World War II

name: Battle for Guadalcanal
description:
Published in Japan, but sold briefly as a ziplock in the US at the Origins convention, this is a wargame of the crucial October battles at Guadalcanal. In fact, the game's subtitle is "Bloody October."

Game includes a Masahiro Yamazaki map of Henderson Field and the surrounding area done in a somewhat stylized manner. There are 264 counters including several surface ships and planes. The Japanese rules are twenty pages of 8.5 x 11, done in a sepia tone. including some advertisements for the Japanese edition of Command magazine. The English rules are sixteen black and white xeroxed pages, also 8.5 x 11 unbound, although two sided and perfectly readable.

name: Speedy Gonzales
description: Speedy Gonzales is an original race game, where chance has a rather large part, but also tactics are important. The game is played in two phases. In the first phase, the players set their water-gourds - small tokens - along the route. In the second phase, the race itself, each player on his or her turn is confronted with a difficult choice -- either drink one or more water-gourds, and then roll a die for as many gourds drunk (with distribution - 0, 1, 2, 2, 3, 4) and advance the number indicated, or advance one space without using a water-gourd. Players can collect water-gourds by landing on spaces with them, but cannot carry more than three at the same time. For those not far-sighted enough to plan for the future, some wells are available along the way.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Frog
description:
One of Haba's Mini-Spiels that come in a small tin and contain small wooden pieces.

A flicking game for 2 to 4 jolly jumping players. Contains 4 sets of wooden frogs and matching coloured flicking disks. All players go simultaneously in an attempt to be the first to flick their frog back into the pond (the empty tin)

name: Schmetti Coloretti
description:
From rules booklet:

"Colour and pattern recognition and a bit of luck with the dice are what you need to collect the lovely brightly coloured butterflies. This game goes a step further and not only promotes colour recognition but also presents the secondary colours orange, green and purple in a playful manner. Learning colours with the aid of the transparent colour is 'child's play'

Each player is given a butterfly. The butterfly cards are stacked face down on the table and the dice is put down beside it. The butterfly wings are spread out on the table and each player may take a butterfly card and put it down face up in front of him.

The youngest player throws the dice. If the colour or pattern that comes up on the dice is shown on the butterfly card, he may put the wings of that colour onto the butterfly. Each butterfly consists of three pairs of wings, which can be a colour with two patterns or two colours with one pattern. On some butterfly cards, the colour or pattern must be mixed to get the right colour or the right pattern."

name: Corsa Tris
description:
Corsa Tris

This is an Italian edition of the Jockey horse racing game.

You will bet and you will move the horses during the races trying to win as much money as possible.

Use your cards correctly and try to anticipate your opponents moves

name: Monopoly: New York Giants Superbowl XLII Champions
description: Themed Monopoly based on the football team, the New York Giants and their victory in Super Bowl XLII in January 2007. The 6 collectible pewter tokens are: Linebacker, Quarterback, Football on a tee, Referee's Whistle, Giants helmet, and a Cleat. 60-minute game play option makes for a shorter/quicker game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Kingdoms of the Middle Sea
description:
Each player takes on the management of an independent kingdom that has its capital on one of the four continents surrounding the Middle Sea. Using military power, economic might and religious influence players vie to increase the size of their kingdoms. Players must also guard against unrest, which could cause rebellion or even civil war to break out. With several paths to victory, players may choose peaceful economic expansion, military invasion, religious unrest or a combination of all three to defeat their rivals.

The requires one piecepack, a box of kitchen matches or small wooden/plastic rods to represent goods, roads and ports and about fifty pennies (or tokens) to represent gold.

Rules can be found on the Piecepack Wiki.

Game System

Piecepack Game System

name: Around the World in 80 Days
description: A card game based on the classic Jules Verne adventure tale of the same name. The players compete to be the first to travel forty Units of Distance, with a major victory being scored if a player finishes the trip in ten turns (the equivalent of eighty days in game time). The players travel by playing cards representing modes of transportation. The euphemistically named Adventure cards, representing various calamities, may be played on opposing players to impede their progress.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Novel-based, Print & Play, Travel

name: Green Alligators: Rings & Things
description:
Green Alligators is that wonderful little "I'm thinking of" card game, but this one has pictures so you can't change your mind part way through the game!

Play with your little ones while doing other things around the house. Just take a look at your card and start giving clues. They will delight in trying to guess what your card is. Then it's your childs' turn to give clues.

It is a non-competitive activity for 2 players, or it becomes competitive when the "big kids" try to out guess the others!
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game

name: Hey You in the Jail!
description:
"Rules for Small Scale Battles in the American West, 1850-1890."

A 23 page rulebook of old west skirmish rules (20-100 figures on each side) designed for use with the 15mm Peter Pig Wild West miniature figures.

name: Gnosis
description: Interesting board looks like an abstract pyramid: one ground and to levels with fields to move. Each player tries to reach with his 22 wooden cylinders special fields to get 22 victory points. But the nice look disappoints in play, it's boring cause of no real strategy playing. Every player tries to run and reach some special fields with his figures and collect the 22 points.

name: MSK 5 Extension Kit for 1829 (Northern & Southern Boards)
description:
The 18xx MSK 5 extension kit adds 8 tiles: 2 of #55 (yellow), 2 of #56(yellow), 2 of #69 (1853-style, not 1830 style -yellow), and 2 of #11 (green), with a half-page of rules for their use.

Expands:

* 1829
* 1829 Northern Board

name: The Great Crusade
description:
The Great Crusade is a roll-and-move game which starts as a puzzle and a big cardboard castle/tower. The players construct the board by putting together the puzzle, and then roll-and-move to see who gets to the dragon's hiding place first.
The Castle constitutes the game box, and the whole package is called The Enchanted Castle Adventure Play Set. Included are rules for "The Memory Game", using the cards and tokens.

name: Industry, The New Zealand Game
description:
Industry - The New Zealand Game, teaches about geography, economics, history & about the people who helped shape the country.

Objective of the game is to be the first to complete all three of your milestones - Placing all your industries, collecting 5 commodities, & collecting 15 coins.

To complete your milestones, you need to place industries on the main board. Industries generate commodities (via dice roll) that can be sold for coin. Coin can be used to place more industries, & so on.

As you build your industrial empire, you'll experience the events that shaped New Zealand & its economy. You'll learn some basic economics & a lot about New Zealand's history & geography.

Home Page: http://www.newzealandgame.co.nz
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Trading

name: Sulawesi
description: Players simulate the planting and harvesting of the rattan palm in Sulawesi, Indonesia. A player's turn essentially consists of two parts: A move in which one of the player's meeples moves either on a path or through the jungle, cutting down all or some (or none) of the rattan on the way; this costs rattan itself. Afterwards, the player rolls four dice to plant four new rattan plants anywhere on the board, but only in places adjacent to as much rattan as one die shows. Whoever reaches the sum of 18 rattan pieces first, wins.

name: Mathador
description:
Mathador is a mathematical educational game.

You move trough the board answering arithmetic questions and resolving mathematical quizzes.

Home Page: http://www.mathador.fr/ (French)

name: El Alamein 1942
description:
A wargame about the Battle of El Alamein.

The game uses rules of the B35 (Battles of World War II 1943-1945) system designed for dealing with medium battles of World War II. Counters represent battalions, one hex represents 1000m, one turn represents 8 hours.

name: Was ist Was: Das Quizspiel
description:
A mixture of board game and trivia game. The players move with train and planes across a map of the world, collecting various knowledge chits. At various times, a quiz round is hold, where the players can use the chips and their knowledge to gain points. There are 4 themes for the trivia questions - history, science & technology, nature & animals, geography.

The board game part is quite simple; move the pawn to a place with a chit, or draw a plane or a joker if you have none. Once one player has 3 chits of the same color, or the last chit of a color gets drawn, a quiz round occurs.

For the trivia round, a card is turned up with a question and 12 possible answers; an unknown number of them is right (example: which of these towns were members of the Hanseatic League). Each player can now use his knowledge chits of the proper color to bet on the answers he assumes are correct (one chit per answer) and score points.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: $ue Me! The Classic Game of Lawsuits
description:
$ue Me: The Classic Game of Lawsuits is designed to simulate the strategy and craftiness employed by attorneys as they practice their livelihood. Whether you choose to counsel the plaintiff or the defendant, prepare for some surprisingly interesting facts, unlikely witnesses, and some outrageous characters!

$ue Me is a hilarious parody of this favorite American pastime. Whether you are collecting facts, studying the law, or trying to bluff your opposing counsel into settling, you'll enjoy "playing lawyer" all the way to the courthouse! (from box)

name: Escape With Honour
description:
Escape with Honour (Fuga de Honor) is a game where the players try to escape from a Prisoner Camp in WWII, it is heavily based on the movie The Great Escape.

The player which manages to escape with more prisoners, or with the ones with higher Honour rating is the winner. Several tunnels can be dug in the same game.

This game was on the Design Contest Granollers 2009

Fuga de Honor es un juego donde cada jugador llevará el papel de uno de los comandantes aliado en un campo de concentración en la Segunda Guerra Mundial, los comandantes han elegido escaparse, y se crea una carrera para ver quien consigue sacar del mismo campo a los prisioneros más notorios. El juego esta influenciado por la película La Gran Evasión

Este juego fue presentado al concurso de Diseño de Juegos de Granollers 2009.
categories: Print & Play, Racing, World War II
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Trading, Worker Placement

name: Astérix présente Obélix contre Hattack
description: Each player is a character Gauls: Falbala, Panoramix, Asterix or Abraracourcix. After launching the 2 dice, each moves through the forest in search of information, to be 1 to find the sorcerer Hattack. Along the way, our heroes encounter enemies or friends, Romans, wild boar and rotten fish, which help them or slow down!

name: A-mazing rooks
description:
Material: a double 6 dominoes set (with gaps separating the halves of each domino), a pair of rooks of different colors, a rectangular board and two rings.

Rules: the players set the dominoes randomly upon the board, and choose their departure and arrival squares upon the opposite edges of the board. Then they move their rooks each turn accordingly to the number of steps indicated by the domino upon which their rook sits, changing direction each time they meet a gap. First player either to reach his arrival square, block his opponent from moving or capture the opposing rook wins the game.

name: Howzat: The Cricket Game For Enthusiasts
description:
A new and exciting cricket game that reproduces team and individual scoring as found in top level cricket.

Play your own TESTS and ONE DAY series.

Suitable for the enthusiast and beginner alike - where the rules are similar to the "real" game.

Six different scoring rates allows variety while increased risk of dismissal with the higher scoring rate provides exciting matches.

Not a computer simulation - as YOU the captain determine tactics and scoring rates.

No need for dice, tokens or game board.

Suitable for commuters,kids travelling in the car, as well as play in the comfort of home.

name: Castle Clash
description:
In castle Clash each player uses one suit of a deck of cards (eg hearts) to build and populate their castle in an attempt to protect their king. The Queen and Knave can both be given special abilities to help protect their King.

Players then choose combinations of dice to attack the other player's castle in the hopes of taking out their king. You must be careful, however, because an attack that fails could cause you to lose your ammunition ... or worse yet - give it to your opponent.

Careful planning and a bit of luck are important if you are going to have the last King standing.

name: Conflict of Heroes: First Men In – Normandy 1944
description:
First Men In will be the fourth stand-alone title in the best selling Conflict of Heroes series and follows in the footsteps of Awakening the Bear!, Storms of Steel!, Price of Honour, and Guadalcanal. Each game in the series uses the same core rules system, so it’s easy to advance from one game to the next!

First Men In covers the actions of the 82nd, 101st, and 6th Airborne Divisions in Normandy 1944.

The Conflict of Heroes system offers a unique blend of playability and realism.
Fun: Quick-paced simultaneous play keeps you in the action all the time!
Fast: Scenarios can be played in as little as half an hour or as long as 2 hours.
Easy: You can teach a new player how to play in under 5 minutes!
BIG: The high quality maps & counters are BIG and easy to read. The counters are 1" square!
Multi-player: Scenarios are included that are playable by 1 - 4 players. Yes, we have custom made solo firefights with this one!
Historically Accurate: Learn the unique tactics and logistics used by each side as you experience the same battlefield challenges real commanders faced!

Part of the Conflict of Heroes series.

Other games in the series:

Conflict of Heroes: Awakening the Bear! – Russia 1941-42
Conflict of Heroes: Storms of Steel! – Kursk 1943
Conflict of Heroes: Price of Honour – Poland 1939
Conflict of Heroes: Guadalcanal – The Pacific 1942

name: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
description:
Tiger's electronic Who Wants to be a Millionaire? table-top game brings all the excitement of the hit TV quiz show into your home. One to six players compete for £1,000,000. Lights, music, sound effects, and Chris Tarrant's voice add to the drama. Just like on TV, you have 3 lifelines - Fifty-fifty, Ask the Audience, & Phone-A-Friend - to get a little help!

Contents:
Electronic table-top unit
100 double-sided question cards
90 cheques
categories: Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Gotham:  Building the American City
description:
Gotham is a tile-laying game set around the turn of the twentieth century. Players take turns laying tiles to complete city blocks, which they can them claim for points. More residences on each block means more points. And civic improvements -- such as churches and schools -- can boost the value of a block. But watch out: homes can only be built where commerce supports it. And urban blights -- like jails and slums -- can reduce a profitable city block into a landlord's nightmare.

This is a free print and play game. It uses graphics from old insurance maps, and produces a lovely tabletop!

name: Ben 10 Alien Force Trading Card Game
description:
Based on the second Ben 10 series, each card in this game represents a character from the show, including Ben and Gwen Tennyson, Kevin Levin, and the aliens Ben turns into, as well as the enemies they fight to protect earth.

Players each play one card per turn, which engages the enemy in battle. Each card has a series of Battle Elements, as well as which battle element the opposing character will use that turn. The character with the highest battle value is victorious, and the loser draws a number of cards based on the damage dealt. The winner is the player who makes their opponent draw their last card.

name: Fruit Salad
description:
A match-up card game for the whole family.

Players try to match 3 different or identical fruits to score points.
Similar to rummy, this game is easy to learn and play and targeted for younger childrens.

It's a free print and play game that I made for my daughter.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Print & Play

name: Vampires' Dance
description:
For 7000 years, from the time of the first civilization through imperial Rome, the Dark Ages and on to the present day, two vampires must strive together to unite the rebellious forces of Vampirekind, knowing the thirst for ultimate power lurks in the heart of every vampire and in the end, only one can rule.

Play moves through a unique combination of significant years that dramatically affect each game. Each player must skillfully balance their present needs, their alliance and their long-term agenda for dominance.

Vampires' Dance was a free print-and-play card game developed as part of a BGG competition.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Horror, Print & Play

name: Tutela
description: Players control groups of postilions, who have to arrive to their goals as soon as possible. Each hex on the board has a number on every side; a roll of a die decides which direction a postilion can leave. The first player wins who arrives with all his/her postilions to their goals.

name: Monopoly: Hans Anders
description: The famous Monopoly game. The theme of this Monopoly game is the dutch glasses company Hans Anders. In honor of their 25 year existence, all the company employees got an edition.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Gaston Game
description:
It's up to you and your ladybug helper to rid your beautiful flower of those pesky aphids.

In this rummy variant, created for younger players and families, players collect different sets of coloured ladybugs. For each set laid, your ladybug is moved to a leaf. All aphids that are on that leaf become ladybug lunch and can be removed from your flower. The first player to rid their flower from all the aphids is the winner!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Print & Play

name: Unocitta
description:
Unocitta is a 3HOUSE territory-based war game for 2-5 players using Icehouse pieces and a Uno deck. The ever-changing gameboard is made up of Uno cards and is created by the players during the game. Icehouse pyramids are used to indicate player card control. Players complete for control of city blocks in the Martian city of Unocitta. The goal is to completely control a connected trio of cards which are either Three-of-a-Kind or three consecutive numbers of the same suit, thereby gaining control of the city.

It is inspired by Zark City.

name: Das große Windjammer Spiel
description: Players travel from port to port on the large game board, bringing along goods or passengers. Passengers pay upfront, while goods have to be bought and sold according to price charts. A ship that cannot be filled completely has to carry ballast, which has to be paid for. The richest player at the end is the winner.

name: Ambush Valley: A Force on Force Theater Book for the Vietnam Conflict
description:
From the back of the book:

Ambush Valley takes Force on Force players to the deadly battlegrounds of the Vietnam conflict. From the flooded paddies to the jungle choked hills and death-haunted deltas, Ambush Valley provides players with all the theater specific rules they need to recreate engagements of the Vietnam era, including new campaign rules that allow you to follow the evolution of a platoon as it takes part in a multi-scenario campaign.

The designers of Ambush Valley have taken great pains to ensure that playing the VC is as challenging and fun as playing the Free World forces. VC players will truly feel as if they are lords of the jungle and masters of the night as they frustrate their heavily armed opponents with hit-and-run ambushes and booby traps!

Example organizations and vehicle write-ups for:
- US Army
- USMC
- ROK
- ANZAC
- CIDG
- VC Local Force
- VC Main Force
- NVA Infantry
- NVA Sappers

Expansion rules for:
- Campaign Rules
- VC Tunnel Networks
- Tunnel Rats
- CS Gas
- Night Fighting
- Theater specific weapons - M79, M60, M14 Modified
- Booby Traps
- Riverine Operations
- Point Men
- Kit Carson Scouts
- Spooky Gunships
- Claymore Mines
- Improvised Alarms
- And much more!

Ambush Valley is a supplement for Force on Force: Modern Wargaming Rules. Force on Force is required to play.
categories: Book, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Vietnam War, Wargame

name: Tower of Babel
description: Stack the tile up into a single stack. This game is an adaptation of the traditional card solitaire game of the same name. A turn in the game is performed by drawing a new tile, using it to create a new stack at the right end of the line and then moving stacks of tiles, placing them on the top of stacks to their left in the line.

name: Powerhouse
description:
In Powerhouse each player is the head of a crime syndicate that's yearning to take control of The City. To gain influence you'll need to infiltrate various authority powerhouses with your Minions. He who controls the powerhouses will dominate and be the one and only real authority in The City!

Powerhouse is an area control boardgame where players take turns to move one of their Minions to a certain place in The City. When you have the mayority in key locations (powerhouses), new powers will be unlocked for you to use. Players will feel like mafia crime lords that try to bribe, talk and fight their way to the top, using only their followers.

The first edition is a free print and play version.

name: Ritual
description:
Introduction:

Ri+Val (Ritual) is a game of strategy based on the Books of Rituals.
The books are collections of rituals, where each page is an ancient manuscript with which you can tackle your opponent.
In Ritual every player embodies the spirit of an Immortal Sorcerer who must demonstrate his magical abilities and strategic skills.
Each book is protected by 5 seals: once they are destroyed the Sorcerer can take possession of the opponent's Book:
the ultimate goal is to control as many books as possible becoming the most powerful sorcerer in History!

Setting:
Millenias ago, an ancient powerfull civilazation was at its most high evolution point. All of its society was based on the magic and spiritual power of Nature. There were five Guilds,
Earth, Fire, Water, Air and the Guil of Destiny which rulled them all with justice and equity.
One day Evok, the demon spirit of the Abyss, escaped from his century long imprisonment. He promised revenge over the ones who chained him for so long in Darkness.
Gathering all sorts of evil souls and demons he attacked with fury the Capital of that ancient world.
The flames reached the sky, floods destroyed the land and everything seeemed near to an end...
The most powerfull Sorcerers then united their powers for the final battle against Evok: after an epical fight the evil spirit was resealed in his Jail forever.
Unfortunatly, that ancient world was destined to extinction, therefore the Sorcers wrote down on books all their knowledge and magic power.
Now these books have returned to chose the future of this world: who will be the most powerfull Sorcerer?!

General Game Rules:
Every player has a book which contains 33 Rituals
Evey book is "protected" by 5 Seals (this can be read as every player has 5 life points)
The Rituals are devided in Curses, Blessings and Summonings
which use Runes to be cast in to play.
They also have Element Points and Seal points which show the
power of every single Ritual.

Every turn you have 5 Runes to use.
The Turn is divided into
1-Casting Phase:
put into play the Rituals

2-Combat Phase
fighting phase

3-Closing Phase
resolution of combat

This is the general description of the game's rules,
shortly it will be available on the website.

name: Haiku: The Card Game
description:
Revised for 2012, Haiku: The Card Game is a system that supports 6 different rule variants in the base game. Originally, Haiku: The Card Game only played like the variant mentioned below named Haiku Hustle, which makes a good party game but experienced gamers demanded more, as did the designer.

While the core of the game, forming Haiku from the cards you collect, remains the same across all six variants, each of the six different rule sets change how you do that dramatically.

Haiku Helpers
In this collaborative version, designed for younger gamers, players are awarded points for completing lines in a Haiku both in front of them and other players. The game is over once all players have a completed Haiku in front of them.

Haiku Hustle
One of the simplest game modes, this version focuses on completing Haiku’s quickly and the winner deciding who made the best Haiku. This version works great in a party setting or as an introduction to Haiku.

Haiku Rummy
The quality, as well as quantity, of Haiku plays a major factor as an end of the game
scoring round may determine a winner based on the quality of their best Haiku.

Haiku Auctions
Players outbid one another for a chance to recite their Haiku in front of the Emperor and gain Favor points. In the end, only the player who scored the most valuable favors will win.

Haiku Seasons
In this version, special Season Cards allow players to retain parts of their Haiku for points while a simultaneous action mechanic introduces special voting rounds.

Haiku Stackers
A quick paced abstract variant which focuses on building up or breaking down the
Syllable Cards in a communal Haiku to maximize your point value.

name: Le jeu des fruits
description:
In Le jeu des fruits you have to get rid of all of your cards. There are six sorts of fruit on the cards: pears, bananas, plums, strawberries, oranges or pineapples. Each fruit is now 0-5 times on the cards.

A player must always play a card that has more fruit on it then the previous card that has been played in one of the fruit categories. For example, if the visible card shows two pears, three plums and a banana, you can play any card that contains three or more pears, two or more bananas, four or more plums.

name: Звездный адмирал (Star Admiral)
description:
The game is dedicated to the conflict between two space fleets. "Admiral" is a strategic wargame with die rolls.
Players command a fleet of space ships with different characteristics and abilities. Ships can move only by order of the command ship if they are within command range. For every movement or attacking maneuver player spends a command point.
In addition, players can use the event cards to influence the course of the battle. The game objective is to destroy a minimum of 5 enemy ships.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Supervivencia
description:
A game about survival. The players represent a group of survivors of a helicopter crash in the middle of the Amazon rainforest. Each player has eigth starting objects and the goal of the game is finding nearest village (the end of the board). The first player to succeed wins.

Using the dice to advance, every now and then some player lands on a red dot, when this happens a "situation card" is revealed an readed out loud: some situation cards presents the player with opportunities while other with problems, for example you may need some object to advance, or some object to affect other players. Some cards represents goblal situations that affect all the players.

Also there's some trading and bluffing element in the way of how the game manages objects. Note: i got this game as a present for chrismas in 1993 but there's no record of the year of publishing whatsoever.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Alamo 1836
description:
Alamo 1836 is a solitaire wargame (but it can eventually be played by two), published in Vae Victis #97 (February 2011), about the key episode of the thirteen days siege of the fort.

The A4 map is divided into areas. The game includes a sheet of 80 counters. Each texan counter represent 10 soldiers or 1 cannon. Each mexican counter represent 80 soldier or 1 cannon. there are also counters for each officer: Travis, Bowie, Crockett, Santa Anna, Cos, Duque, Romero, Juan Morales.

The player is in charge of Texan defenders of Alamo, The rules manage the actions of the Mexican army.

There is not a limited number of turns: the game ends when all the defender are eliminated. Victory is given by the number of Mexican conters eliminated.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: SOS Jungle
description:
Progressive game with a favourite theme, where children help baby animals find their parents in a jungle with look-alike paths riddled with obstacles.
Games begins with the closed board. Players roll 2 dice (number die and color die) and move on the board, open the tokens if it match with color die until they are able to go through the whole jungle and bring the lost baby animals safely to their mothers!

Contents:

1 colourful game board
2 big foam dice,
35 tokens,
6 large wooden markers

name: Pyramids in My Pocket
description:
One player, the Disciple, must find out which pyramids the other has hidden in his pocket, while the other, the Master, tries to prevent the first from guessing.

On their turn, the disciple asks for a certain color or size. If available, the Master gives them a matching pyramid which they must drop in an Icehouse tube.
On the Master turn, they will give the Disciple any pyramid to drop into the tube.

The game ends either when the Disciple guesses which three pyramids the master has hidden or when the stack of pyramids reaches over the edge of the tube.

name: Scrapok
description:
Scrapok is a card game which mixes the spirit of competition of a game of bet such as the famous Poker with the reflection of a game of words.
The aim of the game is to take the chips of other players having the longest word with private and common cards or at least to make the other players believing it. The cards are discovered in several step where gamer must bet, bluff, raise, fold.
Scrapok is played with chips and special cards with letters and 4 signs Heart, Diamonds, Spades, Clubs

At the beginning, each player recive 5 cards. At the end of the first round of betting three cards are turned over and seen by all players, then, in each of the following two rounds of betting, another card is emerging. At each round of betting and depending on their games, players fold, call, bet, raise, check as poker.
At the end, players not fold must form the longest word. In case of equality, color cards and signs make up the tie.

name: Critical Hit! - Volume 4, No. 1
description:
Volume 4, Number 1 of Critical Hit Magazine comes with new expansions for Advanced Squad Leader.

Included are the following articles:
- Fighting Soldiers from the Sky (ASL paradrops)
- Big Cat's Den (Designer Notes and play notes for that scenario)
- Cold Reception (Scenario replay of that scenario)
- Dictum Concentrate (ASL strategy article)
- SW Teams and MG Crews (variant rules)
- The Weapons Pit (variant rules)

There is also a countersheet with a few new vehicles and the "Weapons Pit"

Also, it contains the following scenarios:
CH73: THE STAND OFF; 18 September, 1941; Outside of Romny, Russia
CH74: TROTEVAL FARM; 24 July, 1944; Near Verrieres, France
CH75: THE BIG CAT'S DEN; 19 August, 1944; St. Lambert-Sur-Dives, France
CH76: HURTGEN HELL; 6 October 1944; Hurtgen Forest, Germany
CH77: DROP ZONE A; 24 March 1945, Two miles west of Hamminkeln, Germany
CH78: THE OUTSKIRTS OF LEMBERG; 12 September 1939; Lemberg, Poland
CH79: BAR's AGAINST PANZERS; 26 December 1944; Verdenne, Belgium
CH80: CUT THE LINE; 17 December 1941; Route 1 near Ragay, Bicol Peninsula, the Philippines
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Mondrago
description:
Visit Mondrago on VideoGameGeek, too. The version allows to play the game with two players sharing a mobile phone or tablet device.

Two opponents play on a board with 5 x 5 fields. Each player has 4 pawns. The pawns are aligned on the opposite borders. Both players have a pair of pawns on each side at the beginning of the game.

In alternating manner players move one of their pawns to an empty adjacent field next to it. You can move in any direction: vertically, horizontally, and diagonally, too. Jumping is not possible.

Aim is to build a perfect square with own pawns (while shouting out and announcing MONDRAGO then). These perfect squares can be aligned in parallel to the edge of the board or be diagonally aligned or be oblique aligned as well.

A quite similar game developed independently from Mondrago (1992) is Teeko (1945). It could somehow be called a predecessor maybe...

Another game that fits in that row is Artyom Tchebotaryov's Quartetto (2008). More being a successor although developed independently, too.





Game

Board Size

Pawn moves like...

Winning Condition: Pawns form a...



Mondrago

5x5

King in Chess

rotated and non rotated square (any size)



Teeko

5x5

King in Chess

straight line or non rotated square



Quartetto

8x8

Rook in Chess

rotated square larger than defined minimum size
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement

name: Kaiju City
description:
Kaiju City is constantly plagued by giant rampaging monsters. For this reason, the city is always rebuilding itself in the hopes of fending off the latest giant monster attack. Will this be the end of Kaiju City or will the monsters be defeated? Pick a side and play against your friends to decide the fate of Kaiju City!

In Kaiju City 2-6 players divide into two teams. One team controls four titanic skyscraper-toppling monsters, the other directs the efforts of Kaiju City to defend itself and drive off its invaders.

The monster team stomps their way through the city destroying as much as they can as quickly as possible using special powers like poison breath and causing earthquakes. Destroy the city and the monsters win! This team provides a lighter gaming experience allowing monster players to focus on stomping their way to victory.

The City team draws and places tiles allowing them to manage resources and mobilize the military to engage and destroy the invaders. Kill four monsters and the City team wins! This team provides a more strategic gaming experience as the city players must choose their tile placement carefully as well as managing their resources to ensure that they have what they need to drive the monsters from their beloved Kaiju City.

Experience an asymmetrical game design and have several tons of fun crashing through buildings and zapping monsters with your lightning cannon!
categories: City Building, Dice, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Monopoly: Sindelfingen
description: Monopoly set in Sindelfingen, Germany. All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Med nebb og klør
description:
This is a trivia game that comes with a book series that deals with facts. With every book you get a pack of "question cards" that expands the deck.

There is also a deck of "animal cards". To solve these cards you have to mime the animal that is pictured.

Unlike most trivia games you move along the path by "moving cards". You get two "moving cards" if you solve one animal or question card. You have to figure witch "moving cards" you have to use to get you faster to the end.

name: ARK: The Great Race
description:
ARK the Great Race is a Family Board game that can be played from 2 to 6 players. The age group that we have suggested is 8 years and up, however younger children as young as 6 still can grasp the concept of the game. The game consist of 6 Noah figures, large playing board, 336 playing cards, 6 Ark pieces with card holders, 2 card trays and dice.

The object of the game is to collect as many animal pair cards from as many coloured regions in the time allocated. To start the game each player positions his Noah piece and Ark to correspond with the coloured starting icon on the board. Each player then rolls the dice; the highest roll starts s first. As you move around the game board you will come across 3 different icons; 1. Coloured Region spots, 2. Rainbow spots and 3. Question mark spots.

Landing on any 1 of 7 coloured region spots will entitle you to receive a corresponding coloured animal card. These animal cards consist of male, female and paired animals. Each colourfully illustrated animal card is unique to its region and comes with 3 descriptive facts and animal sound. When you pick up an animal card you must inform the rest of the players what the animal is without revealing its sex. These cards must be collected in pairs and placed in your Ark to be protected. Unpaired cards are placed face down in front of each player until such time the corresponding male or female card is collected.

Rainbow spots are randomly placed around the playing board. Landing upon one of these icons allows the player to receive a Rainbow card. These cards can alter the course of the game in a very exciting way. This card set consists of good cards and not so good cards. The good cards can offer the player protection, extra animal cards and the chance to disadvantage your opponents. The not so good cards can damage your Ark and allow other players a chance to take your animal pairs which are no longer protected by a completed, undamaged Ark. Rainbow cards can dramatically change the outcome of any game in the dying minutes.

Question mark spots allow the player to win other players animal cards by correctly guessing not only the animal card but the correct sex. Guessing correctly also entitles you to another turn. When you land on a question mark spot you can ask any other player 1 question. If you are having difficulty remembering who has what animal card you may chose to ask that player to read any 1 of 3 animal card facts on that card. Remembering other player’s animal cards will definitely give you an advantage in game play.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Novel-based, Religious
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Crystal Clash: Light vs Darkness
description:
Crystal Clash is an easy-to-pick-up yet tremendously strategic card game for two players. One player picks the Light Deck and the other plays the Darkness Deck.

The goal of the game is to bring your opponent down to zero Crystals in their Crystal-Pool.

Each player starts with 10 Crystals (represented by 10-sided dice) and plays Characters, equips them with magical Relics and has them perform powerful Abilities. Your Crystals double as "Life Points" and resources.

At the beginning of your turn you draw 3 cards from your deck, then you may discard a card from your hand and add a number of Crystals to your Crystal-Pool equal to the Crystal Value of the discarded card (which doubles as cost to play the card from your hand). Then, in Main Phase, you may play Characters and Relics and have your Characters attack the opponent. Each unblocked attack results in 2 Crystals being removed from your opponent's Crystal Pool. If at any point a player has no more Crystals left in their Pool, they lose the game immediately.

Crystal Clash consists of two preconstructed, well balanced decks with 40 UNIQUE cards each. All the cards are illustrated in Anime-Style by Manchen Yang (the Darkness Deck) and Laurie Thomas (the Light Deck).


This game is a cooperative effort by Andreas Propst and Nora Propst, Andreas' younger sister.

If you want to take a look at all 40 different Darkness Cards please visit

http://ap.o-nan.org/2012/11/crystal-clash-darkness-deck-all-...

If you want to take a look at all 40 different Light Cards please visit

http://ap.o-nan.org/2012/11/crystal-clash-light-deck-all-car...
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Commodity Speculation, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Express 01: Merseburg Promokarte
description:
With the Merseburg Promokarte is Merseburg (hometown of "Spiele-Schmiede)part of the game. It is only another card in the game.
With this Promocard I change the basecard No. 15 from the basegame starting map and I have the other station MERSEBURG. There is no change in the game, only another station.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: Monopoly: Zürich
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Zurich, a city in Switzerland
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: No Words
description:
Запретные слова (No Words) is a game of (not-)creating words from the letters of the Russian alphabet. Each player has a hand of 3 cards (1 letter on each card). On his/her turn, the player should play one card from hand into the common pool. If after his/her turn any of the opponents is able to create a complete Russian word from the letters in the pool, the player has to take all the letters of this word as his penalty points (1 letter equals 1 penalty point). The winner is the player with lesser number of penalty points at the end of the game.

Contents:
84 cards with Cyrillic letters
rules

name: Age of Steam Expansion: The Railroad Switches
description:
This is the third part of the Age of Steam 2013 set released by Alban Viard

These pair of expansions is called Railroad Switches (again never seen in the Age of Steam world).

This expansion introduces two new maps with special rules for rotating complex hexes, and a special station master action!!!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Transportation

name: ATS TT Cassino I: Gustav Graveyard
description:
The Advanced Tobruk System (ATS) returns to Snakeshead Ridge near Cassino, Italy for more intense squad level action on one of history's most rugged battlefields. American and Commonwealth soldiers (including Free Poles, Free French and Gurkhas) battle the dug in Germans for the all important high ground of Points 569 and 593.

The game contains eight scenarios, a remastered, larger map of Snakeshead Ridge and a collection of ATS TT unit counters featuring brand new art that promises to be the most varied and colourful in any ATS game so far. The special Battlefield Walkaround insert and ATS TT variant rules fill out this package.
Ownership of the standard ATS rules, play aids and informational counters is required.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, World War II

name: Swordquest (Revised Edition)
description:
From the back of the box:

Each player will command a force of Leaders, Guards and Magic-Users in his search for the Lost Sword of Lumina. As players maneuver over the full color map, they will encounter monsters, enemies, spells and a Dragon that can be controlled; but will often turn on the controller! A unique tactical combat system will allow players to take on a much larger force with a good chance of winning. It is not difficult for a player to discover a sword, but once found it must be taken to a citadel, and even then it may be counterfeit!
In this new revised edition, each character is given his own individual abilities. Also included in the edition is a Random Events Table, which can drastically change a players strategy. Also included is a new map.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: Happy Hour: No winners, just losers!
description:
The best drinking game ever is in your hands!
No swearing, no pointing and no toilet breaks. Respect these 3 laws or you will have to... drink. So keep an eye on your opponents and fill glasses, rise to the tasks (speed, sequences of numbers, general knowledge...). But don’t forget the law!
Happy Hour, the game where everyone loses but wants to play again!
This game is for players 18 and over. You are responsible for your own actions and decisions. This game is not intended to be played with alcoholic drinks.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Jenga: Space Invaders Collector's Edition
description: A Space Invaders-themed Jenga set with a new type of game play. As you remove blocks you're also trying to move your Invader down the tower, so you can kill the puny humans.

name: GOAL Campionato di Calcio a Squadre
description:
"GOAL: Campionato di Calcio a Squadre" put 22 1:72 plastic miniatures football players on a playing field represented by a green cardboard with a 25x17 grid overimposed. Each player rolls two dice and moves one or more of their 11 players to reach the ball and run it along a straight path. Goal is to bring the ball over the goal line. 15 minutes to try to make the most goals possible.
In the box there are 8 Italian footbal teams of different colors to organize leagues, they are:


Bologna
Cagliari
Fiorentina
Inter
Juventus
Milan
Napoli
Roma
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Square Grid

name: Climaxxx
description:
Climaxxx is a Roll and move erotic game for two players with similar mechanics to Snakes and Ladders. The goal of the game is to be the first to reach the end of the board. However, you lose the game if you have an orgasm before your partner at any time before the end.

The game is played in two separate phases, the first being softer while the second phase is played naked. Throughout the game, players may have to pick a card and do what the image on it explains. Other possible areas are 'Wine/Drinks pauses' and 'Bite the other player'.

The winner gets to dare the other player to do something he or she wants.

From the publisher's website:
The game for lovers that takes you and your partner through a dizzying array of sensuous thrills. Illustrated cards guide you through a series of sexy trials. But be careful! No matter how excited you get, you have to keep your passions in check.

The game includes: - 1 board - 4 decks of cards - 1 die - 1 hourglass - 2 tokens

name: Visegrad 4: The Coming War in Eastern Europe
description:
Visegrad 4: The Coming War in Eastern Europe covers a hypothetical conflict between the forces of the Eastern NATO and Russia. With the US in retreat in the world, and the Russians getting overly aggressive, it could be that a resurgent Russia could make an attempt to take back its classic sphere of influence. This, factored in with the fact that Russia is the primary energy source for much of Europe, has made them overly powerful. The biggest threat to the Russian energy dominance is amazingly the country of Poland. Recent technological breakthrough in ‘Fracking’ has made the Polish shale resources the number one competitor to Russian energy domination. So, once again, the two nations may well be on a collision course to destiny.

The other assumption made for the background of the game is that Germany, caught in the grips of an isolationist government, and not willing to risk rocking the boat with its primary source of energy, declares Poland the aggressor and that it will be neutral in the NATO “violation”. The US, already weakened from its own internal problems, is unable to force them to honor their commitments. The resulting chaos and confusion will delay the entry of much of the NATO forces and force Poland and its neighbors to go it alone.

Game Scale:

Game Turn: 1 week
Hex: 35 miles / 56 kilometers
Units: Brigades or equivalent


Game Inventory:

One 22 x 34" full color map
One dual-side printed countersheet (176 5/8" counters - 128 for this game, 48 for Red Dragon / Green Crescent published in Modern War Magazine #1).
One 16-page rulebook


Solitaire Playability: High
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 4-10 hours

Note: Players will need to provide one 6-sided die for game play.

name: Κυνήγι ερωτήσεων: Αθλητισμός (Quiz Hunt: Sports)
description:
A competitive game with 600 questions about Greece and the whole wold focusing on Sports.

The game play is simple: Each player rolls the dice and according to the outcome of the dice he is being asked the corresponding question. If he answers right, he collects the card.

The player or the team with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

It belongs to a series of trivia games Κυνήγι Ερωτήσεων
1.History
2.Animals - Plants
3.Science
4.Culture
5.Sports
6.Geography
7.20th century
8.Greece

name: Stak Bots: Magnet Bot
description:
