A Kickstarter exclusive promo card for Stak Bots.

It has a high power value, but must be chosen for any effects played.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Variable Phase Order

name: Warzone: The Brotherhood Cathedral
description:
From the back of the box:

The Cathedrals of the Brotherhood stand as citadels of faith before the overwhelming tide of the Dark Legion. Raised as places of prayer they have become the focus for some of the fiercest battles. Both sides fight for possession of the sacred walls and the powerful relics that lie within the Cathedral vaults. Where one side fights to keep the Light of Faith alive, the other side fights to see it extinguished, replaced forever with Blessed Night.

This Box-set Contains:

A full colour card model of the Brotherhood Cathedral: on eight A4 sheets of card for you to construct.
Two exclusive new miniatures only available with this box set: The Brotherhood's - "Visionary" and the Dark Legion's - "Angel of Mercy".
A 32 page booklet, containing 10 scenarios that can be played as stand alone battles or as part of an extended campaign, where the fate of the Cathedral depends upon the success or failure of each scenario. There is separate descriptive text and maps for each scenario and battle photographs throughout to put the struggle for the Cathedral and the two new characters in context.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Hypocrisy
description:
Hypocrisy is a "Nomic" style game of rules making and enacting in order to fashion a rule-set that allows you to win. However, in this game, certain players will be IMMUNE from certain rules, making hypocrisy the way to win!

One player per round serves as the judge, and the rest of the players submit rules on a topic related to the starting rule-set. A public vote then takes place, with the winning rule being enacted into the rule-set. However, the Judge and the author of the winning rule can CHOOSE to be immune from that rule, making loopholes not only possible, but the most probable way to win!

name: Città Verde
description:
Each player attempts to be the first to build nine buildings in his own land.

At first, the players try to accumulate money through by rolling a special die.

It can be rolled several times, always adding up the results and earning that amount of money, but if the red dot goes out, you lose everything you've earned.

With the money you can build or buy construction licenses that allow counter opponents in constructing their buildings.

When you decide to build, after paying the cost of construction, it may happen that one or more adversaries oppose it, so it will be useful to play as many building permits possible to increase the chances of success of the building.

name: Kakelspektakel
description:
The chicken crazy party game.

The game is played in teams. One person on the team will use the chicken to depict one of the words of on the card while the rest of his team tries to guess.
If the word isn't guessed in ten seconds the other team gets one chance to guess.
First team to ten points wins the game.

name: Sentinel Tactics: Battle for Broken City
description:
Sentinel Tactics: Battle for Broken City was supposed to be a standalone game using the Sentinel Tactics system that can be played on its own or combined with Sentinel Tactics: The Flame of Freedom with or without the Uprising expansion.

However, in 2018 - the publisher announced that this was not to be published but replaced by a new product Sentinal Tactics: Prime war - which itself was cancelled in 2020 before publication.
publishers: Greater Than Games, LLC, Living Worlds Games

name: Scooby-Doo! Story Telling Dice
description: 9 Dice, 54 images. When kids combine Story Telling Dice with their imaginations they get to make up all kinds of Scooby-Doo stories. Players roll the dice and, one at a time, take one and use it to create a Scooby-Doo adventure.

name: We're Going on a Bear Hunt Board Game
description:
Roll and move game, with an end game chase between the leading player and the bear.

From the publisher:

A bright and colourful race and chase board game featuring the beautiful illustrations from the best selling book. The aim of the game is to be the first player to reach home, without being caught by the bear! Youngest player goes first and rolls one dice and move that number of spaces in the direction of the arrows on the board. If a player lands on a 'Uh-uh' space they must take a card from the top of the card pile. If the card is red 'We can't go over it' this ends their turn. If the card is green 'Oh no! We've got to go through it' they can roll the dice again and move forward.
When a player reaches the 'Run' space they must stop and take full control of the game. Throw both dice and move your character that number of spaces, then throw just one dice and move the bear that number of spaces chasing after you. Keep going like this, it's a race to try and get home before the bear catches you. If you reach the 'Home' space before the bear catches up with you, you win!

This game has strong educational components and helps children learn through social interaction as well as taking turns, all whilst having great fun. The game is for 2 - 4 players and suitable for children ages 3 years and up.

name: Raid & Trade: War on the Streets
description:
From deep within the wastelands, far from the Golden City comes a new breed of survivors. Forged in the most desolate conditions these opportunistic individuals prowl the ruins watching for passers-by – to either join or exploit.

Skilled nomads, these ‘Hitchhikers’ can twist any situation to their advantage, whether through silver-tongued and honeyed words or brute force and lethal cunning. Having been bred far from the Golden City, some Hitchhikers have only recently heard of the glittering utopia and many have made their way across hundreds of miles, braving unimaginable dangers and hardships for a chance to learn more about this potential prize.

Some consider the Hitchhikers to be parasites that latch onto and leech from others, but for them it is a way of life and the ultimate path to survival. They are wild rovers, moving from one opportunity to the next in search of the last big pay-off… But they are not the only ones who come from the shadows.. Riders & gangs, rebels & outlanders are rising in the wastelands. They tried to enter the Golden City, but they were stopped by the Forces and now they are exiled for ever in the wastelands. Anyone who is trying to reach the Golden City, has to face them and their minions!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Miniatures, Negotiation, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Fakes
description:
Tell an anecdote about the chosen topic and listen to those of your opponents. A secret card wil let you know whether you should tell the truth or lie. You must make everyone believe you, and use your wits to discover which of your opponents is lying.

Each player receives secretly a card that indicates if he has to say the truth or lying. Then, a theme card is showed and every player explains a personal history on the theme lying or telling the truth depending on his card. When finising all players can make questions to the others to guess if they're lying or not. Before that, they count up to three and everybody points the person who he thinks is the liar.

You get points discovering the liar and when anybody thinks that are you and it's not. Five cards are played and then the player with most points wins.

name: No Fish!
description:
You and your fellow fishermen are having a whale of a time on the high seas. The fish are literally jumping into your boats. So many fish are landing on deck that your boats are beginning to overload and capsize. The only way to tackle this fishy situation is to release all of the fish you've caught before you take a trip to Davy Jones' locker. The winner is the first fisherman to release all of their fish. Good luck and let cod be with you!

Each turn in No Fish!, players guess a number or special fish type. If they guess correctly, they release all of those fish from their hand and may take a special action; if they guess incorrectly, the other players call "No Fish!" and that player has to draw a card from the fish deck. The special action fish — Starfish, Toadfish, Flyingfish, Lionfish and Monkfish — are what separates this game from a generic number-guessing game to a game of strategy, bluffing and manipulation.

Each pack contains 54 cards: four types of basic fish (Goldfish, Dogfish, Rainbowfish and Clownfish) numbered 1-10, five types of special fish (Starfish, Toadfish, Flyingfish, Lionfish (three copies of each) and Monkfish (two copies)).
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Math

name: Castle Assault: Dagger of Ill Omen Promo Card
description:
Promo Card for Castle Assault.

Epic Neutral Command (Attachment)
Cost: 1
Target Unit gains: Loses 1 Health at the End of its turn
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Futures!
description: Futures! is a Japanese game themed around commodity futures. The three resources traded in the game are Corn, Rice, and Pepper. Players aim to finish the game with the most money.

name: Spectracube
description:
Spectracube offers six different games, using a set of primary and a set of secondary color cubes.

SPECTACULAR SHUFFLE
Roll primary and secondary Spectracubes to create the highest scoring spectrum straights, pairs and 3 of a kind! Do you take the risk to roll again?

GREEDY GRAB
Be the quickest player to roll colors that match the center cubes and grab them! Roll again before other players and grab what’s left!

YOU SCORE!
There are so many ways to score in this game that you may think you’re way ahead of the competition! But watch out—a few quick rolls, and your competition could catch up!

BLOTCH OUT!
Try not to Blotch Out! Avoid the “Color Blotch” Spectracubes. Sound easy? Not so fast…You’ll learn a lot about chance in this game!

RUMMY ROLL
Quick eyes and fast rolls get you winning—as you place your Spectracubes into Rummy straights and sets!

SPECTRA-SLAM!
Roll the Spectra-Slam cubes to win. This game gets more intense as players approach the 15 point threshold to winning!

name: Sushifuda
description:
Sushifuda is a sushi-inspired take on the traditional Hanafuda matching card game from Japan. However, instead of featuring plants and flowers like traditional Hanafuda, Sushifuda depicts kawaii-style sushi art! Collect the most points by matching sushi types and use bonus sashimi 3-card combos for extra points to win!

The game features 12 suits which represent the 12 months, each month containing 4 cards depicting the type of sushi for that month. 2 cards typically are point cards in the suit while the remaining two are normally chaff (no points). There is one wild card called the Gaji or Lightning card which allows you to take non-matching cards.

Games can play with from 2-6 players playing singly or in teams, each round lasting only about 10 minutes. Quick, fast-paced, easy fun from ages 7 and up! You can also play a solo variation.

The cards are marked for Sakura-style play, with point totals and months designated on the cards for instant recognition. Also included are reference cards containing the sashimi bonus point 3-card combos (also known as Yaku). Reference cards are double-sided standard poker playing card size while the main suits cards, which total 48 in number, are half the size, based on traditional Hanafuda. This allows for great portability and also a smaller footprint on your table while playing. All cards and the tuck box come UV coated and linen finished, made of the same cardstock as Magic: The Gathering. Great art collectible, playable cards!

name: Ninja All-Stars: Ryu
description: As a young boy, Ryu showed a talent in alchemy and was able to apprentice in this profession with his father. One fateful trip, however, saw them fall victim to a howling group of bandits. He survived, and wandering monks found him. As he grew in their monastery, Ryu soon became a strong and focused fighter with an understandable hatred for those who preyed on the weak.
publishers: Heidelberger Spieleverlag, Ninja Division, Soda Pop Miniatures, Ulisses Spiele

name: Ninja All-Stars: Mizuchi
description: The Ika are more than just fishermen and traders. They are charged by the Princess herself with watching and protecting Kagejima's coasts. Serious in demeanor, strategically clever, and ruthless in battle, Mizuchi's ship, the Honor of Ishika, and a hail of fire arrows are often the last things would-be invaders ever see.
publishers: Heidelberger Spieleverlag, Ninja Division, Soda Pop Miniatures, Ulisses Spiele

name: Taking of Taidian
description:
Taking of Taidian is a deck-building game for 2-6 players. It is character based and set in the near future. Due to the many different choices, players can make, such as do I buy attack cards or defense cards, and the variety of character skills Taking of Taidian has a lot of replayability. The game is designed to encourage table talk and group strategy. Build your own deck while keeping your eyes open to what others are doing.


Each player starts with 150 health, 0 energy and a deck of 15 cards: 5 coin cards, 1 cash card, 4 energy shield cards, 3 kick cards, 1 robber card and 1 shotgun card.
You will use attacking cards to lower your opponents' health while using defense cards to keep yourself alive.
You may also buy new and better cards or try to power yourself up with energy cards.
The goal of the game is to be the last person or team standing.
Table talk and trash talk are not only allowed, but encouraged.


Have fun while making your friends hate you.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Role Playing

name: Monsterpark
description:
The King wants a zoo of unprecedented diversity, filled with spectacular mythical creatures. Thus, he asks several wizards to travel to the steppes, forests, mountains and seas of his kingdom to hunt for suitable creatures. Your job: Build a fantastic zoo full of incredible mythical creatures!

In Monsterpark, each player takes on the role of a wizard and tries to capture as many mythical creatures as possible by the end of the game that are popular among the people and desired by its rulers.

name: War & Pieces
description:
War & Pieces is the ultimate family game of building, tactical skill, and destruction. Each player builds a fortress with blocks and must knock the other player(s) fortresses down by launching a catapult.

Each player begins with 50 building blocks and 5 special soldier blocks, and constructs a fortress on a game mat. Rules are simple, solider blocks cannot touch the mat and building blocks that touch the map must be sideways.

Players take turns launching the stone catapult, or the ballista at an opposing player's fortress. If a solider block gets knocked down, that unlocks a special power that may benefit or harm the shooter. Players who lose all their solider blocks are eliminated. Last player standing wins!

War & Pieces is created by YouTube Superstar and family man, Roman Atwood, in conjunction with Studio71 and Justin Gary, founder of Blade Entertainment.
mechanics: Action Queue, Enclosure, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Plingo
description:
One player has to guess a word that everybody else knows.
The other players will each make a list of up to seven words associated with the secret word. Then, each of the other players have to make the guesser guess the word, but if they say a word that is on someone else's list, the turn will pass to that person. In the end, the guesser and the player-on-turn will get points if the word is guessed. If the word isn't guessed, everybody else gets a point.

name: Aborted: The Game
description:
Aborted: The Game is a simple card game where at least one of the players mast survive and defeat "The Doctor” and his demons with the help of a dice and the weapons that they will find in the events deck.
This game was an add on at the “limited deluxe box set” of the Aborted's record “The Necrotic Manifesto” (2014). Aborted is a brutal-death band from Belgium. The game yas published by the record company Century Media.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fighting, Horror, Humor, Party Game, Science Fiction, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Role Playing

name: Argle Bargle
description:
Description from the publisher:

"The game where you insult your friends"

Each player is dealt 10 cards and 5 lives. The object of the game is to use your cards to create hilarious insults that score damage points that remove the "lives" from your opponents. The last player left with lives wins.

Each card has two words are phrases on it and an associated point value with each one. Play proceeds clockwise starting with the player left of the dealer.

Each turn the player can either play an insult on anyone at the table OR exchange any amount of cards from their hand for new cards. An insult is 4 or more cards that when read aloud, form a complete sentence that insults another player. Example:

YOUR JACKED, BUCK-TOOTHED GRANDFATHER LIKES TO SPOON WITH A NEUROTIC, TINY CHICKEN!

The player lays down the cards that forms their insult, points to a player they are insulting, and reads the sentence aloud. You imply the punctuation with how you speak the sentence. So say it like you mean it!

You then total the points on the read side of each card in the insult (upper right corner).
If this total is 5 or more, the insulted player loses 1 life.
If the total is 10 or more, the insulted player loses 2 lives
If the total is 15 or more, the insulted player loses 3 lives, AND the insulting player takes one of the lost lives and adds it to their own lives.

There are "Reversal" and "Redirect" cards that the insulted player can play to deflect an insult. The insulting player can play a "BOOM" card at the end of their insult to make it unreversable and unredirectable.

Argle Bargle is a casual game, but it takes more than luck to best your opponents. It requires creativity and strategy.

There are no dirty or offensive words in this version.

name: YO! Fish
description:
Yo Fish! is a game for 3 or 4 players and involves laying cards in a grid and scoring points based on adjacencies.

Needed to play:
Deck of 48 cards, 4 score cards and 8 wooden cubes

Setup:
1. Give each player a score card and two cubes. Players place one cube on the 0 space of their score tracks and keep the other aside for later scoring in the tens columns of the score track.

2. Shuffle the deck of 48 cards and remove the following number of cards from the game:

3 players - remove 6 cards
4 players - remove 5 cards

3. Deal 6 cards to each player. Place the remaining cards in a draw pile. Draw three cards from the draw deck and place them in the center of the table with a card space between each.

4. The youngest player is the Starting Player.

To Win:
Have the most victory points at the end of the game.

Play:
Beginning with the Starting Player, and proceeding clockwise, players may take one of two actions on their turn:

1. Play a card face up and adjacent (left or right, above or below) to any previously played cards in the playing area. For each card that is adjacent to the card played (left or right, above or below), and matches the color of the played card, gain one victory point. If none of the adjacent cards match in color, gain victory points equal to the value of the played card.

2. Play a card face up on top of a previously played card. These cards must never match in color and the card being played must have a higher value than the one it is covering. Gain victory points equal to the sum of both cards (the card played and the one below it) and then remove both cards from the game.

The current player then draws a new card from the draw deck to place in their hand. If the draw deck is empty, the player will not draw a new card. It is now the turn of the player to their left.

Game End:
After all players have played their last card and their hands are empty, the player with the most victory points is declared the winner and all the fish can yo!

Advanced Game:
Before the game begins, deal one card to each player from those removed during setup. These cards will be kept hidden by players during the game. At the end of the game each player will receive additional victory points equal to the largest number of adjacent cards whose color matches the player’s hidden card. Two or more players may have the same hidden card color.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Print & Play

name: Nibbled
description:
Description from the publisher:

Nibbled is a fast-paced, easy-to-learn game that starts with kids clipping four plastic fish onto themselves. Guess a color, then flip a card. Guess correctly, and you unclip one fish and clip it onto an opponent. Whoever first unclips all of their fish wins!

name: Trivial Pursuit: The 1980's Card Set
description: Subsidiary expansion cards for use with Trivial Pursuit: The 1980's Master Game.

name: Doodle Delirium
description:
Teams of 2 or more compete to reach the end of the track on the game board. Each turn, one team member rolls a die to determine which of the 4 categories they will attempt.

Oodle Doodles is simple drawing;
Model Madness involves modelling with clay provided in the box;
Paper Mash-Ups has the player folding and tearing paper;
Scribble Riddles requires drawing a phrase, saying or something from popular culture (a song, film or famous person).

The player draws a card from the category that they rolled, and chooses one line from the card. A timer is started, and the other players have to guess what is being drawn or modelled. In some cases, the player is allowed to act and move with the object they are modelling. If the team guess correctly, a miniature representing a marker pen is moved on to the next space of that colour.

Some board spaces have special features. "All Play" means all teams are allowed to guess instead of just the team whose turn it currently is (and move on the board if they guess correctly). "X" means the team moves back by one space if they do not guess correctly. And a "2" means the team has twice the amount of time to guess (the sand timer is turned twice).

To win the game, a team must complete two separate challenges (with two separate rolls of the dice) within the normal time limit, a single turn of the sand timer.

name: Marvel Comics Super Heroes Game Book
description:
A collection of six roll-and-move games in a book format. Each two-page spread is one game. All games use the electronic die that is attached on the top right corner of the book.

Games included in the book:

The Amazing Spider-Man
Fantastic Four
The Avengers
The Incredible Hulk
Wolverine
X-Men

name: 1944 La Libération
description:
A card game about the liberation of France in 1944.

Goal: Be the first the exceed the attack value on the chosen combat zone card.

Contains: 5 combat zone cards, 15 attack cards, 9 defence cards, 2 ace cards and 57 unit cards representing allied forces.

Gameplay: You hold 5 cards. On your first turn you start invading by playing a unit card which has a value on it. Take a new card from the drawpile. On your next turn you either play another card to this row or you play an attack card in front of another player. If there is an attack card in front of you either play a unit card or a defence card to it in order to defeat it. When the total value of the played cards exceeds the value of the attack card, all cards are removed. On your next turn you may add unit cards to your invasion-row again.
The first player who exceede the value on the combat zone cards wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Race, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Who's Gary: The 1-Player Guild (crappy) Board Game
description:
“Who’s Gary : The 1-Player Guild (crappy) Board Game” is a silly solo game celebrating the 1-Player Guild on BGG.

Your goal is to forget who Gary R. Brooks is (a 1-Player Guild in-joke) and gain as much Geek Gold as possible, while avoiding Albert (founder of the 1-Player Guild), his army of sock puppet accounts, and his trusty sidekick Julius.

The game is a simple and quick dice-rolling push your luck game where you have to stay ahead of Albert and navigate the traps and boons on the board. Albert gradually ramps up his speed thus ramping up the tension of the game.

"Who's Gary" is free PnP game with no cutting, gluing, etc. required. Just print the 1-page game board, print the 1-page player's aid/have it available electronically, and read the 1-page of rules. Finally add in 6d6 and 7 tokens (e.g. eurocubes).

Designer's warning: Don't play this if you're not familiar with the 1-Player Guild at around 2018, since it's designed as one big in-joke for a guild event instead of as a good game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Story In a Box
description:
It's a party game!
For fast thinkers!
Press your luck in this sentence building game that is fun for everyone aged 14+.

Race against time to build a fully connected sentence to score the most amount of points!

How to play: Draw a Word Card, speak up to three words to connect to your sentence - use 6 Word Cards in your sentence before the time runs out to score extra points but don’t get stuck with a Word Card in your hand or it will cost you!

Create a somewhat logical, mostly hilarious grammatically correct sentence using randomly drawn words before time runs out! Or close enough to grammatically correct that no one notices.

—description from the publisher

name: Dirk Gently's Holistic Detective Agency: Everything is Connected
description:
Dirk Gently's Holistic Detective Agency: Everything is Connected is the first in a series of "Everything is Connected" storytelling games in which the mysteries are only as looney as the players.

In this game, a detective and a holistic detective put together the clues, accuse a person of interest, and tell their assistants the story of the crime. The assistants then process the two versions of the case and simultaneously select which version of the truth is more believable. To solve the case, you have to think on your feet and remember that "everything is connected".
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: キャットヒルズ (Cat Hills)
description:
Cat Hills is a simplistic but weird trick-taking game in which the leader can choose between a must-follow or a may-follow. With must-follow, other players must play the same suit as the leader, or any other color if they don't have the leader's color, and the player who played highest of the leader's color wins the trick. With may-follow, players can play any color, and the highest number regardless of color wins the trick, with ties cancelling each other out.

Players take their won tricks to build small stacks that are worth points at the end of the game.

name: Five Nights At Freddy's
description:
Five Nights At Freddy's is based off of the very popular game app with the same name. The board game version is a jump scare game that will surely make you jump! You take mini pizza's from the tray in front of Freddy Fazbear. Watch out, because if you mess around with his pizza's too much he JUMPS!

Basic Game Play
You set the game up by pressing Freddy into a locked position. Take all the total of 24 mini plastic pizza pieces in red (8) blue (8) and yellow (8) and put them in the pizza tray/box in front of Freddy.

Time to turn Freddy on, once you do that, you will hear the haunting Calliope style music plays in the main base of the game.

Each player on their turn spins the multi colored spinner which has corresponding colors to the pizza slices - Each slice on the spinner has a number value. That is the number of pieces you have to remove from the tray in front of Freddy. On the dial there is also a skip a turn, but in this game that is a good thing!

The players uses a bear paw shaped salad style tongs (grey in color) to pick the pizza slices out by the color and quantity shown on the spinner. As you reach in, there is a lower level tray bottom that is pressure sensitive and will slowly based on the number of times you agitate, randomly activate Freddy to jump at you and spill the pizzas all over the table top!

(If at any time a color is spun that is not in the tray, a player must take another color pizza instead)

The winner is the one that does not find themselves the unlucky person that made Freddy JUMP!

If playing more then two players, then the person that makes Freddy jump is eliminated. Players return the pizza back to the tray, set Freddy up again and continue playing in the same manner.

Once it is down to two players, then the overall winner is the one that does not set Freddy to JUMP!

(If the players remove all of the pizza before Freddy wakes, then the game ends in a tie)

Requires 3 AA Batteries

name: Hit Me!
description:
Hit me! is a comic book style push your luck card game. Players will be playing Hit! cards to make other players discard cards from their Life deck. The last player with cards remaining in their life deck is the winner.

Players begin with a small deck of face-down cards that make their life deck and a single Hit! deck in the middle of the table. During a player's turn, they draw a card from the Hit! deck and place it face up for all players to see. They continue to play cards until they choose to stop or they Bust and are out of the round.

If a player draws a Hit! card, they place it in front of any other player. If the current player stops before Busting, all other players will discard 1 card for each Hit! in front of them. All cards are added to a communal discard pile. If the Hit! deck runs out of cards. All of the cards in the discard pile are reshuffled to make a new Hit! deck. If a player draws a Trip! card, they place it in front of themselves. If a player ever draws 3 Trips! they Bust, and they instead discard 1 card from their life deck for each Hit! in front of all players.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey: Crops Starter Deck
description:
Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey is a new take on the collectible non-collectible KB line, with Jeffrey Neil Bellinger once again putting the rabbits through the grinder. Six new starter decks Animals, Crops, Elementals, Energy, Land and Technology will be available, and players can construct personalized decks of no less than 60 cards, with the cards from any deck.

Ultimate Odyssey is not collectible or random. Players can now buy starter decks and booster expansions for Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey and then use any combination of those cards to form their own constructed decks to play against opponents. Unlike in Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot, where up to eight players play with the same deck of cards, all sharing the same draw pile, Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey has players each draw only from their own constructed deck of 60 cards. There are not any random packs, so players will always know which cards they are purchasing in a deck and they can buy the right products for their planned deck. For Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey six brand new starter decks (red, violet, blue, yellow, green, or orange) allow players to construct a personalized deck with any of the cards of any deck.

The setting for the new game is an ultimate race to build a bunny society on planet Earth. Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey pits players against each other as they struggle to gain Civilization Points, by building cities and increasing their bunny populations. Players gain points by developing their own civilizations or by using zany weapons and hilarious scenarios to destroy their opponents.

The Green deck has a Crops based theme which also includes fruits, vegetables and marvelous cards such as Transplanted Troop which allows players to steal bunnies and Reversal Of Order which helps dictate the order of card play.

name: Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey: Animals Starter Deck
description:
Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey is a new take on the collectible non-collectible KB line, with Jeffrey Neil Bellinger once again putting the rabbits through the grinder. Six new starter decks Animals, Crops, Elementals, Energy, Land and Technology will be available, and players can construct personalized decks of no less than 60 cards, with the cards from any deck.

Ultimate Odyssey is not collectible or random. Players can now buy starter decks and booster expansions for Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey and then use any combination of those cards to form their own constructed decks to play against opponents. Unlike in Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot, where up to eight players play with the same deck of cards, all sharing the same draw pile, Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey has players each draw only from their own constructed deck of 60 cards. There are not any random packs, so players will always know which cards they are purchasing in a deck and they can buy the right products for their planned deck. For Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey six brand new starter decks (red, violet, blue, yellow, green, or orange) allow players to construct a personalized deck with any of the cards of any deck.

The setting for the new game is an ultimate race to build a bunny society on planet Earth. Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey pits players against each other as they struggle to gain Civilization Points, by building cities and increasing their bunny populations. Players gain points by developing their own civilizations or by using zany weapons and hilarious scenarios to destroy their opponents.

name: Magic Maze: Maximum Security Bonus Tiles
description: 2 new tiles for Magic Maze: Maximum Security from Plato magazine issue #102. They replace the tile 29 from module 13.

name: Are You Gonna Eat That?
description:
You’re greeted at the front door with a smile on the cashier's face and a welcoming attitude; the smells of all sorts of food invade your senses. The scent of spaghetti dances in your nose and you can almost taste the roast beef being slowly cooked and it’s almost as if the kid shaking sprinkles on their ice cream is happening right in your ear. You’ve never been this hungry and you can not take it much longer. The cashier asks for your money and you dig into your pocket looking for your wallet and as you grab it you see yourself shaking. “It’s okay” you think to yourself “I’m almost there”. You hand the cashier your money and with a smile as warm as fresh cinnamon rolls you hear “enjoy!”. But as you walk through you start to notice something is terribly wrong. People are fighting with one another, stealing from unsuspecting victims, and devouring food for the worry that it might be gone any moment. Fear hits you suddenly as you notice a sign at the front of the buffet “NO REFUNDS!” and before you can gather your thoughts you hear someone whisper in your ear, “Are You Gonna Eat That?”

“Are You Gonna Eat That?” is a 2-5 player game played in about 30-45 minutes. Over the course of three rounds you will earn points by devouring the most amount of dishes at the table, but be careful as your opponents will be trying to steal your food! Food cards are placed faced down in front of you; hiding their respective point values. Using a wide variety of action cards you will be able steal from opponents, play defensive cards, and even gross dishes removing them from play; but beware of opponents tricking you into taking their rotten foods. Spice up your dishes by playing add-ons on your dishes or trap other players by placing add-ons of opposite flavors onto a dish causing it to be worth negative points. Still hungry? Fill up your plates using empty plate tokens to steal even more food, all is fair game until a dish is devoured.

name: Punkin Fight
description:
It's a rainy, Halloween Night. You're under attack. A rival gang is lobbing Punkin Bombs at your various clubhouses around town—trying to bring them down, and take over your turf. It's time to fight back!

How To Play
Separate the "Clubhouse" cards from the deck and deal 3 face-up in front of each player. Place the rest of the deck face down between all players. The player left of the dealer has first turn.

For each turn, players draw up to 5 cards (the hand limit), and then may play only 1 card of each card type. Punkin Bomb cards are played in front of a player's house to attack it. Witch cards are played behind a house to strengthen it. Ghost cards are played on the last bomb placed on a house to remove it to the discard pile, and Vampire cards may be paired with a card to play an extra card of that type during a turn. A turn is over when no card can be played. If a player already has 5 cards at the start of a turn, draw 1 more card. Play continues clockwise.

When the total value of all Punkin Bombs played on a Clubhouse equals (or eclipses) its value (plus the value of Witch cards behind it), the Clubhouse is destroyed/removed from play. All cards played on the Clubhouse go to the discard pile. Should the game deck exhaust, reuse the discard pile.

The last player with a Clubhouse left, wins!

name: Let Them Eat Shapes
description:
"Let Them Eat Shapes" is a print and play, and entirely abstract, version of the game Let Them Eat Shrimp. The game board (which is printed on one sheet of paper) has hexagonal spaces, many of which contain shapes that are either hexagons or may be combined to make hexagons. You begin with 4 shapes in your supply and players take turns "placing" them onto the board (i.e., by filling in matching shapes on the board). If you fill in shapes on the board, you gain that shape and mark it as acquired in your supply. When there are no shapes to get from the board, the game ends and players tally their scores. The player with the most points win.

Players familiar with Let Them Eat Shrimp will almost immediately understand the game.

name: Triple Cross
description:
Players engage in a head-to-head battle by placing discs in the innovative Triple Cross tower. Your aim is to have more vertical and diagonal "3-in-a-rows" than your opponent.

Game play is unique in that players push a disc into the row from the side. If the push in another disc, the first disc played is moved up along the track. If a 3rd disc is played in the same row, the disc in the middle is dropped down one row - and if a 4th disc is placed the first disc played is popped out the side.

There is subtle strategy in where to place the discs and when to use the blockers to lock a row.

—description from the publisher

name: Link 'Em
description:
A Link ‘Em is a riddle that contains two clues, the answers to which share a common word in the middle. What do you get when Leonardo da Vinci's Most Famous Painting meets Bart's Sax-playing Sister? The answer? MONA LISA SIMPSON. What do you get when A Toy Spud meets A Dandruff Shampoo? MR. POTATO HEAD & SHOULDERS! Listen to a "this meets that" riddle and try to Link them correctly to win. It's pop culture candy for your brain!

—description from the publisher

name: Hail Hydra: Superior Octopus Promo Card
description:
Originally available at GenCon 2018

Hail Hydra - Superior Octopus Promo Card

Villian

Health: 10

4 City Damage

Upgrade: if Superior Octopus has 2 or Less health, he deals an additional 6 damage to the city.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Mount Memo
description:
As a natural scientist you observe the animals and flowers in the
area of Mount Memo. You lay landscape cards over each other and let a card mountain grow steadily. How many toucans are already sitting on the mountain? How many whales swim in the water? And what is that? A green sparrow sailing in a hat? Shoot your photos at the right moment and win real pebbles!

name: Dragon Castle: The Dice Tower Promo
description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2018 Kickstarter campaign.

A new castle layout.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: 閻魔裁判 (Last Judgement)
description:
You are dead. You must remember good deeds you have made during your previous life and appeal to the judge for a better life next time.

In the dexterity game of Last Judgement (閻魔裁判, pronounced "Enma Saiban"), players try to gather fragments of their memory. When you have gathered enough memory, you remember a good deed and score points.

During your turn, you try to stack a number of wooden blocks. If you fail to stack them, your turn ends immediately; if you succeed, for each block you stacked, your pawn advances one square or you gain a fragment. Depending on the square where your pawn lands, you gain additional fragments or convert fragments into a fragment of better quality, or you may spend fragments to regain the full memory of your deed, earning several points. Turns go clockwise, and the next player begins their turn by stacking a number of blocks on top of the existing stack.

At the end of a round, if any player has scored 40 or more points, the game ends. Players score their end-of-game bonuses, and the highest scorer wins the game and enjoys a good start for their next life.

•••

・プレイヤーは死にました。閻魔様に善行をアピールして、より良い来世を迎えましょう！
・賽の河原で石を積み、善行カードを獲得して徳点を稼ぎます。
・40点に到達したらゲーム終了、最高得点プレイヤーが勝利！
・獲得した徳点によってプレイヤーの来世が決まります。
・積みアクションと戦略を組み合わせた全く新しいゲームです！

name: HoneyGlory
description:
Where animals once lived together in ancient times, the animals here loved honey.
Honey was a symbol of food and medicines and, above all, of honor in this world.
The world with the most honorable lords!
This lord may be yours.

The weather core can be predicted, but it is perfectly possible to communicate with other participants using information I have identified, such as an unfamiliar weather forecast, to acquire additional information and create my own interests, It's possible.

Game progress

Create a weather deck.
Place BeeHive(=worker) on the board.
Open 1 weather card.
Produce honey according to the weather.
Produce goods or make market action.
Proceed 5 turns for 3 rounds.


Predict the weather and place the Beehive.
You should use your character skills at the right time.
The most prestigious lord wins.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Silly Safari
description:
How exciting to be on safari, trying to spot all your favourite animals... but, hang on, one of them has wandered off!
Be the first to spot the missing animal!

The double-sided cards feature two levels of play. Choose the side with 7 possible animals for children or for learning the game, and choose the other side with 12 possible animals for a challenge!

In every card there is one missing animal compared to the key cards showing all possible animals. There is no taking turns, you can take the card if you are the first player to identify that missing animal!

After one of the piles runs out, the game ends. The player that has collected most cards wins the game.

Fun and frantic card game of matching and observation.

name: Serpent Master
description:
Serpent Master is a card-driven abstract board game for 1-4 players where a player must keep their serpent on top to win.

Serpent Master's core mechanic is the simultaneous selection and playing of cards. Each round players select one of their cards to play, which will direct the movement of their serpent, and cards are resolved highest to lowest.

SETUP

Players will have to decide which card to play when for the best move to either gain ground or counteract what their opponents may play. It is as much about knowing the game as it is about knowing the other players.

Place the game board in the center of the table and each player chooses a color of their choice and takes the associated cards and tokens. Players shuffle their cards and sets aside 4 random cards without looking at them. The remaining cards form a player's hand.

Each player finds the token with their serpent head and places the head next to the side of the board from which they will enter (players cannot enter on the same space as another player).

GAME PLAY

Each turn players select one of the remaining cards in their hand to play and places it in front of them face down.

All players simultaneously reveal their cards. Players then resolve the cards, moving their serpent, from highest to lowest.

Play continues until all cards have been played. The player with the most serpent showing is the winner!

-description from designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Trumps & Ladders
description:
Trumps & Ladders is a trick-taking party game.

A new party game that takes a humorous spin on a divisive political subject - the border wall. The game is simple & similar to spades. The first player lays down anything they want, and players must follow suit. If a player cannot follow suit, he may play a ‘Trump’ or lose the round. The hand is won by the player who has the highest ‘Trump’ or ‘immigration’ card.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Political

name: プリウスレーシング (Prius Racing)
description: プリウスレーシング (Prius Racing) is a racing game in which you're trying to run over as little as possible. Be careful not to mistake the accelerator and brake!

name: Dream Journey
description: Now players are trapped by mysterious magic in Dreamcatcher with Boogie man. There will be only one player that can escape from this magic. It is a person who pay the highest price of Dream coin to Boogie man within 3 Dream Circle.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Rondel, Set Collection

name: Bite Your Tongue
description:
Players must give clues so guessers can figure out a famous person, place or thing. Trouble is, you must give the first clue holding your nose, the second clue with your tongue "tied" and the third clue with your tongue out and nose held!

—description from the publisher

name: Skulduggery!
description:
Skulduggery! is a fast-paced take-that style trick-taking game. Players send adventurers into an unknown dragon's lair in hopes of making it out alive with the most riches. Use the human's ability to peak at the dragon card, the dwarf's ability to steal gems, the halfling's ability to swap cards, and the elf's ability to double the value of cards in play. Each round uses a different dragon's lair, so you need to be as crafty as you can to win. Plays in 30 to 60 minutes and up to 8 players.

—description from the designer

name: Il gioco dell'oca di Cornabicorna
description:
It is a game based on a goose game. You must roll the dice to advance on the board. In addition to the classic boxes in this case we have the boxes ivy. Whoever happens to us must draw a card in which there are challenges to be faced.
First will arrive on last box will win.

name: Kami-sama: Ichijama Promo
description:
4 promo cards included (1 for each season deck) as part of Dice Tower's 2019 Kickstarter campaign

When drawn "Each player must swap the positions of their Favor and Nature tracks. If a player has the same amount of Favor and Nature, they must lose either 2 Favor or 2 Nature."
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Leaning Tower
description: Stack a tower with 6 columns per floor. Roll the dice and get a color. Pull out the corresponding color block without crashing the tower to win.

name: Crónicas del Estallido
description:
Crónicas del Estallido is a cooperative game about the social protests in Chile in late 2019. Gameplay resembles Anno Domini/Timeline, but the game is played cooperatively:
Each player has a number of event cards in front of them. The cards show an event on the red side, and the same event plus the day it happened on the yellow side. Players keep the red side of their cards up, so they cannot see the date. One random event is placed in the middle of the table. Players now take turns placing one of their cards either on the left or the right of the initial card (and subsequent ones) to form a correct timeline of events. When each player has only two cards left, the placed cards are flipped to the yellow side. For each card that is at the correct place of the timeline, the players score a point. The more points, the better the result.
Group discussion is encouraged, with the card holder having the final word about where to place a given card.
The game is aimed at keeping memories about the series of events alive.
No individual designer is named, as the game was a colloborative effort by many people, but there is a long list of credits. Each card was also illustrated by a different artist.

User summary

name: Quarantine Haircuts
description:
Quarantine Haircuts is a push-your-luck, roll-and-write game where you try to give the best haircuts to your entire family

Overview:
Unable to leave your home during quarantine, your family is in desperate need of some haircuts. Cut their hair, but make sure not to cut off too much hair, or else you will have to buzz off all their hair.

Players: 1 - 100+
Game Time: 10 minutes
Items needed: 3 six-sided dice

Gameplay:
Roll - Roll all 3 dice. Set aside all, some, or none. Re-roll any dice. You can re-roll the dice up to two times, and may stop rolling at any time.
Write - Mark off the results of all 3 dice rolled for this haircut. (You may only mark off results for the current haircut)
Buzz Cut? - Check if you have cut too much and reached the end of a number track, hitting an X. If so, score 0 and go to next haircut.
Keep Cutting or Stop - Choose to keep cutting and repeating these steps or to stop. If you stop, score the number directly below your last mark on each track. Then, go to the next haircut.

End of Game:
After you have completed the last haircut decision (in F), total up your score from all your haircuts. Congratulations, you have completed your Quarantine Haircuts!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Lord Of The Bunnies Promo Card
description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is also included as part of Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Chocolate Booster, and is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot.

Lord Of The Bunnies
Omega 05: Specialty Bunny or Super Specialty (OUT OF PRINT): The player with these bunnies down (in The Bunny Circle) may play two cards per turn. All other Specialty Bunny cards in The Bunny Circle are eliminated.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Tapikekoi
description:
MEMORY GAME
OBJECT: test your opponents’ memories by finding the things that have been stolen from around the house while the family is asleep.
Players take it in turns to be the family, while all the other players pretend they are thieves. Objects are placed on the boards that represent the family’s living room, kitchen, bedroom and garden. While the “family” player is asleep, the thieves steal things. When the “family” player wakes up, they have to use their memory to try and identify all the missing objects. If they miss one, the thief keeps it! New objects are added for each round. Who will collect the most counters?

+++ Each object can be put back in its usual place to help make it easier for players to remember them.

—description from the publisher

name: Grabolo 3D
description:
Prove that you have the best eyes and the fastest hands at the table.

A roll of the dice determines the combination of color and shape, so react quickly.

Play your favorite game in a new way – wooden pawns!

Grabolo 3D – wild fun for everyone!

name: Fipolino
description:
Fipolino is a game of logic, concentration, and speed for children.

The game comes with three figurines--a blue knight, a yellow princess, and a red dragon--and two pairs of dice. One pair of dice depicts a sword, a crown, and fire--each one corresponding to one of the characters. The other pair shows colors: blue, yellow, and red--again, each one corresponding to one of the characters. The game also has 20 counters.

Players roll either pair of dice. If they roll the dice with pictures and each dice shows a different character, players grab for the third character not shown on the dice. Whoever grabs the character first gets one counter. If the dice match and show the same character, players grab for that figurine and the first to get it takes a counter. Play works the same way if players roll the dice with colors on them.

The first player to get five counters wins!
Putting hands, eyes and minds together to choose which wooden figurine to grab according to the colors and images from the roll of the dice.

Simple, intuitive and fun – Fipolino!

name: Potlatch Klone
description:
[Overview]
Pile up chips on your pawns route.
You win if you have 3 your stacks when your turn begins.
Which is the best? Increase your stacks?
Break opponent stacks? Or create new area?
This is the abstract strategy game what torment your brain.

[Rule Overview]
You win when there are 3 your stacks at your turn begins.
Play "Move Pawn" or "Move Chip" twice in your turn.
Increase chips when you play "Move Pawn".
You can put your color chip when stack height become 3. (This stack become your stack.)
You can destroy opponent stack by "Move Chip".

name: Cyber Odyssey
description:
Cyber Odyssey is an openworld cyberpunk board game with investigation at its core.

Play as the head of a Faction, recruit agents and send them all over the 5 Districts of New Eden to discover what goes wrong in this city...

Turn after turn, during a definite number of day, player will choose between great amount of actions in order to gather clue, or advantages. They can even fight for them on separate tactical boards.

If a player manages to gather all the clues before everyone, they get to win. Otherwise, each player will add up their clue points which will give the final score.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: インスマスから届いた手紙 (Innsmouth kara todoita tegami)
description:
Five characters who had experienced a terrifying past in the cursed town of Innsmouth. Their forgotten childhood memories are fragmented on 30 cards. Use this information to uncover the identity of the cursed child together.

Letter from Innsmouth (インスマスから届いた手紙), another title in ARCLIGHT’s Mystery Portable Series, is a cooperative deduction game set in the Cthulhu Mythos, with simple rules just by flipping cards.

name: Crimes & Capers: Lady Leona's Last Wishes
description:
It's 1919 at the Langford Estate. Lady Leona has died and absolutely no one is sad about it. She was forever threatening to write people out of her will. Now that she is finally gone, her closest family and favored servants have gathered for the reading of her will — but Leona always loved two things: puzzles and making life difficult.

Crimes & Capers: Lady Leona's Last Wishes is a co-operative game in which you and a group of friends take on the roles of polished high society folks and hard-working servants who need to collaborate to solve the mystery and find Leona's treasure. No special skills or prior knowledge are required. Read the notes, figure out puzzles, and unlock the answers to find out where Leona hid her fortune!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Role Playing, Roles with Asymmetric Information

name: The Final Light-Year: The Echo Sector
description:
June 2021 episode for The Final Light-Year.

This kit adds a new map, a new boss, a new set of enemies and a new event.


Released in the June 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Code Monkey: Going Bananas
description:
Code Monkey - Going Bananas is a programming board game designed to introduce logical thinking and basic coding to kids and adults. Your goal is to collect as many bananas as possible by looking for the best movement/action combos hidden in an ever changing jungle and other monkeys hanging around.

On each round, roll dice and move based on combining die rolls and hex numbers, then code actions (like RoboRally) and execute them. Additional optional feature are available, such as missions and setting traps.

name: Trolling for Trouble: Firebeast
description:
An additional player character for Trolling for Trouble, the Firebeast. Attributes are listed on card.


Released in the November 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

name: Run Fight or Die: Reloaded Kickstarter Upgrade Pack
description:
Miss out on the Run Fight or Die: Reloaded Kickstarter campaign? Never fear! Now, with our new upgrade pack you can pick up all the stretch goals from the campaign and get a fancy new Mutant Zombie miniature.

—description from the publisher

name: Cuinze
description: Cuinze is a shedding game of luck, memory, skill and strategy. It is a competitive game: be the first to play all of your tiles and you WIN! At game's end, players are ordered from first place to last place. As long as you are in the top half of all players, you are still a winner! It is fast-paced: there is little waiting between turns, and a game normally ends within 10 minutes. Rules are straightforward and easy to learn. The game teaches young children how to track and sequence numbers, recognize patterns, assess probabilities, and develop strategies: the game avoids use of face cards that impede learning of numbers. It is family friendly (ages 8 and up) - adults will not dominate! It is great for groups: an unlimited number of players (with more boxes) can easily play together in one giant game. Freestanding tiles provide a satisfying tactile experience; no racks are needed and no more fumbling to hide cards.

name: Mau Mau Junior
description:
What a beautiful day! All the farmyard animals want to play in the flower meadow, but players can only lead them there by placing cards with a matching animal or color. The player with the fewest animals at the end wins.

Player have 3 cards in their hand and 1 in the paddock. On their turn, the must try to add a card to the discard pile (meadow) by matching the color or animal on the card in the pile. If they can't, the player adds a card to their paddock pile and picks a new card to add to their hand.

The game ends when the draw pile is finished and no one can add a card to the meadow from their paddock.

The player with fewest animals in their paddock at the end of the game wins.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Farming
mechanics: Hand Management, Matching, Move Through Deck, Take That

name: Trolling for Trouble: Chain Devil
description:
An additional player character for Trolling for Trouble, the Chain Devil. Attributes are listed on card.


Released in the December 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Negotiation

name: Crimes & Capers: And the Winner Is... Dead
description:
You are a nominee at the 67th Annual Music Awards! Unfortunately, you won't be winning anything tonight. Our host Mannie, America's Sweetheart Pop Star, is dead. We are asking that you remain in the green room for your safety. While there, try to open Mannie's purse to look for clues as to what went down at rehearsal that led to her murder.

Crimes & Capers: And the Winner Is... Dead is a co-operative game in which you and a group of friends take on the roles of famous recording artists and work together to solve the mystery. No special skills or prior knowledge are required. Read social media posts and solve puzzles to unlock Mannie's purse, then figure out who murdered her!

—description from the publisher

name: Freakz in the Sheetz: Vol. 1 Starter Pack
description:
How would you react if you woke up with a Sheetz tattoo? What if you made an M*T*O Burger so big you couldn’t fit it in your mouth? Find out in this hilarious adult (13+) party game! Compete with your friends to see who will be crowned Freak of the Memez by matching Pic Cardz with Caption Cardz, and creating your own Sheetzy meme combos.

Uses What Do You Meme? game mechanics. Each round, one player takes the role of judge and plays a photo card, after which everyone else plays a caption card to complete the meme. The judge decides the funniest pairing, and whoever played the winning caption card wins the round.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: TekenNeus
description:
Put on the crazy glasses, take a card and draw the words on the board. The only goal for your fellow players is to guess what you draw. Easy, right!
But it is not. because you have to draw with your nose.
Vor every guessed drawing, not only the person with the correct answer, getas a point, but you to.
Hillarous partygame for the whole family.

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Ricochet
description:
Ricochet is a solitaire card game that combines Tri-Peaks Solitaire with the arcade classic Breakout.

In this game, players use the top card of the waste pile to destroy cards along the four surrounding walls. Each wall has three layers, and as layers are destroyed, more cards are uncovered.

Play your cards right, completely destroy the walls, and win the game!

—description from the publisher

name: Fabula Rasa: Horror
description:
In Fabula Rasa, players take turns telling a constantly changing story as is typical of oral traditions. The motifs on the cards provide visual bullet points for people, objects, and locations that are central to the action, things that must be remembered in the correct order, with cards disappearing and new ones being added each round. Those who, as a narrator, manage to present their version of the story without errors will be rewarded accordingly.

Fabula Rasa: Horror contains 30 cards that feature characters (Dracula, werewolf, zombie), objects (carriage, cape, torch), and locations (castle, village, sinister alley) that can be combined with either of the standalone games Fabula Rasa: Crime or Fabula Rasa: Seemannsgarn.
